module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Application

-- | With Amazon EMR release version 4.0 and later, the only accepted
--   parameter is the application name. To pass arguments to applications,
--   you use configuration classifications specified using configuration
--   JSON objects. For more information, see <a>Configuring
--   Applications</a>.
--   
--   With earlier Amazon EMR releases, the application is any Amazon or
--   third-party software that you can add to the cluster. This structure
--   contains a list of strings that indicates the software to use with the
--   cluster and accepts a user argument list. Amazon EMR accepts and
--   forwards the argument list to the corresponding installation script as
--   bootstrap action argument.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newApplication</a> smart constructor.
data Application
Application' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Application

-- | Arguments for Amazon EMR to pass to the application.
[$sel:args:Application'] :: Application -> Maybe [Text]

-- | This option is for advanced users only. This is meta information about
--   third-party applications that third-party vendors use for testing
--   purposes.
[$sel:additionalInfo:Application'] :: Application -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The version of the application.
[$sel:version:Application'] :: Application -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the application.
[$sel:name:Application'] :: Application -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Application</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:args:Application'</a>, <a>application_args</a> - Arguments for
--   Amazon EMR to pass to the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalInfo:Application'</a>,
--   <a>application_additionalInfo</a> - This option is for advanced users
--   only. This is meta information about third-party applications that
--   third-party vendors use for testing purposes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:Application'</a>, <a>application_version</a> - The
--   version of the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Application'</a>, <a>application_name</a> - The name of
--   the application.
newApplication :: Application

-- | Arguments for Amazon EMR to pass to the application.
application_args :: Lens' Application (Maybe [Text])

-- | This option is for advanced users only. This is meta information about
--   third-party applications that third-party vendors use for testing
--   purposes.

-- | The version of the application.

--   policy state change.

-- | The code indicating the reason for the change in
--   status.<tt>USER_REQUEST</tt> indicates that the scaling policy status
--   was changed by a user. <tt>PROVISION_FAILURE</tt> indicates that the
--   status change was because the policy failed to provision.
--   <tt>CLEANUP_FAILURE</tt> indicates an error.

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.AutoTerminationPolicy

-- | An auto-termination policy for an Amazon EMR cluster. An
--   auto-termination policy defines the amount of idle time in seconds
--   after which a cluster automatically terminates. For alternative
--   cluster termination options, see <a>Control cluster termination</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoTerminationPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data AutoTerminationPolicy
AutoTerminationPolicy' :: Maybe Integer -> AutoTerminationPolicy

-- | Specifies the amount of idle time in seconds after which the cluster
--   automatically terminates. You can specify a minimum of 60 seconds and
--   a maximum of 604800 seconds (seven days).
[$sel:idleTimeout:AutoTerminationPolicy'] :: AutoTerminationPolicy -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoTerminationPolicy</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:idleTimeout:AutoTerminationPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>autoTerminationPolicy_idleTimeout</a> - Specifies the amount of
--   idle time in seconds after which the cluster automatically terminates.
--   You can specify a minimum of 60 seconds and a maximum of 604800
--   seconds (seven days).
newAutoTerminationPolicy :: AutoTerminationPolicy

-- | Specifies the amount of idle time in seconds after which the cluster
--   automatically terminates. You can specify a minimum of 60 seconds and
--   a maximum of 604800 seconds (seven days).
autoTerminationPolicy_idleTimeout :: Lens' AutoTerminationPolicy (Maybe Integer)

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.CancelStepsInfo

-- | Specification of the status of a CancelSteps request. Available only
--   in Amazon EMR version 4.8.0 and later, excluding version 5.0.0.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCancelStepsInfo</a> smart constructor.
data CancelStepsInfo
CancelStepsInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe CancelStepsRequestStatus -> Maybe Text -> CancelStepsInfo

-- | The encrypted StepId of a step.
[$sel:stepId:CancelStepsInfo'] :: CancelStepsInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of a CancelSteps Request. The value may be SUBMITTED or
--   FAILED.
[$sel:status:CancelStepsInfo'] :: CancelStepsInfo -> Maybe CancelStepsRequestStatus

-- | The reason for the failure if the CancelSteps request fails.
[$sel:reason:CancelStepsInfo'] :: CancelStepsInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CancelStepsInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stepId:CancelStepsInfo'</a>, <a>cancelStepsInfo_stepId</a> -
--   The encrypted StepId of a step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:CancelStepsInfo'</a>, <a>cancelStepsInfo_status</a> -
--   The status of a CancelSteps Request. The value may be SUBMITTED or
--   FAILED.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reason:CancelStepsInfo'</a>, <a>cancelStepsInfo_reason</a> -
--   The reason for the failure if the CancelSteps request fails.
newCancelStepsInfo :: CancelStepsInfo

-- | The encrypted StepId of a step.
cancelStepsInfo_stepId :: Lens' CancelStepsInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of a CancelSteps Request. The value may be SUBMITTED or
--   FAILED.
cancelStepsInfo_status :: Lens' CancelStepsInfo (Maybe CancelStepsRequestStatus)

-- | The reason for the failure if the CancelSteps request fails.
cancelStepsInfo_reason :: Lens' CancelStepsInfo (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.CancelStepsInfo.CancelStepsInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.CancelStepsInfo.CancelStepsInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.CancelStepsInfo.CancelStepsInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.CancelStepsInfo.CancelStepsInfo
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.CancelStepsInfo.CancelStepsInfo
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.CancelStepsInfo.CancelStepsInfo
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.CancelStepsInfo.CancelStepsInfo

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ClusterTimeline

-- | Represents the timeline of the cluster's lifecycle.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClusterTimeline</a> smart constructor.
data ClusterTimeline
ClusterTimeline' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> ClusterTimeline

-- | The date and time when the cluster was terminated.
[$sel:endDateTime:ClusterTimeline'] :: ClusterTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The creation date and time of the cluster.
[$sel:creationDateTime:ClusterTimeline'] :: ClusterTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time when the cluster was ready to run steps.
[$sel:readyDateTime:ClusterTimeline'] :: ClusterTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endDateTime:ClusterTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>clusterTimeline_endDateTime</a> - The date and time when the
--   cluster was terminated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDateTime:ClusterTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>clusterTimeline_creationDateTime</a> - The creation date and time
--   of the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readyDateTime:ClusterTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>clusterTimeline_readyDateTime</a> - The date and time when the
--   cluster was ready to run steps.
newClusterTimeline :: ClusterTimeline

-- | The creation date and time of the cluster.
clusterTimeline_creationDateTime :: Lens' ClusterTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time when the cluster was ready to run steps.
clusterTimeline_readyDateTime :: Lens' ClusterTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ClusterTimeline.ClusterTimeline

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ClusterStatus

-- | The detailed status of the cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClusterStatus</a> smart constructor.
data ClusterStatus

[$sel:state:ClusterStatus'] :: ClusterStatus -> Maybe ClusterState

--   of the cluster.

--   omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>clusterStatus_stateChangeReason</a> - The reason for the cluster
--   status change.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:ClusterStatus'</a>, <a>clusterStatus_state</a> - The
--   current state of the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeline:ClusterStatus'</a>, <a>clusterStatus_timeline</a> - A
--   timeline that represents the status of a cluster over the lifetime of
--   the cluster.
newClusterStatus :: ClusterStatus

-- | The current state of the cluster.
clusterStatus_state :: Lens' ClusterStatus (Maybe ClusterState)

-- | A timeline that represents the status of a cluster over the lifetime
--   of the cluster.
clusterStatus_timeline :: Lens' ClusterStatus (Maybe ClusterTimeline)

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ClusterSummary

-- | The summary description of the cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClusterSummary</a> smart constructor.
data ClusterSummary
ClusterSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ClusterStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> ClusterSummary

-- | The Amazon Resource Name of the cluster.
[$sel:clusterArn:ClusterSummary'] :: ClusterSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The details about the current status of the cluster.
[$sel:status:ClusterSummary'] :: ClusterSummary -> Maybe ClusterStatus

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost where the cluster is
--   launched.
[$sel:outpostArn:ClusterSummary'] :: ClusterSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the cluster.
[$sel:id:ClusterSummary'] :: ClusterSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the cluster.
[$sel:name:ClusterSummary'] :: ClusterSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | An approximation of the cost of the cluster, represented in
--   m1.small/hours. This value is incremented one time for every hour an
--   m1.small instance runs. Larger instances are weighted more, so an EC2
--   instance that is roughly four times more expensive would result in the
--   normalized instance hours being incremented by four. This result is
--   only an approximation and does not reflect the actual billing rate.
[$sel:normalizedInstanceHours:ClusterSummary'] :: ClusterSummary -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ClusterSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterArn:ClusterSummary'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSummary_clusterArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name of the
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ClusterSummary'</a>, <a>clusterSummary_status</a> - The
--   details about the current status of the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outpostArn:ClusterSummary'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSummary_outpostArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the Outpost where the cluster is launched.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ClusterSummary'</a>, <a>clusterSummary_id</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ClusterSummary'</a>, <a>clusterSummary_name</a> - The
--   name of the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:normalizedInstanceHours:ClusterSummary'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSummary_normalizedInstanceHours</a> - An approximation of
--   the cost of the cluster, represented in m1.small/hours. This value is
--   incremented one time for every hour an m1.small instance runs. Larger
--   instances are weighted more, so an EC2 instance that is roughly four
--   times more expensive would result in the normalized instance hours
--   being incremented by four. This result is only an approximation and
--   does not reflect the actual billing rate.
newClusterSummary :: ClusterSummary

-- | The Amazon Resource Name of the cluster.
clusterSummary_clusterArn :: Lens' ClusterSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The details about the current status of the cluster.
clusterSummary_status :: Lens' ClusterSummary (Maybe ClusterStatus)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost where the cluster is
--   launched.
clusterSummary_outpostArn :: Lens' ClusterSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the cluster.
clusterSummary_id :: Lens' ClusterSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the cluster.
clusterSummary_name :: Lens' ClusterSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | An approximation of the cost of the cluster, represented in
--   m1.small/hours. This value is incremented one time for every hour an
--   m1.small instance runs. Larger instances are weighted more, so an EC2
--   instance that is roughly four times more expensive would result in the
--   normalized instance hours being incremented by four. This result is
--   only an approximation and does not reflect the actual billing rate.
clusterSummary_normalizedInstanceHours :: Lens' ClusterSummary (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ClusterSummary.ClusterSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ClusterSummary.ClusterSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ClusterSummary.ClusterSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ClusterSummary.ClusterSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ClusterSummary.ClusterSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ClusterSummary.ClusterSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ClusterSummary.ClusterSummary


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Command

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCommand</a> smart constructor.
data Command

-- | Arguments for Amazon EMR to pass to the command for execution.
[$sel:args:Command'] :: Command -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The Amazon S3 location of the command script.
[$sel:scriptPath:Command'] :: Command -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the command.
[$sel:name:Command'] :: Command -> Maybe Text

--

--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   EMR to pass to the command for execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scriptPath:Command'</a>, <a>command_scriptPath</a> - The
--   Amazon S3 location of the command script.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Command'</a>, <a>command_name</a> - The name of the
--   command.
newCommand :: Command

instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ComputeLimitsUnitType.ComputeLimitsUnitType
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ComputeLimitsUnitType.ComputeLimitsUnitType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ComputeLimitsUnitType.ComputeLimitsUnitType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ComputeLimitsUnitType.ComputeLimitsUnitType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ComputeLimitsUnitType.ComputeLimitsUnitType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ComputeLimitsUnitType.ComputeLimitsUnitType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ComputeLimitsUnitType.ComputeLimitsUnitType
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ComputeLimitsUnitType.ComputeLimitsUnitType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ComputeLimitsUnitType.ComputeLimitsUnitType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ComputeLimitsUnitType.ComputeLimitsUnitType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ComputeLimitsUnitType.ComputeLimitsUnitType


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ComputeLimits

-- | The EC2 unit limits for a managed scaling policy. The managed scaling
--   activity of a cluster can not be above or below these limits. The
--   limit only applies to the core and task nodes. The master node cannot
--   be scaled after initial configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newComputeLimits</a> smart constructor.
data ComputeLimits
ComputeLimits' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> ComputeLimitsUnitType -> Int -> Int -> ComputeLimits

-- | The upper boundary of On-Demand EC2 units. It is measured through vCPU
--   cores or instances for instance groups and measured through units for
--   instance fleets. The On-Demand units are not allowed to scale beyond
--   this boundary. The parameter is used to split capacity allocation
--   between On-Demand and Spot Instances.
[$sel:maximumOnDemandCapacityUnits:ComputeLimits'] :: ComputeLimits -> Maybe Int

-- | The upper boundary of EC2 units for core node type in a cluster. It is
--   measured through vCPU cores or instances for instance groups and
--   measured through units for instance fleets. The core units are not
--   allowed to scale beyond this boundary. The parameter is used to split
--   capacity allocation between core and task nodes.
[$sel:maximumCoreCapacityUnits:ComputeLimits'] :: ComputeLimits -> Maybe Int

-- | The unit type used for specifying a managed scaling policy.
[$sel:unitType:ComputeLimits'] :: ComputeLimits -> ComputeLimitsUnitType

-- | The lower boundary of EC2 units. It is measured through vCPU cores or
--   instances for instance groups and measured through units for instance
--   fleets. Managed scaling activities are not allowed beyond this
--   boundary. The limit only applies to the core and task nodes. The
--   master node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.
[$sel:minimumCapacityUnits:ComputeLimits'] :: ComputeLimits -> Int

-- | The upper boundary of EC2 units. It is measured through vCPU cores or
--   instances for instance groups and measured through units for instance
--   fleets. Managed scaling activities are not allowed beyond this
--   boundary. The limit only applies to the core and task nodes. The
--   master node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.
[$sel:maximumCapacityUnits:ComputeLimits'] :: ComputeLimits -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ComputeLimits</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumOnDemandCapacityUnits:ComputeLimits'</a>,
--   <a>computeLimits_maximumOnDemandCapacityUnits</a> - The upper boundary
--   of On-Demand EC2 units. It is measured through vCPU cores or instances
--   for instance groups and measured through units for instance fleets.
--   The On-Demand units are not allowed to scale beyond this boundary. The
--   parameter is used to split capacity allocation between On-Demand and
--   Spot Instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumCoreCapacityUnits:ComputeLimits'</a>,
--   <a>computeLimits_maximumCoreCapacityUnits</a> - The upper boundary of
--   EC2 units for core node type in a cluster. It is measured through vCPU
--   cores or instances for instance groups and measured through units for
--   instance fleets. The core units are not allowed to scale beyond this
--   boundary. The parameter is used to split capacity allocation between
--   core and task nodes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unitType:ComputeLimits'</a>, <a>computeLimits_unitType</a> -
--   The unit type used for specifying a managed scaling policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minimumCapacityUnits:ComputeLimits'</a>,
--   <a>computeLimits_minimumCapacityUnits</a> - The lower boundary of EC2
--   units. It is measured through vCPU cores or instances for instance
--   groups and measured through units for instance fleets. Managed scaling
--   activities are not allowed beyond this boundary. The limit only
--   applies to the core and task nodes. The master node cannot be scaled
--   after initial configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumCapacityUnits:ComputeLimits'</a>,
--   <a>computeLimits_maximumCapacityUnits</a> - The upper boundary of EC2
--   units. It is measured through vCPU cores or instances for instance
--   groups and measured through units for instance fleets. Managed scaling
--   activities are not allowed beyond this boundary. The limit only
--   applies to the core and task nodes. The master node cannot be scaled
--   after initial configuration.
newComputeLimits :: ComputeLimitsUnitType -> Int -> Int -> ComputeLimits

-- | The upper boundary of On-Demand EC2 units. It is measured through vCPU
--   cores or instances for instance groups and measured through units for
--   instance fleets. The On-Demand units are not allowed to scale beyond
--   this boundary. The parameter is used to split capacity allocation
--   between On-Demand and Spot Instances.
computeLimits_maximumOnDemandCapacityUnits :: Lens' ComputeLimits (Maybe Int)

-- | The upper boundary of EC2 units for core node type in a cluster. It is
--   measured through vCPU cores or instances for instance groups and
--   measured through units for instance fleets. The core units are not
--   allowed to scale beyond this boundary. The parameter is used to split
--   capacity allocation between core and task nodes.
computeLimits_maximumCoreCapacityUnits :: Lens' ComputeLimits (Maybe Int)

-- | The unit type used for specifying a managed scaling policy.
computeLimits_unitType :: Lens' ComputeLimits ComputeLimitsUnitType

-- | The lower boundary of EC2 units. It is measured through vCPU cores or
--   instances for instance groups and measured through units for instance
--   fleets. Managed scaling activities are not allowed beyond this
--   boundary. The limit only applies to the core and task nodes. The
--   master node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.
computeLimits_minimumCapacityUnits :: Lens' ComputeLimits Int

-- | The upper boundary of EC2 units. It is measured through vCPU cores or
--   instances for instance groups and measured through units for instance
--   fleets. Managed scaling activities are not allowed beyond this
--   boundary. The limit only applies to the core and task nodes. The
--   master node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.
computeLimits_maximumCapacityUnits :: Lens' ComputeLimits Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ComputeLimits.ComputeLimits
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ComputeLimits.ComputeLimits
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ComputeLimits.ComputeLimits
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ComputeLimits.ComputeLimits
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ComputeLimits.ComputeLimits
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ComputeLimits.ComputeLimits
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ComputeLimits.ComputeLimits
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ComputeLimits.ComputeLimits


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Configuration

-- | Amazon EMR releases 4.x or later.
--   
--   An optional configuration specification to be used when provisioning
--   cluster instances, which can include configurations for applications
--   and software bundled with Amazon EMR. A configuration consists of a
--   classification, properties, and optional nested configurations. A
--   classification refers to an application-specific configuration file.
--   Properties are the settings you want to change in that file. For more
--   information, see <a>Configuring Applications</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data Configuration
Configuration' :: Maybe [Configuration] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Configuration

-- | A list of additional configurations to apply within a configuration
--   object.
[$sel:configurations:Configuration'] :: Configuration -> Maybe [Configuration]

-- | A set of properties specified within a configuration classification.
[$sel:properties:Configuration'] :: Configuration -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The classification within a configuration.
[$sel:classification:Configuration'] :: Configuration -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Configuration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurations:Configuration'</a>,
--   <a>configuration_configurations</a> - A list of additional
--   configurations to apply within a configuration object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:properties:Configuration'</a>, <a>configuration_properties</a>
--   - A set of properties specified within a configuration classification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:classification:Configuration'</a>,
--   <a>configuration_classification</a> - The classification within a
--   configuration.
newConfiguration :: Configuration

-- | A list of additional configurations to apply within a configuration
--   object.
configuration_configurations :: Lens' Configuration (Maybe [Configuration])

-- | A set of properties specified within a configuration classification.
configuration_properties :: Lens' Configuration (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The classification within a configuration.
configuration_classification :: Lens' Configuration (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Configuration.Configuration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Configuration.Configuration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Configuration.Configuration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Configuration.Configuration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Configuration.Configuration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Configuration.Configuration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Configuration.Configuration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Configuration.Configuration


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsVolume

-- | EBS block device that's attached to an EC2 instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEbsVolume</a> smart constructor.
data EbsVolume
EbsVolume' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EbsVolume

-- | The device name that is exposed to the instance, such as /dev/sdh.
[$sel:device:EbsVolume'] :: EbsVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | The volume identifier of the EBS volume.
[$sel:volumeId:EbsVolume'] :: EbsVolume -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EbsVolume</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:device:EbsVolume'</a>, <a>ebsVolume_device</a> - The device
--   name that is exposed to the instance, such as /dev/sdh.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeId:EbsVolume'</a>, <a>ebsVolume_volumeId</a> - The
--   volume identifier of the EBS volume.
newEbsVolume :: EbsVolume

-- | The device name that is exposed to the instance, such as /dev/sdh.
ebsVolume_device :: Lens' EbsVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume identifier of the EBS volume.
ebsVolume_volumeId :: Lens' EbsVolume (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsVolume.EbsVolume
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsVolume.EbsVolume

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsVolume.EbsVolume


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Ec2InstanceAttributes

-- | Provides information about the EC2 instances in a cluster grouped by
--   category. For example, key name, subnet ID, IAM instance profile, and
--   so on.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEc2InstanceAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data Ec2InstanceAttributes
Ec2InstanceAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Ec2InstanceAttributes

-- | The name of the Amazon EC2 key pair to use when connecting with SSH
--   into the master node as a user named "hadoop".
[$sel:ec2KeyName:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the core and
--   task nodes.
[$sel:additionalSlaveSecurityGroups:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The Availability Zone in which the cluster will run.
[$sel:ec2AvailabilityZone:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the core and task
--   nodes.
[$sel:emrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Applies to clusters configured with the instance fleets option.
--   Specifies one or more Availability Zones in which to launch EC2
--   cluster instances when the EC2-Classic network configuration is
--   supported. Amazon EMR chooses the Availability Zone with the best fit
--   from among the list of <tt>RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones</tt>, and
--   then launches all cluster instances within that Availability Zone. If
--   you do not specify this value, Amazon EMR chooses the Availability
--   Zone for you. <tt>RequestedEc2SubnetIDs</tt> and
--   <tt>RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones</tt> cannot be specified together.
[$sel:requestedEc2AvailabilityZones:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Set this parameter to the identifier of the Amazon VPC subnet where
--   you want the cluster to launch. If you do not specify this value, and
--   your account supports EC2-Classic, the cluster launches in
--   EC2-Classic.
[$sel:ec2SubnetId:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the master node.
[$sel:emrManagedMasterSecurityGroup:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The IAM role that was specified when the cluster was launched. The EC2
--   instances of the cluster assume this role.
[$sel:iamInstanceProfile:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the master
--   node.
[$sel:additionalMasterSecurityGroups:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Applies to clusters configured with the instance fleets option.
--   Specifies the unique identifier of one or more Amazon EC2 subnets in
--   which to launch EC2 cluster instances. Subnets must exist within the
--   same VPC. Amazon EMR chooses the EC2 subnet with the best fit from
--   among the list of <tt>RequestedEc2SubnetIds</tt>, and then launches
--   all cluster instances within that Subnet. If this value is not
--   specified, and the account and Region support EC2-Classic networks,
--   the cluster launches instances in the EC2-Classic network and uses
--   <tt>RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones</tt> instead of this setting. If
--   EC2-Classic is not supported, and no Subnet is specified, Amazon EMR
--   chooses the subnet for you. <tt>RequestedEc2SubnetIDs</tt> and
--   <tt>RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones</tt> cannot be specified together.
[$sel:requestedEc2SubnetIds:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the Amazon EMR
--   service to access clusters in VPC private subnets.
[$sel:serviceAccessSecurityGroup:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Ec2InstanceAttributes</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2KeyName:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_ec2KeyName</a> - The name of the Amazon EC2
--   key pair to use when connecting with SSH into the master node as a
--   user named "hadoop".
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalSlaveSecurityGroups:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_additionalSlaveSecurityGroups</a> - A list of
--   additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the core and task nodes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2AvailabilityZone:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_ec2AvailabilityZone</a> - The Availability
--   Zone in which the cluster will run.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_emrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup</a> - The
--   identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the core and task
--   nodes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestedEc2AvailabilityZones:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_requestedEc2AvailabilityZones</a> - Applies
--   to clusters configured with the instance fleets option. Specifies one
--   or more Availability Zones in which to launch EC2 cluster instances
--   when the EC2-Classic network configuration is supported. Amazon EMR
--   chooses the Availability Zone with the best fit from among the list of
--   <tt>RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones</tt>, and then launches all cluster
--   instances within that Availability Zone. If you do not specify this
--   value, Amazon EMR chooses the Availability Zone for you.
--   <tt>RequestedEc2SubnetIDs</tt> and
--   <tt>RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones</tt> cannot be specified together.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2SubnetId:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_ec2SubnetId</a> - Set this parameter to the
--   identifier of the Amazon VPC subnet where you want the cluster to
--   launch. If you do not specify this value, and your account supports
--   EC2-Classic, the cluster launches in EC2-Classic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emrManagedMasterSecurityGroup:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_emrManagedMasterSecurityGroup</a> - The
--   identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the master node.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamInstanceProfile:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_iamInstanceProfile</a> - The IAM role that
--   was specified when the cluster was launched. The EC2 instances of the
--   cluster assume this role.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalMasterSecurityGroups:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_additionalMasterSecurityGroups</a> - A list
--   of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the master node.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestedEc2SubnetIds:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_requestedEc2SubnetIds</a> - Applies to
--   clusters configured with the instance fleets option. Specifies the
--   unique identifier of one or more Amazon EC2 subnets in which to launch
--   EC2 cluster instances. Subnets must exist within the same VPC. Amazon
--   EMR chooses the EC2 subnet with the best fit from among the list of
--   <tt>RequestedEc2SubnetIds</tt>, and then launches all cluster
--   instances within that Subnet. If this value is not specified, and the
--   account and Region support EC2-Classic networks, the cluster launches
--   instances in the EC2-Classic network and uses
--   <tt>RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones</tt> instead of this setting. If
--   EC2-Classic is not supported, and no Subnet is specified, Amazon EMR
--   chooses the subnet for you. <tt>RequestedEc2SubnetIDs</tt> and
--   <tt>RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones</tt> cannot be specified together.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessSecurityGroup:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_serviceAccessSecurityGroup</a> - The
--   identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the Amazon EMR service
--   to access clusters in VPC private subnets.
newEc2InstanceAttributes :: Ec2InstanceAttributes

-- | The name of the Amazon EC2 key pair to use when connecting with SSH
--   into the master node as a user named "hadoop".
ec2InstanceAttributes_ec2KeyName :: Lens' Ec2InstanceAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the core and
--   task nodes.
ec2InstanceAttributes_additionalSlaveSecurityGroups :: Lens' Ec2InstanceAttributes (Maybe [Text])

-- | The Availability Zone in which the cluster will run.
ec2InstanceAttributes_ec2AvailabilityZone :: Lens' Ec2InstanceAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the core and task
--   nodes.
ec2InstanceAttributes_emrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup :: Lens' Ec2InstanceAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | Applies to clusters configured with the instance fleets option.
--   Specifies one or more Availability Zones in which to launch EC2
--   cluster instances when the EC2-Classic network configuration is
--   supported. Amazon EMR chooses the Availability Zone with the best fit
--   from among the list of <tt>RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones</tt>, and
--   then launches all cluster instances within that Availability Zone. If
--   you do not specify this value, Amazon EMR chooses the Availability
--   Zone for you. <tt>RequestedEc2SubnetIDs</tt> and
--   <tt>RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones</tt> cannot be specified together.
ec2InstanceAttributes_requestedEc2AvailabilityZones :: Lens' Ec2InstanceAttributes (Maybe [Text])

-- | Set this parameter to the identifier of the Amazon VPC subnet where
--   you want the cluster to launch. If you do not specify this value, and
--   your account supports EC2-Classic, the cluster launches in
--   EC2-Classic.
ec2InstanceAttributes_ec2SubnetId :: Lens' Ec2InstanceAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the master node.
ec2InstanceAttributes_emrManagedMasterSecurityGroup :: Lens' Ec2InstanceAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The IAM role that was specified when the cluster was launched. The EC2
--   instances of the cluster assume this role.
ec2InstanceAttributes_iamInstanceProfile :: Lens' Ec2InstanceAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the master
--   node.
ec2InstanceAttributes_additionalMasterSecurityGroups :: Lens' Ec2InstanceAttributes (Maybe [Text])

-- | Applies to clusters configured with the instance fleets option.
--   Specifies the unique identifier of one or more Amazon EC2 subnets in
--   which to launch EC2 cluster instances. Subnets must exist within the
--   same VPC. Amazon EMR chooses the EC2 subnet with the best fit from
--   among the list of <tt>RequestedEc2SubnetIds</tt>, and then launches
--   all cluster instances within that Subnet. If this value is not
--   specified, and the account and Region support EC2-Classic networks,
--   the cluster launches instances in the EC2-Classic network and uses
--   <tt>RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones</tt> instead of this setting. If
--   EC2-Classic is not supported, and no Subnet is specified, Amazon EMR
--   chooses the subnet for you. <tt>RequestedEc2SubnetIDs</tt> and
--   <tt>RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones</tt> cannot be specified together.
ec2InstanceAttributes_requestedEc2SubnetIds :: Lens' Ec2InstanceAttributes (Maybe [Text])

-- | The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the Amazon EMR
--   service to access clusters in VPC private subnets.
ec2InstanceAttributes_serviceAccessSecurityGroup :: Lens' Ec2InstanceAttributes (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ExecutionEngineConfig

-- | Specifies the execution engine (cluster) to run the notebook and
--   perform the notebook execution, for example, an EMR cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExecutionEngineConfig</a> smart constructor.
data ExecutionEngineConfig
ExecutionEngineConfig' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ExecutionEngineType -> Text -> ExecutionEngineConfig

-- | An optional unique ID of an EC2 security group to associate with the
--   master instance of the EMR cluster for this notebook execution. For
--   more information see <a>Specifying EC2 Security Groups for EMR
--   Notebooks</a> in the <i>EMR Management Guide</i>.
[$sel:masterInstanceSecurityGroupId:ExecutionEngineConfig'] :: ExecutionEngineConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of execution engine. A value of <tt>EMR</tt> specifies an EMR
--   cluster.
[$sel:type':ExecutionEngineConfig'] :: ExecutionEngineConfig -> Maybe ExecutionEngineType

-- | The unique identifier of the execution engine. For an EMR cluster,
--   this is the cluster ID.
[$sel:id:ExecutionEngineConfig'] :: ExecutionEngineConfig -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ExecutionEngineConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterInstanceSecurityGroupId:ExecutionEngineConfig'</a>,
--   <a>executionEngineConfig_masterInstanceSecurityGroupId</a> - An
--   optional unique ID of an EC2 security group to associate with the
--   master instance of the EMR cluster for this notebook execution. For
--   more information see <a>Specifying EC2 Security Groups for EMR
--   Notebooks</a> in the <i>EMR Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ExecutionEngineConfig'</a>,
--   <a>executionEngineConfig_type</a> - The type of execution engine. A
--   value of <tt>EMR</tt> specifies an EMR cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ExecutionEngineConfig'</a>, <a>executionEngineConfig_id</a>
--   - The unique identifier of the execution engine. For an EMR cluster,
--   this is the cluster ID.
newExecutionEngineConfig :: Text -> ExecutionEngineConfig

-- | An optional unique ID of an EC2 security group to associate with the
--   master instance of the EMR cluster for this notebook execution. For
--   more information see <a>Specifying EC2 Security Groups for EMR
--   Notebooks</a> in the <i>EMR Management Guide</i>.
executionEngineConfig_masterInstanceSecurityGroupId :: Lens' ExecutionEngineConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of execution engine. A value of <tt>EMR</tt> specifies an EMR
--   cluster.
executionEngineConfig_type :: Lens' ExecutionEngineConfig (Maybe ExecutionEngineType)

-- | The unique identifier of the execution engine. For an EMR cluster,
--   this is the cluster ID.
executionEngineConfig_id :: Lens' ExecutionEngineConfig Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ExecutionEngineConfig.ExecutionEngineConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ExecutionEngineConfig.ExecutionEngineConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ExecutionEngineConfig.ExecutionEngineConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ExecutionEngineConfig.ExecutionEngineConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ExecutionEngineConfig.ExecutionEngineConfig
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ExecutionEngineConfig.ExecutionEngineConfig
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ExecutionEngineConfig.ExecutionEngineConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ExecutionEngineConfig.ExecutionEngineConfig


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.FailureDetails

-- | The details of the step failure. The service attempts to detect the
--   root cause for many common failures.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFailureDetails</a> smart constructor.
data FailureDetails
FailureDetails' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> FailureDetails

-- | The descriptive message including the error the Amazon EMR service has
--   identified as the cause of step failure. This is text from an error
--   log that describes the root cause of the failure.
[$sel:message:FailureDetails'] :: FailureDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The reason for the step failure. In the case where the service cannot
--   successfully determine the root cause of the failure, it returns
--   "Unknown Error" as a reason.
[$sel:reason:FailureDetails'] :: FailureDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The path to the log file where the step failure root cause was
--   originally recorded.
[$sel:logFile:FailureDetails'] :: FailureDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>FailureDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:FailureDetails'</a>, <a>failureDetails_message</a> -
--   The descriptive message including the error the Amazon EMR service has
--   identified as the cause of step failure. This is text from an error
--   log that describes the root cause of the failure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reason:FailureDetails'</a>, <a>failureDetails_reason</a> - The
--   reason for the step failure. In the case where the service cannot
--   successfully determine the root cause of the failure, it returns
--   "Unknown Error" as a reason.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logFile:FailureDetails'</a>, <a>failureDetails_logFile</a> -
--   The path to the log file where the step failure root cause was
--   originally recorded.
newFailureDetails :: FailureDetails

-- | The descriptive message including the error the Amazon EMR service has
--   identified as the cause of step failure. This is text from an error
--   log that describes the root cause of the failure.
failureDetails_message :: Lens' FailureDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The reason for the step failure. In the case where the service cannot
--   successfully determine the root cause of the failure, it returns
--   "Unknown Error" as a reason.
failureDetails_reason :: Lens' FailureDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The path to the log file where the step failure root cause was
--   originally recorded.
failureDetails_logFile :: Lens' FailureDetails (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.FailureDetails.FailureDetails
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.FailureDetails.FailureDetails
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.FailureDetails.FailureDetails
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.FailureDetails.FailureDetails
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.FailureDetails.FailureDetails
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.FailureDetails.FailureDetails
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.FailureDetails.FailureDetails


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.HadoopStepConfig

-- | A cluster step consisting of a JAR file whose main function will be
--   executed. The main function submits a job for Hadoop to execute and
--   waits for the job to finish or fail.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHadoopStepConfig</a> smart constructor.
data HadoopStepConfig
HadoopStepConfig' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> HadoopStepConfig

-- | The list of command line arguments to pass to the JAR file's main
--   function for execution.
[$sel:args:HadoopStepConfig'] :: HadoopStepConfig -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The list of Java properties that are set when the step runs. You can
--   use these properties to pass key-value pairs to your main function.
[$sel:properties:HadoopStepConfig'] :: HadoopStepConfig -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The path to the JAR file that runs during the step.
[$sel:jar:HadoopStepConfig'] :: HadoopStepConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the main class in the specified Java file. If not
--   specified, the JAR file should specify a main class in its manifest
--   file.
[$sel:mainClass:HadoopStepConfig'] :: HadoopStepConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>HadoopStepConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:args:HadoopStepConfig'</a>, <a>hadoopStepConfig_args</a> - The
--   list of command line arguments to pass to the JAR file's main function
--   for execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:properties:HadoopStepConfig'</a>,
--   <a>hadoopStepConfig_properties</a> - The list of Java properties that
--   are set when the step runs. You can use these properties to pass
--   key-value pairs to your main function.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jar:HadoopStepConfig'</a>, <a>hadoopStepConfig_jar</a> - The
--   path to the JAR file that runs during the step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mainClass:HadoopStepConfig'</a>,
--   <a>hadoopStepConfig_mainClass</a> - The name of the main class in the
--   specified Java file. If not specified, the JAR file should specify a
--   main class in its manifest file.
newHadoopStepConfig :: HadoopStepConfig

-- | The list of command line arguments to pass to the JAR file's main
--   function for execution.
hadoopStepConfig_args :: Lens' HadoopStepConfig (Maybe [Text])

-- | The list of Java properties that are set when the step runs. You can
--   use these properties to pass key-value pairs to your main function.
hadoopStepConfig_properties :: Lens' HadoopStepConfig (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The path to the JAR file that runs during the step.
hadoopStepConfig_jar :: Lens' HadoopStepConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the main class in the specified Java file. If not
--   specified, the JAR file should specify a main class in its manifest
--   file.
hadoopStepConfig_mainClass :: Lens' HadoopStepConfig (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.HadoopStepConfig.HadoopStepConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.HadoopStepConfig.HadoopStepConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.HadoopStepConfig.HadoopStepConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.HadoopStepConfig.HadoopStepConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.HadoopStepConfig.HadoopStepConfig
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.HadoopStepConfig.HadoopStepConfig
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.HadoopStepConfig.HadoopStepConfig

--

--

--   information see InstanceFleetConfig$TargetOnDemandCapacity.

--   <a>$sel:targetSpotCapacity:InstanceFleetModifyConfig'</a>,

--

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleetTimeline

-- | Provides historical timestamps for the instance fleet, including the
--   time of creation, the time it became ready to run jobs, and the time
--   of termination.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceFleetTimeline</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceFleetTimeline
InstanceFleetTimeline' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> InstanceFleetTimeline

-- | The time and date the instance fleet terminated.
[$sel:endDateTime:InstanceFleetTimeline'] :: InstanceFleetTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The time and date the instance fleet was created.
[$sel:creationDateTime:InstanceFleetTimeline'] :: InstanceFleetTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The time and date the instance fleet was ready to run jobs.
[$sel:readyDateTime:InstanceFleetTimeline'] :: InstanceFleetTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceFleetTimeline</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endDateTime:InstanceFleetTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleetTimeline_endDateTime</a> - The time and date the
--   instance fleet terminated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDateTime:InstanceFleetTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleetTimeline_creationDateTime</a> - The time and date the
--   instance fleet was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readyDateTime:InstanceFleetTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleetTimeline_readyDateTime</a> - The time and date the
--   instance fleet was ready to run jobs.
newInstanceFleetTimeline :: InstanceFleetTimeline

-- | The time and date the instance fleet terminated.
instanceFleetTimeline_endDateTime :: Lens' InstanceFleetTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The time and date the instance fleet was created.
instanceFleetTimeline_creationDateTime :: Lens' InstanceFleetTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The time and date the instance fleet was ready to run jobs.
instanceFleetTimeline_readyDateTime :: Lens' InstanceFleetTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleetTimeline.InstanceFleetTimeline
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleetTimeline.InstanceFleetTimeline
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleetTimeline.InstanceFleetTimeline

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleetTimeline.InstanceFleetTimeline


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleetStatus

-- | The status of the instance fleet.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceFleetStatus</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceFleetStatus
InstanceFleetStatus' :: Maybe InstanceFleetStateChangeReason -> Maybe InstanceFleetState -> Maybe InstanceFleetTimeline -> InstanceFleetStatus

-- | Provides status change reason details for the instance fleet.
[$sel:stateChangeReason:InstanceFleetStatus'] :: InstanceFleetStatus -> Maybe InstanceFleetStateChangeReason

-- | A code representing the instance fleet status.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PROVISIONING</tt>—The instance fleet is provisioning EC2
--   resources and is not yet ready to run jobs.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOOTSTRAPPING</tt>—EC2 instances and other resources have been
--   provisioned and the bootstrap actions specified for the instances are
--   underway.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt>—EC2 instances and other resources are running.
--   They are either executing jobs or waiting to execute jobs.</li>
--   <li><tt>RESIZING</tt>—A resize operation is underway. EC2 instances
--   are either being added or removed.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUSPENDED</tt>—A resize operation could not complete. Existing
--   EC2 instances are running, but instances can't be added or
--   removed.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATING</tt>—The instance fleet is terminating EC2
--   instances.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATED</tt>—The instance fleet is no longer active, and
--   all EC2 instances have been terminated.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:state:InstanceFleetStatus'] :: InstanceFleetStatus -> Maybe InstanceFleetState

-- | Provides historical timestamps for the instance fleet, including the
--   time of creation, the time it became ready to run jobs, and the time
--   of termination.
[$sel:timeline:InstanceFleetStatus'] :: InstanceFleetStatus -> Maybe InstanceFleetTimeline

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceFleetStatus</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateChangeReason:InstanceFleetStatus'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleetStatus_stateChangeReason</a> - Provides status change
--   reason details for the instance fleet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:InstanceFleetStatus'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleetStatus_state</a> - A code representing the instance
--   fleet status.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PROVISIONING</tt>—The instance fleet is provisioning EC2
--   resources and is not yet ready to run jobs.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOOTSTRAPPING</tt>—EC2 instances and other resources have been
--   provisioned and the bootstrap actions specified for the instances are
--   underway.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt>—EC2 instances and other resources are running.
--   They are either executing jobs or waiting to execute jobs.</li>
--   <li><tt>RESIZING</tt>—A resize operation is underway. EC2 instances
--   are either being added or removed.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUSPENDED</tt>—A resize operation could not complete. Existing
--   EC2 instances are running, but instances can't be added or
--   removed.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATING</tt>—The instance fleet is terminating EC2
--   instances.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATED</tt>—The instance fleet is no longer active, and
--   all EC2 instances have been terminated.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeline:InstanceFleetStatus'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleetStatus_timeline</a> - Provides historical timestamps
--   for the instance fleet, including the time of creation, the time it
--   became ready to run jobs, and the time of termination.
newInstanceFleetStatus :: InstanceFleetStatus

-- | Provides status change reason details for the instance fleet.
instanceFleetStatus_stateChangeReason :: Lens' InstanceFleetStatus (Maybe InstanceFleetStateChangeReason)

-- | A code representing the instance fleet status.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PROVISIONING</tt>—The instance fleet is provisioning EC2
--   resources and is not yet ready to run jobs.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOOTSTRAPPING</tt>—EC2 instances and other resources have been
--   provisioned and the bootstrap actions specified for the instances are
--   underway.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt>—EC2 instances and other resources are running.
--   They are either executing jobs or waiting to execute jobs.</li>
--   <li><tt>RESIZING</tt>—A resize operation is underway. EC2 instances
--   are either being added or removed.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUSPENDED</tt>—A resize operation could not complete. Existing
--   EC2 instances are running, but instances can't be added or
--   removed.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATING</tt>—The instance fleet is terminating EC2
--   instances.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATED</tt>—The instance fleet is no longer active, and
--   all EC2 instances have been terminated.</li>
--   </ul>
instanceFleetStatus_state :: Lens' InstanceFleetStatus (Maybe InstanceFleetState)

-- | Provides historical timestamps for the instance fleet, including the
--   time of creation, the time it became ready to run jobs, and the time
--   of termination.
instanceFleetStatus_timeline :: Lens' InstanceFleetStatus (Maybe InstanceFleetTimeline)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleetStatus.InstanceFleetStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleetStatus.InstanceFleetStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleetStatus.InstanceFleetStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleetStatus.InstanceFleetStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleetStatus.InstanceFleetStatus
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleetStatus.InstanceFleetStatus
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleetStatus.InstanceFleetStatus

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceGroupTimeline

-- | The timeline of the instance group lifecycle.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceGroupTimeline</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceGroupTimeline
InstanceGroupTimeline' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> InstanceGroupTimeline

-- | The date and time when the instance group terminated.
[$sel:endDateTime:InstanceGroupTimeline'] :: InstanceGroupTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The creation date and time of the instance group.
[$sel:creationDateTime:InstanceGroupTimeline'] :: InstanceGroupTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time when the instance group became ready to perform
--   tasks.
[$sel:readyDateTime:InstanceGroupTimeline'] :: InstanceGroupTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceGroupTimeline</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   instance group terminated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDateTime:InstanceGroupTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroupTimeline_creationDateTime</a> - The creation date and
--   time of the instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readyDateTime:InstanceGroupTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroupTimeline_readyDateTime</a> - The date and time when
--   the instance group became ready to perform tasks.
newInstanceGroupTimeline :: InstanceGroupTimeline

-- | The date and time when the instance group terminated.
instanceGroupTimeline_endDateTime :: Lens' InstanceGroupTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The creation date and time of the instance group.
instanceGroupTimeline_creationDateTime :: Lens' InstanceGroupTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time when the instance group became ready to perform
--   tasks.
instanceGroupTimeline_readyDateTime :: Lens' InstanceGroupTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceGroupTimeline.InstanceGroupTimeline
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceGroupTimeline.InstanceGroupTimeline

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceResizePolicy

-- | Custom policy for requesting termination protection or termination of
--   specific instances when shrinking an instance group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceResizePolicy</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceResizePolicy
InstanceResizePolicy' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> InstanceResizePolicy

-- | Decommissioning timeout override for the specific list of instances to
--   be terminated.
[$sel:instanceTerminationTimeout:InstanceResizePolicy'] :: InstanceResizePolicy -> Maybe Int

-- | Specific list of instances to be terminated when shrinking an instance
--   group.
[$sel:instancesToTerminate:InstanceResizePolicy'] :: InstanceResizePolicy -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Specific list of instances to be protected when shrinking an instance
--   group.
[$sel:instancesToProtect:InstanceResizePolicy'] :: InstanceResizePolicy -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceResizePolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceTerminationTimeout:InstanceResizePolicy'</a>,
--   <a>instanceResizePolicy_instanceTerminationTimeout</a> -
--   Decommissioning timeout override for the specific list of instances to
--   be terminated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instancesToTerminate:InstanceResizePolicy'</a>,
--   <a>instanceResizePolicy_instancesToTerminate</a> - Specific list of
--   instances to be terminated when shrinking an instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instancesToProtect:InstanceResizePolicy'</a>,
--   <a>instanceResizePolicy_instancesToProtect</a> - Specific list of
--   instances to be protected when shrinking an instance group.
newInstanceResizePolicy :: InstanceResizePolicy

-- | Decommissioning timeout override for the specific list of instances to
--   be terminated.
instanceResizePolicy_instanceTerminationTimeout :: Lens' InstanceResizePolicy (Maybe Int)

-- | Specific list of instances to be terminated when shrinking an instance
--   group.
instanceResizePolicy_instancesToTerminate :: Lens' InstanceResizePolicy (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specific list of instances to be protected when shrinking an instance
--   group.
instanceResizePolicy_instancesToProtect :: Lens' InstanceResizePolicy (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceResizePolicy.InstanceResizePolicy
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceResizePolicy.InstanceResizePolicy
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceResizePolicy.InstanceResizePolicy
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceResizePolicy.InstanceResizePolicy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceResizePolicy.InstanceResizePolicy
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceResizePolicy.InstanceResizePolicy
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceResizePolicy.InstanceResizePolicy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceResizePolicy.InstanceResizePolicy
