module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceStateChangeReason

-- | The details of the status change reason for the instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceStateChangeReason</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceStateChangeReason
InstanceStateChangeReason' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe InstanceStateChangeReasonCode -> InstanceStateChangeReason

-- | The status change reason description.
[$sel:message:InstanceStateChangeReason'] :: InstanceStateChangeReason -> Maybe Text

-- | The programmable code for the state change reason.
[$sel:code:InstanceStateChangeReason'] :: InstanceStateChangeReason -> Maybe InstanceStateChangeReasonCode

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceStateChangeReason</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:InstanceStateChangeReason'</a>,
--   <a>instanceStateChangeReason_message</a> - The status change reason
--   description.
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:InstanceStateChangeReason'</a>,
--   <a>instanceStateChangeReason_code</a> - The programmable code for the
--   state change reason.
newInstanceStateChangeReason :: InstanceStateChangeReason

-- | The status change reason description.
instanceStateChangeReason_message :: Lens' InstanceStateChangeReason (Maybe Text)

-- | The programmable code for the state change reason.
instanceStateChangeReason_code :: Lens' InstanceStateChangeReason (Maybe InstanceStateChangeReasonCode)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceStateChangeReason.InstanceStateChangeReason
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceStateChangeReason.InstanceStateChangeReason
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceStateChangeReason.InstanceStateChangeReason
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceStateChangeReason.InstanceStateChangeReason
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceStateChangeReason.InstanceStateChangeReason
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceStateChangeReason.InstanceStateChangeReason
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceStateChangeReason.InstanceStateChangeReason


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTimeline

-- | The timeline of the instance lifecycle.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceTimeline</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceTimeline
InstanceTimeline' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> InstanceTimeline

-- | The date and time when the instance was terminated.
[$sel:endDateTime:InstanceTimeline'] :: InstanceTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The creation date and time of the instance.
[$sel:creationDateTime:InstanceTimeline'] :: InstanceTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time when the instance was ready to perform tasks.
[$sel:readyDateTime:InstanceTimeline'] :: InstanceTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceTimeline</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endDateTime:InstanceTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTimeline_endDateTime</a> - The date and time when the
--   instance was terminated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDateTime:InstanceTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTimeline_creationDateTime</a> - The creation date and time
--   of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readyDateTime:InstanceTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTimeline_readyDateTime</a> - The date and time when the
--   instance was ready to perform tasks.
newInstanceTimeline :: InstanceTimeline

-- | The date and time when the instance was terminated.
instanceTimeline_endDateTime :: Lens' InstanceTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The creation date and time of the instance.
instanceTimeline_creationDateTime :: Lens' InstanceTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time when the instance was ready to perform tasks.
instanceTimeline_readyDateTime :: Lens' InstanceTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTimeline.InstanceTimeline
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTimeline.InstanceTimeline
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTimeline.InstanceTimeline
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTimeline.InstanceTimeline
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTimeline.InstanceTimeline
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTimeline.InstanceTimeline
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTimeline.InstanceTimeline


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceStatus

-- | The instance status details.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceStatus</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceStatus
InstanceStatus' :: Maybe InstanceStateChangeReason -> Maybe InstanceState -> Maybe InstanceTimeline -> InstanceStatus

-- | The details of the status change reason for the instance.
[$sel:stateChangeReason:InstanceStatus'] :: InstanceStatus -> Maybe InstanceStateChangeReason

-- | The current state of the instance.
[$sel:state:InstanceStatus'] :: InstanceStatus -> Maybe InstanceState

-- | The timeline of the instance status over time.
[$sel:timeline:InstanceStatus'] :: InstanceStatus -> Maybe InstanceTimeline

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceStatus</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateChangeReason:InstanceStatus'</a>,
--   <a>instanceStatus_stateChangeReason</a> - The details of the status
--   change reason for the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:InstanceStatus'</a>, <a>instanceStatus_state</a> - The
--   current state of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeline:InstanceStatus'</a>, <a>instanceStatus_timeline</a> -
--   The timeline of the instance status over time.
newInstanceStatus :: InstanceStatus

-- | The details of the status change reason for the instance.
instanceStatus_stateChangeReason :: Lens' InstanceStatus (Maybe InstanceStateChangeReason)

-- | The current state of the instance.
instanceStatus_state :: Lens' InstanceStatus (Maybe InstanceState)

-- | The timeline of the instance status over time.
instanceStatus_timeline :: Lens' InstanceStatus (Maybe InstanceTimeline)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceStatus.InstanceStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceStatus.InstanceStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceStatus.InstanceStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceStatus.InstanceStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceStatus.InstanceStatus
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceStatus.InstanceStatus
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceStatus.InstanceStatus


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.KerberosAttributes

-- | Attributes for Kerberos configuration when Kerberos authentication is
--   enabled using a security configuration. For more information see
--   <a>Use Kerberos Authentication</a> in the <i>Amazon EMR Management
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKerberosAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data KerberosAttributes
KerberosAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> KerberosAttributes

-- | The name of the Kerberos realm to which all nodes in a cluster belong.
--   For example, <tt>EC2.INTERNAL</tt>.
[$sel:realm:KerberosAttributes'] :: KerberosAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Required only when establishing a cross-realm trust with an Active
--   Directory domain. A user with sufficient privileges to join resources
--   to the domain.
[$sel:aDDomainJoinUser:KerberosAttributes'] :: KerberosAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The password used within the cluster for the kadmin service on the
--   cluster-dedicated KDC, which maintains Kerberos principals, password
--   policies, and keytabs for the cluster.
[$sel:kdcAdminPassword:KerberosAttributes'] :: KerberosAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Required only when establishing a cross-realm trust with a KDC in a
--   different realm. The cross-realm principal password, which must be
--   identical across realms.
[$sel:crossRealmTrustPrincipalPassword:KerberosAttributes'] :: KerberosAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The Active Directory password for <tt>ADDomainJoinUser</tt>.
[$sel:aDDomainJoinPassword:KerberosAttributes'] :: KerberosAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>KerberosAttributes</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:realm:KerberosAttributes'</a>, <a>kerberosAttributes_realm</a>
--   - The name of the Kerberos realm to which all nodes in a cluster
--   belong. For example, <tt>EC2.INTERNAL</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aDDomainJoinUser:KerberosAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>kerberosAttributes_aDDomainJoinUser</a> - Required only when
--   establishing a cross-realm trust with an Active Directory domain. A
--   user with sufficient privileges to join resources to the domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kdcAdminPassword:KerberosAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>kerberosAttributes_kdcAdminPassword</a> - The password used within
--   the cluster for the kadmin service on the cluster-dedicated KDC, which
--   maintains Kerberos principals, password policies, and keytabs for the
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:crossRealmTrustPrincipalPassword:KerberosAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>kerberosAttributes_crossRealmTrustPrincipalPassword</a> - Required
--   only when establishing a cross-realm trust with a KDC in a different
--   realm. The cross-realm principal password, which must be identical
--   across realms.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aDDomainJoinPassword:KerberosAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>kerberosAttributes_aDDomainJoinPassword</a> - The Active Directory
--   password for <tt>ADDomainJoinUser</tt>.
newKerberosAttributes :: KerberosAttributes

-- | The name of the Kerberos realm to which all nodes in a cluster belong.
--   For example, <tt>EC2.INTERNAL</tt>.
kerberosAttributes_realm :: Lens' KerberosAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | Required only when establishing a cross-realm trust with an Active
--   Directory domain. A user with sufficient privileges to join resources
--   to the domain.
kerberosAttributes_aDDomainJoinUser :: Lens' KerberosAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The password used within the cluster for the kadmin service on the
--   cluster-dedicated KDC, which maintains Kerberos principals, password
--   policies, and keytabs for the cluster.
kerberosAttributes_kdcAdminPassword :: Lens' KerberosAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | Required only when establishing a cross-realm trust with a KDC in a
--   different realm. The cross-realm principal password, which must be
--   identical across realms.
kerberosAttributes_crossRealmTrustPrincipalPassword :: Lens' KerberosAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The Active Directory password for <tt>ADDomainJoinUser</tt>.
kerberosAttributes_aDDomainJoinPassword :: Lens' KerberosAttributes (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.KerberosAttributes.KerberosAttributes
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.KerberosAttributes.KerberosAttributes
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.KerberosAttributes.KerberosAttributes
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.KerberosAttributes.KerberosAttributes
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.KerberosAttributes.KerberosAttributes
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.KerberosAttributes.KerberosAttributes
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.KerberosAttributes.KerberosAttributes
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.KerberosAttributes.KerberosAttributes


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.KeyValue

-- | A key-value pair.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKeyValue</a> smart constructor.
data KeyValue
KeyValue' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> KeyValue

-- | The unique identifier of a key-value pair.
[$sel:key:KeyValue'] :: KeyValue -> Maybe Text

-- | The value part of the identified key.
[$sel:value:KeyValue'] :: KeyValue -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>KeyValue</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:KeyValue'</a>, <a>keyValue_key</a> - The unique identifier
--   of a key-value pair.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:KeyValue'</a>, <a>keyValue_value</a> - The value part of
--   the identified key.
newKeyValue :: KeyValue

-- | The unique identifier of a key-value pair.
keyValue_key :: Lens' KeyValue (Maybe Text)

-- | The value part of the identified key.
keyValue_value :: Lens' KeyValue (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.KeyValue.KeyValue
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.KeyValue.KeyValue
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.KeyValue.KeyValue
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.KeyValue.KeyValue
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.KeyValue.KeyValue
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.KeyValue.KeyValue
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.KeyValue.KeyValue


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.HadoopJarStepConfig

-- | A job flow step consisting of a JAR file whose main function will be
--   executed. The main function submits a job for Hadoop to execute and
--   waits for the job to finish or fail.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHadoopJarStepConfig</a> smart constructor.
data HadoopJarStepConfig
HadoopJarStepConfig' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [KeyValue] -> Maybe Text -> Text -> HadoopJarStepConfig

-- | A list of command line arguments passed to the JAR file's main
--   function when executed.
[$sel:args:HadoopJarStepConfig'] :: HadoopJarStepConfig -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of Java properties that are set when the step runs. You can use
--   these properties to pass key-value pairs to your main function.
[$sel:properties:HadoopJarStepConfig'] :: HadoopJarStepConfig -> Maybe [KeyValue]

-- | The name of the main class in the specified Java file. If not
--   specified, the JAR file should specify a Main-Class in its manifest
--   file.
[$sel:mainClass:HadoopJarStepConfig'] :: HadoopJarStepConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | A path to a JAR file run during the step.
[$sel:jar:HadoopJarStepConfig'] :: HadoopJarStepConfig -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>HadoopJarStepConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:args:HadoopJarStepConfig'</a>, <a>hadoopJarStepConfig_args</a>
--   - A list of command line arguments passed to the JAR file's main
--   function when executed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:properties:HadoopJarStepConfig'</a>,
--   <a>hadoopJarStepConfig_properties</a> - A list of Java properties that
--   are set when the step runs. You can use these properties to pass
--   key-value pairs to your main function.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mainClass:HadoopJarStepConfig'</a>,
--   <a>hadoopJarStepConfig_mainClass</a> - The name of the main class in
--   the specified Java file. If not specified, the JAR file should specify
--   a Main-Class in its manifest file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jar:HadoopJarStepConfig'</a>, <a>hadoopJarStepConfig_jar</a> -
--   A path to a JAR file run during the step.
newHadoopJarStepConfig :: Text -> HadoopJarStepConfig

-- | A list of command line arguments passed to the JAR file's main
--   function when executed.
hadoopJarStepConfig_args :: Lens' HadoopJarStepConfig (Maybe [Text])

-- | A list of Java properties that are set when the step runs. You can use
--   these properties to pass key-value pairs to your main function.
hadoopJarStepConfig_properties :: Lens' HadoopJarStepConfig (Maybe [KeyValue])

-- | The name of the main class in the specified Java file. If not
--   specified, the JAR file should specify a Main-Class in its manifest
--   file.
hadoopJarStepConfig_mainClass :: Lens' HadoopJarStepConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | A path to a JAR file run during the step.
hadoopJarStepConfig_jar :: Lens' HadoopJarStepConfig Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.HadoopJarStepConfig.HadoopJarStepConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.HadoopJarStepConfig.HadoopJarStepConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.HadoopJarStepConfig.HadoopJarStepConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.HadoopJarStepConfig.HadoopJarStepConfig

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ManagedScalingPolicy

-- | Managed scaling policy for an Amazon EMR cluster. The policy specifies
--   the limits for resources that can be added or terminated from a
--   cluster. The policy only applies to the core and task nodes. The
--   master node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newManagedScalingPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data ManagedScalingPolicy
ManagedScalingPolicy' :: Maybe ComputeLimits -> ManagedScalingPolicy

-- | The EC2 unit limits for a managed scaling policy. The managed scaling
--   activity of a cluster is not allowed to go above or below these
--   limits. The limit only applies to the core and task nodes. The master
--   node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.
[$sel:computeLimits:ManagedScalingPolicy'] :: ManagedScalingPolicy -> Maybe ComputeLimits

-- | Create a value of <a>ManagedScalingPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:computeLimits:ManagedScalingPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>managedScalingPolicy_computeLimits</a> - The EC2 unit limits for a
--   managed scaling policy. The managed scaling activity of a cluster is
--   not allowed to go above or below these limits. The limit only applies
--   to the core and task nodes. The master node cannot be scaled after
--   initial configuration.
newManagedScalingPolicy :: ManagedScalingPolicy

-- | The EC2 unit limits for a managed scaling policy. The managed scaling
--   activity of a cluster is not allowed to go above or below these
--   limits. The limit only applies to the core and task nodes. The master
--   node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.
managedScalingPolicy_computeLimits :: Lens' ManagedScalingPolicy (Maybe ComputeLimits)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ManagedScalingPolicy.ManagedScalingPolicy
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ManagedScalingPolicy.ManagedScalingPolicy
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ManagedScalingPolicy.ManagedScalingPolicy
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ManagedScalingPolicy.ManagedScalingPolicy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ManagedScalingPolicy.ManagedScalingPolicy
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ManagedScalingPolicy.ManagedScalingPolicy
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ManagedScalingPolicy.ManagedScalingPolicy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ManagedScalingPolicy.ManagedScalingPolicy

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Instance

-- | Represents an EC2 instance provisioned as part of cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstance</a> smart constructor.
data Instance
Instance' :: Maybe [EbsVolume] -> Maybe InstanceStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MarketType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Instance

-- | The list of Amazon EBS volumes that are attached to this instance.
[$sel:ebsVolumes:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe [EbsVolume]

-- | The current status of the instance.
[$sel:status:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe InstanceStatus

-- | The EC2 instance type, for example <tt>m3.xlarge</tt>.
[$sel:instanceType:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the instance group to which this instance belongs.
[$sel:instanceGroupId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the instance in Amazon EMR.
[$sel:id:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier of the instance fleet to which an EC2 instance
--   belongs.
[$sel:instanceFleetId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The public DNS name of the instance.
[$sel:publicDnsName:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance purchasing option. Valid values are <tt>ON_DEMAND</tt> or
--   <tt>SPOT</tt>.
[$sel:market:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe MarketType

-- | The public IP address of the instance.
[$sel:publicIpAddress:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The private DNS name of the instance.
[$sel:privateDnsName:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier of the instance in Amazon EC2.
[$sel:ec2InstanceId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The private IP address of the instance.
[$sel:privateIpAddress:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Instance</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsVolumes:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_ebsVolumes</a> - The
--   list of Amazon EBS volumes that are attached to this instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_status</a> - The current
--   status of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_instanceType</a> - The
--   EC2 instance type, for example <tt>m3.xlarge</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceGroupId:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_instanceGroupId</a>
--   - The identifier of the instance group to which this instance belongs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_id</a> - The unique identifier
--   for the instance in Amazon EMR.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceFleetId:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_instanceFleetId</a>
--   - The unique identifier of the instance fleet to which an EC2 instance
--   belongs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicDnsName:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_publicDnsName</a> -
--   The public DNS name of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:market:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_market</a> - The instance
--   purchasing option. Valid values are <tt>ON_DEMAND</tt> or
--   <tt>SPOT</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicIpAddress:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_publicIpAddress</a>
--   - The public IP address of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:privateDnsName:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_privateDnsName</a> -
--   The private DNS name of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2InstanceId:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_ec2InstanceId</a> -
--   The unique identifier of the instance in Amazon EC2.
--   
--   <a>$sel:privateIpAddress:Instance'</a>,
--   <a>instance_privateIpAddress</a> - The private IP address of the
--   instance.
newInstance :: Instance

-- | The list of Amazon EBS volumes that are attached to this instance.
instance_ebsVolumes :: Lens' Instance (Maybe [EbsVolume])

-- | The current status of the instance.
instance_status :: Lens' Instance (Maybe InstanceStatus)

-- | The EC2 instance type, for example <tt>m3.xlarge</tt>.
instance_instanceType :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the instance group to which this instance belongs.
instance_instanceGroupId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the instance in Amazon EMR.
instance_id :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier of the instance fleet to which an EC2 instance
--   belongs.
instance_instanceFleetId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The public DNS name of the instance.
instance_publicDnsName :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance purchasing option. Valid values are <tt>ON_DEMAND</tt> or
--   <tt>SPOT</tt>.
instance_market :: Lens' Instance (Maybe MarketType)

-- | The public IP address of the instance.
instance_publicIpAddress :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The private DNS name of the instance.
instance_privateDnsName :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier of the instance in Amazon EC2.
instance_ec2InstanceId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The private IP address of the instance.
instance_privateIpAddress :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Instance.Instance
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Instance.Instance
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Instance.Instance
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Instance.Instance
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Instance.Instance
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Instance.Instance
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Instance.Instance


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.MetricDimension

-- | A CloudWatch dimension, which is specified using a <tt>Key</tt> (known
--   as a <tt>Name</tt> in CloudWatch), <tt>Value</tt> pair. By default,
--   Amazon EMR uses one dimension whose <tt>Key</tt> is <tt>JobFlowID</tt>
--   and <tt>Value</tt> is a variable representing the cluster ID, which is
--   <tt>${emr.clusterId}</tt>. This enables the rule to bootstrap when the
--   cluster ID becomes available.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricDimension</a> smart constructor.
data MetricDimension
MetricDimension' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> MetricDimension

-- | The dimension name.
[$sel:key:MetricDimension'] :: MetricDimension -> Maybe Text

-- | The dimension value.
[$sel:value:MetricDimension'] :: MetricDimension -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MetricDimension</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:MetricDimension'</a>, <a>metricDimension_key</a> - The
--   dimension name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:MetricDimension'</a>, <a>metricDimension_value</a> - The
--   dimension value.
newMetricDimension :: MetricDimension

-- | The dimension name.
metricDimension_key :: Lens' MetricDimension (Maybe Text)

-- | The dimension value.
metricDimension_value :: Lens' MetricDimension (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.NotebookExecutionSummary

-- | Details for a notebook execution. The details include information such
--   as the unique ID and status of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNotebookExecutionSummary</a> smart constructor.
data NotebookExecutionSummary
NotebookExecutionSummary' :: Maybe NotebookExecutionStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> NotebookExecutionSummary

-- | The status of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>START_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received the
--   execution request but execution has not begun.</li>
--   <li><tt>STARTING</tt> indicates that the execution is starting on the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> indicates that the execution is being processed
--   by the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHING</tt> indicates that execution processing is in the
--   final stages.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHED</tt> indicates that the execution has completed
--   without error.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILING</tt> indicates that the execution is failing and will
--   not finish successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> indicates that the execution failed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOP_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request and the stop is pending.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt> indicates that the cluster is in the process of
--   stopping the execution as a result of a <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt>
--   request.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt> indicates that the execution stopped because of a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:NotebookExecutionSummary'] :: NotebookExecutionSummary -> Maybe NotebookExecutionStatus

-- | The name of the notebook execution.
[$sel:notebookExecutionName:NotebookExecutionSummary'] :: NotebookExecutionSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier of the editor associated with the notebook
--   execution.
[$sel:editorId:NotebookExecutionSummary'] :: NotebookExecutionSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier of the notebook execution.
[$sel:notebookExecutionId:NotebookExecutionSummary'] :: NotebookExecutionSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when notebook execution started.
[$sel:startTime:NotebookExecutionSummary'] :: NotebookExecutionSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The timestamp when notebook execution started.
[$sel:endTime:NotebookExecutionSummary'] :: NotebookExecutionSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>NotebookExecutionSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:NotebookExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecutionSummary_status</a> - The status of the notebook
--   execution.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>START_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received the
--   execution request but execution has not begun.</li>
--   <li><tt>STARTING</tt> indicates that the execution is starting on the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> indicates that the execution is being processed
--   by the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHING</tt> indicates that execution processing is in the
--   final stages.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHED</tt> indicates that the execution has completed
--   without error.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILING</tt> indicates that the execution is failing and will
--   not finish successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> indicates that the execution failed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOP_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request and the stop is pending.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt> indicates that the cluster is in the process of
--   stopping the execution as a result of a <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt>
--   request.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt> indicates that the execution stopped because of a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:notebookExecutionName:NotebookExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecutionSummary_notebookExecutionName</a> - The name of
--   the notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:editorId:NotebookExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecutionSummary_editorId</a> - The unique identifier of
--   the editor associated with the notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notebookExecutionId:NotebookExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecutionSummary_notebookExecutionId</a> - The unique
--   identifier of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:NotebookExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecutionSummary_startTime</a> - The timestamp when
--   notebook execution started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:NotebookExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecutionSummary_endTime</a> - The timestamp when notebook
--   execution started.
newNotebookExecutionSummary :: NotebookExecutionSummary

-- | The status of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>START_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received the
--   execution request but execution has not begun.</li>
--   <li><tt>STARTING</tt> indicates that the execution is starting on the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> indicates that the execution is being processed
--   by the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHING</tt> indicates that execution processing is in the
--   final stages.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHED</tt> indicates that the execution has completed
--   without error.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILING</tt> indicates that the execution is failing and will
--   not finish successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> indicates that the execution failed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOP_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request and the stop is pending.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt> indicates that the cluster is in the process of
--   stopping the execution as a result of a <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt>
--   request.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt> indicates that the execution stopped because of a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request.</li>
--   </ul>
notebookExecutionSummary_status :: Lens' NotebookExecutionSummary (Maybe NotebookExecutionStatus)

-- | The name of the notebook execution.
notebookExecutionSummary_notebookExecutionName :: Lens' NotebookExecutionSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier of the editor associated with the notebook
--   execution.
notebookExecutionSummary_editorId :: Lens' NotebookExecutionSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier of the notebook execution.
notebookExecutionSummary_notebookExecutionId :: Lens' NotebookExecutionSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when notebook execution started.
notebookExecutionSummary_startTime :: Lens' NotebookExecutionSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The timestamp when notebook execution started.
notebookExecutionSummary_endTime :: Lens' NotebookExecutionSummary (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.NotebookExecutionSummary.NotebookExecutionSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.NotebookExecutionSummary.NotebookExecutionSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.NotebookExecutionSummary.NotebookExecutionSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.NotebookExecutionSummary.NotebookExecutionSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.NotebookExecutionSummary.NotebookExecutionSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.NotebookExecutionSummary.NotebookExecutionSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.NotebookExecutionSummary.NotebookExecutionSummary

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.OnDemandCapacityReservationPreference.OnDemandCapacityReservationPreference

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions

-- | Describes the strategy for using unused Capacity Reservations for
--   fulfilling On-Demand capacity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOnDemandCapacityReservationOptions</a> smart
--   constructor.
data OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions
OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions' :: Maybe OnDemandCapacityReservationPreference -> Maybe Text -> Maybe OnDemandCapacityReservationUsageStrategy -> OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions

-- | Indicates the instance's Capacity Reservation preferences. Possible
--   preferences include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>open</tt> - The instance can run in any open Capacity
--   Reservation that has matching attributes (instance type, platform,
--   Availability Zone).</li>
--   <li><tt>none</tt> - The instance avoids running in a Capacity
--   Reservation even if one is available. The instance runs as an
--   On-Demand Instance.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:capacityReservationPreference:OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions'] :: OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions -> Maybe OnDemandCapacityReservationPreference

-- | The ARN of the Capacity Reservation resource group in which to run the
--   instance.
[$sel:capacityReservationResourceGroupArn:OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions'] :: OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether to use unused Capacity Reservations for fulfilling
--   On-Demand capacity.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>use-capacity-reservations-first</tt>, the fleet
--   uses unused Capacity Reservations to fulfill On-Demand capacity up to
--   the target On-Demand capacity. If multiple instance pools have unused
--   Capacity Reservations, the On-Demand allocation strategy
--   (<tt>lowest-price</tt>) is applied. If the number of unused Capacity
--   Reservations is less than the On-Demand target capacity, the remaining
--   On-Demand target capacity is launched according to the On-Demand
--   allocation strategy (<tt>lowest-price</tt>).
--   
--   If you do not specify a value, the fleet fulfills the On-Demand
--   capacity according to the chosen On-Demand allocation strategy.
[$sel:usageStrategy:OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions'] :: OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions -> Maybe OnDemandCapacityReservationUsageStrategy

-- | Create a value of <a>OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:capacityReservationPreference:OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions'</a>,
--   <a>onDemandCapacityReservationOptions_capacityReservationPreference</a>
--   - Indicates the instance's Capacity Reservation preferences. Possible
--   preferences include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>open</tt> - The instance can run in any open Capacity
--   Reservation that has matching attributes (instance type, platform,
--   Availability Zone).</li>
--   <li><tt>none</tt> - The instance avoids running in a Capacity
--   Reservation even if one is available. The instance runs as an
--   On-Demand Instance.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:capacityReservationResourceGroupArn:OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions'</a>,
--   <a>onDemandCapacityReservationOptions_capacityReservationResourceGroupArn</a>
--   - The ARN of the Capacity Reservation resource group in which to run
--   the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:usageStrategy:OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions'</a>,
--   <a>onDemandCapacityReservationOptions_usageStrategy</a> - Indicates
--   whether to use unused Capacity Reservations for fulfilling On-Demand
--   capacity.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>use-capacity-reservations-first</tt>, the fleet
--   uses unused Capacity Reservations to fulfill On-Demand capacity up to
--   the target On-Demand capacity. If multiple instance pools have unused
--   Capacity Reservations, the On-Demand allocation strategy
--   (<tt>lowest-price</tt>) is applied. If the number of unused Capacity
--   Reservations is less than the On-Demand target capacity, the remaining
--   On-Demand target capacity is launched according to the On-Demand
--   allocation strategy (<tt>lowest-price</tt>).
--   
--   If you do not specify a value, the fleet fulfills the On-Demand
--   capacity according to the chosen On-Demand allocation strategy.
newOnDemandCapacityReservationOptions :: OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions

-- | Indicates the instance's Capacity Reservation preferences. Possible
--   preferences include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>open</tt> - The instance can run in any open Capacity
--   Reservation that has matching attributes (instance type, platform,
--   Availability Zone).</li>
--   <li><tt>none</tt> - The instance avoids running in a Capacity
--   Reservation even if one is available. The instance runs as an
--   On-Demand Instance.</li>
--   </ul>
onDemandCapacityReservationOptions_capacityReservationPreference :: Lens' OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions (Maybe OnDemandCapacityReservationPreference)

-- | The ARN of the Capacity Reservation resource group in which to run the
--   instance.
onDemandCapacityReservationOptions_capacityReservationResourceGroupArn :: Lens' OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether to use unused Capacity Reservations for fulfilling
--   On-Demand capacity.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>use-capacity-reservations-first</tt>, the fleet
--   uses unused Capacity Reservations to fulfill On-Demand capacity up to
--   the target On-Demand capacity. If multiple instance pools have unused
--   Capacity Reservations, the On-Demand allocation strategy
--   (<tt>lowest-price</tt>) is applied. If the number of unused Capacity
--   Reservations is less than the On-Demand target capacity, the remaining
--   On-Demand target capacity is launched according to the On-Demand
--   allocation strategy (<tt>lowest-price</tt>).
--   
--   If you do not specify a value, the fleet fulfills the On-Demand
--   capacity according to the chosen On-Demand allocation strategy.
onDemandCapacityReservationOptions_usageStrategy :: Lens' OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions (Maybe OnDemandCapacityReservationUsageStrategy)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions.OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions.OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions.OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions.OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.OnDemandProvisioningSpecification

-- | The launch specification for On-Demand Instances in the instance
--   fleet, which determines the allocation strategy.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions. On-Demand
--   Instances allocation strategy is available in Amazon EMR version
--   5.12.1 and later.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOnDemandProvisioningSpecification</a> smart
--   constructor.
data OnDemandProvisioningSpecification
OnDemandProvisioningSpecification' :: Maybe OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions -> OnDemandProvisioningAllocationStrategy -> OnDemandProvisioningSpecification

-- | The launch specification for On-Demand instances in the instance
--   fleet, which determines the allocation strategy.
[$sel:capacityReservationOptions:OnDemandProvisioningSpecification'] :: OnDemandProvisioningSpecification -> Maybe OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions

-- | Specifies the strategy to use in launching On-Demand instance fleets.
--   Currently, the only option is <tt>lowest-price</tt> (the default),
--   which launches the lowest price first.
[$sel:allocationStrategy:OnDemandProvisioningSpecification'] :: OnDemandProvisioningSpecification -> OnDemandProvisioningAllocationStrategy

-- | Create a value of <a>OnDemandProvisioningSpecification</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:capacityReservationOptions:OnDemandProvisioningSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>onDemandProvisioningSpecification_capacityReservationOptions</a> -
--   The launch specification for On-Demand instances in the instance
--   fleet, which determines the allocation strategy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allocationStrategy:OnDemandProvisioningSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>onDemandProvisioningSpecification_allocationStrategy</a> -
--   Specifies the strategy to use in launching On-Demand instance fleets.
--   Currently, the only option is <tt>lowest-price</tt> (the default),
--   which launches the lowest price first.
newOnDemandProvisioningSpecification :: OnDemandProvisioningAllocationStrategy -> OnDemandProvisioningSpecification

-- | The launch specification for On-Demand instances in the instance
--   fleet, which determines the allocation strategy.
onDemandProvisioningSpecification_capacityReservationOptions :: Lens' OnDemandProvisioningSpecification (Maybe OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions)

-- | Specifies the strategy to use in launching On-Demand instance fleets.
--   Currently, the only option is <tt>lowest-price</tt> (the default),
--   which launches the lowest price first.
onDemandProvisioningSpecification_allocationStrategy :: Lens' OnDemandProvisioningSpecification OnDemandProvisioningAllocationStrategy

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.PlacementGroupConfig

-- | Placement group configuration for an Amazon EMR cluster. The
--   configuration specifies the placement strategy that can be applied to
--   instance roles during cluster creation.
--   
--   To use this configuration, consider attaching managed policy
--   AmazonElasticMapReducePlacementGroupPolicy to the EMR role.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPlacementGroupConfig</a> smart constructor.
data PlacementGroupConfig
PlacementGroupConfig' :: Maybe PlacementGroupStrategy -> InstanceRoleType -> PlacementGroupConfig

-- | EC2 Placement Group strategy associated with instance role.
--   
--   Starting with Amazon EMR version 5.23.0, the only supported placement
--   strategy is <tt>SPREAD</tt> for the <tt>MASTER</tt> instance role.
[$sel:placementStrategy:PlacementGroupConfig'] :: PlacementGroupConfig -> Maybe PlacementGroupStrategy

-- | Role of the instance in the cluster.
--   
--   Starting with Amazon EMR version 5.23.0, the only supported instance
--   role is <tt>MASTER</tt>.
[$sel:instanceRole:PlacementGroupConfig'] :: PlacementGroupConfig -> InstanceRoleType

-- | Create a value of <a>PlacementGroupConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:placementStrategy:PlacementGroupConfig'</a>,
--   <a>placementGroupConfig_placementStrategy</a> - EC2 Placement Group
--   strategy associated with instance role.
--   
--   Starting with Amazon EMR version 5.23.0, the only supported placement
--   strategy is <tt>SPREAD</tt> for the <tt>MASTER</tt> instance role.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceRole:PlacementGroupConfig'</a>,
--   <a>placementGroupConfig_instanceRole</a> - Role of the instance in the
--   cluster.
--   
--   Starting with Amazon EMR version 5.23.0, the only supported instance
--   role is <tt>MASTER</tt>.
newPlacementGroupConfig :: InstanceRoleType -> PlacementGroupConfig

-- | EC2 Placement Group strategy associated with instance role.
--   
--   Starting with Amazon EMR version 5.23.0, the only supported placement
--   strategy is <tt>SPREAD</tt> for the <tt>MASTER</tt> instance role.
placementGroupConfig_placementStrategy :: Lens' PlacementGroupConfig (Maybe PlacementGroupStrategy)

-- | Role of the instance in the cluster.
--   
--   Starting with Amazon EMR version 5.23.0, the only supported instance
--   role is <tt>MASTER</tt>.
placementGroupConfig_instanceRole :: Lens' PlacementGroupConfig InstanceRoleType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.PlacementGroupConfig.PlacementGroupConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.PlacementGroupConfig.PlacementGroupConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.PlacementGroupConfig.PlacementGroupConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.PlacementGroupConfig.PlacementGroupConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.PlacementGroupConfig.PlacementGroupConfig

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.PlacementType

-- | The Amazon EC2 Availability Zone configuration of the cluster (job
--   flow).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPlacementType</a> smart constructor.
data PlacementType
PlacementType' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> PlacementType

-- | When multiple Availability Zones are specified, Amazon EMR evaluates
--   them and launches instances in the optimal Availability Zone.
--   <tt>AvailabilityZones</tt> is used for instance fleets, while
--   <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> (singular) is used for uniform instance
--   groups.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
[$sel:availabilityZones:PlacementType'] :: PlacementType -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The Amazon EC2 Availability Zone for the cluster.
--   <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> is used for uniform instance groups, while
--   <tt>AvailabilityZones</tt> (plural) is used for instance fleets.
[$sel:availabilityZone:PlacementType'] :: PlacementType -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PlacementType</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZones:PlacementType'</a>,
--   <a>placementType_availabilityZones</a> - When multiple Availability
--   Zones are specified, Amazon EMR evaluates them and launches instances
--   in the optimal Availability Zone. <tt>AvailabilityZones</tt> is used
--   for instance fleets, while <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> (singular) is
--   used for uniform instance groups.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:PlacementType'</a>,
--   <a>placementType_availabilityZone</a> - The Amazon EC2 Availability
--   Zone for the cluster. <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> is used for uniform
--   instance groups, while <tt>AvailabilityZones</tt> (plural) is used for
--   instance fleets.
newPlacementType :: PlacementType

-- | When multiple Availability Zones are specified, Amazon EMR evaluates
--   them and launches instances in the optimal Availability Zone.
--   <tt>AvailabilityZones</tt> is used for instance fleets, while
--   <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> (singular) is used for uniform instance
--   groups.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
placementType_availabilityZones :: Lens' PlacementType (Maybe [Text])

-- | The Amazon EC2 Availability Zone for the cluster.
--   <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> is used for uniform instance groups, while
--   <tt>AvailabilityZones</tt> (plural) is used for instance fleets.
placementType_availabilityZone :: Lens' PlacementType (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.PlacementType.PlacementType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.PlacementType.PlacementType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.PlacementType.PlacementType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.PlacementType.PlacementType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.PlacementType.PlacementType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.PlacementType.PlacementType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.PlacementType.PlacementType


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.PortRange

-- | A list of port ranges that are permitted to allow inbound traffic from
--   all public IP addresses. To specify a single port, use the same value
--   for <tt>MinRange</tt> and <tt>MaxRange</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPortRange</a> smart constructor.
data PortRange
PortRange' :: Maybe Int -> Int -> PortRange

-- | The smallest port number in a specified range of port numbers.
[$sel:maxRange:PortRange'] :: PortRange -> Maybe Int

-- | The smallest port number in a specified range of port numbers.
[$sel:minRange:PortRange'] :: PortRange -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>PortRange</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxRange:PortRange'</a>, <a>portRange_maxRange</a> - The
--   smallest port number in a specified range of port numbers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minRange:PortRange'</a>, <a>portRange_minRange</a> - The
--   smallest port number in a specified range of port numbers.
newPortRange :: Int -> PortRange

-- | The smallest port number in a specified range of port numbers.
portRange_maxRange :: Lens' PortRange (Maybe Int)

-- | The smallest port number in a specified range of port numbers.
portRange_minRange :: Lens' PortRange Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.PortRange.PortRange
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.PortRange.PortRange
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.PortRange.PortRange
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.PortRange.PortRange

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration

-- | A configuration for Amazon EMR block public access. When
--   <tt>BlockPublicSecurityGroupRules</tt> is set to <tt>true</tt>, Amazon
--   EMR prevents cluster creation if one of the cluster's security groups
--   has a rule that allows inbound traffic from 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 on a
--   port, unless the port is specified as an exception using
--   <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBlockPublicAccessConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data BlockPublicAccessConfiguration
BlockPublicAccessConfiguration' :: Maybe [PortRange] -> Bool -> BlockPublicAccessConfiguration

-- | Specifies ports and port ranges that are permitted to have security
--   group rules that allow inbound traffic from all public sources. For
--   example, if Port 23 (Telnet) is specified for
--   <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>, Amazon EMR allows
--   cluster creation if a security group associated with the cluster has a
--   rule that allows inbound traffic on Port 23 from IPv4 0.0.0.0/0 or
--   IPv6 port ::/0 as the source.
--   
--   By default, Port 22, which is used for SSH access to the cluster EC2
--   instances, is in the list of
--   <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>.
[$sel:permittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges:BlockPublicAccessConfiguration'] :: BlockPublicAccessConfiguration -> Maybe [PortRange]

-- | Indicates whether Amazon EMR block public access is enabled
--   (<tt>true</tt>) or disabled (<tt>false</tt>). By default, the value is
--   <tt>false</tt> for accounts that have created EMR clusters before July
--   2019. For accounts created after this, the default is <tt>true</tt>.
[$sel:blockPublicSecurityGroupRules:BlockPublicAccessConfiguration'] :: BlockPublicAccessConfiguration -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>BlockPublicAccessConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:permittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges:BlockPublicAccessConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>blockPublicAccessConfiguration_permittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</a>
--   - Specifies ports and port ranges that are permitted to have security
--   group rules that allow inbound traffic from all public sources. For
--   example, if Port 23 (Telnet) is specified for
--   <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>, Amazon EMR allows
--   cluster creation if a security group associated with the cluster has a
--   rule that allows inbound traffic on Port 23 from IPv4 0.0.0.0/0 or
--   IPv6 port ::/0 as the source.
--   
--   By default, Port 22, which is used for SSH access to the cluster EC2
--   instances, is in the list of
--   <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockPublicSecurityGroupRules:BlockPublicAccessConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>blockPublicAccessConfiguration_blockPublicSecurityGroupRules</a> -
--   Indicates whether Amazon EMR block public access is enabled
--   (<tt>true</tt>) or disabled (<tt>false</tt>). By default, the value is
--   <tt>false</tt> for accounts that have created EMR clusters before July
--   2019. For accounts created after this, the default is <tt>true</tt>.
newBlockPublicAccessConfiguration :: Bool -> BlockPublicAccessConfiguration

-- | Specifies ports and port ranges that are permitted to have security
--   group rules that allow inbound traffic from all public sources. For
--   example, if Port 23 (Telnet) is specified for
--   <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>, Amazon EMR allows
--   cluster creation if a security group associated with the cluster has a
--   rule that allows inbound traffic on Port 23 from IPv4 0.0.0.0/0 or
--   IPv6 port ::/0 as the source.
--   
--   By default, Port 22, which is used for SSH access to the cluster EC2
--   instances, is in the list of
--   <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>.
blockPublicAccessConfiguration_permittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges :: Lens' BlockPublicAccessConfiguration (Maybe [PortRange])

-- | Indicates whether Amazon EMR block public access is enabled
--   (<tt>true</tt>) or disabled (<tt>false</tt>). By default, the value is
--   <tt>false</tt> for accounts that have created EMR clusters before July
--   2019. For accounts created after this, the default is <tt>true</tt>.
blockPublicAccessConfiguration_blockPublicSecurityGroupRules :: Lens' BlockPublicAccessConfiguration Bool
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration

-- | The release label filters by application or version prefix.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReleaseLabelFilter</a> smart constructor.

--   <tt>emr-5</tt>.
[$sel:prefix:ReleaseLabelFilter'] :: ReleaseLabelFilter -> Maybe Text

-- | Optional release label application filter. For example,
--   <tt>spark@2.1.0</tt>.

--   fields.

--   prefix filter. For example, <tt>emr-5</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:application:ReleaseLabelFilter'</a>,
--   <a>releaseLabelFilter_application</a> - Optional release label
--   application filter. For example, <tt>spark@2.1.0</tt>.
newReleaseLabelFilter :: ReleaseLabelFilter

-- | Optional release label version prefix filter. For example,
--   <tt>emr-5</tt>.

--   <tt>spark@2.1.0</tt>.

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingConstraints

-- | The upper and lower EC2 instance limits for an automatic scaling
--   policy. Automatic scaling activities triggered by automatic scaling
--   rules will not cause an instance group to grow above or below these
--   limits.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScalingConstraints</a> smart constructor.
data ScalingConstraints
ScalingConstraints' :: Int -> Int -> ScalingConstraints

-- | The lower boundary of EC2 instances in an instance group below which
--   scaling activities are not allowed to shrink. Scale-in activities will
--   not terminate instances below this boundary.
[$sel:minCapacity:ScalingConstraints'] :: ScalingConstraints -> Int

-- | The upper boundary of EC2 instances in an instance group beyond which
--   scaling activities are not allowed to grow. Scale-out activities will
--   not add instances beyond this boundary.
[$sel:maxCapacity:ScalingConstraints'] :: ScalingConstraints -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ScalingConstraints</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:minCapacity:ScalingConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>scalingConstraints_minCapacity</a> - The lower boundary of EC2
--   instances in an instance group below which scaling activities are not
--   allowed to shrink. Scale-in activities will not terminate instances
--   below this boundary.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxCapacity:ScalingConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>scalingConstraints_maxCapacity</a> - The upper boundary of EC2
--   instances in an instance group beyond which scaling activities are not
--   allowed to grow. Scale-out activities will not add instances beyond
--   this boundary.
newScalingConstraints :: Int -> Int -> ScalingConstraints

-- | The lower boundary of EC2 instances in an instance group below which
--   scaling activities are not allowed to shrink. Scale-in activities will
--   not terminate instances below this boundary.
scalingConstraints_minCapacity :: Lens' ScalingConstraints Int

-- | The upper boundary of EC2 instances in an instance group beyond which
--   scaling activities are not allowed to grow. Scale-out activities will
--   not add instances beyond this boundary.
scalingConstraints_maxCapacity :: Lens' ScalingConstraints Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingConstraints.ScalingConstraints
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingConstraints.ScalingConstraints
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingConstraints.ScalingConstraints
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingConstraints.ScalingConstraints
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingConstraints.ScalingConstraints
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingConstraints.ScalingConstraints
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingConstraints.ScalingConstraints
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingConstraints.ScalingConstraints

--   script to run during a bootstrap action.

--   script.

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SessionMappingDetail

-- | Details for an Amazon EMR Studio session mapping including creation
--   time, user or group ID, Studio ID, and so on.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSessionMappingDetail</a> smart constructor.
data SessionMappingDetail
SessionMappingDetail' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe IdentityType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SessionMappingDetail

-- | The time the session mapping was created.
[$sel:creationTime:SessionMappingDetail'] :: SessionMappingDetail -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the user or group. For more information, see
--   <a>UserName</a> and <a>DisplayName</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services
--   SSO Identity Store API Reference</i>.
[$sel:identityName:SessionMappingDetail'] :: SessionMappingDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The time the session mapping was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedTime:SessionMappingDetail'] :: SessionMappingDetail -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Specifies whether the identity mapped to the Amazon EMR Studio is a
--   user or a group.
[$sel:identityType:SessionMappingDetail'] :: SessionMappingDetail -> Maybe IdentityType

-- | The globally unique identifier (GUID) of the user or group.
[$sel:identityId:SessionMappingDetail'] :: SessionMappingDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the session policy associated with
--   the user or group.
[$sel:sessionPolicyArn:SessionMappingDetail'] :: SessionMappingDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:studioId:SessionMappingDetail'] :: SessionMappingDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SessionMappingDetail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:SessionMappingDetail'</a>,
--   <a>sessionMappingDetail_creationTime</a> - The time the session
--   mapping was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityName:SessionMappingDetail'</a>,
--   <a>sessionMappingDetail_identityName</a> - The name of the user or
--   group. For more information, see <a>UserName</a> and
--   <a>DisplayName</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services SSO Identity Store
--   API Reference</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedTime:SessionMappingDetail'</a>,
--   <a>sessionMappingDetail_lastModifiedTime</a> - The time the session
--   mapping was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityType:SessionMappingDetail'</a>,
--   <a>sessionMappingDetail_identityType</a> - Specifies whether the
--   identity mapped to the Amazon EMR Studio is a user or a group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityId:SessionMappingDetail'</a>,
--   <a>sessionMappingDetail_identityId</a> - The globally unique
--   identifier (GUID) of the user or group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sessionPolicyArn:SessionMappingDetail'</a>,
--   <a>sessionMappingDetail_sessionPolicyArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the session policy associated with the user or group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:studioId:SessionMappingDetail'</a>,
--   <a>sessionMappingDetail_studioId</a> - The ID of the Amazon EMR
--   Studio.
newSessionMappingDetail :: SessionMappingDetail

-- | The time the session mapping was created.
sessionMappingDetail_creationTime :: Lens' SessionMappingDetail (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the user or group. For more information, see
--   <a>UserName</a> and <a>DisplayName</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services
--   SSO Identity Store API Reference</i>.
sessionMappingDetail_identityName :: Lens' SessionMappingDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The time the session mapping was last modified.
sessionMappingDetail_lastModifiedTime :: Lens' SessionMappingDetail (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies whether the identity mapped to the Amazon EMR Studio is a
--   user or a group.
sessionMappingDetail_identityType :: Lens' SessionMappingDetail (Maybe IdentityType)

-- | The globally unique identifier (GUID) of the user or group.
sessionMappingDetail_identityId :: Lens' SessionMappingDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the session policy associated with
--   the user or group.
sessionMappingDetail_sessionPolicyArn :: Lens' SessionMappingDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio.
sessionMappingDetail_studioId :: Lens' SessionMappingDetail (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SessionMappingDetail.SessionMappingDetail
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SessionMappingDetail.SessionMappingDetail
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SessionMappingDetail.SessionMappingDetail

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SessionMappingSummary

-- | Details for an Amazon EMR Studio session mapping. The details do not
--   include the time the session mapping was last modified.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSessionMappingSummary</a> smart constructor.
data SessionMappingSummary
SessionMappingSummary' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe IdentityType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SessionMappingSummary

-- | The time the session mapping was created.
[$sel:creationTime:SessionMappingSummary'] :: SessionMappingSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the user or group. For more information, see
--   <a>UserName</a> and <a>DisplayName</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services
--   SSO Identity Store API Reference</i>.
[$sel:identityName:SessionMappingSummary'] :: SessionMappingSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the identity mapped to the Amazon EMR Studio is a
--   user or a group.
[$sel:identityType:SessionMappingSummary'] :: SessionMappingSummary -> Maybe IdentityType

-- | The globally unique identifier (GUID) of the user or group from the
--   Amazon Web Services SSO Identity Store.
[$sel:identityId:SessionMappingSummary'] :: SessionMappingSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the session policy associated with
--   the user or group.
[$sel:sessionPolicyArn:SessionMappingSummary'] :: SessionMappingSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:studioId:SessionMappingSummary'] :: SessionMappingSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SessionMappingSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:SessionMappingSummary'</a>,
--   <a>sessionMappingSummary_creationTime</a> - The time the session
--   mapping was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityName:SessionMappingSummary'</a>,
--   <a>sessionMappingSummary_identityName</a> - The name of the user or
--   group. For more information, see <a>UserName</a> and
--   <a>DisplayName</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services SSO Identity Store
--   API Reference</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityType:SessionMappingSummary'</a>,
--   <a>sessionMappingSummary_identityType</a> - Specifies whether the
--   identity mapped to the Amazon EMR Studio is a user or a group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityId:SessionMappingSummary'</a>,
--   <a>sessionMappingSummary_identityId</a> - The globally unique
--   identifier (GUID) of the user or group from the Amazon Web Services
--   SSO Identity Store.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sessionPolicyArn:SessionMappingSummary'</a>,
--   <a>sessionMappingSummary_sessionPolicyArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the session policy associated with the user or group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:studioId:SessionMappingSummary'</a>,
--   <a>sessionMappingSummary_studioId</a> - The ID of the Amazon EMR
--   Studio.
newSessionMappingSummary :: SessionMappingSummary

-- | The time the session mapping was created.
sessionMappingSummary_creationTime :: Lens' SessionMappingSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the user or group. For more information, see
--   <a>UserName</a> and <a>DisplayName</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services
--   SSO Identity Store API Reference</i>.
sessionMappingSummary_identityName :: Lens' SessionMappingSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the identity mapped to the Amazon EMR Studio is a
--   user or a group.
sessionMappingSummary_identityType :: Lens' SessionMappingSummary (Maybe IdentityType)

-- | The globally unique identifier (GUID) of the user or group from the

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ShrinkPolicy

-- | Policy for customizing shrink operations. Allows configuration of
--   decommissioning timeout and targeted instance shrinking.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newShrinkPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data ShrinkPolicy
ShrinkPolicy' :: Maybe InstanceResizePolicy -> Maybe Int -> ShrinkPolicy

-- | Custom policy for requesting termination protection or termination of
--   specific instances when shrinking an instance group.
[$sel:instanceResizePolicy:ShrinkPolicy'] :: ShrinkPolicy -> Maybe InstanceResizePolicy

-- | The desired timeout for decommissioning an instance. Overrides the
--   default YARN decommissioning timeout.
[$sel:decommissionTimeout:ShrinkPolicy'] :: ShrinkPolicy -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ShrinkPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceResizePolicy:ShrinkPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>shrinkPolicy_instanceResizePolicy</a> - Custom policy for
--   requesting termination protection or termination of specific instances
--   when shrinking an instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:decommissionTimeout:ShrinkPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>shrinkPolicy_decommissionTimeout</a> - The desired timeout for
--   decommissioning an instance. Overrides the default YARN
--   decommissioning timeout.
newShrinkPolicy :: ShrinkPolicy

-- | Custom policy for requesting termination protection or termination of
--   specific instances when shrinking an instance group.
shrinkPolicy_instanceResizePolicy :: Lens' ShrinkPolicy (Maybe InstanceResizePolicy)

-- | The desired timeout for decommissioning an instance. Overrides the
--   default YARN decommissioning timeout.
shrinkPolicy_decommissionTimeout :: Lens' ShrinkPolicy (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ShrinkPolicy.ShrinkPolicy
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ShrinkPolicy.ShrinkPolicy
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ShrinkPolicy.ShrinkPolicy
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ShrinkPolicy.ShrinkPolicy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ShrinkPolicy.ShrinkPolicy
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ShrinkPolicy.ShrinkPolicy
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ShrinkPolicy.ShrinkPolicy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ShrinkPolicy.ShrinkPolicy


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceGroupModifyConfig

-- | Modify the size or configurations of an instance group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceGroupModifyConfig</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceGroupModifyConfig
InstanceGroupModifyConfig' :: Maybe [Configuration] -> Maybe ShrinkPolicy -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Int -> Text -> InstanceGroupModifyConfig

-- | A list of new or modified configurations to apply for an instance
--   group.
[$sel:configurations:InstanceGroupModifyConfig'] :: InstanceGroupModifyConfig -> Maybe [Configuration]

-- | Policy for customizing shrink operations.
[$sel:shrinkPolicy:InstanceGroupModifyConfig'] :: InstanceGroupModifyConfig -> Maybe ShrinkPolicy

-- | The EC2 InstanceIds to terminate. After you terminate the instances,
--   the instance group will not return to its original requested size.
[$sel:eC2InstanceIdsToTerminate:InstanceGroupModifyConfig'] :: InstanceGroupModifyConfig -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Target size for the instance group.
[$sel:instanceCount:InstanceGroupModifyConfig'] :: InstanceGroupModifyConfig -> Maybe Int

-- | Unique ID of the instance group to modify.
[$sel:instanceGroupId:InstanceGroupModifyConfig'] :: InstanceGroupModifyConfig -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceGroupModifyConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurations:InstanceGroupModifyConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroupModifyConfig_configurations</a> - A list of new or
--   modified configurations to apply for an instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shrinkPolicy:InstanceGroupModifyConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroupModifyConfig_shrinkPolicy</a> - Policy for customizing
--   shrink operations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eC2InstanceIdsToTerminate:InstanceGroupModifyConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroupModifyConfig_eC2InstanceIdsToTerminate</a> - The EC2
--   InstanceIds to terminate. After you terminate the instances, the
--   instance group will not return to its original requested size.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceCount:InstanceGroupModifyConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroupModifyConfig_instanceCount</a> - Target size for the
--   instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceGroupId:InstanceGroupModifyConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroupModifyConfig_instanceGroupId</a> - Unique ID of the
--   instance group to modify.
newInstanceGroupModifyConfig :: Text -> InstanceGroupModifyConfig

-- | A list of new or modified configurations to apply for an instance
--   group.
instanceGroupModifyConfig_configurations :: Lens' InstanceGroupModifyConfig (Maybe [Configuration])

-- | Policy for customizing shrink operations.
instanceGroupModifyConfig_shrinkPolicy :: Lens' InstanceGroupModifyConfig (Maybe ShrinkPolicy)

-- | The EC2 InstanceIds to terminate. After you terminate the instances,
--   the instance group will not return to its original requested size.
instanceGroupModifyConfig_eC2InstanceIdsToTerminate :: Lens' InstanceGroupModifyConfig (Maybe [Text])

-- | Target size for the instance group.
instanceGroupModifyConfig_instanceCount :: Lens' InstanceGroupModifyConfig (Maybe Int)

-- | Unique ID of the instance group to modify.
instanceGroupModifyConfig_instanceGroupId :: Lens' InstanceGroupModifyConfig Text
