module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration

-- | An automatic scaling configuration, which describes how the policy
--   adds or removes instances, the cooldown period, and the number of EC2
--   instances that will be added each time the CloudWatch metric alarm
--   condition is satisfied.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration
SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe AdjustmentType -> Int -> SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes
--   before any further trigger-related scaling activities can start. The
--   default value is 0.
[$sel:coolDown:SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration'] :: SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration -> Maybe Int

-- | The way in which EC2 instances are added (if
--   <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt> is a positive number) or terminated (if
--   <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt> is a negative number) each time the scaling
--   activity is triggered. <tt>CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt> is the default.
--   <tt>CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt> indicates that the EC2 instance count
--   increments or decrements by <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt>, which should
--   be expressed as an integer. <tt>PERCENT_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt>
--   indicates the instance count increments or decrements by the
--   percentage specified by <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt>, which should be
--   expressed as an integer. For example, 20 indicates an increase in 20%
--   increments of cluster capacity. <tt>EXACT_CAPACITY</tt> indicates the
--   scaling activity results in an instance group with the number of EC2
--   instances specified by <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt>, which should be
--   expressed as a positive integer.
[$sel:adjustmentType:SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration'] :: SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration -> Maybe AdjustmentType

-- | The amount by which to scale in or scale out, based on the specified
--   <tt>AdjustmentType</tt>. A positive value adds to the instance group's
--   EC2 instance count while a negative number removes instances. If
--   <tt>AdjustmentType</tt> is set to <tt>EXACT_CAPACITY</tt>, the number
--   should only be a positive integer. If <tt>AdjustmentType</tt> is set
--   to <tt>PERCENT_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt>, the value should express the
--   percentage as an integer. For example, -20 indicates a decrease in 20%
--   increments of cluster capacity.
[$sel:scalingAdjustment:SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration'] :: SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:coolDown:SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration_coolDown</a> - The amount of time,
--   in seconds, after a scaling activity completes before any further
--   trigger-related scaling activities can start. The default value is 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:adjustmentType:SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration_adjustmentType</a> - The way in
--   which EC2 instances are added (if <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt> is a
--   positive number) or terminated (if <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt> is a
--   negative number) each time the scaling activity is triggered.
--   <tt>CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt> is the default.
--   <tt>CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt> indicates that the EC2 instance count
--   increments or decrements by <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt>, which should
--   be expressed as an integer. <tt>PERCENT_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt>
--   indicates the instance count increments or decrements by the
--   percentage specified by <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt>, which should be
--   expressed as an integer. For example, 20 indicates an increase in 20%
--   increments of cluster capacity. <tt>EXACT_CAPACITY</tt> indicates the
--   scaling activity results in an instance group with the number of EC2
--   instances specified by <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt>, which should be
--   expressed as a positive integer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scalingAdjustment:SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration_scalingAdjustment</a> - The amount
--   by which to scale in or scale out, based on the specified
--   <tt>AdjustmentType</tt>. A positive value adds to the instance group's
--   EC2 instance count while a negative number removes instances. If
--   <tt>AdjustmentType</tt> is set to <tt>EXACT_CAPACITY</tt>, the number
--   should only be a positive integer. If <tt>AdjustmentType</tt> is set
--   to <tt>PERCENT_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt>, the value should express the
--   percentage as an integer. For example, -20 indicates a decrease in 20%
--   increments of cluster capacity.
newSimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration :: Int -> SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes
--   before any further trigger-related scaling activities can start. The
--   default value is 0.
simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration_coolDown :: Lens' SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration (Maybe Int)

-- | The way in which EC2 instances are added (if
--   <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt> is a positive number) or terminated (if
--   <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt> is a negative number) each time the scaling
--   activity is triggered. <tt>CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt> is the default.
--   <tt>CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt> indicates that the EC2 instance count
--   increments or decrements by <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt>, which should
--   be expressed as an integer. <tt>PERCENT_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt>
--   indicates the instance count increments or decrements by the
--   percentage specified by <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt>, which should be
--   expressed as an integer. For example, 20 indicates an increase in 20%
--   increments of cluster capacity. <tt>EXACT_CAPACITY</tt> indicates the
--   scaling activity results in an instance group with the number of EC2
--   instances specified by <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt>, which should be
--   expressed as a positive integer.
simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration_adjustmentType :: Lens' SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration (Maybe AdjustmentType)

-- | The amount by which to scale in or scale out, based on the specified
--   <tt>AdjustmentType</tt>. A positive value adds to the instance group's
--   EC2 instance count while a negative number removes instances. If
--   <tt>AdjustmentType</tt> is set to <tt>EXACT_CAPACITY</tt>, the number
--   should only be a positive integer. If <tt>AdjustmentType</tt> is set
--   to <tt>PERCENT_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt>, the value should express the
--   percentage as an integer. For example, -20 indicates a decrease in 20%
--   increments of cluster capacity.
simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration_scalingAdjustment :: Lens' SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration.SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration.SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration.SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration.SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration.SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration.SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration.SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration.SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingAction

-- | The type of adjustment the automatic scaling activity makes when
--   triggered, and the periodicity of the adjustment.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScalingAction</a> smart constructor.
data ScalingAction
ScalingAction' :: Maybe MarketType -> SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration -> ScalingAction

-- | Not available for instance groups. Instance groups use the market type
--   specified for the group.
[$sel:market:ScalingAction'] :: ScalingAction -> Maybe MarketType

-- | The type of adjustment the automatic scaling activity makes when
--   triggered, and the periodicity of the adjustment.
[$sel:simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration:ScalingAction'] :: ScalingAction -> SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>ScalingAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:market:ScalingAction'</a>, <a>scalingAction_market</a> - Not
--   available for instance groups. Instance groups use the market type
--   specified for the group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration:ScalingAction'</a>,
--   <a>scalingAction_simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration</a> - The type of
--   adjustment the automatic scaling activity makes when triggered, and
--   the periodicity of the adjustment.
newScalingAction :: SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration -> ScalingAction

-- | Not available for instance groups. Instance groups use the market type
--   specified for the group.
scalingAction_market :: Lens' ScalingAction (Maybe MarketType)

-- | The type of adjustment the automatic scaling activity makes when
--   triggered, and the periodicity of the adjustment.
scalingAction_simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration :: Lens' ScalingAction SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingAction.ScalingAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingAction.ScalingAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingAction.ScalingAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingAction.ScalingAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingAction.ScalingAction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingAction.ScalingAction
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingAction.ScalingAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingAction.ScalingAction


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SimplifiedApplication

-- | The returned release label application names or versions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSimplifiedApplication</a> smart constructor.
data SimplifiedApplication
SimplifiedApplication' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SimplifiedApplication

-- | The returned release label application version. For example,
--   <tt>3.2.1</tt>.
[$sel:version:SimplifiedApplication'] :: SimplifiedApplication -> Maybe Text

-- | The returned release label application name. For example,
--   <tt>hadoop</tt>.
[$sel:name:SimplifiedApplication'] :: SimplifiedApplication -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SimplifiedApplication</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   application version. For example, <tt>3.2.1</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:SimplifiedApplication'</a>,
--   <a>simplifiedApplication_name</a> - The returned release label
--   application name. For example, <tt>hadoop</tt>.
newSimplifiedApplication :: SimplifiedApplication

-- | The returned release label application version. For example,
--   <tt>3.2.1</tt>.
simplifiedApplication_version :: Lens' SimplifiedApplication (Maybe Text)

-- | The returned release label application name. For example,
--   <tt>hadoop</tt>.
simplifiedApplication_name :: Lens' SimplifiedApplication (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SimplifiedApplication.SimplifiedApplication

instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SpotProvisioningAllocationStrategy.SpotProvisioningAllocationStrategy
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SpotProvisioningAllocationStrategy.SpotProvisioningAllocationStrategy
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SpotProvisioningAllocationStrategy.SpotProvisioningAllocationStrategy
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SpotProvisioningAllocationStrategy.SpotProvisioningAllocationStrategy

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SpotProvisioningSpecification

-- | The launch specification for Spot Instances in the instance fleet,
--   which determines the defined duration, provisioning timeout behavior,
--   and allocation strategy.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions. Spot Instance
--   allocation strategy is available in Amazon EMR version 5.12.1 and
--   later.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSpotProvisioningSpecification</a> smart constructor.
data SpotProvisioningSpecification
SpotProvisioningSpecification' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe SpotProvisioningAllocationStrategy -> Natural -> SpotProvisioningTimeoutAction -> SpotProvisioningSpecification

-- | The defined duration for Spot Instances (also known as Spot blocks) in
--   minutes. When specified, the Spot Instance does not terminate before
--   the defined duration expires, and defined duration pricing for Spot
--   Instances applies. Valid values are 60, 120, 180, 240, 300, or 360.
--   The duration period starts as soon as a Spot Instance receives its
--   instance ID. At the end of the duration, Amazon EC2 marks the Spot
--   Instance for termination and provides a Spot Instance termination
--   notice, which gives the instance a two-minute warning before it
--   terminates.
[$sel:blockDurationMinutes:SpotProvisioningSpecification'] :: SpotProvisioningSpecification -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the strategy to use in launching Spot Instance fleets.
--   Currently, the only option is capacity-optimized (the default), which
--   launches instances from Spot Instance pools with optimal capacity for
--   the number of instances that are launching.
[$sel:allocationStrategy:SpotProvisioningSpecification'] :: SpotProvisioningSpecification -> Maybe SpotProvisioningAllocationStrategy

-- | The spot provisioning timeout period in minutes. If Spot Instances are
--   not provisioned within this time period, the <tt>TimeOutAction</tt> is
--   taken. Minimum value is 5 and maximum value is 1440. The timeout
--   applies only during initial provisioning, when the cluster is first
--   created.
[$sel:timeoutDurationMinutes:SpotProvisioningSpecification'] :: SpotProvisioningSpecification -> Natural

-- | The action to take when <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> has not been
--   fulfilled when the <tt>TimeoutDurationMinutes</tt> has expired; that
--   is, when all Spot Instances could not be provisioned within the Spot
--   provisioning timeout. Valid values are <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt> and
--   <tt>SWITCH_TO_ON_DEMAND</tt>. SWITCH_TO_ON_DEMAND specifies that if no
--   Spot Instances are available, On-Demand Instances should be
--   provisioned to fulfill any remaining Spot capacity.
[$sel:timeoutAction:SpotProvisioningSpecification'] :: SpotProvisioningSpecification -> SpotProvisioningTimeoutAction

-- | Create a value of <a>SpotProvisioningSpecification</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockDurationMinutes:SpotProvisioningSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>spotProvisioningSpecification_blockDurationMinutes</a> - The
--   defined duration for Spot Instances (also known as Spot blocks) in
--   minutes. When specified, the Spot Instance does not terminate before
--   the defined duration expires, and defined duration pricing for Spot
--   Instances applies. Valid values are 60, 120, 180, 240, 300, or 360.
--   The duration period starts as soon as a Spot Instance receives its
--   instance ID. At the end of the duration, Amazon EC2 marks the Spot
--   Instance for termination and provides a Spot Instance termination
--   notice, which gives the instance a two-minute warning before it
--   terminates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allocationStrategy:SpotProvisioningSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>spotProvisioningSpecification_allocationStrategy</a> - Specifies
--   the strategy to use in launching Spot Instance fleets. Currently, the
--   only option is capacity-optimized (the default), which launches
--   instances from Spot Instance pools with optimal capacity for the
--   number of instances that are launching.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeoutDurationMinutes:SpotProvisioningSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>spotProvisioningSpecification_timeoutDurationMinutes</a> - The spot
--   provisioning timeout period in minutes. If Spot Instances are not
--   provisioned within this time period, the <tt>TimeOutAction</tt> is
--   taken. Minimum value is 5 and maximum value is 1440. The timeout
--   applies only during initial provisioning, when the cluster is first
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeoutAction:SpotProvisioningSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>spotProvisioningSpecification_timeoutAction</a> - The action to
--   take when <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> has not been fulfilled when the
--   <tt>TimeoutDurationMinutes</tt> has expired; that is, when all Spot
--   Instances could not be provisioned within the Spot provisioning
--   timeout. Valid values are <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt> and
--   <tt>SWITCH_TO_ON_DEMAND</tt>. SWITCH_TO_ON_DEMAND specifies that if no
--   Spot Instances are available, On-Demand Instances should be
--   provisioned to fulfill any remaining Spot capacity.
newSpotProvisioningSpecification :: Natural -> SpotProvisioningTimeoutAction -> SpotProvisioningSpecification

-- | The defined duration for Spot Instances (also known as Spot blocks) in
--   minutes. When specified, the Spot Instance does not terminate before
--   the defined duration expires, and defined duration pricing for Spot
--   Instances applies. Valid values are 60, 120, 180, 240, 300, or 360.
--   The duration period starts as soon as a Spot Instance receives its
--   instance ID. At the end of the duration, Amazon EC2 marks the Spot
--   Instance for termination and provides a Spot Instance termination
--   notice, which gives the instance a two-minute warning before it
--   terminates.
spotProvisioningSpecification_blockDurationMinutes :: Lens' SpotProvisioningSpecification (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the strategy to use in launching Spot Instance fleets.
--   Currently, the only option is capacity-optimized (the default), which
--   launches instances from Spot Instance pools with optimal capacity for
--   the number of instances that are launching.
spotProvisioningSpecification_allocationStrategy :: Lens' SpotProvisioningSpecification (Maybe SpotProvisioningAllocationStrategy)

-- | The spot provisioning timeout period in minutes. If Spot Instances are
--   not provisioned within this time period, the <tt>TimeOutAction</tt> is
--   taken. Minimum value is 5 and maximum value is 1440. The timeout
--   applies only during initial provisioning, when the cluster is first
--   created.
spotProvisioningSpecification_timeoutDurationMinutes :: Lens' SpotProvisioningSpecification Natural

-- | The action to take when <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> has not been
--   fulfilled when the <tt>TimeoutDurationMinutes</tt> has expired; that
--   is, when all Spot Instances could not be provisioned within the Spot
--   provisioning timeout. Valid values are <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt> and
--   <tt>SWITCH_TO_ON_DEMAND</tt>. SWITCH_TO_ON_DEMAND specifies that if no
--   Spot Instances are available, On-Demand Instances should be
--   provisioned to fulfill any remaining Spot capacity.
spotProvisioningSpecification_timeoutAction :: Lens' SpotProvisioningSpecification SpotProvisioningTimeoutAction
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SpotProvisioningSpecification.SpotProvisioningSpecification
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SpotProvisioningSpecification.SpotProvisioningSpecification
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SpotProvisioningSpecification.SpotProvisioningSpecification
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SpotProvisioningSpecification.SpotProvisioningSpecification
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SpotProvisioningSpecification.SpotProvisioningSpecification
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SpotProvisioningSpecification.SpotProvisioningSpecification
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SpotProvisioningSpecification.SpotProvisioningSpecification
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SpotProvisioningSpecification.SpotProvisioningSpecification


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications

-- | The launch specification for Spot Instances in the fleet, which
--   determines the defined duration, provisioning timeout behavior, and
--   allocation strategy.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions. On-Demand and Spot
--   Instance allocation strategies are available in Amazon EMR version
--   5.12.1 and later.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications</a> smart
--   constructor.
data InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications
InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications' :: Maybe OnDemandProvisioningSpecification -> Maybe SpotProvisioningSpecification -> InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications

-- | The launch specification for On-Demand Instances in the instance
--   fleet, which determines the allocation strategy.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions. On-Demand
--   Instances allocation strategy is available in Amazon EMR version
--   5.12.1 and later.
[$sel:onDemandSpecification:InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications'] :: InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications -> Maybe OnDemandProvisioningSpecification

-- | The launch specification for Spot Instances in the fleet, which
--   determines the defined duration, provisioning timeout behavior, and
--   allocation strategy.
[$sel:spotSpecification:InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications'] :: InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications -> Maybe SpotProvisioningSpecification

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:onDemandSpecification:InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications_onDemandSpecification</a> -
--   The launch specification for On-Demand Instances in the instance
--   fleet, which determines the allocation strategy.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions. On-Demand
--   Instances allocation strategy is available in Amazon EMR version
--   5.12.1 and later.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:spotSpecification:InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications_spotSpecification</a> - The
--   launch specification for Spot Instances in the fleet, which determines
--   the defined duration, provisioning timeout behavior, and allocation
--   strategy.
newInstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications :: InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications

-- | The launch specification for On-Demand Instances in the instance
--   fleet, which determines the allocation strategy.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions. On-Demand
--   Instances allocation strategy is available in Amazon EMR version
--   5.12.1 and later.
instanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications_onDemandSpecification :: Lens' InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications (Maybe OnDemandProvisioningSpecification)

-- | The launch specification for Spot Instances in the fleet, which
--   determines the defined duration, provisioning timeout behavior, and
--   allocation strategy.
instanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications_spotSpecification :: Lens' InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications (Maybe SpotProvisioningSpecification)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications.InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications.InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications.InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepConfig

-- | Specification for a cluster (job flow) step.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStepConfig</a> smart constructor.
data StepConfig
StepConfig' :: Maybe ActionOnFailure -> Text -> HadoopJarStepConfig -> StepConfig

-- | The action to take when the step fails. Use one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt> - Shuts down the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt> - Cancels any pending steps and returns
--   the cluster to the <tt>WAITING</tt> state.</li>
--   <li><tt>CONTINUE</tt> - Continues to the next step in the queue.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW</tt> - Shuts down the cluster.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW</tt> is provided for backward compatibility. We
--   recommend using <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt> instead.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> is greater than
--   <tt>1</tt>, do not use <tt>AddJobFlowSteps</tt> to submit a step with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt> or
--   <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>. The step is not submitted and the action
--   fails with a message that the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> setting is not
--   valid.
--   
--   If you change a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> to be greater
--   than 1 while a step is running, the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> parameter
--   may not behave as you expect. In this case, for a step that fails with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt>, pending steps and the
--   running step are not canceled; for a step that fails with this
--   parameter set to <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>, the cluster does not
--   terminate.
[$sel:actionOnFailure:StepConfig'] :: StepConfig -> Maybe ActionOnFailure

-- | The name of the step.
[$sel:name:StepConfig'] :: StepConfig -> Text

-- | The JAR file used for the step.
[$sel:hadoopJarStep:StepConfig'] :: StepConfig -> HadoopJarStepConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>StepConfig</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionOnFailure:StepConfig'</a>,
--   <a>stepConfig_actionOnFailure</a> - The action to take when the step
--   fails. Use one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt> - Shuts down the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt> - Cancels any pending steps and returns
--   the cluster to the <tt>WAITING</tt> state.</li>
--   <li><tt>CONTINUE</tt> - Continues to the next step in the queue.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW</tt> - Shuts down the cluster.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW</tt> is provided for backward compatibility. We
--   recommend using <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt> instead.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> is greater than
--   <tt>1</tt>, do not use <tt>AddJobFlowSteps</tt> to submit a step with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt> or
--   <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>. The step is not submitted and the action
--   fails with a message that the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> setting is not
--   valid.
--   
--   If you change a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> to be greater
--   than 1 while a step is running, the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> parameter
--   may not behave as you expect. In this case, for a step that fails with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt>, pending steps and the
--   running step are not canceled; for a step that fails with this
--   parameter set to <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>, the cluster does not
--   terminate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:StepConfig'</a>, <a>stepConfig_name</a> - The name of the
--   step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hadoopJarStep:StepConfig'</a>, <a>stepConfig_hadoopJarStep</a>
--   - The JAR file used for the step.
newStepConfig :: Text -> HadoopJarStepConfig -> StepConfig

-- | The action to take when the step fails. Use one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt> - Shuts down the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt> - Cancels any pending steps and returns
--   the cluster to the <tt>WAITING</tt> state.</li>
--   <li><tt>CONTINUE</tt> - Continues to the next step in the queue.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW</tt> - Shuts down the cluster.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW</tt> is provided for backward compatibility. We
--   recommend using <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt> instead.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> is greater than
--   <tt>1</tt>, do not use <tt>AddJobFlowSteps</tt> to submit a step with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt> or
--   <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>. The step is not submitted and the action
--   fails with a message that the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> setting is not
--   valid.
--   
--   If you change a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> to be greater
--   than 1 while a step is running, the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> parameter
--   may not behave as you expect. In this case, for a step that fails with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt>, pending steps and the
--   running step are not canceled; for a step that fails with this
--   parameter set to <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>, the cluster does not
--   terminate.
stepConfig_actionOnFailure :: Lens' StepConfig (Maybe ActionOnFailure)

-- | The name of the step.
stepConfig_name :: Lens' StepConfig Text

-- | The JAR file used for the step.
stepConfig_hadoopJarStep :: Lens' StepConfig HadoopJarStepConfig
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepConfig.StepConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepConfig.StepConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepConfig.StepConfig

instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepConfig.StepConfig

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepStateChangeReason

-- | The details of the step state change reason.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStepStateChangeReason</a> smart constructor.
data StepStateChangeReason
StepStateChangeReason' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe StepStateChangeReasonCode -> StepStateChangeReason

-- | The descriptive message for the state change reason.
[$sel:message:StepStateChangeReason'] :: StepStateChangeReason -> Maybe Text

-- | The programmable code for the state change reason. Note: Currently,
--   the service provides no code for the state change.
[$sel:code:StepStateChangeReason'] :: StepStateChangeReason -> Maybe StepStateChangeReasonCode

-- | Create a value of <a>StepStateChangeReason</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:StepStateChangeReason'</a>,
--   <a>stepStateChangeReason_message</a> - The descriptive message for the
--   state change reason.
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:StepStateChangeReason'</a>,
--   <a>stepStateChangeReason_code</a> - The programmable code for the
--   state change reason. Note: Currently, the service provides no code for
--   the state change.
newStepStateChangeReason :: StepStateChangeReason

-- | The descriptive message for the state change reason.
stepStateChangeReason_message :: Lens' StepStateChangeReason (Maybe Text)

-- | The programmable code for the state change reason. Note: Currently,
--   the service provides no code for the state change.
stepStateChangeReason_code :: Lens' StepStateChangeReason (Maybe StepStateChangeReasonCode)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepStateChangeReason.StepStateChangeReason
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepStateChangeReason.StepStateChangeReason

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepTimeline

-- | The timeline of the cluster step lifecycle.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStepTimeline</a> smart constructor.
data StepTimeline
StepTimeline' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> StepTimeline

-- | The date and time when the cluster step execution started.
[$sel:startDateTime:StepTimeline'] :: StepTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time when the cluster step execution completed or failed.
[$sel:endDateTime:StepTimeline'] :: StepTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time when the cluster step was created.
[$sel:creationDateTime:StepTimeline'] :: StepTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>StepTimeline</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startDateTime:StepTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>stepTimeline_startDateTime</a> - The date and time when the cluster
--   step execution started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endDateTime:StepTimeline'</a>, <a>stepTimeline_endDateTime</a>
--   - The date and time when the cluster step execution completed or
--   failed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDateTime:StepTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>stepTimeline_creationDateTime</a> - The date and time when the
--   cluster step was created.
newStepTimeline :: StepTimeline

-- | The date and time when the cluster step execution started.
stepTimeline_startDateTime :: Lens' StepTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time when the cluster step execution completed or failed.
stepTimeline_endDateTime :: Lens' StepTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time when the cluster step was created.
stepTimeline_creationDateTime :: Lens' StepTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)
