instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepTimeline.StepTimeline


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepStatus

-- | The execution status details of the cluster step.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStepStatus</a> smart constructor.
data StepStatus
StepStatus' :: Maybe StepStateChangeReason -> Maybe FailureDetails -> Maybe StepState -> Maybe StepTimeline -> StepStatus

-- | The reason for the step execution status change.
[$sel:stateChangeReason:StepStatus'] :: StepStatus -> Maybe StepStateChangeReason

-- | The details for the step failure including reason, message, and log
--   file path where the root cause was identified.
[$sel:failureDetails:StepStatus'] :: StepStatus -> Maybe FailureDetails

-- | The execution state of the cluster step.
[$sel:state:StepStatus'] :: StepStatus -> Maybe StepState

-- | The timeline of the cluster step status over time.
[$sel:timeline:StepStatus'] :: StepStatus -> Maybe StepTimeline

-- | Create a value of <a>StepStatus</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateChangeReason:StepStatus'</a>,
--   <a>stepStatus_stateChangeReason</a> - The reason for the step
--   execution status change.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureDetails:StepStatus'</a>,
--   <a>stepStatus_failureDetails</a> - The details for the step failure
--   including reason, message, and log file path where the root cause was
--   identified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:StepStatus'</a>, <a>stepStatus_state</a> - The execution
--   state of the cluster step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeline:StepStatus'</a>, <a>stepStatus_timeline</a> - The
--   timeline of the cluster step status over time.
newStepStatus :: StepStatus

-- | The reason for the step execution status change.
stepStatus_stateChangeReason :: Lens' StepStatus (Maybe StepStateChangeReason)

-- | The details for the step failure including reason, message, and log
--   file path where the root cause was identified.
stepStatus_failureDetails :: Lens' StepStatus (Maybe FailureDetails)

-- | The execution state of the cluster step.
stepStatus_state :: Lens' StepStatus (Maybe StepState)

-- | The timeline of the cluster step status over time.
stepStatus_timeline :: Lens' StepStatus (Maybe StepTimeline)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepStatus.StepStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepStatus.StepStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepStatus.StepStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepStatus.StepStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepStatus.StepStatus
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepStatus.StepStatus
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepStatus.StepStatus


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepSummary

-- | The summary of the cluster step.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStepSummary</a> smart constructor.
data StepSummary
StepSummary' :: Maybe StepStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HadoopStepConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ActionOnFailure -> StepSummary

-- | The current execution status details of the cluster step.
[$sel:status:StepSummary'] :: StepSummary -> Maybe StepStatus

-- | The identifier of the cluster step.
[$sel:id:StepSummary'] :: StepSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The Hadoop job configuration of the cluster step.
[$sel:config:StepSummary'] :: StepSummary -> Maybe HadoopStepConfig

-- | The name of the cluster step.
[$sel:name:StepSummary'] :: StepSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The action to take when the cluster step fails. Possible values are
--   TERMINATE_CLUSTER, CANCEL_AND_WAIT, and CONTINUE. TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW
--   is available for backward compatibility.
[$sel:actionOnFailure:StepSummary'] :: StepSummary -> Maybe ActionOnFailure

-- | Create a value of <a>StepSummary</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:StepSummary'</a>, <a>stepSummary_status</a> - The
--   current execution status details of the cluster step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:StepSummary'</a>, <a>stepSummary_id</a> - The identifier of
--   the cluster step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:config:StepSummary'</a>, <a>stepSummary_config</a> - The
--   Hadoop job configuration of the cluster step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:StepSummary'</a>, <a>stepSummary_name</a> - The name of
--   the cluster step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionOnFailure:StepSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stepSummary_actionOnFailure</a> - The action to take when the
--   cluster step fails. Possible values are TERMINATE_CLUSTER,
--   CANCEL_AND_WAIT, and CONTINUE. TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW is available for
--   backward compatibility.
newStepSummary :: StepSummary

-- | The current execution status details of the cluster step.
stepSummary_status :: Lens' StepSummary (Maybe StepStatus)

-- | The identifier of the cluster step.
stepSummary_id :: Lens' StepSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The Hadoop job configuration of the cluster step.
stepSummary_config :: Lens' StepSummary (Maybe HadoopStepConfig)

-- | The name of the cluster step.
stepSummary_name :: Lens' StepSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The action to take when the cluster step fails. Possible values are
--   TERMINATE_CLUSTER, CANCEL_AND_WAIT, and CONTINUE. TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW
--   is available for backward compatibility.
stepSummary_actionOnFailure :: Lens' StepSummary (Maybe ActionOnFailure)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepSummary.StepSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepSummary.StepSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepSummary.StepSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepSummary.StepSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepSummary.StepSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepSummary.StepSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StepSummary.StepSummary


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Step

-- | This represents a step in a cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStep</a> smart constructor.
data Step
Step' :: Maybe StepStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HadoopStepConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ActionOnFailure -> Step

-- | The current execution status details of the cluster step.
[$sel:status:Step'] :: Step -> Maybe StepStatus

-- | The identifier of the cluster step.
[$sel:id:Step'] :: Step -> Maybe Text

-- | The Hadoop job configuration of the cluster step.
[$sel:config:Step'] :: Step -> Maybe HadoopStepConfig

-- | The name of the cluster step.
[$sel:name:Step'] :: Step -> Maybe Text

-- | The action to take when the cluster step fails. Possible values are
--   <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>, <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt>, and
--   <tt>CONTINUE</tt>. <tt>TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW</tt> is provided for
--   backward compatibility. We recommend using <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>
--   instead.
--   
--   If a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> is greater than
--   <tt>1</tt>, do not use <tt>AddJobFlowSteps</tt> to submit a step with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt> or
--   <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>. The step is not submitted and the action
--   fails with a message that the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> setting is not
--   valid.
--   
--   If you change a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> to be greater
--   than 1 while a step is running, the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> parameter
--   may not behave as you expect. In this case, for a step that fails with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt>, pending steps and the
--   running step are not canceled; for a step that fails with this
--   parameter set to <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>, the cluster does not
--   terminate.
[$sel:actionOnFailure:Step'] :: Step -> Maybe ActionOnFailure

-- | Create a value of <a>Step</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Step'</a>, <a>step_status</a> - The current execution
--   status details of the cluster step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Step'</a>, <a>step_id</a> - The identifier of the cluster
--   step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:config:Step'</a>, <a>step_config</a> - The Hadoop job
--   configuration of the cluster step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Step'</a>, <a>step_name</a> - The name of the cluster
--   step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionOnFailure:Step'</a>, <a>step_actionOnFailure</a> - The
--   action to take when the cluster step fails. Possible values are
--   <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>, <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt>, and
--   <tt>CONTINUE</tt>. <tt>TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW</tt> is provided for
--   backward compatibility. We recommend using <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>
--   instead.
--   
--   If a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> is greater than
--   <tt>1</tt>, do not use <tt>AddJobFlowSteps</tt> to submit a step with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt> or
--   <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>. The step is not submitted and the action
--   fails with a message that the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> setting is not
--   valid.
--   
--   If you change a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> to be greater
--   than 1 while a step is running, the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> parameter
--   may not behave as you expect. In this case, for a step that fails with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt>, pending steps and the
--   running step are not canceled; for a step that fails with this
--   parameter set to <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>, the cluster does not
--   terminate.
newStep :: Step

-- | The current execution status details of the cluster step.
step_status :: Lens' Step (Maybe StepStatus)

-- | The identifier of the cluster step.
step_id :: Lens' Step (Maybe Text)

-- | The Hadoop job configuration of the cluster step.
step_config :: Lens' Step (Maybe HadoopStepConfig)

-- | The name of the cluster step.
step_name :: Lens' Step (Maybe Text)

-- | The action to take when the cluster step fails. Possible values are
--   <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>, <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt>, and
--   <tt>CONTINUE</tt>. <tt>TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW</tt> is provided for
--   backward compatibility. We recommend using <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>
--   instead.
--   
--   If a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> is greater than
--   <tt>1</tt>, do not use <tt>AddJobFlowSteps</tt> to submit a step with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt> or
--   <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>. The step is not submitted and the action
--   fails with a message that the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> setting is not
--   valid.
--   
--   If you change a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> to be greater
--   than 1 while a step is running, the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> parameter
--   may not behave as you expect. In this case, for a step that fails with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt>, pending steps and the
--   running step are not canceled; for a step that fails with this
--   parameter set to <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>, the cluster does not
--   terminate.
step_actionOnFailure :: Lens' Step (Maybe ActionOnFailure)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Step.Step
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Step.Step
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Step.Step
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Step.Step
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Step.Step
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Step.Step
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Step.Step


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StudioSummary

-- | Details for an Amazon EMR Studio, including ID, Name, VPC, and
--   Description. The details do not include subnets, IAM roles, security
--   groups, or tags associated with the Studio.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStudioSummary</a> smart constructor.
data StudioSummary
StudioSummary' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe AuthMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> StudioSummary

-- | The time when the Amazon EMR Studio was created.
[$sel:creationTime:StudioSummary'] :: StudioSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Specifies whether the Studio authenticates users using IAM or Amazon
--   Web Services SSO.
[$sel:authMode:StudioSummary'] :: StudioSummary -> Maybe AuthMode

-- | The name of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:name:StudioSummary'] :: StudioSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The detailed description of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:description:StudioSummary'] :: StudioSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique access URL of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:url:StudioSummary'] :: StudioSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) associated with the
--   Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:vpcId:StudioSummary'] :: StudioSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:studioId:StudioSummary'] :: StudioSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StudioSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:StudioSummary'</a>,
--   <a>studioSummary_creationTime</a> - The time when the Amazon EMR
--   Studio was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authMode:StudioSummary'</a>, <a>studioSummary_authMode</a> -
--   Specifies whether the Studio authenticates users using IAM or Amazon
--   Web Services SSO.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:StudioSummary'</a>, <a>studioSummary_name</a> - The name
--   of the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:StudioSummary'</a>,
--   <a>studioSummary_description</a> - The detailed description of the
--   Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:StudioSummary'</a>, <a>studioSummary_url</a> - The unique
--   access URL of the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:StudioSummary'</a>, <a>studioSummary_vpcId</a> - The ID
--   of the Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) associated with the Amazon
--   EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:studioId:StudioSummary'</a>, <a>studioSummary_studioId</a> -
--   The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio.
newStudioSummary :: StudioSummary

-- | The time when the Amazon EMR Studio was created.
studioSummary_creationTime :: Lens' StudioSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies whether the Studio authenticates users using IAM or Amazon
--   Web Services SSO.
studioSummary_authMode :: Lens' StudioSummary (Maybe AuthMode)

-- | The name of the Amazon EMR Studio.
studioSummary_name :: Lens' StudioSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The detailed description of the Amazon EMR Studio.
studioSummary_description :: Lens' StudioSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique access URL of the Amazon EMR Studio.
studioSummary_url :: Lens' StudioSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) associated with the
--   Amazon EMR Studio.
studioSummary_vpcId :: Lens' StudioSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio.
studioSummary_studioId :: Lens' StudioSummary (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StudioSummary.StudioSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StudioSummary.StudioSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StudioSummary.StudioSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StudioSummary.StudioSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StudioSummary.StudioSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StudioSummary.StudioSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.StudioSummary.StudioSummary


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SupportedProductConfig

-- | The list of supported product configurations that allow user-supplied
--   arguments. EMR accepts these arguments and forwards them to the
--   corresponding installation script as bootstrap action arguments.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSupportedProductConfig</a> smart constructor.
data SupportedProductConfig
SupportedProductConfig' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> SupportedProductConfig

-- | The list of user-supplied arguments.
[$sel:args:SupportedProductConfig'] :: SupportedProductConfig -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The name of the product configuration.
[$sel:name:SupportedProductConfig'] :: SupportedProductConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SupportedProductConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:args:SupportedProductConfig'</a>,
--   <a>supportedProductConfig_args</a> - The list of user-supplied
--   arguments.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:SupportedProductConfig'</a>,
--   <a>supportedProductConfig_name</a> - The name of the product
--   configuration.
newSupportedProductConfig :: SupportedProductConfig

-- | The list of user-supplied arguments.
supportedProductConfig_args :: Lens' SupportedProductConfig (Maybe [Text])

-- | The name of the product configuration.
supportedProductConfig_name :: Lens' SupportedProductConfig (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SupportedProductConfig.SupportedProductConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SupportedProductConfig.SupportedProductConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SupportedProductConfig.SupportedProductConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SupportedProductConfig.SupportedProductConfig
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SupportedProductConfig.SupportedProductConfig
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SupportedProductConfig.SupportedProductConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.SupportedProductConfig.SupportedProductConfig


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Tag

-- | A key-value pair containing user-defined metadata that you can
--   associate with an Amazon EMR resource. Tags make it easier to
--   associate clusters in various ways, such as grouping clusters to track
--   your Amazon EMR resource allocation costs. For more information, see
--   <a>Tag Clusters</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Tag

-- | A user-defined key, which is the minimum required information for a
--   valid tag. For more information, see <a>Tag</a> .
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | A user-defined value, which is optional in a tag. For more
--   information, see <a>Tag Clusters</a>.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - A user-defined key, which is
--   the minimum required information for a valid tag. For more
--   information, see <a>Tag</a> .
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - A user-defined value, which
--   is optional in a tag. For more information, see <a>Tag Clusters</a>.
newTag :: Tag

-- | A user-defined key, which is the minimum required information for a
--   valid tag. For more information, see <a>Tag</a> .
tag_key :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | A user-defined value, which is optional in a tag. For more
--   information, see <a>Tag Clusters</a>.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Tag.Tag


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Studio

-- | Details for an Amazon EMR Studio including ID, creation time, name,
--   and so on.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStudio</a> smart constructor.
data Studio
Studio' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AuthMode -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Studio

-- | The time the Amazon EMR Studio was created.
[$sel:creationTime:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the IAM role assumed by the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:serviceRole:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the Workspace security group associated with the Amazon EMR
--   Studio. The Workspace security group allows outbound network traffic
--   to resources in the Engine security group and to the internet.
[$sel:workspaceSecurityGroupId:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon S3 location to back up Amazon EMR Studio Workspaces and
--   notebook files.
[$sel:defaultS3Location:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the Amazon EMR Studio authenticates users using IAM
--   or Amazon Web Services SSO.
[$sel:authMode:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe AuthMode

-- | The list of IDs of the subnets associated with the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:subnetIds:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The name of the IAM role assumed by users logged in to the Amazon EMR
--   Studio. A Studio only requires a <tt>UserRole</tt> when you use IAM
--   authentication.
[$sel:userRole:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:name:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of your identity provider's <tt>RelayState</tt> parameter.
[$sel:idpRelayStateParameterName:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of tags associated with the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:tags:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Your identity provider's authentication endpoint. Amazon EMR Studio
--   redirects federated users to this endpoint for authentication when
--   logging in to a Studio with the Studio URL.
[$sel:idpAuthUrl:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | The detailed description of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:description:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique access URL of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:url:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the VPC associated with the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:vpcId:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:studioId:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:studioArn:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the Engine security group associated with the Amazon EMR
--   Studio. The Engine security group allows inbound network traffic from
--   resources in the Workspace security group.
[$sel:engineSecurityGroupId:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Studio</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_creationTime</a> - The
--   time the Amazon EMR Studio was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceRole:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_serviceRole</a> - The name
--   of the IAM role assumed by the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceSecurityGroupId:Studio'</a>,
--   <a>studio_workspaceSecurityGroupId</a> - The ID of the Workspace
--   security group associated with the Amazon EMR Studio. The Workspace
--   security group allows outbound network traffic to resources in the
--   Engine security group and to the internet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultS3Location:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_defaultS3Location</a>
--   - The Amazon S3 location to back up Amazon EMR Studio Workspaces and
--   notebook files.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authMode:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_authMode</a> - Specifies
--   whether the Amazon EMR Studio authenticates users using IAM or Amazon
--   Web Services SSO.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetIds:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_subnetIds</a> - The list of
--   IDs of the subnets associated with the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userRole:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_userRole</a> - The name of the
--   IAM role assumed by users logged in to the Amazon EMR Studio. A Studio
--   only requires a <tt>UserRole</tt> when you use IAM authentication.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_name</a> - The name of the Amazon
--   EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:idpRelayStateParameterName:Studio'</a>,
--   <a>studio_idpRelayStateParameterName</a> - The name of your identity
--   provider's <tt>RelayState</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_tags</a> - A list of tags
--   associated with the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:idpAuthUrl:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_idpAuthUrl</a> - Your
--   identity provider's authentication endpoint. Amazon EMR Studio
--   redirects federated users to this endpoint for authentication when
--   logging in to a Studio with the Studio URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_description</a> - The
--   detailed description of the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_url</a> - The unique access URL of
--   the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_vpcId</a> - The ID of the VPC
--   associated with the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:studioId:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_studioId</a> - The ID of the
--   Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:studioArn:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_studioArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineSecurityGroupId:Studio'</a>,
--   <a>studio_engineSecurityGroupId</a> - The ID of the Engine security
--   group associated with the Amazon EMR Studio. The Engine security group
--   allows inbound network traffic from resources in the Workspace
--   security group.
newStudio :: Studio

-- | The time the Amazon EMR Studio was created.
studio_creationTime :: Lens' Studio (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the IAM role assumed by the Amazon EMR Studio.
studio_serviceRole :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the Workspace security group associated with the Amazon EMR
--   Studio. The Workspace security group allows outbound network traffic
--   to resources in the Engine security group and to the internet.
studio_workspaceSecurityGroupId :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon S3 location to back up Amazon EMR Studio Workspaces and
--   notebook files.
studio_defaultS3Location :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the Amazon EMR Studio authenticates users using IAM
--   or Amazon Web Services SSO.
studio_authMode :: Lens' Studio (Maybe AuthMode)

-- | The list of IDs of the subnets associated with the Amazon EMR Studio.
studio_subnetIds :: Lens' Studio (Maybe [Text])

-- | The name of the IAM role assumed by users logged in to the Amazon EMR
--   Studio. A Studio only requires a <tt>UserRole</tt> when you use IAM
--   authentication.
studio_userRole :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Amazon EMR Studio.
studio_name :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of your identity provider's <tt>RelayState</tt> parameter.
studio_idpRelayStateParameterName :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags associated with the Amazon EMR Studio.
studio_tags :: Lens' Studio (Maybe [Tag])

-- | Your identity provider's authentication endpoint. Amazon EMR Studio
--   redirects federated users to this endpoint for authentication when
--   logging in to a Studio with the Studio URL.
studio_idpAuthUrl :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

-- | The detailed description of the Amazon EMR Studio.
studio_description :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique access URL of the Amazon EMR Studio.
studio_url :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the VPC associated with the Amazon EMR Studio.
studio_vpcId :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio.
studio_studioId :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon EMR Studio.
studio_studioArn :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the Engine security group associated with the Amazon EMR
--   Studio. The Engine security group allows inbound network traffic from
--   resources in the Workspace security group.
studio_engineSecurityGroupId :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Studio.Studio
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Studio.Studio
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Studio.Studio
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Studio.Studio
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Studio.Studio
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Studio.Studio
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Studio.Studio


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.NotebookExecution

-- | A notebook execution. An execution is a specific instance that an EMR
--   Notebook is run using the <tt>StartNotebookExecution</tt> action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNotebookExecution</a> smart constructor.
data NotebookExecution
NotebookExecution' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe NotebookExecutionStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ExecutionEngineConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> NotebookExecution

-- | The reason for the latest status change of the notebook execution.
[$sel:lastStateChangeReason:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>START_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received the
--   execution request but execution has not begun.</li>
--   <li><tt>STARTING</tt> indicates that the execution is starting on the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> indicates that the execution is being processed
--   by the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHING</tt> indicates that execution processing is in the
--   final stages.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHED</tt> indicates that the execution has completed
--   without error.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILING</tt> indicates that the execution is failing and will
--   not finish successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> indicates that the execution failed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOP_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request and the stop is pending.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt> indicates that the cluster is in the process of
--   stopping the execution as a result of a <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt>
--   request.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt> indicates that the execution stopped because of a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe NotebookExecutionStatus

-- | A name for the notebook execution.
[$sel:notebookExecutionName:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier of the EMR Notebook that is used for the
--   notebook execution.
[$sel:editorId:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier of a notebook execution.
[$sel:notebookExecutionId:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notebook execution.
[$sel:arn:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when notebook execution started.
[$sel:startTime:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Input parameters in JSON format passed to the EMR Notebook at runtime
--   for execution.
[$sel:notebookParams:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when notebook execution ended.
[$sel:endTime:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The execution engine, such as an EMR cluster, used to run the EMR
--   notebook and perform the notebook execution.
[$sel:executionEngine:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe ExecutionEngineConfig

-- | The unique identifier of the EC2 security group associated with the
--   EMR Notebook instance. For more information see <a>Specifying EC2
--   Security Groups for EMR Notebooks</a> in the <i>EMR Management
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:notebookInstanceSecurityGroupId:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of tags associated with a notebook execution. Tags are
--   user-defined key-value pairs that consist of a required key string
--   with a maximum of 128 characters and an optional value string with a
--   maximum of 256 characters.
[$sel:tags:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The location of the notebook execution's output file in Amazon S3.
[$sel:outputNotebookURI:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NotebookExecution</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastStateChangeReason:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_lastStateChangeReason</a> - The reason for the
--   latest status change of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:NotebookExecution'</a>, <a>notebookExecution_status</a>
--   - The status of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>START_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received the
--   execution request but execution has not begun.</li>
--   <li><tt>STARTING</tt> indicates that the execution is starting on the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> indicates that the execution is being processed
--   by the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHING</tt> indicates that execution processing is in the
--   final stages.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHED</tt> indicates that the execution has completed
--   without error.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILING</tt> indicates that the execution is failing and will
--   not finish successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> indicates that the execution failed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOP_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request and the stop is pending.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt> indicates that the cluster is in the process of
--   stopping the execution as a result of a <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt>
--   request.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt> indicates that the execution stopped because of a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:notebookExecutionName:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_notebookExecutionName</a> - A name for the
--   notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:editorId:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_editorId</a> - The unique identifier of the EMR
--   Notebook that is used for the notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notebookExecutionId:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_notebookExecutionId</a> - The unique identifier
--   of a notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:NotebookExecution'</a>, <a>notebookExecution_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_startTime</a> - The timestamp when notebook
--   execution started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notebookParams:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_notebookParams</a> - Input parameters in JSON
--   format passed to the EMR Notebook at runtime for execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_endTime</a> - The timestamp when notebook
--   execution ended.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionEngine:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_executionEngine</a> - The execution engine, such
--   as an EMR cluster, used to run the EMR notebook and perform the
--   notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notebookInstanceSecurityGroupId:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_notebookInstanceSecurityGroupId</a> - The unique
--   identifier of the EC2 security group associated with the EMR Notebook
--   instance. For more information see <a>Specifying EC2 Security Groups
--   for EMR Notebooks</a> in the <i>EMR Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:NotebookExecution'</a>, <a>notebookExecution_tags</a> - A
--   list of tags associated with a notebook execution. Tags are
--   user-defined key-value pairs that consist of a required key string
--   with a maximum of 128 characters and an optional value string with a
--   maximum of 256 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputNotebookURI:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_outputNotebookURI</a> - The location of the
--   notebook execution's output file in Amazon S3.
newNotebookExecution :: NotebookExecution

-- | The reason for the latest status change of the notebook execution.
notebookExecution_lastStateChangeReason :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>START_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received the
--   execution request but execution has not begun.</li>
--   <li><tt>STARTING</tt> indicates that the execution is starting on the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> indicates that the execution is being processed
--   by the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHING</tt> indicates that execution processing is in the
--   final stages.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHED</tt> indicates that the execution has completed
--   without error.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILING</tt> indicates that the execution is failing and will
--   not finish successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> indicates that the execution failed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOP_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request and the stop is pending.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt> indicates that the cluster is in the process of
--   stopping the execution as a result of a <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt>
--   request.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt> indicates that the execution stopped because of a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request.</li>
--   </ul>
notebookExecution_status :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe NotebookExecutionStatus)

-- | A name for the notebook execution.
notebookExecution_notebookExecutionName :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier of the EMR Notebook that is used for the
--   notebook execution.
notebookExecution_editorId :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier of a notebook execution.
notebookExecution_notebookExecutionId :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notebook execution.
notebookExecution_arn :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when notebook execution started.
notebookExecution_startTime :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Input parameters in JSON format passed to the EMR Notebook at runtime
--   for execution.
notebookExecution_notebookParams :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when notebook execution ended.
notebookExecution_endTime :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The execution engine, such as an EMR cluster, used to run the EMR
--   notebook and perform the notebook execution.
notebookExecution_executionEngine :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe ExecutionEngineConfig)

-- | The unique identifier of the EC2 security group associated with the
--   EMR Notebook instance. For more information see <a>Specifying EC2
--   Security Groups for EMR Notebooks</a> in the <i>EMR Management
--   Guide</i>.
notebookExecution_notebookInstanceSecurityGroupId :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags associated with a notebook execution. Tags are
--   user-defined key-value pairs that consist of a required key string
--   with a maximum of 128 characters and an optional value string with a
--   maximum of 256 characters.
notebookExecution_tags :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The location of the notebook execution's output file in Amazon S3.
notebookExecution_outputNotebookURI :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.NotebookExecution.NotebookExecution
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.NotebookExecution.NotebookExecution
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.NotebookExecution.NotebookExecution
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.NotebookExecution.NotebookExecution
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.NotebookExecution.NotebookExecution
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.NotebookExecution.NotebookExecution
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.NotebookExecution.NotebookExecution


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Cluster

-- | The detailed description of the cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCluster</a> smart constructor.
data Cluster
Cluster' :: Maybe RepoUpgradeOnBoot -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ScaleDownBehavior -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Configuration] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InstanceCollectionType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe [Application] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [PlacementGroupConfig] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe KerberosAttributes -> Maybe Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Text -> Text -> ClusterStatus -> Cluster

-- | Applies only when <tt>CustomAmiID</tt> is used. Specifies the type of
--   updates that are applied from the Amazon Linux AMI package
--   repositories when an instance boots using the AMI.
[$sel:repoUpgradeOnBoot:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe RepoUpgradeOnBoot

-- | The Amazon Resource Name of the cluster.
[$sel:clusterArn:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The IAM role that Amazon EMR assumes in order to access Amazon Web
--   Services resources on your behalf.
[$sel:serviceRole:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | An IAM role for automatic scaling policies. The default role is
--   <tt>EMR_AutoScaling_DefaultRole</tt>. The IAM role provides
--   permissions that the automatic scaling feature requires to launch and
--   terminate EC2 instances in an instance group.
[$sel:autoScalingRole:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The way that individual Amazon EC2 instances terminate when an
--   automatic scale-in activity occurs or an instance group is resized.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_INSTANCE_HOUR</tt> indicates that Amazon EMR
--   terminates nodes at the instance-hour boundary, regardless of when the
--   request to terminate the instance was submitted. This option is only
--   available with Amazon EMR 5.1.0 and later and is the default for
--   clusters created using that version.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> indicates that Amazon EMR adds
--   nodes to a deny list and drains tasks from nodes before terminating
--   the Amazon EC2 instances, regardless of the instance-hour boundary.
--   With either behavior, Amazon EMR removes the least active nodes first
--   and blocks instance termination if it could lead to HDFS corruption.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> is available only in Amazon EMR
--   version 4.1.0 and later, and is the default for versions of Amazon EMR
--   earlier than 5.1.0.
[$sel:scaleDownBehavior:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe ScaleDownBehavior

-- | The name of the security configuration applied to the cluster.
[$sel:securityConfiguration:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether Amazon EMR will lock the cluster to prevent the EC2
--   instances from being terminated by an API call or user intervention,
--   or in the event of a cluster error.
[$sel:terminationProtected:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | The DNS name of the master node. If the cluster is on a private
--   subnet, this is the private DNS name. On a public subnet, this is the
--   public DNS name.
[$sel:masterPublicDnsName:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Applies only to Amazon EMR releases 4.x and later. The list of
--   Configurations supplied to the EMR cluster.
[$sel:configurations:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe [Configuration]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost where the cluster is
--   launched.
[$sel:outpostArn:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The AMI version running on this cluster.
[$sel:runningAmiVersion:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in GiB, of the Amazon EBS root device volume of the Linux
--   AMI that is used for each EC2 instance. Available in Amazon EMR
--   version 4.x and later.
[$sel:ebsRootVolumeSize:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Int

-- | The AMI version requested for this cluster.
[$sel:requestedAmiVersion:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon EMR release label, which determines the version of
--   open-source application packages installed on the cluster. Release
--   labels are in the form <tt>emr-x.x.x</tt>, where x.x.x is an Amazon
--   EMR release version such as <tt>emr-5.14.0</tt>. For more information
--   about Amazon EMR release versions and included application versions
--   and features, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ReleaseGuide/</a>. The
--   release label applies only to Amazon EMR releases version 4.0 and
--   later. Earlier versions use <tt>AmiVersion</tt>.
[$sel:releaseLabel:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   The instance group configuration of the cluster. A value of
--   <tt>INSTANCE_GROUP</tt> indicates a uniform instance group
--   configuration. A value of <tt>INSTANCE_FLEET</tt> indicates an
--   instance fleets configuration.
[$sel:instanceCollectionType:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe InstanceCollectionType

-- | The KMS key used for encrypting log files. This attribute is only
--   available with EMR version 5.30.0 and later, excluding EMR 6.0.0.
[$sel:logEncryptionKmsKeyId:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of tags associated with a cluster.
[$sel:tags:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The applications installed on this cluster.
[$sel:applications:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe [Application]

-- | Specifies the number of steps that can be executed concurrently.
[$sel:stepConcurrencyLevel:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Int

-- | Indicates whether the cluster is visible to IAM principals in the
--   Amazon Web Services account associated with the cluster. When
--   <tt>true</tt>, IAM principals in the Amazon Web Services account can
--   perform EMR cluster actions on the cluster that their IAM policies
--   allow. When <tt>false</tt>, only the IAM principal that created the
--   cluster and the Amazon Web Services account root user can perform EMR
--   actions, regardless of IAM permissions policies attached to other IAM
--   principals.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>true</tt> if a value is not provided when
--   creating a cluster using the EMR API RunJobFlow command, the CLI
--   <a>create-cluster</a> command, or the Amazon Web Services Management
--   Console. IAM principals that are allowed to perform actions on the
--   cluster can use the SetVisibleToAllUsers action to change the value on
--   a running cluster. For more information, see <a>Understanding the EMR
--   Cluster VisibleToAllUsers Setting</a> in the <i>Amazon EMRManagement
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:visibleToAllUsers:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether the cluster should terminate after completing all
--   steps.
[$sel:autoTerminate:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | Available only in Amazon EMR version 5.7.0 and later. The ID of a
--   custom Amazon EBS-backed Linux AMI if the cluster uses a custom AMI.
[$sel:customAmiId:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | An approximation of the cost of the cluster, represented in
--   m1.small/hours. This value is incremented one time for every hour an
--   m1.small instance runs. Larger instances are weighted more, so an EC2
--   instance that is roughly four times more expensive would result in the
--   normalized instance hours being incremented by four. This result is
--   only an approximation and does not reflect the actual billing rate.
[$sel:normalizedInstanceHours:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Int

-- | Placement group configured for an Amazon EMR cluster.
[$sel:placementGroups:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe [PlacementGroupConfig]

-- | The path to the Amazon S3 location where logs for this cluster are
--   stored.
[$sel:logUri:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Attributes for Kerberos configuration when Kerberos authentication is
--   enabled using a security configuration. For more information see
--   <a>Use Kerberos Authentication</a> in the <i>Amazon EMR Management
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:kerberosAttributes:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe KerberosAttributes

-- | Provides information about the EC2 instances in a cluster grouped by
--   category. For example, key name, subnet ID, IAM instance profile, and
--   so on.
[$sel:ec2InstanceAttributes:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Ec2InstanceAttributes

-- | The unique identifier for the cluster.
[$sel:id:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Text

-- | The name of the cluster.
[$sel:name:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Text

-- | The current status details about the cluster.
[$sel:status:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> ClusterStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>Cluster</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:repoUpgradeOnBoot:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_repoUpgradeOnBoot</a> - Applies only when
--   <tt>CustomAmiID</tt> is used. Specifies the type of updates that are
--   applied from the Amazon Linux AMI package repositories when an
--   instance boots using the AMI.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterArn:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_clusterArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name of the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceRole:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_serviceRole</a> - The IAM
--   role that Amazon EMR assumes in order to access Amazon Web Services
--   resources on your behalf.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScalingRole:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_autoScalingRole</a> -
--   An IAM role for automatic scaling policies. The default role is
--   <tt>EMR_AutoScaling_DefaultRole</tt>. The IAM role provides
--   permissions that the automatic scaling feature requires to launch and
--   terminate EC2 instances in an instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleDownBehavior:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_scaleDownBehavior</a> - The way that individual Amazon EC2
--   instances terminate when an automatic scale-in activity occurs or an
--   instance group is resized. <tt>TERMINATE_AT_INSTANCE_HOUR</tt>
--   indicates that Amazon EMR terminates nodes at the instance-hour
--   boundary, regardless of when the request to terminate the instance was
--   submitted. This option is only available with Amazon EMR 5.1.0 and
--   later and is the default for clusters created using that version.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> indicates that Amazon EMR adds
--   nodes to a deny list and drains tasks from nodes before terminating
--   the Amazon EC2 instances, regardless of the instance-hour boundary.
--   With either behavior, Amazon EMR removes the least active nodes first
--   and blocks instance termination if it could lead to HDFS corruption.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> is available only in Amazon EMR
--   version 4.1.0 and later, and is the default for versions of Amazon EMR
--   earlier than 5.1.0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityConfiguration:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_securityConfiguration</a> - The name of the security
--   configuration applied to the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:terminationProtected:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_terminationProtected</a> - Indicates whether Amazon EMR
--   will lock the cluster to prevent the EC2 instances from being
--   terminated by an API call or user intervention, or in the event of a
--   cluster error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterPublicDnsName:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_masterPublicDnsName</a> - The DNS name of the master node.
--   If the cluster is on a private subnet, this is the private DNS name.
--   On a public subnet, this is the public DNS name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurations:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_configurations</a> -
--   Applies only to Amazon EMR releases 4.x and later. The list of
--   Configurations supplied to the EMR cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outpostArn:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_outpostArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost where the cluster is
--   launched.
--   
--   <a>$sel:runningAmiVersion:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_runningAmiVersion</a> - The AMI version running on this
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsRootVolumeSize:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_ebsRootVolumeSize</a> - The size, in GiB, of the Amazon EBS
--   root device volume of the Linux AMI that is used for each EC2
--   instance. Available in Amazon EMR version 4.x and later.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestedAmiVersion:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_requestedAmiVersion</a> - The AMI version requested for
--   this cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:releaseLabel:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_releaseLabel</a> - The
--   Amazon EMR release label, which determines the version of open-source
--   application packages installed on the cluster. Release labels are in
--   the form <tt>emr-x.x.x</tt>, where x.x.x is an Amazon EMR release
--   version such as <tt>emr-5.14.0</tt>. For more information about Amazon
--   EMR release versions and included application versions and features,
--   see <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ReleaseGuide/</a>. The
--   release label applies only to Amazon EMR releases version 4.0 and
--   later. Earlier versions use <tt>AmiVersion</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceCollectionType:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_instanceCollectionType</a> - The instance fleet
--   configuration is available only in Amazon EMR versions 4.8.0 and
--   later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   The instance group configuration of the cluster. A value of
--   <tt>INSTANCE_GROUP</tt> indicates a uniform instance group
--   configuration. A value of <tt>INSTANCE_FLEET</tt> indicates an
--   instance fleets configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logEncryptionKmsKeyId:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_logEncryptionKmsKeyId</a> - The KMS key used for encrypting
--   log files. This attribute is only available with EMR version 5.30.0
--   and later, excluding EMR 6.0.0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_tags</a> - A list of tags
--   associated with a cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applications:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_applications</a> - The
--   applications installed on this cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stepConcurrencyLevel:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_stepConcurrencyLevel</a> - Specifies the number of steps
--   that can be executed concurrently.
--   
--   <a>$sel:visibleToAllUsers:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_visibleToAllUsers</a> - Indicates whether the cluster is
--   visible to IAM principals in the Amazon Web Services account
--   associated with the cluster. When <tt>true</tt>, IAM principals in the
--   Amazon Web Services account can perform EMR cluster actions on the
--   cluster that their IAM policies allow. When <tt>false</tt>, only the
--   IAM principal that created the cluster and the Amazon Web Services
--   account root user can perform EMR actions, regardless of IAM
--   permissions policies attached to other IAM principals.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>true</tt> if a value is not provided when
--   creating a cluster using the EMR API RunJobFlow command, the CLI
--   <a>create-cluster</a> command, or the Amazon Web Services Management
--   Console. IAM principals that are allowed to perform actions on the
--   cluster can use the SetVisibleToAllUsers action to change the value on
--   a running cluster. For more information, see <a>Understanding the EMR
--   Cluster VisibleToAllUsers Setting</a> in the <i>Amazon EMRManagement
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoTerminate:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_autoTerminate</a> -
--   Specifies whether the cluster should terminate after completing all
--   steps.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customAmiId:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_customAmiId</a> -
--   Available only in Amazon EMR version 5.7.0 and later. The ID of a
--   custom Amazon EBS-backed Linux AMI if the cluster uses a custom AMI.
--   
--   <a>$sel:normalizedInstanceHours:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_normalizedInstanceHours</a> - An approximation of the cost
--   of the cluster, represented in m1.small/hours. This value is
--   incremented one time for every hour an m1.small instance runs. Larger
--   instances are weighted more, so an EC2 instance that is roughly four
--   times more expensive would result in the normalized instance hours
--   being incremented by four. This result is only an approximation and
--   does not reflect the actual billing rate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:placementGroups:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_placementGroups</a> -
--   Placement group configured for an Amazon EMR cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logUri:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_logUri</a> - The path to the
--   Amazon S3 location where logs for this cluster are stored.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kerberosAttributes:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_kerberosAttributes</a> - Attributes for Kerberos
--   configuration when Kerberos authentication is enabled using a security
--   configuration. For more information see <a>Use Kerberos
--   Authentication</a> in the <i>Amazon EMR Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2InstanceAttributes:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_ec2InstanceAttributes</a> - Provides information about the
--   EC2 instances in a cluster grouped by category. For example, key name,
--   subnet ID, IAM instance profile, and so on.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_id</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_name</a> - The name of the
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_status</a> - The current
--   status details about the cluster.
newCluster :: Text -> Text -> ClusterStatus -> Cluster

-- | Applies only when <tt>CustomAmiID</tt> is used. Specifies the type of
--   updates that are applied from the Amazon Linux AMI package
--   repositories when an instance boots using the AMI.
cluster_repoUpgradeOnBoot :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe RepoUpgradeOnBoot)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name of the cluster.
cluster_clusterArn :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The IAM role that Amazon EMR assumes in order to access Amazon Web
--   Services resources on your behalf.
cluster_serviceRole :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | An IAM role for automatic scaling policies. The default role is
--   <tt>EMR_AutoScaling_DefaultRole</tt>. The IAM role provides
--   permissions that the automatic scaling feature requires to launch and
--   terminate EC2 instances in an instance group.
cluster_autoScalingRole :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The way that individual Amazon EC2 instances terminate when an
--   automatic scale-in activity occurs or an instance group is resized.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_INSTANCE_HOUR</tt> indicates that Amazon EMR
--   terminates nodes at the instance-hour boundary, regardless of when the
--   request to terminate the instance was submitted. This option is only
--   available with Amazon EMR 5.1.0 and later and is the default for
--   clusters created using that version.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> indicates that Amazon EMR adds
--   nodes to a deny list and drains tasks from nodes before terminating
--   the Amazon EC2 instances, regardless of the instance-hour boundary.
--   With either behavior, Amazon EMR removes the least active nodes first
--   and blocks instance termination if it could lead to HDFS corruption.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> is available only in Amazon EMR
--   version 4.1.0 and later, and is the default for versions of Amazon EMR
--   earlier than 5.1.0.
cluster_scaleDownBehavior :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe ScaleDownBehavior)

-- | The name of the security configuration applied to the cluster.
cluster_securityConfiguration :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether Amazon EMR will lock the cluster to prevent the EC2
--   instances from being terminated by an API call or user intervention,
--   or in the event of a cluster error.
cluster_terminationProtected :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Bool)

-- | The DNS name of the master node. If the cluster is on a private
--   subnet, this is the private DNS name. On a public subnet, this is the
--   public DNS name.
cluster_masterPublicDnsName :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Applies only to Amazon EMR releases 4.x and later. The list of
--   Configurations supplied to the EMR cluster.
cluster_configurations :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [Configuration])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost where the cluster is
--   launched.
cluster_outpostArn :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The AMI version running on this cluster.
cluster_runningAmiVersion :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The size, in GiB, of the Amazon EBS root device volume of the Linux
--   AMI that is used for each EC2 instance. Available in Amazon EMR
--   version 4.x and later.
cluster_ebsRootVolumeSize :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Int)

-- | The AMI version requested for this cluster.
cluster_requestedAmiVersion :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon EMR release label, which determines the version of
--   open-source application packages installed on the cluster. Release
--   labels are in the form <tt>emr-x.x.x</tt>, where x.x.x is an Amazon
--   EMR release version such as <tt>emr-5.14.0</tt>. For more information
--   about Amazon EMR release versions and included application versions
--   and features, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ReleaseGuide/</a>. The
--   release label applies only to Amazon EMR releases version 4.0 and
--   later. Earlier versions use <tt>AmiVersion</tt>.
cluster_releaseLabel :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   The instance group configuration of the cluster. A value of
--   <tt>INSTANCE_GROUP</tt> indicates a uniform instance group
--   configuration. A value of <tt>INSTANCE_FLEET</tt> indicates an
--   instance fleets configuration.
cluster_instanceCollectionType :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe InstanceCollectionType)

-- | The KMS key used for encrypting log files. This attribute is only
--   available with EMR version 5.30.0 and later, excluding EMR 6.0.0.
cluster_logEncryptionKmsKeyId :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags associated with a cluster.
cluster_tags :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The applications installed on this cluster.
cluster_applications :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [Application])

-- | Specifies the number of steps that can be executed concurrently.
cluster_stepConcurrencyLevel :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Int)

-- | Indicates whether the cluster is visible to IAM principals in the
--   Amazon Web Services account associated with the cluster. When
--   <tt>true</tt>, IAM principals in the Amazon Web Services account can
--   perform EMR cluster actions on the cluster that their IAM policies
--   allow. When <tt>false</tt>, only the IAM principal that created the
--   cluster and the Amazon Web Services account root user can perform EMR
--   actions, regardless of IAM permissions policies attached to other IAM
--   principals.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>true</tt> if a value is not provided when
--   creating a cluster using the EMR API RunJobFlow command, the CLI
--   <a>create-cluster</a> command, or the Amazon Web Services Management
--   Console. IAM principals that are allowed to perform actions on the
--   cluster can use the SetVisibleToAllUsers action to change the value on
--   a running cluster. For more information, see <a>Understanding the EMR
--   Cluster VisibleToAllUsers Setting</a> in the <i>Amazon EMRManagement
--   Guide</i>.
cluster_visibleToAllUsers :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether the cluster should terminate after completing all
--   steps.
cluster_autoTerminate :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Bool)

-- | Available only in Amazon EMR version 5.7.0 and later. The ID of a
--   custom Amazon EBS-backed Linux AMI if the cluster uses a custom AMI.
cluster_customAmiId :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | An approximation of the cost of the cluster, represented in
--   m1.small/hours. This value is incremented one time for every hour an
--   m1.small instance runs. Larger instances are weighted more, so an EC2
--   instance that is roughly four times more expensive would result in the
--   normalized instance hours being incremented by four. This result is
--   only an approximation and does not reflect the actual billing rate.
cluster_normalizedInstanceHours :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Int)

-- | Placement group configured for an Amazon EMR cluster.
cluster_placementGroups :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [PlacementGroupConfig])

-- | The path to the Amazon S3 location where logs for this cluster are
--   stored.
cluster_logUri :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Attributes for Kerberos configuration when Kerberos authentication is
--   enabled using a security configuration. For more information see
--   <a>Use Kerberos Authentication</a> in the <i>Amazon EMR Management
--   Guide</i>.
cluster_kerberosAttributes :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe KerberosAttributes)

-- | Provides information about the EC2 instances in a cluster grouped by
--   category. For example, key name, subnet ID, IAM instance profile, and
--   so on.
cluster_ec2InstanceAttributes :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Ec2InstanceAttributes)

-- | The unique identifier for the cluster.
cluster_id :: Lens' Cluster Text

-- | The name of the cluster.
cluster_name :: Lens' Cluster Text

-- | The current status details about the cluster.
cluster_status :: Lens' Cluster ClusterStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Cluster.Cluster
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Cluster.Cluster
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Cluster.Cluster
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Cluster.Cluster
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Cluster.Cluster
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Cluster.Cluster
