instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Unit.Unit
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Unit.Unit
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.Unit.Unit


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition

-- | The definition of a CloudWatch metric alarm, which determines when an
--   automatic scaling activity is triggered. When the defined alarm
--   conditions are satisfied, scaling activity begins.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudWatchAlarmDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data CloudWatchAlarmDefinition
CloudWatchAlarmDefinition' :: Maybe Unit -> Maybe Statistic -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [MetricDimension] -> Maybe Int -> ComparisonOperator -> Text -> Int -> Double -> CloudWatchAlarmDefinition

-- | The unit of measure associated with the CloudWatch metric being
--   watched. The value specified for <tt>Unit</tt> must correspond to the
--   units specified in the CloudWatch metric.
[$sel:unit:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'] :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> Maybe Unit

-- | The statistic to apply to the metric associated with the alarm. The
--   default is <tt>AVERAGE</tt>.
[$sel:statistic:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'] :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> Maybe Statistic

-- | The namespace for the CloudWatch metric. The default is
--   <tt>AWS/ElasticMapReduce</tt>.
[$sel:namespace:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'] :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> Maybe Text

-- | A CloudWatch metric dimension.
[$sel:dimensions:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'] :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> Maybe [MetricDimension]

-- | The number of periods, in five-minute increments, during which the
--   alarm condition must exist before the alarm triggers automatic scaling
--   activity. The default value is <tt>1</tt>.
[$sel:evaluationPeriods:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'] :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> Maybe Int

-- | Determines how the metric specified by <tt>MetricName</tt> is compared
--   to the value specified by <tt>Threshold</tt>.
[$sel:comparisonOperator:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'] :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> ComparisonOperator

-- | The name of the CloudWatch metric that is watched to determine an
--   alarm condition.
[$sel:metricName:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'] :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> Text

-- | The period, in seconds, over which the statistic is applied. EMR
--   CloudWatch metrics are emitted every five minutes (300 seconds), so if
--   an EMR CloudWatch metric is specified, specify <tt>300</tt>.
[$sel:period:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'] :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> Int

-- | The value against which the specified statistic is compared.
[$sel:threshold:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'] :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> Double

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudWatchAlarmDefinition</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_unit</a> - The unit of measure associated
--   with the CloudWatch metric being watched. The value specified for
--   <tt>Unit</tt> must correspond to the units specified in the CloudWatch
--   metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statistic:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_statistic</a> - The statistic to apply to
--   the metric associated with the alarm. The default is <tt>AVERAGE</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:namespace:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_namespace</a> - The namespace for the
--   CloudWatch metric. The default is <tt>AWS/ElasticMapReduce</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_dimensions</a> - A CloudWatch metric
--   dimension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluationPeriods:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_evaluationPeriods</a> - The number of
--   periods, in five-minute increments, during which the alarm condition
--   must exist before the alarm triggers automatic scaling activity. The
--   default value is <tt>1</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparisonOperator:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_comparisonOperator</a> - Determines how
--   the metric specified by <tt>MetricName</tt> is compared to the value
--   specified by <tt>Threshold</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricName:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_metricName</a> - The name of the
--   CloudWatch metric that is watched to determine an alarm condition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:period:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_period</a> - The period, in seconds, over
--   which the statistic is applied. EMR CloudWatch metrics are emitted
--   every five minutes (300 seconds), so if an EMR CloudWatch metric is
--   specified, specify <tt>300</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:threshold:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_threshold</a> - The value against which
--   the specified statistic is compared.
newCloudWatchAlarmDefinition :: ComparisonOperator -> Text -> Int -> Double -> CloudWatchAlarmDefinition

-- | The unit of measure associated with the CloudWatch metric being
--   watched. The value specified for <tt>Unit</tt> must correspond to the
--   units specified in the CloudWatch metric.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_unit :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition (Maybe Unit)

-- | The statistic to apply to the metric associated with the alarm. The
--   default is <tt>AVERAGE</tt>.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_statistic :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition (Maybe Statistic)

-- | The namespace for the CloudWatch metric. The default is
--   <tt>AWS/ElasticMapReduce</tt>.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_namespace :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition (Maybe Text)

-- | A CloudWatch metric dimension.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_dimensions :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition (Maybe [MetricDimension])

-- | The number of periods, in five-minute increments, during which the
--   alarm condition must exist before the alarm triggers automatic scaling
--   activity. The default value is <tt>1</tt>.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_evaluationPeriods :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition (Maybe Int)

-- | Determines how the metric specified by <tt>MetricName</tt> is compared
--   to the value specified by <tt>Threshold</tt>.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_comparisonOperator :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition ComparisonOperator

-- | The name of the CloudWatch metric that is watched to determine an
--   alarm condition.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_metricName :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition Text

-- | The period, in seconds, over which the statistic is applied. EMR
--   CloudWatch metrics are emitted every five minutes (300 seconds), so if
--   an EMR CloudWatch metric is specified, specify <tt>300</tt>.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_period :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition Int

-- | The value against which the specified statistic is compared.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_threshold :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition Double
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingTrigger

-- | The conditions that trigger an automatic scaling activity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScalingTrigger</a> smart constructor.
data ScalingTrigger
ScalingTrigger' :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> ScalingTrigger

-- | The definition of a CloudWatch metric alarm. When the defined alarm
--   conditions are met along with other trigger parameters, scaling
--   activity begins.
[$sel:cloudWatchAlarmDefinition:ScalingTrigger'] :: ScalingTrigger -> CloudWatchAlarmDefinition

-- | Create a value of <a>ScalingTrigger</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchAlarmDefinition:ScalingTrigger'</a>,
--   <a>scalingTrigger_cloudWatchAlarmDefinition</a> - The definition of a
--   CloudWatch metric alarm. When the defined alarm conditions are met
--   along with other trigger parameters, scaling activity begins.
newScalingTrigger :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> ScalingTrigger

-- | The definition of a CloudWatch metric alarm. When the defined alarm
--   conditions are met along with other trigger parameters, scaling
--   activity begins.
scalingTrigger_cloudWatchAlarmDefinition :: Lens' ScalingTrigger CloudWatchAlarmDefinition
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingTrigger.ScalingTrigger
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingTrigger.ScalingTrigger
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingTrigger.ScalingTrigger
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingTrigger.ScalingTrigger
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingTrigger.ScalingTrigger
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingTrigger.ScalingTrigger
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingTrigger.ScalingTrigger
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingTrigger.ScalingTrigger


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingRule

-- | A scale-in or scale-out rule that defines scaling activity, including
--   the CloudWatch metric alarm that triggers activity, how EC2 instances
--   are added or removed, and the periodicity of adjustments. The
--   automatic scaling policy for an instance group can comprise one or
--   more automatic scaling rules.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScalingRule</a> smart constructor.
data ScalingRule
ScalingRule' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> ScalingAction -> ScalingTrigger -> ScalingRule

-- | A friendly, more verbose description of the automatic scaling rule.
[$sel:description:ScalingRule'] :: ScalingRule -> Maybe Text

-- | The name used to identify an automatic scaling rule. Rule names must
--   be unique within a scaling policy.
[$sel:name:ScalingRule'] :: ScalingRule -> Text

-- | The conditions that trigger an automatic scaling activity.
[$sel:action:ScalingRule'] :: ScalingRule -> ScalingAction

-- | The CloudWatch alarm definition that determines when automatic scaling
--   activity is triggered.
[$sel:trigger:ScalingRule'] :: ScalingRule -> ScalingTrigger

-- | Create a value of <a>ScalingRule</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:ScalingRule'</a>, <a>scalingRule_description</a> -
--   A friendly, more verbose description of the automatic scaling rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ScalingRule'</a>, <a>scalingRule_name</a> - The name used
--   to identify an automatic scaling rule. Rule names must be unique
--   within a scaling policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:ScalingRule'</a>, <a>scalingRule_action</a> - The
--   conditions that trigger an automatic scaling activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:trigger:ScalingRule'</a>, <a>scalingRule_trigger</a> - The
--   CloudWatch alarm definition that determines when automatic scaling
--   activity is triggered.
newScalingRule :: Text -> ScalingAction -> ScalingTrigger -> ScalingRule

-- | A friendly, more verbose description of the automatic scaling rule.
scalingRule_description :: Lens' ScalingRule (Maybe Text)

-- | The name used to identify an automatic scaling rule. Rule names must
--   be unique within a scaling policy.
scalingRule_name :: Lens' ScalingRule Text

-- | The conditions that trigger an automatic scaling activity.
scalingRule_action :: Lens' ScalingRule ScalingAction

-- | The CloudWatch alarm definition that determines when automatic scaling
--   activity is triggered.
scalingRule_trigger :: Lens' ScalingRule ScalingTrigger
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingRule.ScalingRule
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingRule.ScalingRule
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingRule.ScalingRule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingRule.ScalingRule
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingRule.ScalingRule
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingRule.ScalingRule
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingRule.ScalingRule
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.ScalingRule.ScalingRule


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.AutoScalingPolicyDescription

-- | An automatic scaling policy for a core instance group or task instance
--   group in an Amazon EMR cluster. The automatic scaling policy defines
--   how an instance group dynamically adds and terminates EC2 instances in
--   response to the value of a CloudWatch metric. See
--   PutAutoScalingPolicy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoScalingPolicyDescription</a> smart constructor.
data AutoScalingPolicyDescription
AutoScalingPolicyDescription' :: Maybe AutoScalingPolicyStatus -> Maybe ScalingConstraints -> Maybe [ScalingRule] -> AutoScalingPolicyDescription

-- | The status of an automatic scaling policy.
[$sel:status:AutoScalingPolicyDescription'] :: AutoScalingPolicyDescription -> Maybe AutoScalingPolicyStatus

-- | The upper and lower EC2 instance limits for an automatic scaling
--   policy. Automatic scaling activity will not cause an instance group to
--   grow above or below these limits.
[$sel:constraints:AutoScalingPolicyDescription'] :: AutoScalingPolicyDescription -> Maybe ScalingConstraints

-- | The scale-in and scale-out rules that comprise the automatic scaling
--   policy.
[$sel:rules:AutoScalingPolicyDescription'] :: AutoScalingPolicyDescription -> Maybe [ScalingRule]

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoScalingPolicyDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AutoScalingPolicyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingPolicyDescription_status</a> - The status of an
--   automatic scaling policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:constraints:AutoScalingPolicyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingPolicyDescription_constraints</a> - The upper and lower
--   EC2 instance limits for an automatic scaling policy. Automatic scaling
--   activity will not cause an instance group to grow above or below these
--   limits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rules:AutoScalingPolicyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingPolicyDescription_rules</a> - The scale-in and scale-out
--   rules that comprise the automatic scaling policy.
newAutoScalingPolicyDescription :: AutoScalingPolicyDescription

-- | The status of an automatic scaling policy.
autoScalingPolicyDescription_status :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicyDescription (Maybe AutoScalingPolicyStatus)

-- | The upper and lower EC2 instance limits for an automatic scaling
--   policy. Automatic scaling activity will not cause an instance group to
--   grow above or below these limits.
autoScalingPolicyDescription_constraints :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicyDescription (Maybe ScalingConstraints)

-- | The scale-in and scale-out rules that comprise the automatic scaling
--   policy.
autoScalingPolicyDescription_rules :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicyDescription (Maybe [ScalingRule])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.AutoScalingPolicyDescription.AutoScalingPolicyDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.AutoScalingPolicyDescription.AutoScalingPolicyDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.AutoScalingPolicyDescription.AutoScalingPolicyDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.AutoScalingPolicyDescription.AutoScalingPolicyDescription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.AutoScalingPolicyDescription.AutoScalingPolicyDescription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.AutoScalingPolicyDescription.AutoScalingPolicyDescription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.AutoScalingPolicyDescription.AutoScalingPolicyDescription


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.AutoScalingPolicy

-- | An automatic scaling policy for a core instance group or task instance
--   group in an Amazon EMR cluster. An automatic scaling policy defines
--   how an instance group dynamically adds and terminates EC2 instances in
--   response to the value of a CloudWatch metric. See
--   PutAutoScalingPolicy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoScalingPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data AutoScalingPolicy
AutoScalingPolicy' :: ScalingConstraints -> [ScalingRule] -> AutoScalingPolicy

-- | The upper and lower EC2 instance limits for an automatic scaling
--   policy. Automatic scaling activity will not cause an instance group to
--   grow above or below these limits.
[$sel:constraints:AutoScalingPolicy'] :: AutoScalingPolicy -> ScalingConstraints

--   policy.

--   omitted.

--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:constraints:AutoScalingPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingPolicy_constraints</a> - The upper and lower EC2
--   instance limits for an automatic scaling policy. Automatic scaling
--   activity will not cause an instance group to grow above or below these
--   limits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rules:AutoScalingPolicy'</a>, <a>autoScalingPolicy_rules</a> -
--   The scale-in and scale-out rules that comprise the automatic scaling
--   policy.
newAutoScalingPolicy :: ScalingConstraints -> AutoScalingPolicy

-- | The upper and lower EC2 instance limits for an automatic scaling
--   policy. Automatic scaling activity will not cause an instance group to
--   grow above or below these limits.
autoScalingPolicy_constraints :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicy ScalingConstraints

-- | The scale-in and scale-out rules that comprise the automatic scaling
--   policy.
autoScalingPolicy_rules :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicy [ScalingRule]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.AutoScalingPolicy.AutoScalingPolicy
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.AutoScalingPolicy.AutoScalingPolicy

instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.AutoScalingPolicy.AutoScalingPolicy

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.VolumeSpecification

-- | EBS volume specifications such as volume type, IOPS, and size (GiB)
--   that will be requested for the EBS volume attached to an EC2 instance
--   in the cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVolumeSpecification</a> smart constructor.
data VolumeSpecification
VolumeSpecification' :: Maybe Int -> Text -> Int -> VolumeSpecification

-- | The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume
--   supports.
[$sel:iops:VolumeSpecification'] :: VolumeSpecification -> Maybe Int

-- | The volume type. Volume types supported are gp2, io1, standard.
[$sel:volumeType:VolumeSpecification'] :: VolumeSpecification -> Text

-- | The volume size, in gibibytes (GiB). This can be a number from 1 -
--   1024. If the volume type is EBS-optimized, the minimum value is 10.
[$sel:sizeInGB:VolumeSpecification'] :: VolumeSpecification -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>VolumeSpecification</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iops:VolumeSpecification'</a>, <a>volumeSpecification_iops</a>
--   - The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume
--   supports.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeType:VolumeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>volumeSpecification_volumeType</a> - The volume type. Volume types
--   supported are gp2, io1, standard.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInGB:VolumeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>volumeSpecification_sizeInGB</a> - The volume size, in gibibytes
--   (GiB). This can be a number from 1 - 1024. If the volume type is
--   EBS-optimized, the minimum value is 10.
newVolumeSpecification :: Text -> Int -> VolumeSpecification

-- | The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume
--   supports.
volumeSpecification_iops :: Lens' VolumeSpecification (Maybe Int)

-- | The volume type. Volume types supported are gp2, io1, standard.
volumeSpecification_volumeType :: Lens' VolumeSpecification Text

-- | The volume size, in gibibytes (GiB). This can be a number from 1 -
--   1024. If the volume type is EBS-optimized, the minimum value is 10.
volumeSpecification_sizeInGB :: Lens' VolumeSpecification Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.VolumeSpecification.VolumeSpecification
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.VolumeSpecification.VolumeSpecification
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.VolumeSpecification.VolumeSpecification
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.VolumeSpecification.VolumeSpecification
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.VolumeSpecification.VolumeSpecification
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.VolumeSpecification.VolumeSpecification
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.VolumeSpecification.VolumeSpecification
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.VolumeSpecification.VolumeSpecification


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsBlockDeviceConfig

-- | Configuration of requested EBS block device associated with the
--   instance group with count of volumes that will be associated to every
--   instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEbsBlockDeviceConfig</a> smart constructor.
data EbsBlockDeviceConfig
EbsBlockDeviceConfig' :: Maybe Int -> VolumeSpecification -> EbsBlockDeviceConfig

-- | Number of EBS volumes with a specific volume configuration that will
--   be associated with every instance in the instance group
[$sel:volumesPerInstance:EbsBlockDeviceConfig'] :: EbsBlockDeviceConfig -> Maybe Int

-- | EBS volume specifications such as volume type, IOPS, and size (GiB)
--   that will be requested for the EBS volume attached to an EC2 instance
--   in the cluster.
[$sel:volumeSpecification:EbsBlockDeviceConfig'] :: EbsBlockDeviceConfig -> VolumeSpecification

-- | Create a value of <a>EbsBlockDeviceConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumesPerInstance:EbsBlockDeviceConfig'</a>,
--   <a>ebsBlockDeviceConfig_volumesPerInstance</a> - Number of EBS volumes
--   with a specific volume configuration that will be associated with
--   every instance in the instance group
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeSpecification:EbsBlockDeviceConfig'</a>,
--   <a>ebsBlockDeviceConfig_volumeSpecification</a> - EBS volume
--   specifications such as volume type, IOPS, and size (GiB) that will be
--   requested for the EBS volume attached to an EC2 instance in the
--   cluster.
newEbsBlockDeviceConfig :: VolumeSpecification -> EbsBlockDeviceConfig

-- | Number of EBS volumes with a specific volume configuration that will
--   be associated with every instance in the instance group
ebsBlockDeviceConfig_volumesPerInstance :: Lens' EbsBlockDeviceConfig (Maybe Int)

-- | EBS volume specifications such as volume type, IOPS, and size (GiB)
--   that will be requested for the EBS volume attached to an EC2 instance
--   in the cluster.
ebsBlockDeviceConfig_volumeSpecification :: Lens' EbsBlockDeviceConfig VolumeSpecification
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsBlockDeviceConfig.EbsBlockDeviceConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsBlockDeviceConfig.EbsBlockDeviceConfig

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsConfiguration

-- | The Amazon EBS configuration of a cluster instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEbsConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data EbsConfiguration
EbsConfiguration' :: Maybe [EbsBlockDeviceConfig] -> Maybe Bool -> EbsConfiguration

-- | An array of Amazon EBS volume specifications attached to a cluster
--   instance.
[$sel:ebsBlockDeviceConfigs:EbsConfiguration'] :: EbsConfiguration -> Maybe [EbsBlockDeviceConfig]

-- | Indicates whether an Amazon EBS volume is EBS-optimized.
[$sel:ebsOptimized:EbsConfiguration'] :: EbsConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>EbsConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsBlockDeviceConfigs:EbsConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>ebsConfiguration_ebsBlockDeviceConfigs</a> - An array of Amazon EBS
--   volume specifications attached to a cluster instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsOptimized:EbsConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>ebsConfiguration_ebsOptimized</a> - Indicates whether an Amazon EBS
--   volume is EBS-optimized.
newEbsConfiguration :: EbsConfiguration

-- | An array of Amazon EBS volume specifications attached to a cluster
--   instance.
ebsConfiguration_ebsBlockDeviceConfigs :: Lens' EbsConfiguration (Maybe [EbsBlockDeviceConfig])

-- | Indicates whether an Amazon EBS volume is EBS-optimized.
ebsConfiguration_ebsOptimized :: Lens' EbsConfiguration (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsConfiguration.EbsConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsConfiguration.EbsConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsConfiguration.EbsConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsConfiguration.EbsConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsConfiguration.EbsConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsConfiguration.EbsConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsConfiguration.EbsConfiguration


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTypeConfig

-- | An instance type configuration for each instance type in an instance
--   fleet, which determines the EC2 instances Amazon EMR attempts to
--   provision to fulfill On-Demand and Spot target capacities. When you
--   use an allocation strategy, you can include a maximum of 30 instance
--   type configurations for a fleet. For more information about how to use
--   an allocation strategy, see <a>Configure Instance Fleets</a>. Without
--   an allocation strategy, you may specify a maximum of five instance
--   type configurations for a fleet.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceTypeConfig</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceTypeConfig
InstanceTypeConfig' :: Maybe EbsConfiguration -> Maybe [Configuration] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> InstanceTypeConfig

-- | The configuration of Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) attached
--   to each instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>.
[$sel:ebsConfiguration:InstanceTypeConfig'] :: InstanceTypeConfig -> Maybe EbsConfiguration

-- | A configuration classification that applies when provisioning cluster
--   instances, which can include configurations for applications and
--   software that run on the cluster.
[$sel:configurations:InstanceTypeConfig'] :: InstanceTypeConfig -> Maybe [Configuration]

-- | The bid price for each EC2 Spot Instance type as defined by
--   <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed in USD. If neither <tt>BidPrice</tt>
--   nor <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> is provided,
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> defaults to 100%.
[$sel:bidPrice:InstanceTypeConfig'] :: InstanceTypeConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The bid price, as a percentage of On-Demand price, for each EC2 Spot
--   Instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed as a number
--   (for example, 20 specifies 20%). If neither <tt>BidPrice</tt> nor
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> is provided,
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> defaults to 100%.
[$sel:bidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice:InstanceTypeConfig'] :: InstanceTypeConfig -> Maybe Double

-- | The custom AMI ID to use for the instance type.
[$sel:customAmiId:InstanceTypeConfig'] :: InstanceTypeConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of units that a provisioned instance of this type provides
--   toward fulfilling the target capacities defined in
--   InstanceFleetConfig. This value is 1 for a master instance fleet, and
--   must be 1 or greater for core and task instance fleets. Defaults to 1
--   if not specified.
[$sel:weightedCapacity:InstanceTypeConfig'] :: InstanceTypeConfig -> Maybe Natural

-- | An EC2 instance type, such as <tt>m3.xlarge</tt>.
[$sel:instanceType:InstanceTypeConfig'] :: InstanceTypeConfig -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceTypeConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsConfiguration:InstanceTypeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeConfig_ebsConfiguration</a> - The configuration of
--   Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) attached to each instance as
--   defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurations:InstanceTypeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeConfig_configurations</a> - A configuration
--   classification that applies when provisioning cluster instances, which
--   can include configurations for applications and software that run on
--   the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bidPrice:InstanceTypeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeConfig_bidPrice</a> - The bid price for each EC2 Spot
--   Instance type as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed in USD.
--   If neither <tt>BidPrice</tt> nor
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> is provided,
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> defaults to 100%.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice:InstanceTypeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeConfig_bidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</a> - The
--   bid price, as a percentage of On-Demand price, for each EC2 Spot
--   Instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed as a number
--   (for example, 20 specifies 20%). If neither <tt>BidPrice</tt> nor
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> is provided,
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> defaults to 100%.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customAmiId:InstanceTypeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeConfig_customAmiId</a> - The custom AMI ID to use for
--   the instance type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:weightedCapacity:InstanceTypeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeConfig_weightedCapacity</a> - The number of units that
--   a provisioned instance of this type provides toward fulfilling the
--   target capacities defined in InstanceFleetConfig. This value is 1 for
--   a master instance fleet, and must be 1 or greater for core and task
--   instance fleets. Defaults to 1 if not specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:InstanceTypeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeConfig_instanceType</a> - An EC2 instance type, such as
--   <tt>m3.xlarge</tt>.
newInstanceTypeConfig :: Text -> InstanceTypeConfig

-- | The configuration of Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) attached
--   to each instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>.
instanceTypeConfig_ebsConfiguration :: Lens' InstanceTypeConfig (Maybe EbsConfiguration)

-- | A configuration classification that applies when provisioning cluster
--   instances, which can include configurations for applications and
--   software that run on the cluster.
instanceTypeConfig_configurations :: Lens' InstanceTypeConfig (Maybe [Configuration])

-- | The bid price for each EC2 Spot Instance type as defined by
--   <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed in USD. If neither <tt>BidPrice</tt>
--   nor <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> is provided,
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> defaults to 100%.
instanceTypeConfig_bidPrice :: Lens' InstanceTypeConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The bid price, as a percentage of On-Demand price, for each EC2 Spot
--   Instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed as a number
--   (for example, 20 specifies 20%). If neither <tt>BidPrice</tt> nor
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> is provided,
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> defaults to 100%.
instanceTypeConfig_bidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice :: Lens' InstanceTypeConfig (Maybe Double)

-- | The custom AMI ID to use for the instance type.
instanceTypeConfig_customAmiId :: Lens' InstanceTypeConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of units that a provisioned instance of this type provides
--   toward fulfilling the target capacities defined in
--   InstanceFleetConfig. This value is 1 for a master instance fleet, and
--   must be 1 or greater for core and task instance fleets. Defaults to 1
--   if not specified.
instanceTypeConfig_weightedCapacity :: Lens' InstanceTypeConfig (Maybe Natural)

-- | An EC2 instance type, such as <tt>m3.xlarge</tt>.
instanceTypeConfig_instanceType :: Lens' InstanceTypeConfig Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTypeConfig.InstanceTypeConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTypeConfig.InstanceTypeConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTypeConfig.InstanceTypeConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTypeConfig.InstanceTypeConfig
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTypeConfig.InstanceTypeConfig
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTypeConfig.InstanceTypeConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTypeConfig.InstanceTypeConfig


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleetConfig

-- | The configuration that defines an instance fleet.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceFleetConfig</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceFleetConfig
InstanceFleetConfig' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications -> Maybe [InstanceTypeConfig] -> InstanceFleetType -> InstanceFleetConfig

-- | The target capacity of On-Demand units for the instance fleet, which
--   determines how many On-Demand Instances to provision. When the
--   instance fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision On-Demand
--   Instances as specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance
--   configuration has a specified <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>. When an
--   On-Demand Instance is provisioned, the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> units
--   count toward the target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances
--   until the target capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results
--   in an overage. For example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill
--   capacity, and Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a
--   <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and
--   the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units.
--   
--   If not specified or set to 0, only Spot Instances are provisioned for
--   the instance fleet using <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>. At least one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should
--   be greater than 0. For a master instance fleet, only one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be
--   specified, and its value must be 1.
[$sel:targetOnDemandCapacity:InstanceFleetConfig'] :: InstanceFleetConfig -> Maybe Natural

-- | The target capacity of Spot units for the instance fleet, which
--   determines how many Spot Instances to provision. When the instance
--   fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision Spot Instances as
--   specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance configuration has a
--   specified <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>. When a Spot Instance is
--   provisioned, the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> units count toward the
--   target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances until the target
--   capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results in an overage. For
--   example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill capacity, and
--   Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a
--   <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and
--   the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units.
--   
--   If not specified or set to 0, only On-Demand Instances are provisioned
--   for the instance fleet. At least one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>
--   and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should be greater than 0. For a
--   master instance fleet, only one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and
--   <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be specified, and its value must
--   be 1.
[$sel:targetSpotCapacity:InstanceFleetConfig'] :: InstanceFleetConfig -> Maybe Natural

-- | The friendly name of the instance fleet.
[$sel:name:InstanceFleetConfig'] :: InstanceFleetConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The launch specification for the instance fleet.
[$sel:launchSpecifications:InstanceFleetConfig'] :: InstanceFleetConfig -> Maybe InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications

-- | The instance type configurations that define the EC2 instances in the
--   instance fleet.
[$sel:instanceTypeConfigs:InstanceFleetConfig'] :: InstanceFleetConfig -> Maybe [InstanceTypeConfig]

-- | The node type that the instance fleet hosts. Valid values are MASTER,
--   CORE, and TASK.
[$sel:instanceFleetType:InstanceFleetConfig'] :: InstanceFleetConfig -> InstanceFleetType

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceFleetConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetOnDemandCapacity:InstanceFleetConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleetConfig_targetOnDemandCapacity</a> - The target
--   capacity of On-Demand units for the instance fleet, which determines
--   how many On-Demand Instances to provision. When the instance fleet
--   launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision On-Demand Instances as
--   specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance configuration has a
--   specified <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>. When an On-Demand Instance is
--   provisioned, the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> units count toward the
--   target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances until the target
--   capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results in an overage. For
--   example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill capacity, and
--   Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a
--   <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and
--   the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units.
--   
--   If not specified or set to 0, only Spot Instances are provisioned for
--   the instance fleet using <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>. At least one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should
--   be greater than 0. For a master instance fleet, only one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be
--   specified, and its value must be 1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetSpotCapacity:InstanceFleetConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleetConfig_targetSpotCapacity</a> - The target capacity of
--   Spot units for the instance fleet, which determines how many Spot
--   Instances to provision. When the instance fleet launches, Amazon EMR
--   tries to provision Spot Instances as specified by InstanceTypeConfig.
--   Each instance configuration has a specified <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>.
--   When a Spot Instance is provisioned, the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>
--   units count toward the target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions
--   instances until the target capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this
--   results in an overage. For example, if there are 2 units remaining to
--   fulfill capacity, and Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a
--   <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and
--   the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units.
--   
--   If not specified or set to 0, only On-Demand Instances are provisioned
--   for the instance fleet. At least one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>
--   and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should be greater than 0. For a
--   master instance fleet, only one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and
--   <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be specified, and its value must
--   be 1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:InstanceFleetConfig'</a>, <a>instanceFleetConfig_name</a>
--   - The friendly name of the instance fleet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:launchSpecifications:InstanceFleetConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleetConfig_launchSpecifications</a> - The launch
--   specification for the instance fleet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceTypeConfigs:InstanceFleetConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleetConfig_instanceTypeConfigs</a> - The instance type
--   configurations that define the EC2 instances in the instance fleet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceFleetType:InstanceFleetConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleetConfig_instanceFleetType</a> - The node type that the
--   instance fleet hosts. Valid values are MASTER, CORE, and TASK.
newInstanceFleetConfig :: InstanceFleetType -> InstanceFleetConfig

-- | The target capacity of On-Demand units for the instance fleet, which
--   determines how many On-Demand Instances to provision. When the
--   instance fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision On-Demand
--   Instances as specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance
--   configuration has a specified <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>. When an
--   On-Demand Instance is provisioned, the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> units
--   count toward the target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances
--   until the target capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results
--   in an overage. For example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill
--   capacity, and Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a
--   <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and
--   the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units.
--   
--   If not specified or set to 0, only Spot Instances are provisioned for
--   the instance fleet using <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>. At least one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should
--   be greater than 0. For a master instance fleet, only one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be
--   specified, and its value must be 1.
instanceFleetConfig_targetOnDemandCapacity :: Lens' InstanceFleetConfig (Maybe Natural)

-- | The target capacity of Spot units for the instance fleet, which
--   determines how many Spot Instances to provision. When the instance
--   fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision Spot Instances as
--   specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance configuration has a
--   specified <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>. When a Spot Instance is
--   provisioned, the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> units count toward the
--   target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances until the target
--   capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results in an overage. For
--   example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill capacity, and
--   Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a
--   <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and
--   the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units.
--   
--   If not specified or set to 0, only On-Demand Instances are provisioned
--   for the instance fleet. At least one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>
--   and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should be greater than 0. For a
--   master instance fleet, only one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and
--   <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be specified, and its value must
--   be 1.
instanceFleetConfig_targetSpotCapacity :: Lens' InstanceFleetConfig (Maybe Natural)

-- | The friendly name of the instance fleet.
instanceFleetConfig_name :: Lens' InstanceFleetConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The launch specification for the instance fleet.
instanceFleetConfig_launchSpecifications :: Lens' InstanceFleetConfig (Maybe InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications)

-- | The instance type configurations that define the EC2 instances in the
--   instance fleet.
instanceFleetConfig_instanceTypeConfigs :: Lens' InstanceFleetConfig (Maybe [InstanceTypeConfig])

-- | The node type that the instance fleet hosts. Valid values are MASTER,
--   CORE, and TASK.
instanceFleetConfig_instanceFleetType :: Lens' InstanceFleetConfig InstanceFleetType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleetConfig.InstanceFleetConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleetConfig.InstanceFleetConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleetConfig.InstanceFleetConfig

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceGroupConfig

-- | Configuration defining a new instance group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceGroupConfig</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceGroupConfig
InstanceGroupConfig' :: Maybe EbsConfiguration -> Maybe [Configuration] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AutoScalingPolicy -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MarketType -> Maybe Text -> InstanceRoleType -> Text -> Int -> InstanceGroupConfig

-- | EBS configurations that will be attached to each EC2 instance in the
--   instance group.
[$sel:ebsConfiguration:InstanceGroupConfig'] :: InstanceGroupConfig -> Maybe EbsConfiguration

-- | Amazon EMR releases 4.x or later.
--   
--   The list of configurations supplied for an EMR cluster instance group.
--   You can specify a separate configuration for each instance group
--   (master, core, and task).
[$sel:configurations:InstanceGroupConfig'] :: InstanceGroupConfig -> Maybe [Configuration]

-- | If specified, indicates that the instance group uses Spot Instances.
--   This is the maximum price you are willing to pay for Spot Instances.
--   Specify <tt>OnDemandPrice</tt> to set the amount equal to the
--   On-Demand price, or specify an amount in USD.
[$sel:bidPrice:InstanceGroupConfig'] :: InstanceGroupConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | An automatic scaling policy for a core instance group or task instance
--   group in an Amazon EMR cluster. The automatic scaling policy defines
--   how an instance group dynamically adds and terminates EC2 instances in
--   response to the value of a CloudWatch metric. See
--   PutAutoScalingPolicy.
[$sel:autoScalingPolicy:InstanceGroupConfig'] :: InstanceGroupConfig -> Maybe AutoScalingPolicy

-- | Friendly name given to the instance group.
[$sel:name:InstanceGroupConfig'] :: InstanceGroupConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | Market type of the EC2 instances used to create a cluster node.
[$sel:market:InstanceGroupConfig'] :: InstanceGroupConfig -> Maybe MarketType

-- | The custom AMI ID to use for the provisioned instance group.
[$sel:customAmiId:InstanceGroupConfig'] :: InstanceGroupConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The role of the instance group in the cluster.
[$sel:instanceRole:InstanceGroupConfig'] :: InstanceGroupConfig -> InstanceRoleType

-- | The EC2 instance type for all instances in the instance group.
[$sel:instanceType:InstanceGroupConfig'] :: InstanceGroupConfig -> Text

-- | Target number of instances for the instance group.
[$sel:instanceCount:InstanceGroupConfig'] :: InstanceGroupConfig -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceGroupConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsConfiguration:InstanceGroupConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroupConfig_ebsConfiguration</a> - EBS configurations that
--   will be attached to each EC2 instance in the instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurations:InstanceGroupConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroupConfig_configurations</a> - Amazon EMR releases 4.x or
--   later.
--   
--   The list of configurations supplied for an EMR cluster instance group.
--   You can specify a separate configuration for each instance group
--   (master, core, and task).
--   
--   <a>$sel:bidPrice:InstanceGroupConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroupConfig_bidPrice</a> - If specified, indicates that the
--   instance group uses Spot Instances. This is the maximum price you are
--   willing to pay for Spot Instances. Specify <tt>OnDemandPrice</tt> to
--   set the amount equal to the On-Demand price, or specify an amount in
--   USD.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScalingPolicy:InstanceGroupConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroupConfig_autoScalingPolicy</a> - An automatic scaling
--   policy for a core instance group or task instance group in an Amazon
--   EMR cluster. The automatic scaling policy defines how an instance
--   group dynamically adds and terminates EC2 instances in response to the
--   value of a CloudWatch metric. See PutAutoScalingPolicy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:InstanceGroupConfig'</a>, <a>instanceGroupConfig_name</a>
--   - Friendly name given to the instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:market:InstanceGroupConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroupConfig_market</a> - Market type of the EC2 instances
--   used to create a cluster node.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customAmiId:InstanceGroupConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroupConfig_customAmiId</a> - The custom AMI ID to use for
--   the provisioned instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceRole:InstanceGroupConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroupConfig_instanceRole</a> - The role of the instance
--   group in the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:InstanceGroupConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroupConfig_instanceType</a> - The EC2 instance type for
--   all instances in the instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceCount:InstanceGroupConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroupConfig_instanceCount</a> - Target number of instances
--   for the instance group.
newInstanceGroupConfig :: InstanceRoleType -> Text -> Int -> InstanceGroupConfig

-- | EBS configurations that will be attached to each EC2 instance in the
--   instance group.
instanceGroupConfig_ebsConfiguration :: Lens' InstanceGroupConfig (Maybe EbsConfiguration)

-- | Amazon EMR releases 4.x or later.
--   
--   The list of configurations supplied for an EMR cluster instance group.
--   You can specify a separate configuration for each instance group
--   (master, core, and task).
instanceGroupConfig_configurations :: Lens' InstanceGroupConfig (Maybe [Configuration])

-- | If specified, indicates that the instance group uses Spot Instances.
--   This is the maximum price you are willing to pay for Spot Instances.
--   Specify <tt>OnDemandPrice</tt> to set the amount equal to the
--   On-Demand price, or specify an amount in USD.
instanceGroupConfig_bidPrice :: Lens' InstanceGroupConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | An automatic scaling policy for a core instance group or task instance
--   group in an Amazon EMR cluster. The automatic scaling policy defines
--   how an instance group dynamically adds and terminates EC2 instances in
--   response to the value of a CloudWatch metric. See
--   PutAutoScalingPolicy.
instanceGroupConfig_autoScalingPolicy :: Lens' InstanceGroupConfig (Maybe AutoScalingPolicy)

-- | Friendly name given to the instance group.
instanceGroupConfig_name :: Lens' InstanceGroupConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | Market type of the EC2 instances used to create a cluster node.
instanceGroupConfig_market :: Lens' InstanceGroupConfig (Maybe MarketType)

-- | The custom AMI ID to use for the provisioned instance group.
instanceGroupConfig_customAmiId :: Lens' InstanceGroupConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The role of the instance group in the cluster.
instanceGroupConfig_instanceRole :: Lens' InstanceGroupConfig InstanceRoleType

-- | The EC2 instance type for all instances in the instance group.
instanceGroupConfig_instanceType :: Lens' InstanceGroupConfig Text

-- | Target number of instances for the instance group.
instanceGroupConfig_instanceCount :: Lens' InstanceGroupConfig Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceGroupConfig.InstanceGroupConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceGroupConfig.InstanceGroupConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceGroupConfig.InstanceGroupConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceGroupConfig.InstanceGroupConfig
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceGroupConfig.InstanceGroupConfig
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceGroupConfig.InstanceGroupConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceGroupConfig.InstanceGroupConfig


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.JobFlowInstancesConfig

-- | A description of the Amazon EC2 instance on which the cluster (job
--   flow) runs. A valid JobFlowInstancesConfig must contain either
--   InstanceGroups or InstanceFleets. They cannot be used together. You
--   may also have MasterInstanceType, SlaveInstanceType, and InstanceCount
--   (all three must be present), but we don't recommend this
--   configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobFlowInstancesConfig</a> smart constructor.
data JobFlowInstancesConfig
JobFlowInstancesConfig' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InstanceFleetConfig] -> Maybe PlacementType -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InstanceGroupConfig] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> JobFlowInstancesConfig

-- | Applies only to Amazon EMR release versions earlier than 4.0. The
--   Hadoop version for the cluster. Valid inputs are "0.18" (no longer
--   maintained), "0.20" (no longer maintained), "0.20.205" (no longer
--   maintained), "1.0.3", "2.2.0", or "2.4.0". If you do not set this
--   value, the default of 0.18 is used, unless the <tt>AmiVersion</tt>
--   parameter is set in the RunJobFlow call, in which case the default
--   version of Hadoop for that AMI version is used.
[$sel:hadoopVersion:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the EC2 key pair that can be used to connect to the master
--   node using SSH as the user called "hadoop."
[$sel:ec2KeyName:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   Describes the EC2 instances and instance configurations for clusters
--   that use the instance fleet configuration.
[$sel:instanceFleets:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe [InstanceFleetConfig]

-- | The Availability Zone in which the cluster runs.
[$sel:placement:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe PlacementType

-- | Applies to clusters that use the instance fleet configuration. When
--   multiple EC2 subnet IDs are specified, Amazon EMR evaluates them and
--   launches instances in the optimal subnet.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
[$sel:ec2SubnetIds:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the core and
--   task nodes.
[$sel:additionalSlaveSecurityGroups:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Specifies whether to lock the cluster to prevent the Amazon EC2
--   instances from being terminated by API call, user intervention, or in
--   the event of a job-flow error.
[$sel:terminationProtected:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Bool

-- | The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the core and task
--   nodes. If you specify <tt>EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup</tt>, you must
--   also specify <tt>EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup</tt>.
[$sel:emrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The EC2 instance type of the master node.
[$sel:masterInstanceType:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | Configuration for the instance groups in a cluster.
[$sel:instanceGroups:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe [InstanceGroupConfig]

-- | Applies to clusters that use the uniform instance group configuration.
--   To launch the cluster in Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC),
--   set this parameter to the identifier of the Amazon VPC subnet where
--   you want the cluster to launch. If you do not specify this value and
--   your account supports EC2-Classic, the cluster launches in
--   EC2-Classic.
[$sel:ec2SubnetId:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the master node.
--   If you specify <tt>EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup</tt>, you must also
--   specify <tt>EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup</tt>.
[$sel:emrManagedMasterSecurityGroup:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the master
--   node.
[$sel:additionalMasterSecurityGroups:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The EC2 instance type of the core and task nodes.
[$sel:slaveInstanceType:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the Amazon EMR
--   service to access clusters in VPC private subnets.
[$sel:serviceAccessSecurityGroup:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the cluster should remain available after completing
--   all steps. Defaults to <tt>true</tt>. For more information about
--   configuring cluster termination, see <a>Control Cluster
--   Termination</a> in the <i>EMR Management Guide</i>.
[$sel:keepJobFlowAliveWhenNoSteps:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Bool

-- | The number of EC2 instances in the cluster.
[$sel:instanceCount:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>JobFlowInstancesConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:hadoopVersion:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_hadoopVersion</a> - Applies only to Amazon
--   EMR release versions earlier than 4.0. The Hadoop version for the
--   cluster. Valid inputs are "0.18" (no longer maintained), "0.20" (no
--   longer maintained), "0.20.205" (no longer maintained), "1.0.3",
--   "2.2.0", or "2.4.0". If you do not set this value, the default of 0.18
--   is used, unless the <tt>AmiVersion</tt> parameter is set in the
--   RunJobFlow call, in which case the default version of Hadoop for that
--   AMI version is used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2KeyName:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_ec2KeyName</a> - The name of the EC2 key
--   pair that can be used to connect to the master node using SSH as the
--   user called "hadoop."
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceFleets:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_instanceFleets</a> - The instance fleet
--   configuration is available only in Amazon EMR versions 4.8.0 and
--   later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   Describes the EC2 instances and instance configurations for clusters
--   that use the instance fleet configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:placement:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_placement</a> - The Availability Zone in
--   which the cluster runs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2SubnetIds:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_ec2SubnetIds</a> - Applies to clusters that
--   use the instance fleet configuration. When multiple EC2 subnet IDs are
--   specified, Amazon EMR evaluates them and launches instances in the
--   optimal subnet.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalSlaveSecurityGroups:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_additionalSlaveSecurityGroups</a> - A list
--   of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the core and task
--   nodes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:terminationProtected:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_terminationProtected</a> - Specifies whether
--   to lock the cluster to prevent the Amazon EC2 instances from being
--   terminated by API call, user intervention, or in the event of a
--   job-flow error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_emrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup</a> - The
--   identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the core and task
--   nodes. If you specify <tt>EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup</tt>, you must
--   also specify <tt>EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterInstanceType:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_masterInstanceType</a> - The EC2 instance
--   type of the master node.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceGroups:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_instanceGroups</a> - Configuration for the
--   instance groups in a cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2SubnetId:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_ec2SubnetId</a> - Applies to clusters that
--   use the uniform instance group configuration. To launch the cluster in
--   Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC), set this parameter to the
--   identifier of the Amazon VPC subnet where you want the cluster to
--   launch. If you do not specify this value and your account supports
--   EC2-Classic, the cluster launches in EC2-Classic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emrManagedMasterSecurityGroup:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_emrManagedMasterSecurityGroup</a> - The
--   identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the master node. If
--   you specify <tt>EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup</tt>, you must also
--   specify <tt>EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalMasterSecurityGroups:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_additionalMasterSecurityGroups</a> - A list
--   of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the master node.
--   
--   <a>$sel:slaveInstanceType:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_slaveInstanceType</a> - The EC2 instance
--   type of the core and task nodes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessSecurityGroup:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_serviceAccessSecurityGroup</a> - The
--   identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the Amazon EMR service
--   to access clusters in VPC private subnets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keepJobFlowAliveWhenNoSteps:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_keepJobFlowAliveWhenNoSteps</a> - Specifies
--   whether the cluster should remain available after completing all
--   steps. Defaults to <tt>true</tt>. For more information about
--   configuring cluster termination, see <a>Control Cluster
--   Termination</a> in the <i>EMR Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceCount:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_instanceCount</a> - The number of EC2
--   instances in the cluster.
newJobFlowInstancesConfig :: JobFlowInstancesConfig

-- | Applies only to Amazon EMR release versions earlier than 4.0. The
--   Hadoop version for the cluster. Valid inputs are "0.18" (no longer
--   maintained), "0.20" (no longer maintained), "0.20.205" (no longer
--   maintained), "1.0.3", "2.2.0", or "2.4.0". If you do not set this
--   value, the default of 0.18 is used, unless the <tt>AmiVersion</tt>
--   parameter is set in the RunJobFlow call, in which case the default
--   version of Hadoop for that AMI version is used.
jobFlowInstancesConfig_hadoopVersion :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the EC2 key pair that can be used to connect to the master
--   node using SSH as the user called "hadoop."
jobFlowInstancesConfig_ec2KeyName :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   Describes the EC2 instances and instance configurations for clusters
--   that use the instance fleet configuration.
jobFlowInstancesConfig_instanceFleets :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe [InstanceFleetConfig])

-- | The Availability Zone in which the cluster runs.
jobFlowInstancesConfig_placement :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe PlacementType)

--   multiple EC2 subnet IDs are specified, Amazon EMR evaluates them and
--   launches instances in the optimal subnet.

jobFlowInstancesConfig_ec2SubnetIds :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe [Text])

-- | A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the core and
--   task nodes.
jobFlowInstancesConfig_additionalSlaveSecurityGroups :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe [Text])

--   instances from being terminated by API call, user intervention, or in

jobFlowInstancesConfig_terminationProtected :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe Bool)

--   nodes. If you specify <tt>EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup</tt>, you must

jobFlowInstancesConfig_emrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe Text)

jobFlowInstancesConfig_instanceGroups :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe [InstanceGroupConfig])
