module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsBlockDevice

-- | Configuration of requested EBS block device associated with the
--   instance group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEbsBlockDevice</a> smart constructor.
data EbsBlockDevice
EbsBlockDevice' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe VolumeSpecification -> EbsBlockDevice

-- | The device name that is exposed to the instance, such as /dev/sdh.
[$sel:device:EbsBlockDevice'] :: EbsBlockDevice -> Maybe Text

-- | EBS volume specifications such as volume type, IOPS, and size (GiB)
--   that will be requested for the EBS volume attached to an EC2 instance
--   in the cluster.
[$sel:volumeSpecification:EbsBlockDevice'] :: EbsBlockDevice -> Maybe VolumeSpecification

-- | Create a value of <a>EbsBlockDevice</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:device:EbsBlockDevice'</a>, <a>ebsBlockDevice_device</a> - The
--   device name that is exposed to the instance, such as /dev/sdh.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeSpecification:EbsBlockDevice'</a>,
--   <a>ebsBlockDevice_volumeSpecification</a> - EBS volume specifications
--   such as volume type, IOPS, and size (GiB) that will be requested for
--   the EBS volume attached to an EC2 instance in the cluster.
newEbsBlockDevice :: EbsBlockDevice

-- | The device name that is exposed to the instance, such as /dev/sdh.
ebsBlockDevice_device :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe Text)

-- | EBS volume specifications such as volume type, IOPS, and size (GiB)
--   that will be requested for the EBS volume attached to an EC2 instance
--   in the cluster.
ebsBlockDevice_volumeSpecification :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe VolumeSpecification)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsBlockDevice.EbsBlockDevice
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsBlockDevice.EbsBlockDevice
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsBlockDevice.EbsBlockDevice
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsBlockDevice.EbsBlockDevice
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsBlockDevice.EbsBlockDevice
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsBlockDevice.EbsBlockDevice
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.EbsBlockDevice.EbsBlockDevice


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTypeSpecification

-- | The configuration specification for each instance type in an instance
--   fleet.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceTypeSpecification</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceTypeSpecification
InstanceTypeSpecification' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [EbsBlockDevice] -> Maybe [Configuration] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> InstanceTypeSpecification

-- | Evaluates to <tt>TRUE</tt> when the specified <tt>InstanceType</tt> is
--   EBS-optimized.
[$sel:ebsOptimized:InstanceTypeSpecification'] :: InstanceTypeSpecification -> Maybe Bool

-- | The EC2 instance type, for example <tt>m3.xlarge</tt>.
[$sel:instanceType:InstanceTypeSpecification'] :: InstanceTypeSpecification -> Maybe Text

-- | The configuration of Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) attached
--   to each instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>.
[$sel:ebsBlockDevices:InstanceTypeSpecification'] :: InstanceTypeSpecification -> Maybe [EbsBlockDevice]

-- | A configuration classification that applies when provisioning cluster
--   instances, which can include configurations for applications and
--   software bundled with Amazon EMR.
[$sel:configurations:InstanceTypeSpecification'] :: InstanceTypeSpecification -> Maybe [Configuration]

-- | The bid price for each EC2 Spot Instance type as defined by
--   <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed in USD.
[$sel:bidPrice:InstanceTypeSpecification'] :: InstanceTypeSpecification -> Maybe Text

-- | The bid price, as a percentage of On-Demand price, for each EC2 Spot
--   Instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed as a number
--   (for example, 20 specifies 20%).
[$sel:bidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice:InstanceTypeSpecification'] :: InstanceTypeSpecification -> Maybe Double

-- | The custom AMI ID to use for the instance type.
[$sel:customAmiId:InstanceTypeSpecification'] :: InstanceTypeSpecification -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of units that a provisioned instance of this type provides
--   toward fulfilling the target capacities defined in
--   InstanceFleetConfig. Capacity values represent performance
--   characteristics such as vCPUs, memory, or I/O. If not specified, the
--   default value is 1.
[$sel:weightedCapacity:InstanceTypeSpecification'] :: InstanceTypeSpecification -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceTypeSpecification</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsOptimized:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_ebsOptimized</a> - Evaluates to
--   <tt>TRUE</tt> when the specified <tt>InstanceType</tt> is
--   EBS-optimized.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_instanceType</a> - The EC2 instance type,
--   for example <tt>m3.xlarge</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsBlockDevices:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_ebsBlockDevices</a> - The configuration
--   of Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) attached to each instance
--   as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurations:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_configurations</a> - A configuration
--   classification that applies when provisioning cluster instances, which
--   can include configurations for applications and software bundled with
--   Amazon EMR.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bidPrice:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_bidPrice</a> - The bid price for each EC2
--   Spot Instance type as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed in
--   USD.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:bidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_bidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</a> -
--   The bid price, as a percentage of On-Demand price, for each EC2 Spot
--   Instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed as a number
--   (for example, 20 specifies 20%).
--   
--   <a>$sel:customAmiId:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_customAmiId</a> - The custom AMI ID to
--   use for the instance type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:weightedCapacity:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_weightedCapacity</a> - The number of
--   units that a provisioned instance of this type provides toward
--   fulfilling the target capacities defined in InstanceFleetConfig.
--   Capacity values represent performance characteristics such as vCPUs,
--   memory, or I/O. If not specified, the default value is 1.
newInstanceTypeSpecification :: InstanceTypeSpecification

-- | Evaluates to <tt>TRUE</tt> when the specified <tt>InstanceType</tt> is
--   EBS-optimized.
instanceTypeSpecification_ebsOptimized :: Lens' InstanceTypeSpecification (Maybe Bool)

-- | The EC2 instance type, for example <tt>m3.xlarge</tt>.
instanceTypeSpecification_instanceType :: Lens' InstanceTypeSpecification (Maybe Text)

-- | The configuration of Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) attached
--   to each instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>.
instanceTypeSpecification_ebsBlockDevices :: Lens' InstanceTypeSpecification (Maybe [EbsBlockDevice])

-- | A configuration classification that applies when provisioning cluster
--   instances, which can include configurations for applications and
--   software bundled with Amazon EMR.
instanceTypeSpecification_configurations :: Lens' InstanceTypeSpecification (Maybe [Configuration])

-- | The bid price for each EC2 Spot Instance type as defined by
--   <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed in USD.
instanceTypeSpecification_bidPrice :: Lens' InstanceTypeSpecification (Maybe Text)

-- | The bid price, as a percentage of On-Demand price, for each EC2 Spot
--   Instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed as a number
--   (for example, 20 specifies 20%).
instanceTypeSpecification_bidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice :: Lens' InstanceTypeSpecification (Maybe Double)

-- | The custom AMI ID to use for the instance type.
instanceTypeSpecification_customAmiId :: Lens' InstanceTypeSpecification (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of units that a provisioned instance of this type provides
--   toward fulfilling the target capacities defined in
--   InstanceFleetConfig. Capacity values represent performance
--   characteristics such as vCPUs, memory, or I/O. If not specified, the
--   default value is 1.
instanceTypeSpecification_weightedCapacity :: Lens' InstanceTypeSpecification (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTypeSpecification.InstanceTypeSpecification
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTypeSpecification.InstanceTypeSpecification
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTypeSpecification.InstanceTypeSpecification
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTypeSpecification.InstanceTypeSpecification
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTypeSpecification.InstanceTypeSpecification
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTypeSpecification.InstanceTypeSpecification
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceTypeSpecification.InstanceTypeSpecification


module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceFleet

-- | Describes an instance fleet, which is a group of EC2 instances that
--   host a particular node type (master, core, or task) in an Amazon EMR
--   cluster. Instance fleets can consist of a mix of instance types and
--   On-Demand and Spot Instances, which are provisioned to meet a defined
--   target capacity.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceFleet</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceFleet
InstanceFleet' :: Maybe InstanceFleetType -> Maybe InstanceFleetStatus -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InstanceTypeSpecification] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications -> InstanceFleet

-- | The node type that the instance fleet hosts. Valid values are MASTER,
--   CORE, or TASK.
[$sel:instanceFleetType:InstanceFleet'] :: InstanceFleet -> Maybe InstanceFleetType

-- | The current status of the instance fleet.
[$sel:status:InstanceFleet'] :: InstanceFleet -> Maybe InstanceFleetStatus

-- | The target capacity of On-Demand units for the instance fleet, which
--   determines how many On-Demand Instances to provision. When the
--   instance fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision On-Demand
--   Instances as specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance
--   configuration has a specified <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>. When an
--   On-Demand Instance is provisioned, the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> units
--   count toward the target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances
--   until the target capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results
--   in an overage. For example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill
--   capacity, and Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a
--   <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and
--   the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units. You can use
--   InstanceFleet$ProvisionedOnDemandCapacity to determine the Spot
--   capacity units that have been provisioned for the instance fleet.
--   
--   If not specified or set to 0, only Spot Instances are provisioned for
--   the instance fleet using <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>. At least one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should
--   be greater than 0. For a master instance fleet, only one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be
--   specified, and its value must be 1.
[$sel:targetOnDemandCapacity:InstanceFleet'] :: InstanceFleet -> Maybe Natural

-- | The target capacity of Spot units for the instance fleet, which
--   determines how many Spot Instances to provision. When the instance
--   fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision Spot Instances as
--   specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance configuration has a
--   specified <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>. When a Spot instance is
--   provisioned, the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> units count toward the
--   target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances until the target
--   capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results in an overage. For
--   example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill capacity, and
--   Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a
--   <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and
--   the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units. You can use
--   InstanceFleet$ProvisionedSpotCapacity to determine the Spot capacity
--   units that have been provisioned for the instance fleet.
--   
--   If not specified or set to 0, only On-Demand Instances are provisioned
--   for the instance fleet. At least one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>
--   and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should be greater than 0. For a
--   master instance fleet, only one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and
--   <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be specified, and its value must
--   be 1.
[$sel:targetSpotCapacity:InstanceFleet'] :: InstanceFleet -> Maybe Natural

-- | The unique identifier of the instance fleet.
[$sel:id:InstanceFleet'] :: InstanceFleet -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of On-Demand units that have been provisioned for the
--   instance fleet to fulfill <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt>. This
--   provisioned capacity might be less than or greater than
--   <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt>.
[$sel:provisionedOnDemandCapacity:InstanceFleet'] :: InstanceFleet -> Maybe Natural

-- | A friendly name for the instance fleet.
[$sel:name:InstanceFleet'] :: InstanceFleet -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of specifications for the instance types that comprise an
--   instance fleet.
[$sel:instanceTypeSpecifications:InstanceFleet'] :: InstanceFleet -> Maybe [InstanceTypeSpecification]

-- | The number of Spot units that have been provisioned for this instance
--   fleet to fulfill <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>. This provisioned
--   capacity might be less than or greater than
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>.
[$sel:provisionedSpotCapacity:InstanceFleet'] :: InstanceFleet -> Maybe Natural

-- | Describes the launch specification for an instance fleet.
[$sel:launchSpecifications:InstanceFleet'] :: InstanceFleet -> Maybe InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceFleet</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceFleetType:InstanceFleet'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleet_instanceFleetType</a> - The node type that the
--   instance fleet hosts. Valid values are MASTER, CORE, or TASK.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:InstanceFleet'</a>, <a>instanceFleet_status</a> - The
--   current status of the instance fleet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetOnDemandCapacity:InstanceFleet'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleet_targetOnDemandCapacity</a> - The target capacity of
--   On-Demand units for the instance fleet, which determines how many
--   On-Demand Instances to provision. When the instance fleet launches,
--   Amazon EMR tries to provision On-Demand Instances as specified by
--   InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance configuration has a specified
--   <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>. When an On-Demand Instance is provisioned,
--   the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> units count toward the target capacity.
--   Amazon EMR provisions instances until the target capacity is totally
--   fulfilled, even if this results in an overage. For example, if there
--   are 2 units remaining to fulfill capacity, and Amazon EMR can only
--   provision an instance with a <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> of 5 units, the
--   instance is provisioned, and the target capacity is exceeded by 3
--   units. You can use InstanceFleet$ProvisionedOnDemandCapacity to
--   determine the Spot capacity units that have been provisioned for the
--   instance fleet.
--   
--   If not specified or set to 0, only Spot Instances are provisioned for
--   the instance fleet using <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>. At least one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should
--   be greater than 0. For a master instance fleet, only one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be
--   specified, and its value must be 1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetSpotCapacity:InstanceFleet'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleet_targetSpotCapacity</a> - The target capacity of Spot
--   units for the instance fleet, which determines how many Spot Instances
--   to provision. When the instance fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to
--   provision Spot Instances as specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each
--   instance configuration has a specified <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>. When
--   a Spot instance is provisioned, the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> units
--   count toward the target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances
--   until the target capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results
--   in an overage. For example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill
--   capacity, and Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a
--   <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and
--   the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units. You can use
--   InstanceFleet$ProvisionedSpotCapacity to determine the Spot capacity
--   units that have been provisioned for the instance fleet.

--   If not specified or set to 0, only On-Demand Instances are provisioned
--   for the instance fleet. At least one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>
--   and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should be greater than 0. For a
--   master instance fleet, only one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and
--   <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be specified, and its value must
--   be 1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:InstanceFleet'</a>, <a>instanceFleet_id</a> - The unique
--   identifier of the instance fleet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedOnDemandCapacity:InstanceFleet'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleet_provisionedOnDemandCapacity</a> - The number of
--   On-Demand units that have been provisioned for the instance fleet to
--   fulfill <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt>. This provisioned capacity
--   might be less than or greater than <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt>.

--   friendly name for the instance fleet.

--   specifications for the instance types that comprise an instance fleet.

--   units that have been provisioned for this instance fleet to fulfill
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>. This provisioned capacity might be less
--   than or greater than <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:launchSpecifications:InstanceFleet'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleet_launchSpecifications</a> - Describes the launch
--   specification for an instance fleet.
newInstanceFleet :: InstanceFleet

-- | The node type that the instance fleet hosts. Valid values are MASTER,
--   CORE, or TASK.
instanceFleet_instanceFleetType :: Lens' InstanceFleet (Maybe InstanceFleetType)

instanceFleet_status :: Lens' InstanceFleet (Maybe InstanceFleetStatus)

--   determines how many On-Demand Instances to provision. When the
--   instance fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision On-Demand
--   Instances as specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance

--   On-Demand Instance is provisioned, the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> units

--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be
--   specified, and its value must be 1.
instanceFleet_targetOnDemandCapacity :: Lens' InstanceFleet (Maybe Natural)

--   determines how many Spot Instances to provision. When the instance
--   fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision Spot Instances as

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types.InstanceGroup

-- | This entity represents an instance group, which is a group of
--   instances that have common purpose. For example, CORE instance group
--   is used for HDFS.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceGroup</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceGroup
InstanceGroup' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe InstanceGroupStatus -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [EbsBlockDevice] -> Maybe InstanceGroupType -> Maybe [Configuration] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Configuration] -> Maybe ShrinkPolicy -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe AutoScalingPolicyDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MarketType -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> InstanceGroup

-- | The version number of a configuration specification that was
--   successfully applied for an instance group last time.
[$sel:lastSuccessfullyAppliedConfigurationsVersion:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe Integer

-- | The current status of the instance group.
[$sel:status:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe InstanceGroupStatus

-- | If the instance group is EBS-optimized. An Amazon EBS-optimized
--   instance uses an optimized configuration stack and provides
--   additional, dedicated capacity for Amazon EBS I/O.
[$sel:ebsOptimized:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe Bool

-- | The EC2 instance type for all instances in the instance group.
[$sel:instanceType:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The EBS block devices that are mapped to this instance group.
[$sel:ebsBlockDevices:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe [EbsBlockDevice]

-- | The type of the instance group. Valid values are MASTER, CORE or TASK.
[$sel:instanceGroupType:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe InstanceGroupType

-- | Amazon EMR releases 4.x or later.
--   
--   The list of configurations supplied for an Amazon EMR cluster instance
--   group. You can specify a separate configuration for each instance
--   group (master, core, and task).
[$sel:configurations:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe [Configuration]

-- | The identifier of the instance group.
[$sel:id:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of configurations that were successfully applied for an
--   instance group last time.
[$sel:lastSuccessfullyAppliedConfigurations:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe [Configuration]

-- | Policy for customizing shrink operations.
[$sel:shrinkPolicy:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe ShrinkPolicy

-- | If specified, indicates that the instance group uses Spot Instances.
--   This is the maximum price you are willing to pay for Spot Instances.
--   Specify <tt>OnDemandPrice</tt> to set the amount equal to the
--   On-Demand price, or specify an amount in USD.
[$sel:bidPrice:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The target number of instances for the instance group.
[$sel:requestedInstanceCount:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe Int

-- | An automatic scaling policy for a core instance group or task instance
--   group in an Amazon EMR cluster. The automatic scaling policy defines
--   how an instance group dynamically adds and terminates EC2 instances in
--   response to the value of a CloudWatch metric. See
--   PutAutoScalingPolicy.
[$sel:autoScalingPolicy:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe AutoScalingPolicyDescription

-- | The name of the instance group.
[$sel:name:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The marketplace to provision instances for this group. Valid values
--   are ON_DEMAND or SPOT.
[$sel:market:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe MarketType

-- | The version number of the requested configuration specification for
--   this instance group.
[$sel:configurationsVersion:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe Integer

-- | The custom AMI ID to use for the provisioned instance group.
[$sel:customAmiId:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of instances currently running in this instance group.
[$sel:runningInstanceCount:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastSuccessfullyAppliedConfigurationsVersion:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_lastSuccessfullyAppliedConfigurationsVersion</a> -
--   The version number of a configuration specification that was
--   successfully applied for an instance group last time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:InstanceGroup'</a>, <a>instanceGroup_status</a> - The
--   current status of the instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsOptimized:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_ebsOptimized</a> - If the instance group is
--   EBS-optimized. An Amazon EBS-optimized instance uses an optimized
--   configuration stack and provides additional, dedicated capacity for
--   Amazon EBS I/O.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_instanceType</a> - The EC2 instance type for all
--   instances in the instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsBlockDevices:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_ebsBlockDevices</a> - The EBS block devices that are
--   mapped to this instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceGroupType:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_instanceGroupType</a> - The type of the instance
--   group. Valid values are MASTER, CORE or TASK.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurations:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_configurations</a> - Amazon EMR releases 4.x or
--   later.
--   
--   The list of configurations supplied for an Amazon EMR cluster instance
--   group. You can specify a separate configuration for each instance
--   group (master, core, and task).
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:InstanceGroup'</a>, <a>instanceGroup_id</a> - The
--   identifier of the instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastSuccessfullyAppliedConfigurations:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_lastSuccessfullyAppliedConfigurations</a> - A list of
--   configurations that were successfully applied for an instance group
--   last time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shrinkPolicy:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_shrinkPolicy</a> - Policy for customizing shrink
--   operations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bidPrice:InstanceGroup'</a>, <a>instanceGroup_bidPrice</a> -
--   If specified, indicates that the instance group uses Spot Instances.
--   This is the maximum price you are willing to pay for Spot Instances.
--   Specify <tt>OnDemandPrice</tt> to set the amount equal to the
--   On-Demand price, or specify an amount in USD.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestedInstanceCount:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_requestedInstanceCount</a> - The target number of
--   instances for the instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScalingPolicy:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_autoScalingPolicy</a> - An automatic scaling policy
--   for a core instance group or task instance group in an Amazon EMR
--   cluster. The automatic scaling policy defines how an instance group
--   dynamically adds and terminates EC2 instances in response to the value
--   of a CloudWatch metric. See PutAutoScalingPolicy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:InstanceGroup'</a>, <a>instanceGroup_name</a> - The name
--   of the instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:market:InstanceGroup'</a>, <a>instanceGroup_market</a> - The
--   marketplace to provision instances for this group. Valid values are
--   ON_DEMAND or SPOT.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationsVersion:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_configurationsVersion</a> - The version number of the
--   requested configuration specification for this instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customAmiId:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_customAmiId</a> - The custom AMI ID to use for the
--   provisioned instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:runningInstanceCount:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_runningInstanceCount</a> - The number of instances
--   currently running in this instance group.
newInstanceGroup :: InstanceGroup

-- | The version number of a configuration specification that was
--   successfully applied for an instance group last time.
instanceGroup_lastSuccessfullyAppliedConfigurationsVersion :: Lens' InstanceGroup (Maybe Integer)

-- | The current status of the instance group.
instanceGroup_status :: Lens' InstanceGroup (Maybe InstanceGroupStatus)

-- | If the instance group is EBS-optimized. An Amazon EBS-optimized
--   instance uses an optimized configuration stack and provides
--   additional, dedicated capacity for Amazon EBS I/O.
instanceGroup_ebsOptimized :: Lens' InstanceGroup (Maybe Bool)

-- | The EC2 instance type for all instances in the instance group.
instanceGroup_instanceType :: Lens' InstanceGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The EBS block devices that are mapped to this instance group.
instanceGroup_ebsBlockDevices :: Lens' InstanceGroup (Maybe [EbsBlockDevice])

-- | The type of the instance group. Valid values are MASTER, CORE or TASK.
instanceGroup_instanceGroupType :: Lens' InstanceGroup (Maybe InstanceGroupType)

-- | Amazon EMR releases 4.x or later.
--   
--   The list of configurations supplied for an Amazon EMR cluster instance
--   group. You can specify a separate configuration for each instance
--   group (master, core, and task).
instanceGroup_configurations :: Lens' InstanceGroup (Maybe [Configuration])

-- | The identifier of the instance group.
instanceGroup_id :: Lens' InstanceGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of configurations that were successfully applied for an
--   instance group last time.
instanceGroup_lastSuccessfullyAppliedConfigurations :: Lens' InstanceGroup (Maybe [Configuration])

-- | Policy for customizing shrink operations.
instanceGroup_shrinkPolicy :: Lens' InstanceGroup (Maybe ShrinkPolicy)

-- | If specified, indicates that the instance group uses Spot Instances.
--   This is the maximum price you are willing to pay for Spot Instances.
--   Specify <tt>OnDemandPrice</tt> to set the amount equal to the
--   On-Demand price, or specify an amount in USD.
instanceGroup_bidPrice :: Lens' InstanceGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The target number of instances for the instance group.
instanceGroup_requestedInstanceCount :: Lens' InstanceGroup (Maybe Int)

-- | An automatic scaling policy for a core instance group or task instance
--   group in an Amazon EMR cluster. The automatic scaling policy defines
--   how an instance group dynamically adds and terminates EC2 instances in
--   response to the value of a CloudWatch metric. See
--   PutAutoScalingPolicy.
instanceGroup_autoScalingPolicy :: Lens' InstanceGroup (Maybe AutoScalingPolicyDescription)

-- | The name of the instance group.
instanceGroup_name :: Lens' InstanceGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The marketplace to provision instances for this group. Valid values
--   are ON_DEMAND or SPOT.
instanceGroup_market :: Lens' InstanceGroup (Maybe MarketType)

-- | The version number of the requested configuration specification for
--   this instance group.
instanceGroup_configurationsVersion :: Lens' InstanceGroup (Maybe Integer)

-- | The custom AMI ID to use for the provisioned instance group.
instanceGroup_customAmiId :: Lens' InstanceGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of instances currently running in this instance group.
instanceGroup_runningInstanceCount :: Lens' InstanceGroup (Maybe Int)

module Network.AWS.EMR.Types

-- | API version <tt>2009-03-31</tt> of the Amazon EMR SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | Indicates that an error occurred while processing the request and that
--   the request was not completed.
_InternalServerError :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | This exception occurs when there is something wrong with user input.
_InvalidRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | This exception occurs when there is an internal failure in the Amazon
--   EMR service.
_InternalServerException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError
newtype ActionOnFailure
ActionOnFailure' :: Text -> ActionOnFailure
[fromActionOnFailure] :: ActionOnFailure -> Text
pattern ActionOnFailure_CANCEL_AND_WAIT :: ActionOnFailure
pattern ActionOnFailure_CONTINUE :: ActionOnFailure
pattern ActionOnFailure_TERMINATE_CLUSTER :: ActionOnFailure
pattern ActionOnFailure_TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW :: ActionOnFailure
newtype AdjustmentType
AdjustmentType' :: Text -> AdjustmentType
[fromAdjustmentType] :: AdjustmentType -> Text
pattern AdjustmentType_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY :: AdjustmentType
pattern AdjustmentType_EXACT_CAPACITY :: AdjustmentType
pattern AdjustmentType_PERCENT_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY :: AdjustmentType
newtype AuthMode
AuthMode' :: Text -> AuthMode
[fromAuthMode] :: AuthMode -> Text
pattern AuthMode_IAM :: AuthMode
pattern AuthMode_SSO :: AuthMode
newtype AutoScalingPolicyState
AutoScalingPolicyState' :: Text -> AutoScalingPolicyState
[fromAutoScalingPolicyState] :: AutoScalingPolicyState -> Text
pattern AutoScalingPolicyState_ATTACHED :: AutoScalingPolicyState
pattern AutoScalingPolicyState_ATTACHING :: AutoScalingPolicyState
pattern AutoScalingPolicyState_DETACHED :: AutoScalingPolicyState
pattern AutoScalingPolicyState_DETACHING :: AutoScalingPolicyState
pattern AutoScalingPolicyState_FAILED :: AutoScalingPolicyState
pattern AutoScalingPolicyState_PENDING :: AutoScalingPolicyState
newtype AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReasonCode
AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReasonCode' :: Text -> AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReasonCode
[fromAutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReasonCode] :: AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReasonCode -> Text
pattern AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReasonCode_CLEANUP_FAILURE :: AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReasonCode
pattern AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReasonCode_PROVISION_FAILURE :: AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReasonCode

-- | With Amazon EMR release version 4.0 and later, the only accepted
--   parameter is the application name. To pass arguments to applications,
--   you use configuration classifications specified using configuration
--   JSON objects. For more information, see <a>Configuring
--   Applications</a>.
--   
--   With earlier Amazon EMR releases, the application is any Amazon or
--   third-party software that you can add to the cluster. This structure
--   contains a list of strings that indicates the software to use with the
--   cluster and accepts a user argument list. Amazon EMR accepts and
--   forwards the argument list to the corresponding installation script as
--   bootstrap action argument.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newApplication</a> smart constructor.
data Application
Application' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Application

-- | Arguments for Amazon EMR to pass to the application.
[$sel:args:Application'] :: Application -> Maybe [Text]

-- | This option is for advanced users only. This is meta information about
--   third-party applications that third-party vendors use for testing
--   purposes.
[$sel:additionalInfo:Application'] :: Application -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The version of the application.
[$sel:version:Application'] :: Application -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the application.
[$sel:name:Application'] :: Application -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Application</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:args:Application'</a>, <a>application_args</a> - Arguments for
--   Amazon EMR to pass to the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalInfo:Application'</a>,
--   <a>application_additionalInfo</a> - This option is for advanced users
--   only. This is meta information about third-party applications that
--   third-party vendors use for testing purposes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:Application'</a>, <a>application_version</a> - The
--   version of the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Application'</a>, <a>application_name</a> - The name of
--   the application.
newApplication :: Application

-- | Arguments for Amazon EMR to pass to the application.
application_args :: Lens' Application (Maybe [Text])

-- | This option is for advanced users only. This is meta information about
--   third-party applications that third-party vendors use for testing
--   purposes.
application_additionalInfo :: Lens' Application (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The version of the application.
application_version :: Lens' Application (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the application.
application_name :: Lens' Application (Maybe Text)

-- | An automatic scaling policy for a core instance group or task instance
--   group in an Amazon EMR cluster. An automatic scaling policy defines
--   how an instance group dynamically adds and terminates EC2 instances in
--   response to the value of a CloudWatch metric. See
--   PutAutoScalingPolicy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoScalingPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data AutoScalingPolicy
AutoScalingPolicy' :: ScalingConstraints -> [ScalingRule] -> AutoScalingPolicy

-- | The upper and lower EC2 instance limits for an automatic scaling
--   policy. Automatic scaling activity will not cause an instance group to
--   grow above or below these limits.
[$sel:constraints:AutoScalingPolicy'] :: AutoScalingPolicy -> ScalingConstraints

-- | The scale-in and scale-out rules that comprise the automatic scaling
--   policy.
[$sel:rules:AutoScalingPolicy'] :: AutoScalingPolicy -> [ScalingRule]

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoScalingPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:constraints:AutoScalingPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingPolicy_constraints</a> - The upper and lower EC2
--   instance limits for an automatic scaling policy. Automatic scaling
--   activity will not cause an instance group to grow above or below these
--   limits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rules:AutoScalingPolicy'</a>, <a>autoScalingPolicy_rules</a> -
--   The scale-in and scale-out rules that comprise the automatic scaling
--   policy.
newAutoScalingPolicy :: ScalingConstraints -> AutoScalingPolicy

-- | The upper and lower EC2 instance limits for an automatic scaling
--   policy. Automatic scaling activity will not cause an instance group to
--   grow above or below these limits.
autoScalingPolicy_constraints :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicy ScalingConstraints

-- | The scale-in and scale-out rules that comprise the automatic scaling
--   policy.
autoScalingPolicy_rules :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicy [ScalingRule]

-- | An automatic scaling policy for a core instance group or task instance
--   group in an Amazon EMR cluster. The automatic scaling policy defines
--   how an instance group dynamically adds and terminates EC2 instances in
--   response to the value of a CloudWatch metric. See
--   PutAutoScalingPolicy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoScalingPolicyDescription</a> smart constructor.
data AutoScalingPolicyDescription
AutoScalingPolicyDescription' :: Maybe AutoScalingPolicyStatus -> Maybe ScalingConstraints -> Maybe [ScalingRule] -> AutoScalingPolicyDescription

-- | The status of an automatic scaling policy.
[$sel:status:AutoScalingPolicyDescription'] :: AutoScalingPolicyDescription -> Maybe AutoScalingPolicyStatus

-- | The upper and lower EC2 instance limits for an automatic scaling
--   policy. Automatic scaling activity will not cause an instance group to
--   grow above or below these limits.
[$sel:constraints:AutoScalingPolicyDescription'] :: AutoScalingPolicyDescription -> Maybe ScalingConstraints

-- | The scale-in and scale-out rules that comprise the automatic scaling
--   policy.
[$sel:rules:AutoScalingPolicyDescription'] :: AutoScalingPolicyDescription -> Maybe [ScalingRule]

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoScalingPolicyDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AutoScalingPolicyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingPolicyDescription_status</a> - The status of an
--   automatic scaling policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:constraints:AutoScalingPolicyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingPolicyDescription_constraints</a> - The upper and lower
--   EC2 instance limits for an automatic scaling policy. Automatic scaling
--   activity will not cause an instance group to grow above or below these
--   limits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rules:AutoScalingPolicyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingPolicyDescription_rules</a> - The scale-in and scale-out
--   rules that comprise the automatic scaling policy.
newAutoScalingPolicyDescription :: AutoScalingPolicyDescription

-- | The status of an automatic scaling policy.
autoScalingPolicyDescription_status :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicyDescription (Maybe AutoScalingPolicyStatus)

-- | The upper and lower EC2 instance limits for an automatic scaling
--   policy. Automatic scaling activity will not cause an instance group to
--   grow above or below these limits.
autoScalingPolicyDescription_constraints :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicyDescription (Maybe ScalingConstraints)

-- | The scale-in and scale-out rules that comprise the automatic scaling
--   policy.
autoScalingPolicyDescription_rules :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicyDescription (Maybe [ScalingRule])

-- | The reason for an AutoScalingPolicyStatus change.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason
AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReasonCode -> AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason

-- | A friendly, more verbose message that accompanies an automatic scaling
--   policy state change.
[$sel:message:AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason'] :: AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason -> Maybe Text

-- | The code indicating the reason for the change in
--   status.<tt>USER_REQUEST</tt> indicates that the scaling policy status
--   was changed by a user. <tt>PROVISION_FAILURE</tt> indicates that the
--   status change was because the policy failed to provision.
--   <tt>CLEANUP_FAILURE</tt> indicates an error.
[$sel:code:AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason'] :: AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason -> Maybe AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReasonCode

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason_message</a> - A friendly, more
--   verbose message that accompanies an automatic scaling policy state
--   change.
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason_code</a> - The code indicating
--   the reason for the change in status.<tt>USER_REQUEST</tt> indicates
--   that the scaling policy status was changed by a user.
--   <tt>PROVISION_FAILURE</tt> indicates that the status change was
--   because the policy failed to provision. <tt>CLEANUP_FAILURE</tt>
--   indicates an error.
newAutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason :: AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason

-- | A friendly, more verbose message that accompanies an automatic scaling
--   policy state change.
autoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason_message :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason (Maybe Text)

-- | The code indicating the reason for the change in
--   status.<tt>USER_REQUEST</tt> indicates that the scaling policy status
--   was changed by a user. <tt>PROVISION_FAILURE</tt> indicates that the
--   status change was because the policy failed to provision.
--   <tt>CLEANUP_FAILURE</tt> indicates an error.
autoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason_code :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason (Maybe AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReasonCode)

-- | The status of an automatic scaling policy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoScalingPolicyStatus</a> smart constructor.
data AutoScalingPolicyStatus
AutoScalingPolicyStatus' :: Maybe AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason -> Maybe AutoScalingPolicyState -> AutoScalingPolicyStatus

-- | The reason for a change in status.
[$sel:stateChangeReason:AutoScalingPolicyStatus'] :: AutoScalingPolicyStatus -> Maybe AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason

-- | Indicates the status of the automatic scaling policy.
[$sel:state:AutoScalingPolicyStatus'] :: AutoScalingPolicyStatus -> Maybe AutoScalingPolicyState

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoScalingPolicyStatus</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   change in status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:AutoScalingPolicyStatus'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingPolicyStatus_state</a> - Indicates the status of the
--   automatic scaling policy.
newAutoScalingPolicyStatus :: AutoScalingPolicyStatus

-- | The reason for a change in status.
autoScalingPolicyStatus_stateChangeReason :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicyStatus (Maybe AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason)

-- | Indicates the status of the automatic scaling policy.
autoScalingPolicyStatus_state :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicyStatus (Maybe AutoScalingPolicyState)

-- | An auto-termination policy for an Amazon EMR cluster. An
--   auto-termination policy defines the amount of idle time in seconds
--   after which a cluster automatically terminates. For alternative
--   cluster termination options, see <a>Control cluster termination</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoTerminationPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data AutoTerminationPolicy
AutoTerminationPolicy' :: Maybe Integer -> AutoTerminationPolicy

-- | Specifies the amount of idle time in seconds after which the cluster
--   automatically terminates. You can specify a minimum of 60 seconds and
--   a maximum of 604800 seconds (seven days).
[$sel:idleTimeout:AutoTerminationPolicy'] :: AutoTerminationPolicy -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoTerminationPolicy</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:idleTimeout:AutoTerminationPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>autoTerminationPolicy_idleTimeout</a> - Specifies the amount of
--   idle time in seconds after which the cluster automatically terminates.
--   You can specify a minimum of 60 seconds and a maximum of 604800
--   seconds (seven days).
newAutoTerminationPolicy :: AutoTerminationPolicy

-- | Specifies the amount of idle time in seconds after which the cluster
--   automatically terminates. You can specify a minimum of 60 seconds and
--   a maximum of 604800 seconds (seven days).
autoTerminationPolicy_idleTimeout :: Lens' AutoTerminationPolicy (Maybe Integer)

-- | A configuration for Amazon EMR block public access. When
--   <tt>BlockPublicSecurityGroupRules</tt> is set to <tt>true</tt>, Amazon
--   EMR prevents cluster creation if one of the cluster's security groups
--   has a rule that allows inbound traffic from 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 on a
--   port, unless the port is specified as an exception using
--   <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBlockPublicAccessConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data BlockPublicAccessConfiguration
BlockPublicAccessConfiguration' :: Maybe [PortRange] -> Bool -> BlockPublicAccessConfiguration

-- | Specifies ports and port ranges that are permitted to have security
--   group rules that allow inbound traffic from all public sources. For
--   example, if Port 23 (Telnet) is specified for
--   <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>, Amazon EMR allows
--   cluster creation if a security group associated with the cluster has a
--   rule that allows inbound traffic on Port 23 from IPv4 0.0.0.0/0 or
--   IPv6 port ::/0 as the source.
--   
--   By default, Port 22, which is used for SSH access to the cluster EC2
--   instances, is in the list of
--   <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>.
[$sel:permittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges:BlockPublicAccessConfiguration'] :: BlockPublicAccessConfiguration -> Maybe [PortRange]

-- | Indicates whether Amazon EMR block public access is enabled
--   (<tt>true</tt>) or disabled (<tt>false</tt>). By default, the value is
--   <tt>false</tt> for accounts that have created EMR clusters before July
--   2019. For accounts created after this, the default is <tt>true</tt>.
[$sel:blockPublicSecurityGroupRules:BlockPublicAccessConfiguration'] :: BlockPublicAccessConfiguration -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>BlockPublicAccessConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:permittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges:BlockPublicAccessConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>blockPublicAccessConfiguration_permittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</a>
--   - Specifies ports and port ranges that are permitted to have security
--   group rules that allow inbound traffic from all public sources. For
--   example, if Port 23 (Telnet) is specified for
--   <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>, Amazon EMR allows
--   cluster creation if a security group associated with the cluster has a
--   rule that allows inbound traffic on Port 23 from IPv4 0.0.0.0/0 or
--   IPv6 port ::/0 as the source.
--   
--   By default, Port 22, which is used for SSH access to the cluster EC2
--   instances, is in the list of
--   <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockPublicSecurityGroupRules:BlockPublicAccessConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>blockPublicAccessConfiguration_blockPublicSecurityGroupRules</a> -
--   Indicates whether Amazon EMR block public access is enabled
--   (<tt>true</tt>) or disabled (<tt>false</tt>). By default, the value is
--   <tt>false</tt> for accounts that have created EMR clusters before July
--   2019. For accounts created after this, the default is <tt>true</tt>.
newBlockPublicAccessConfiguration :: Bool -> BlockPublicAccessConfiguration

-- | Specifies ports and port ranges that are permitted to have security
--   group rules that allow inbound traffic from all public sources. For
--   example, if Port 23 (Telnet) is specified for
--   <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>, Amazon EMR allows
--   cluster creation if a security group associated with the cluster has a
--   rule that allows inbound traffic on Port 23 from IPv4 0.0.0.0/0 or
--   IPv6 port ::/0 as the source.
--   
--   By default, Port 22, which is used for SSH access to the cluster EC2
--   instances, is in the list of
--   <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>.
blockPublicAccessConfiguration_permittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges :: Lens' BlockPublicAccessConfiguration (Maybe [PortRange])

-- | Indicates whether Amazon EMR block public access is enabled
--   (<tt>true</tt>) or disabled (<tt>false</tt>). By default, the value is
--   <tt>false</tt> for accounts that have created EMR clusters before July
--   2019. For accounts created after this, the default is <tt>true</tt>.
blockPublicAccessConfiguration_blockPublicSecurityGroupRules :: Lens' BlockPublicAccessConfiguration Bool
