-- | The definition of a CloudWatch metric alarm, which determines when an
--   automatic scaling activity is triggered. When the defined alarm
--   conditions are satisfied, scaling activity begins.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudWatchAlarmDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data CloudWatchAlarmDefinition
CloudWatchAlarmDefinition' :: Maybe Unit -> Maybe Statistic -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [MetricDimension] -> Maybe Int -> ComparisonOperator -> Text -> Int -> Double -> CloudWatchAlarmDefinition

-- | The unit of measure associated with the CloudWatch metric being
--   watched. The value specified for <tt>Unit</tt> must correspond to the
--   units specified in the CloudWatch metric.
[$sel:unit:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'] :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> Maybe Unit

-- | The statistic to apply to the metric associated with the alarm. The
--   default is <tt>AVERAGE</tt>.
[$sel:statistic:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'] :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> Maybe Statistic

-- | The namespace for the CloudWatch metric. The default is
--   <tt>AWS/ElasticMapReduce</tt>.
[$sel:namespace:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'] :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> Maybe Text

-- | A CloudWatch metric dimension.
[$sel:dimensions:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'] :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> Maybe [MetricDimension]

-- | The number of periods, in five-minute increments, during which the
--   alarm condition must exist before the alarm triggers automatic scaling
--   activity. The default value is <tt>1</tt>.
[$sel:evaluationPeriods:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'] :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> Maybe Int

-- | Determines how the metric specified by <tt>MetricName</tt> is compared
--   to the value specified by <tt>Threshold</tt>.
[$sel:comparisonOperator:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'] :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> ComparisonOperator

-- | The name of the CloudWatch metric that is watched to determine an
--   alarm condition.
[$sel:metricName:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'] :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> Text

-- | The period, in seconds, over which the statistic is applied. EMR
--   CloudWatch metrics are emitted every five minutes (300 seconds), so if
--   an EMR CloudWatch metric is specified, specify <tt>300</tt>.
[$sel:period:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'] :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> Int

-- | The value against which the specified statistic is compared.
[$sel:threshold:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'] :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> Double

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudWatchAlarmDefinition</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_unit</a> - The unit of measure associated
--   with the CloudWatch metric being watched. The value specified for
--   <tt>Unit</tt> must correspond to the units specified in the CloudWatch
--   metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statistic:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_statistic</a> - The statistic to apply to
--   the metric associated with the alarm. The default is <tt>AVERAGE</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:namespace:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_namespace</a> - The namespace for the
--   CloudWatch metric. The default is <tt>AWS/ElasticMapReduce</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_dimensions</a> - A CloudWatch metric
--   dimension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluationPeriods:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_evaluationPeriods</a> - The number of
--   periods, in five-minute increments, during which the alarm condition
--   must exist before the alarm triggers automatic scaling activity. The
--   default value is <tt>1</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparisonOperator:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_comparisonOperator</a> - Determines how
--   the metric specified by <tt>MetricName</tt> is compared to the value
--   specified by <tt>Threshold</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricName:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_metricName</a> - The name of the
--   CloudWatch metric that is watched to determine an alarm condition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:period:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_period</a> - The period, in seconds, over
--   which the statistic is applied. EMR CloudWatch metrics are emitted
--   every five minutes (300 seconds), so if an EMR CloudWatch metric is
--   specified, specify <tt>300</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:threshold:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_threshold</a> - The value against which
--   the specified statistic is compared.
newCloudWatchAlarmDefinition :: ComparisonOperator -> Text -> Int -> Double -> CloudWatchAlarmDefinition

-- | The unit of measure associated with the CloudWatch metric being
--   watched. The value specified for <tt>Unit</tt> must correspond to the
--   units specified in the CloudWatch metric.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_unit :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition (Maybe Unit)

-- | The statistic to apply to the metric associated with the alarm. The
--   default is <tt>AVERAGE</tt>.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_statistic :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition (Maybe Statistic)

-- | The namespace for the CloudWatch metric. The default is
--   <tt>AWS/ElasticMapReduce</tt>.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_namespace :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition (Maybe Text)

-- | A CloudWatch metric dimension.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_dimensions :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition (Maybe [MetricDimension])

-- | The number of periods, in five-minute increments, during which the
--   alarm condition must exist before the alarm triggers automatic scaling
--   activity. The default value is <tt>1</tt>.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_evaluationPeriods :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition (Maybe Int)

-- | Determines how the metric specified by <tt>MetricName</tt> is compared
--   to the value specified by <tt>Threshold</tt>.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_comparisonOperator :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition ComparisonOperator

-- | The name of the CloudWatch metric that is watched to determine an
--   alarm condition.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_metricName :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition Text

-- | The period, in seconds, over which the statistic is applied. EMR
--   CloudWatch metrics are emitted every five minutes (300 seconds), so if
--   an EMR CloudWatch metric is specified, specify <tt>300</tt>.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_period :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition Int

-- | The value against which the specified statistic is compared.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_threshold :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition Double

-- | The detailed description of the cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCluster</a> smart constructor.
data Cluster
Cluster' :: Maybe RepoUpgradeOnBoot -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ScaleDownBehavior -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Configuration] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InstanceCollectionType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe [Application] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [PlacementGroupConfig] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe KerberosAttributes -> Maybe Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Text -> Text -> ClusterStatus -> Cluster

-- | Applies only when <tt>CustomAmiID</tt> is used. Specifies the type of
--   updates that are applied from the Amazon Linux AMI package
--   repositories when an instance boots using the AMI.
[$sel:repoUpgradeOnBoot:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe RepoUpgradeOnBoot

-- | The Amazon Resource Name of the cluster.
[$sel:clusterArn:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The IAM role that Amazon EMR assumes in order to access Amazon Web
--   Services resources on your behalf.
[$sel:serviceRole:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | An IAM role for automatic scaling policies. The default role is
--   <tt>EMR_AutoScaling_DefaultRole</tt>. The IAM role provides
--   permissions that the automatic scaling feature requires to launch and
--   terminate EC2 instances in an instance group.
[$sel:autoScalingRole:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The way that individual Amazon EC2 instances terminate when an
--   automatic scale-in activity occurs or an instance group is resized.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_INSTANCE_HOUR</tt> indicates that Amazon EMR
--   terminates nodes at the instance-hour boundary, regardless of when the
--   request to terminate the instance was submitted. This option is only
--   available with Amazon EMR 5.1.0 and later and is the default for
--   clusters created using that version.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> indicates that Amazon EMR adds
--   nodes to a deny list and drains tasks from nodes before terminating
--   the Amazon EC2 instances, regardless of the instance-hour boundary.
--   With either behavior, Amazon EMR removes the least active nodes first
--   and blocks instance termination if it could lead to HDFS corruption.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> is available only in Amazon EMR
--   version 4.1.0 and later, and is the default for versions of Amazon EMR
--   earlier than 5.1.0.
[$sel:scaleDownBehavior:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe ScaleDownBehavior

-- | The name of the security configuration applied to the cluster.
[$sel:securityConfiguration:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether Amazon EMR will lock the cluster to prevent the EC2
--   instances from being terminated by an API call or user intervention,
--   or in the event of a cluster error.
[$sel:terminationProtected:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | The DNS name of the master node. If the cluster is on a private
--   subnet, this is the private DNS name. On a public subnet, this is the
--   public DNS name.
[$sel:masterPublicDnsName:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Applies only to Amazon EMR releases 4.x and later. The list of
--   Configurations supplied to the EMR cluster.
[$sel:configurations:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe [Configuration]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost where the cluster is
--   launched.
[$sel:outpostArn:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The AMI version running on this cluster.
[$sel:runningAmiVersion:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in GiB, of the Amazon EBS root device volume of the Linux
--   AMI that is used for each EC2 instance. Available in Amazon EMR
--   version 4.x and later.
[$sel:ebsRootVolumeSize:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Int

-- | The AMI version requested for this cluster.
[$sel:requestedAmiVersion:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon EMR release label, which determines the version of
--   open-source application packages installed on the cluster. Release
--   labels are in the form <tt>emr-x.x.x</tt>, where x.x.x is an Amazon
--   EMR release version such as <tt>emr-5.14.0</tt>. For more information
--   about Amazon EMR release versions and included application versions
--   and features, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ReleaseGuide/</a>. The
--   release label applies only to Amazon EMR releases version 4.0 and
--   later. Earlier versions use <tt>AmiVersion</tt>.
[$sel:releaseLabel:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   The instance group configuration of the cluster. A value of
--   <tt>INSTANCE_GROUP</tt> indicates a uniform instance group
--   configuration. A value of <tt>INSTANCE_FLEET</tt> indicates an
--   instance fleets configuration.
[$sel:instanceCollectionType:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe InstanceCollectionType

-- | The KMS key used for encrypting log files. This attribute is only
--   available with EMR version 5.30.0 and later, excluding EMR 6.0.0.
[$sel:logEncryptionKmsKeyId:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of tags associated with a cluster.
[$sel:tags:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The applications installed on this cluster.
[$sel:applications:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe [Application]

-- | Specifies the number of steps that can be executed concurrently.
[$sel:stepConcurrencyLevel:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Int

-- | Indicates whether the cluster is visible to IAM principals in the
--   Amazon Web Services account associated with the cluster. When
--   <tt>true</tt>, IAM principals in the Amazon Web Services account can
--   perform EMR cluster actions on the cluster that their IAM policies
--   allow. When <tt>false</tt>, only the IAM principal that created the
--   cluster and the Amazon Web Services account root user can perform EMR
--   actions, regardless of IAM permissions policies attached to other IAM
--   principals.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>true</tt> if a value is not provided when
--   creating a cluster using the EMR API RunJobFlow command, the CLI
--   <a>create-cluster</a> command, or the Amazon Web Services Management
--   Console. IAM principals that are allowed to perform actions on the
--   cluster can use the SetVisibleToAllUsers action to change the value on
--   a running cluster. For more information, see <a>Understanding the EMR
--   Cluster VisibleToAllUsers Setting</a> in the <i>Amazon EMRManagement
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:visibleToAllUsers:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether the cluster should terminate after completing all
--   steps.
[$sel:autoTerminate:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | Available only in Amazon EMR version 5.7.0 and later. The ID of a
--   custom Amazon EBS-backed Linux AMI if the cluster uses a custom AMI.
[$sel:customAmiId:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | An approximation of the cost of the cluster, represented in
--   m1.small/hours. This value is incremented one time for every hour an
--   m1.small instance runs. Larger instances are weighted more, so an EC2
--   instance that is roughly four times more expensive would result in the
--   normalized instance hours being incremented by four. This result is
--   only an approximation and does not reflect the actual billing rate.
[$sel:normalizedInstanceHours:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Int

-- | Placement group configured for an Amazon EMR cluster.
[$sel:placementGroups:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe [PlacementGroupConfig]

-- | The path to the Amazon S3 location where logs for this cluster are
--   stored.
[$sel:logUri:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Attributes for Kerberos configuration when Kerberos authentication is
--   enabled using a security configuration. For more information see
--   <a>Use Kerberos Authentication</a> in the <i>Amazon EMR Management
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:kerberosAttributes:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe KerberosAttributes

-- | Provides information about the EC2 instances in a cluster grouped by
--   category. For example, key name, subnet ID, IAM instance profile, and
--   so on.
[$sel:ec2InstanceAttributes:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Ec2InstanceAttributes

-- | The unique identifier for the cluster.
[$sel:id:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Text

-- | The name of the cluster.
[$sel:name:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Text

-- | The current status details about the cluster.
[$sel:status:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> ClusterStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>Cluster</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:repoUpgradeOnBoot:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_repoUpgradeOnBoot</a> - Applies only when
--   <tt>CustomAmiID</tt> is used. Specifies the type of updates that are
--   applied from the Amazon Linux AMI package repositories when an
--   instance boots using the AMI.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterArn:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_clusterArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name of the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceRole:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_serviceRole</a> - The IAM
--   role that Amazon EMR assumes in order to access Amazon Web Services
--   resources on your behalf.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScalingRole:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_autoScalingRole</a> -
--   An IAM role for automatic scaling policies. The default role is
--   <tt>EMR_AutoScaling_DefaultRole</tt>. The IAM role provides
--   permissions that the automatic scaling feature requires to launch and
--   terminate EC2 instances in an instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleDownBehavior:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_scaleDownBehavior</a> - The way that individual Amazon EC2
--   instances terminate when an automatic scale-in activity occurs or an
--   instance group is resized. <tt>TERMINATE_AT_INSTANCE_HOUR</tt>
--   indicates that Amazon EMR terminates nodes at the instance-hour
--   boundary, regardless of when the request to terminate the instance was
--   submitted. This option is only available with Amazon EMR 5.1.0 and
--   later and is the default for clusters created using that version.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> indicates that Amazon EMR adds
--   nodes to a deny list and drains tasks from nodes before terminating
--   the Amazon EC2 instances, regardless of the instance-hour boundary.
--   With either behavior, Amazon EMR removes the least active nodes first
--   and blocks instance termination if it could lead to HDFS corruption.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> is available only in Amazon EMR
--   version 4.1.0 and later, and is the default for versions of Amazon EMR
--   earlier than 5.1.0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityConfiguration:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_securityConfiguration</a> - The name of the security
--   configuration applied to the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:terminationProtected:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_terminationProtected</a> - Indicates whether Amazon EMR
--   will lock the cluster to prevent the EC2 instances from being
--   terminated by an API call or user intervention, or in the event of a
--   cluster error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterPublicDnsName:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_masterPublicDnsName</a> - The DNS name of the master node.
--   If the cluster is on a private subnet, this is the private DNS name.
--   On a public subnet, this is the public DNS name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurations:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_configurations</a> -
--   Applies only to Amazon EMR releases 4.x and later. The list of
--   Configurations supplied to the EMR cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outpostArn:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_outpostArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost where the cluster is
--   launched.
--   
--   <a>$sel:runningAmiVersion:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_runningAmiVersion</a> - The AMI version running on this
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsRootVolumeSize:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_ebsRootVolumeSize</a> - The size, in GiB, of the Amazon EBS
--   root device volume of the Linux AMI that is used for each EC2
--   instance. Available in Amazon EMR version 4.x and later.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestedAmiVersion:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_requestedAmiVersion</a> - The AMI version requested for
--   this cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:releaseLabel:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_releaseLabel</a> - The
--   Amazon EMR release label, which determines the version of open-source
--   application packages installed on the cluster. Release labels are in
--   the form <tt>emr-x.x.x</tt>, where x.x.x is an Amazon EMR release
--   version such as <tt>emr-5.14.0</tt>. For more information about Amazon
--   EMR release versions and included application versions and features,
--   see <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ReleaseGuide/</a>. The
--   release label applies only to Amazon EMR releases version 4.0 and
--   later. Earlier versions use <tt>AmiVersion</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceCollectionType:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_instanceCollectionType</a> - The instance fleet
--   configuration is available only in Amazon EMR versions 4.8.0 and
--   later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   The instance group configuration of the cluster. A value of
--   <tt>INSTANCE_GROUP</tt> indicates a uniform instance group
--   configuration. A value of <tt>INSTANCE_FLEET</tt> indicates an
--   instance fleets configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logEncryptionKmsKeyId:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_logEncryptionKmsKeyId</a> - The KMS key used for encrypting
--   log files. This attribute is only available with EMR version 5.30.0
--   and later, excluding EMR 6.0.0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_tags</a> - A list of tags
--   associated with a cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applications:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_applications</a> - The
--   applications installed on this cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stepConcurrencyLevel:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_stepConcurrencyLevel</a> - Specifies the number of steps
--   that can be executed concurrently.
--   
--   <a>$sel:visibleToAllUsers:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_visibleToAllUsers</a> - Indicates whether the cluster is
--   visible to IAM principals in the Amazon Web Services account
--   associated with the cluster. When <tt>true</tt>, IAM principals in the
--   Amazon Web Services account can perform EMR cluster actions on the
--   cluster that their IAM policies allow. When <tt>false</tt>, only the
--   IAM principal that created the cluster and the Amazon Web Services
--   account root user can perform EMR actions, regardless of IAM
--   permissions policies attached to other IAM principals.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>true</tt> if a value is not provided when
--   creating a cluster using the EMR API RunJobFlow command, the CLI
--   <a>create-cluster</a> command, or the Amazon Web Services Management
--   Console. IAM principals that are allowed to perform actions on the
--   cluster can use the SetVisibleToAllUsers action to change the value on
--   a running cluster. For more information, see <a>Understanding the EMR
--   Cluster VisibleToAllUsers Setting</a> in the <i>Amazon EMRManagement
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoTerminate:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_autoTerminate</a> -
--   Specifies whether the cluster should terminate after completing all
--   steps.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customAmiId:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_customAmiId</a> -
--   Available only in Amazon EMR version 5.7.0 and later. The ID of a
--   custom Amazon EBS-backed Linux AMI if the cluster uses a custom AMI.
--   
--   <a>$sel:normalizedInstanceHours:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_normalizedInstanceHours</a> - An approximation of the cost
--   of the cluster, represented in m1.small/hours. This value is
--   incremented one time for every hour an m1.small instance runs. Larger
--   instances are weighted more, so an EC2 instance that is roughly four
--   times more expensive would result in the normalized instance hours
--   being incremented by four. This result is only an approximation and
--   does not reflect the actual billing rate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:placementGroups:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_placementGroups</a> -
--   Placement group configured for an Amazon EMR cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logUri:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_logUri</a> - The path to the
--   Amazon S3 location where logs for this cluster are stored.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kerberosAttributes:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_kerberosAttributes</a> - Attributes for Kerberos
--   configuration when Kerberos authentication is enabled using a security
--   configuration. For more information see <a>Use Kerberos
--   Authentication</a> in the <i>Amazon EMR Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2InstanceAttributes:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_ec2InstanceAttributes</a> - Provides information about the
--   EC2 instances in a cluster grouped by category. For example, key name,
--   subnet ID, IAM instance profile, and so on.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_id</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_name</a> - The name of the
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_status</a> - The current
--   status details about the cluster.
newCluster :: Text -> Text -> ClusterStatus -> Cluster

-- | Applies only when <tt>CustomAmiID</tt> is used. Specifies the type of
--   updates that are applied from the Amazon Linux AMI package
--   repositories when an instance boots using the AMI.
cluster_repoUpgradeOnBoot :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe RepoUpgradeOnBoot)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name of the cluster.
cluster_clusterArn :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The IAM role that Amazon EMR assumes in order to access Amazon Web
--   Services resources on your behalf.
cluster_serviceRole :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | An IAM role for automatic scaling policies. The default role is
--   <tt>EMR_AutoScaling_DefaultRole</tt>. The IAM role provides
--   permissions that the automatic scaling feature requires to launch and
--   terminate EC2 instances in an instance group.
cluster_autoScalingRole :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The way that individual Amazon EC2 instances terminate when an
--   automatic scale-in activity occurs or an instance group is resized.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_INSTANCE_HOUR</tt> indicates that Amazon EMR
--   terminates nodes at the instance-hour boundary, regardless of when the
--   request to terminate the instance was submitted. This option is only
--   available with Amazon EMR 5.1.0 and later and is the default for
--   clusters created using that version.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> indicates that Amazon EMR adds
--   nodes to a deny list and drains tasks from nodes before terminating
--   the Amazon EC2 instances, regardless of the instance-hour boundary.
--   With either behavior, Amazon EMR removes the least active nodes first
--   and blocks instance termination if it could lead to HDFS corruption.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> is available only in Amazon EMR
--   version 4.1.0 and later, and is the default for versions of Amazon EMR
--   earlier than 5.1.0.
cluster_scaleDownBehavior :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe ScaleDownBehavior)

-- | The name of the security configuration applied to the cluster.
cluster_securityConfiguration :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether Amazon EMR will lock the cluster to prevent the EC2
--   instances from being terminated by an API call or user intervention,
--   or in the event of a cluster error.
cluster_terminationProtected :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Bool)

-- | The DNS name of the master node. If the cluster is on a private
--   subnet, this is the private DNS name. On a public subnet, this is the
--   public DNS name.
cluster_masterPublicDnsName :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Applies only to Amazon EMR releases 4.x and later. The list of
--   Configurations supplied to the EMR cluster.
cluster_configurations :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [Configuration])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost where the cluster is
--   launched.
cluster_outpostArn :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The AMI version running on this cluster.
cluster_runningAmiVersion :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The size, in GiB, of the Amazon EBS root device volume of the Linux
--   AMI that is used for each EC2 instance. Available in Amazon EMR
--   version 4.x and later.
cluster_ebsRootVolumeSize :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Int)

-- | The AMI version requested for this cluster.
cluster_requestedAmiVersion :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon EMR release label, which determines the version of
--   open-source application packages installed on the cluster. Release
--   labels are in the form <tt>emr-x.x.x</tt>, where x.x.x is an Amazon
--   EMR release version such as <tt>emr-5.14.0</tt>. For more information
--   about Amazon EMR release versions and included application versions
--   and features, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ReleaseGuide/</a>. The
--   release label applies only to Amazon EMR releases version 4.0 and
--   later. Earlier versions use <tt>AmiVersion</tt>.
cluster_releaseLabel :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   The instance group configuration of the cluster. A value of
--   <tt>INSTANCE_GROUP</tt> indicates a uniform instance group
--   configuration. A value of <tt>INSTANCE_FLEET</tt> indicates an
--   instance fleets configuration.
cluster_instanceCollectionType :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe InstanceCollectionType)

-- | The KMS key used for encrypting log files. This attribute is only
--   available with EMR version 5.30.0 and later, excluding EMR 6.0.0.
cluster_logEncryptionKmsKeyId :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags associated with a cluster.
cluster_tags :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The applications installed on this cluster.
cluster_applications :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [Application])

-- | Specifies the number of steps that can be executed concurrently.
cluster_stepConcurrencyLevel :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Int)

-- | Indicates whether the cluster is visible to IAM principals in the
--   Amazon Web Services account associated with the cluster. When
--   <tt>true</tt>, IAM principals in the Amazon Web Services account can
--   perform EMR cluster actions on the cluster that their IAM policies
--   allow. When <tt>false</tt>, only the IAM principal that created the
--   cluster and the Amazon Web Services account root user can perform EMR
--   actions, regardless of IAM permissions policies attached to other IAM
--   principals.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>true</tt> if a value is not provided when
--   creating a cluster using the EMR API RunJobFlow command, the CLI
--   <a>create-cluster</a> command, or the Amazon Web Services Management
--   Console. IAM principals that are allowed to perform actions on the
--   cluster can use the SetVisibleToAllUsers action to change the value on
--   a running cluster. For more information, see <a>Understanding the EMR
--   Cluster VisibleToAllUsers Setting</a> in the <i>Amazon EMRManagement
--   Guide</i>.
cluster_visibleToAllUsers :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether the cluster should terminate after completing all
--   steps.
cluster_autoTerminate :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Bool)

-- | Available only in Amazon EMR version 5.7.0 and later. The ID of a
--   custom Amazon EBS-backed Linux AMI if the cluster uses a custom AMI.
cluster_customAmiId :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | An approximation of the cost of the cluster, represented in
--   m1.small/hours. This value is incremented one time for every hour an
--   m1.small instance runs. Larger instances are weighted more, so an EC2
--   instance that is roughly four times more expensive would result in the
--   normalized instance hours being incremented by four. This result is
--   only an approximation and does not reflect the actual billing rate.
cluster_normalizedInstanceHours :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Int)

-- | Placement group configured for an Amazon EMR cluster.
cluster_placementGroups :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [PlacementGroupConfig])

-- | The path to the Amazon S3 location where logs for this cluster are
--   stored.
cluster_logUri :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Attributes for Kerberos configuration when Kerberos authentication is
--   enabled using a security configuration. For more information see
--   <a>Use Kerberos Authentication</a> in the <i>Amazon EMR Management
--   Guide</i>.
cluster_kerberosAttributes :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe KerberosAttributes)

-- | Provides information about the EC2 instances in a cluster grouped by
--   category. For example, key name, subnet ID, IAM instance profile, and
--   so on.
cluster_ec2InstanceAttributes :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Ec2InstanceAttributes)

-- | The unique identifier for the cluster.
cluster_id :: Lens' Cluster Text

-- | The name of the cluster.
cluster_name :: Lens' Cluster Text

-- | The current status details about the cluster.
cluster_status :: Lens' Cluster ClusterStatus

-- | The reason that the cluster changed to its current state.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClusterStateChangeReason</a> smart constructor.
data ClusterStateChangeReason
ClusterStateChangeReason' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ClusterStateChangeReasonCode -> ClusterStateChangeReason

-- | The descriptive message for the state change reason.
[$sel:message:ClusterStateChangeReason'] :: ClusterStateChangeReason -> Maybe Text

-- | The programmatic code for the state change reason.
[$sel:code:ClusterStateChangeReason'] :: ClusterStateChangeReason -> Maybe ClusterStateChangeReasonCode

-- | Create a value of <a>ClusterStateChangeReason</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:ClusterStateChangeReason'</a>,
--   <a>clusterStateChangeReason_message</a> - The descriptive message for
--   the state change reason.
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:ClusterStateChangeReason'</a>,
--   <a>clusterStateChangeReason_code</a> - The programmatic code for the
--   state change reason.
newClusterStateChangeReason :: ClusterStateChangeReason

-- | The descriptive message for the state change reason.
clusterStateChangeReason_message :: Lens' ClusterStateChangeReason (Maybe Text)

-- | The programmatic code for the state change reason.
clusterStateChangeReason_code :: Lens' ClusterStateChangeReason (Maybe ClusterStateChangeReasonCode)

-- | The detailed status of the cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClusterStatus</a> smart constructor.
data ClusterStatus
ClusterStatus' :: Maybe ClusterStateChangeReason -> Maybe ClusterState -> Maybe ClusterTimeline -> ClusterStatus

-- | The reason for the cluster status change.
[$sel:stateChangeReason:ClusterStatus'] :: ClusterStatus -> Maybe ClusterStateChangeReason

-- | The current state of the cluster.
[$sel:state:ClusterStatus'] :: ClusterStatus -> Maybe ClusterState

-- | A timeline that represents the status of a cluster over the lifetime
--   of the cluster.
[$sel:timeline:ClusterStatus'] :: ClusterStatus -> Maybe ClusterTimeline

-- | Create a value of <a>ClusterStatus</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateChangeReason:ClusterStatus'</a>,
--   <a>clusterStatus_stateChangeReason</a> - The reason for the cluster
--   status change.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:ClusterStatus'</a>, <a>clusterStatus_state</a> - The
--   current state of the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeline:ClusterStatus'</a>, <a>clusterStatus_timeline</a> - A
--   timeline that represents the status of a cluster over the lifetime of
--   the cluster.
newClusterStatus :: ClusterStatus

-- | The reason for the cluster status change.
clusterStatus_stateChangeReason :: Lens' ClusterStatus (Maybe ClusterStateChangeReason)

-- | The current state of the cluster.
clusterStatus_state :: Lens' ClusterStatus (Maybe ClusterState)

-- | A timeline that represents the status of a cluster over the lifetime
--   of the cluster.
clusterStatus_timeline :: Lens' ClusterStatus (Maybe ClusterTimeline)

-- | The summary description of the cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClusterSummary</a> smart constructor.
data ClusterSummary
ClusterSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ClusterStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> ClusterSummary

-- | The Amazon Resource Name of the cluster.
[$sel:clusterArn:ClusterSummary'] :: ClusterSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The details about the current status of the cluster.
[$sel:status:ClusterSummary'] :: ClusterSummary -> Maybe ClusterStatus

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost where the cluster is
--   launched.
[$sel:outpostArn:ClusterSummary'] :: ClusterSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the cluster.
[$sel:id:ClusterSummary'] :: ClusterSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the cluster.
[$sel:name:ClusterSummary'] :: ClusterSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | An approximation of the cost of the cluster, represented in
--   m1.small/hours. This value is incremented one time for every hour an
--   m1.small instance runs. Larger instances are weighted more, so an EC2
--   instance that is roughly four times more expensive would result in the
--   normalized instance hours being incremented by four. This result is
--   only an approximation and does not reflect the actual billing rate.
[$sel:normalizedInstanceHours:ClusterSummary'] :: ClusterSummary -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ClusterSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterArn:ClusterSummary'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSummary_clusterArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name of the
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ClusterSummary'</a>, <a>clusterSummary_status</a> - The
--   details about the current status of the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outpostArn:ClusterSummary'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSummary_outpostArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the Outpost where the cluster is launched.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ClusterSummary'</a>, <a>clusterSummary_id</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ClusterSummary'</a>, <a>clusterSummary_name</a> - The
--   name of the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:normalizedInstanceHours:ClusterSummary'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSummary_normalizedInstanceHours</a> - An approximation of
--   the cost of the cluster, represented in m1.small/hours. This value is
--   incremented one time for every hour an m1.small instance runs. Larger
--   instances are weighted more, so an EC2 instance that is roughly four
--   times more expensive would result in the normalized instance hours
--   being incremented by four. This result is only an approximation and
--   does not reflect the actual billing rate.
newClusterSummary :: ClusterSummary

-- | The Amazon Resource Name of the cluster.
clusterSummary_clusterArn :: Lens' ClusterSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The details about the current status of the cluster.
clusterSummary_status :: Lens' ClusterSummary (Maybe ClusterStatus)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost where the cluster is
--   launched.
clusterSummary_outpostArn :: Lens' ClusterSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the cluster.
clusterSummary_id :: Lens' ClusterSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the cluster.
clusterSummary_name :: Lens' ClusterSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | An approximation of the cost of the cluster, represented in
--   m1.small/hours. This value is incremented one time for every hour an
--   m1.small instance runs. Larger instances are weighted more, so an EC2
--   instance that is roughly four times more expensive would result in the
--   normalized instance hours being incremented by four. This result is
--   only an approximation and does not reflect the actual billing rate.
clusterSummary_normalizedInstanceHours :: Lens' ClusterSummary (Maybe Int)

-- | Represents the timeline of the cluster's lifecycle.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClusterTimeline</a> smart constructor.
data ClusterTimeline
ClusterTimeline' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> ClusterTimeline

-- | The date and time when the cluster was terminated.
[$sel:endDateTime:ClusterTimeline'] :: ClusterTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The creation date and time of the cluster.
[$sel:creationDateTime:ClusterTimeline'] :: ClusterTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time when the cluster was ready to run steps.
[$sel:readyDateTime:ClusterTimeline'] :: ClusterTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>ClusterTimeline</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endDateTime:ClusterTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>clusterTimeline_endDateTime</a> - The date and time when the
--   cluster was terminated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDateTime:ClusterTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>clusterTimeline_creationDateTime</a> - The creation date and time
--   of the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readyDateTime:ClusterTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>clusterTimeline_readyDateTime</a> - The date and time when the
--   cluster was ready to run steps.
newClusterTimeline :: ClusterTimeline

clusterTimeline_endDateTime :: Lens' ClusterTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The creation date and time of the cluster.
clusterTimeline_creationDateTime :: Lens' ClusterTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time when the cluster was ready to run steps.
clusterTimeline_readyDateTime :: Lens' ClusterTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An entity describing an executable that runs on a cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCommand</a> smart constructor.
data Command
Command' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Command

-- | Arguments for Amazon EMR to pass to the command for execution.
[$sel:args:Command'] :: Command -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The Amazon S3 location of the command script.
[$sel:scriptPath:Command'] :: Command -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the command.
[$sel:name:Command'] :: Command -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Command</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:args:Command'</a>, <a>command_args</a> - Arguments for Amazon
--   EMR to pass to the command for execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scriptPath:Command'</a>, <a>command_scriptPath</a> - The
--   Amazon S3 location of the command script.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Command'</a>, <a>command_name</a> - The name of the
--   command.
newCommand :: Command

-- | Arguments for Amazon EMR to pass to the command for execution.
command_args :: Lens' Command (Maybe [Text])

-- | The Amazon S3 location of the command script.
command_scriptPath :: Lens' Command (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the command.
command_name :: Lens' Command (Maybe Text)

-- | The EC2 unit limits for a managed scaling policy. The managed scaling
--   activity of a cluster can not be above or below these limits. The
--   limit only applies to the core and task nodes. The master node cannot
--   be scaled after initial configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newComputeLimits</a> smart constructor.
data ComputeLimits
ComputeLimits' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> ComputeLimitsUnitType -> Int -> Int -> ComputeLimits

-- | The upper boundary of On-Demand EC2 units. It is measured through vCPU
--   cores or instances for instance groups and measured through units for
--   instance fleets. The On-Demand units are not allowed to scale beyond
--   this boundary. The parameter is used to split capacity allocation
--   between On-Demand and Spot Instances.
[$sel:maximumOnDemandCapacityUnits:ComputeLimits'] :: ComputeLimits -> Maybe Int

-- | The upper boundary of EC2 units for core node type in a cluster. It is
--   measured through vCPU cores or instances for instance groups and
--   measured through units for instance fleets. The core units are not
--   allowed to scale beyond this boundary. The parameter is used to split
--   capacity allocation between core and task nodes.
[$sel:maximumCoreCapacityUnits:ComputeLimits'] :: ComputeLimits -> Maybe Int

-- | The unit type used for specifying a managed scaling policy.
[$sel:unitType:ComputeLimits'] :: ComputeLimits -> ComputeLimitsUnitType

-- | The lower boundary of EC2 units. It is measured through vCPU cores or
--   instances for instance groups and measured through units for instance
--   fleets. Managed scaling activities are not allowed beyond this
--   boundary. The limit only applies to the core and task nodes. The
--   master node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.
[$sel:minimumCapacityUnits:ComputeLimits'] :: ComputeLimits -> Int

-- | The upper boundary of EC2 units. It is measured through vCPU cores or
--   instances for instance groups and measured through units for instance
--   fleets. Managed scaling activities are not allowed beyond this
--   boundary. The limit only applies to the core and task nodes. The
--   master node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.
[$sel:maximumCapacityUnits:ComputeLimits'] :: ComputeLimits -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ComputeLimits</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumOnDemandCapacityUnits:ComputeLimits'</a>,
--   <a>computeLimits_maximumOnDemandCapacityUnits</a> - The upper boundary
--   of On-Demand EC2 units. It is measured through vCPU cores or instances
--   for instance groups and measured through units for instance fleets.
--   The On-Demand units are not allowed to scale beyond this boundary. The
--   parameter is used to split capacity allocation between On-Demand and
--   Spot Instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumCoreCapacityUnits:ComputeLimits'</a>,
--   <a>computeLimits_maximumCoreCapacityUnits</a> - The upper boundary of
--   EC2 units for core node type in a cluster. It is measured through vCPU
--   cores or instances for instance groups and measured through units for
--   instance fleets. The core units are not allowed to scale beyond this
--   boundary. The parameter is used to split capacity allocation between
--   core and task nodes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unitType:ComputeLimits'</a>, <a>computeLimits_unitType</a> -
--   The unit type used for specifying a managed scaling policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minimumCapacityUnits:ComputeLimits'</a>,
--   <a>computeLimits_minimumCapacityUnits</a> - The lower boundary of EC2
--   units. It is measured through vCPU cores or instances for instance
--   groups and measured through units for instance fleets. Managed scaling
--   activities are not allowed beyond this boundary. The limit only
--   applies to the core and task nodes. The master node cannot be scaled
--   after initial configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumCapacityUnits:ComputeLimits'</a>,
--   <a>computeLimits_maximumCapacityUnits</a> - The upper boundary of EC2
--   units. It is measured through vCPU cores or instances for instance
--   groups and measured through units for instance fleets. Managed scaling
--   activities are not allowed beyond this boundary. The limit only
--   applies to the core and task nodes. The master node cannot be scaled
--   after initial configuration.
newComputeLimits :: ComputeLimitsUnitType -> Int -> Int -> ComputeLimits

-- | The upper boundary of On-Demand EC2 units. It is measured through vCPU
--   cores or instances for instance groups and measured through units for
--   instance fleets. The On-Demand units are not allowed to scale beyond
--   this boundary. The parameter is used to split capacity allocation
--   between On-Demand and Spot Instances.
computeLimits_maximumOnDemandCapacityUnits :: Lens' ComputeLimits (Maybe Int)

-- | The upper boundary of EC2 units for core node type in a cluster. It is
--   measured through vCPU cores or instances for instance groups and
--   measured through units for instance fleets. The core units are not
--   allowed to scale beyond this boundary. The parameter is used to split
--   capacity allocation between core and task nodes.
computeLimits_maximumCoreCapacityUnits :: Lens' ComputeLimits (Maybe Int)

-- | The unit type used for specifying a managed scaling policy.
computeLimits_unitType :: Lens' ComputeLimits ComputeLimitsUnitType

-- | The lower boundary of EC2 units. It is measured through vCPU cores or
--   instances for instance groups and measured through units for instance
--   fleets. Managed scaling activities are not allowed beyond this
--   boundary. The limit only applies to the core and task nodes. The
--   master node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.
computeLimits_minimumCapacityUnits :: Lens' ComputeLimits Int

-- | The upper boundary of EC2 units. It is measured through vCPU cores or
--   instances for instance groups and measured through units for instance
--   fleets. Managed scaling activities are not allowed beyond this
--   boundary. The limit only applies to the core and task nodes. The
--   master node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.
computeLimits_maximumCapacityUnits :: Lens' ComputeLimits Int

-- | Amazon EMR releases 4.x or later.
--   
--   An optional configuration specification to be used when provisioning
--   cluster instances, which can include configurations for applications
--   and software bundled with Amazon EMR. A configuration consists of a
--   classification, properties, and optional nested configurations. A
--   classification refers to an application-specific configuration file.
--   Properties are the settings you want to change in that file. For more
--   information, see <a>Configuring Applications</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data Configuration
Configuration' :: Maybe [Configuration] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Configuration

-- | A list of additional configurations to apply within a configuration
--   object.
[$sel:configurations:Configuration'] :: Configuration -> Maybe [Configuration]

-- | A set of properties specified within a configuration classification.
[$sel:properties:Configuration'] :: Configuration -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The classification within a configuration.
[$sel:classification:Configuration'] :: Configuration -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Configuration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurations:Configuration'</a>,
--   <a>configuration_configurations</a> - A list of additional
--   configurations to apply within a configuration object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:properties:Configuration'</a>, <a>configuration_properties</a>
--   - A set of properties specified within a configuration classification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:classification:Configuration'</a>,
--   <a>configuration_classification</a> - The classification within a
--   configuration.
newConfiguration :: Configuration

-- | A list of additional configurations to apply within a configuration
--   object.
configuration_configurations :: Lens' Configuration (Maybe [Configuration])

-- | A set of properties specified within a configuration classification.
configuration_properties :: Lens' Configuration (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The classification within a configuration.
configuration_classification :: Lens' Configuration (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information about the EC2 instances in a cluster grouped by
--   category. For example, key name, subnet ID, IAM instance profile, and
--   so on.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEc2InstanceAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data Ec2InstanceAttributes
Ec2InstanceAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Ec2InstanceAttributes

-- | The name of the Amazon EC2 key pair to use when connecting with SSH
--   into the master node as a user named "hadoop".
[$sel:ec2KeyName:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the core and
--   task nodes.
[$sel:additionalSlaveSecurityGroups:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The Availability Zone in which the cluster will run.
[$sel:ec2AvailabilityZone:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the core and task
--   nodes.
[$sel:emrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Applies to clusters configured with the instance fleets option.
--   Specifies one or more Availability Zones in which to launch EC2
--   cluster instances when the EC2-Classic network configuration is
--   supported. Amazon EMR chooses the Availability Zone with the best fit
--   from among the list of <tt>RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones</tt>, and
--   then launches all cluster instances within that Availability Zone. If
--   you do not specify this value, Amazon EMR chooses the Availability
--   Zone for you. <tt>RequestedEc2SubnetIDs</tt> and
--   <tt>RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones</tt> cannot be specified together.
[$sel:requestedEc2AvailabilityZones:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Set this parameter to the identifier of the Amazon VPC subnet where
--   you want the cluster to launch. If you do not specify this value, and
--   your account supports EC2-Classic, the cluster launches in
--   EC2-Classic.
[$sel:ec2SubnetId:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the master node.
[$sel:emrManagedMasterSecurityGroup:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The IAM role that was specified when the cluster was launched. The EC2
--   instances of the cluster assume this role.
[$sel:iamInstanceProfile:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the master
--   node.
[$sel:additionalMasterSecurityGroups:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Applies to clusters configured with the instance fleets option.
--   Specifies the unique identifier of one or more Amazon EC2 subnets in
--   which to launch EC2 cluster instances. Subnets must exist within the
--   same VPC. Amazon EMR chooses the EC2 subnet with the best fit from
--   among the list of <tt>RequestedEc2SubnetIds</tt>, and then launches
--   all cluster instances within that Subnet. If this value is not
--   specified, and the account and Region support EC2-Classic networks,
--   the cluster launches instances in the EC2-Classic network and uses
--   <tt>RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones</tt> instead of this setting. If
--   EC2-Classic is not supported, and no Subnet is specified, Amazon EMR
--   chooses the subnet for you. <tt>RequestedEc2SubnetIDs</tt> and
--   <tt>RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones</tt> cannot be specified together.
[$sel:requestedEc2SubnetIds:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the Amazon EMR
--   service to access clusters in VPC private subnets.
[$sel:serviceAccessSecurityGroup:Ec2InstanceAttributes'] :: Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Ec2InstanceAttributes</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2KeyName:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,

--   key pair to use when connecting with SSH into the master node as a
--   user named "hadoop".

--   
--   <a>$sel:emrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,

--   identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the core and task
--   nodes.
--

--   instances in the EC2-Classic network and uses
--   <tt>RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones</tt> instead of this setting. If

--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_serviceAccessSecurityGroup</a> - The
--   identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the Amazon EMR service
--   to access clusters in VPC private subnets.
newEc2InstanceAttributes :: Ec2InstanceAttributes

ec2InstanceAttributes_iamInstanceProfile :: Lens' Ec2InstanceAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the execution engine (cluster) to run the notebook and
--   perform the notebook execution, for example, an EMR cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExecutionEngineConfig</a> smart constructor.
data ExecutionEngineConfig
ExecutionEngineConfig' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ExecutionEngineType -> Text -> ExecutionEngineConfig

-- | An optional unique ID of an EC2 security group to associate with the
--   master instance of the EMR cluster for this notebook execution. For
--   more information see <a>Specifying EC2 Security Groups for EMR
--   Notebooks</a> in the <i>EMR Management Guide</i>.
[$sel:masterInstanceSecurityGroupId:ExecutionEngineConfig'] :: ExecutionEngineConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of execution engine. A value of <tt>EMR</tt> specifies an EMR
--   cluster.
[$sel:type':ExecutionEngineConfig'] :: ExecutionEngineConfig -> Maybe ExecutionEngineType

-- | The unique identifier of the execution engine. For an EMR cluster,
--   this is the cluster ID.
[$sel:id:ExecutionEngineConfig'] :: ExecutionEngineConfig -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ExecutionEngineConfig</a> with all optional

--   master instance of the EMR cluster for this notebook execution. For
--   more information see <a>Specifying EC2 Security Groups for EMR
--   Notebooks</a> in the <i>EMR Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ExecutionEngineConfig'</a>,
--   <a>executionEngineConfig_type</a> - The type of execution engine. A
--   value of <tt>EMR</tt> specifies an EMR cluster.
--

--   - The unique identifier of the execution engine. For an EMR cluster,
--   this is the cluster ID.
newExecutionEngineConfig :: Text -> ExecutionEngineConfig
