-- | The details of the step failure. The service attempts to detect the
--   root cause for many common failures.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFailureDetails</a> smart constructor.
data FailureDetails
FailureDetails' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> FailureDetails

-- | The descriptive message including the error the Amazon EMR service has
--   identified as the cause of step failure. This is text from an error
--   log that describes the root cause of the failure.
[$sel:message:FailureDetails'] :: FailureDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The reason for the step failure. In the case where the service cannot
--   successfully determine the root cause of the failure, it returns
--   "Unknown Error" as a reason.
[$sel:reason:FailureDetails'] :: FailureDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The path to the log file where the step failure root cause was
--   originally recorded.
[$sel:logFile:FailureDetails'] :: FailureDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>FailureDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:FailureDetails'</a>, <a>failureDetails_message</a> -
--   The descriptive message including the error the Amazon EMR service has
--   identified as the cause of step failure. This is text from an error
--   log that describes the root cause of the failure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reason:FailureDetails'</a>, <a>failureDetails_reason</a> - The
--   reason for the step failure. In the case where the service cannot
--   successfully determine the root cause of the failure, it returns
--   "Unknown Error" as a reason.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logFile:FailureDetails'</a>, <a>failureDetails_logFile</a> -
--   The path to the log file where the step failure root cause was
--   originally recorded.
newFailureDetails :: FailureDetails

-- | The descriptive message including the error the Amazon EMR service has
--   identified as the cause of step failure. This is text from an error
--   log that describes the root cause of the failure.
failureDetails_message :: Lens' FailureDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The reason for the step failure. In the case where the service cannot
--   successfully determine the root cause of the failure, it returns
--   "Unknown Error" as a reason.
failureDetails_reason :: Lens' FailureDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The path to the log file where the step failure root cause was
--   originally recorded.
failureDetails_logFile :: Lens' FailureDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | A job flow step consisting of a JAR file whose main function will be
--   executed. The main function submits a job for Hadoop to execute and
--   waits for the job to finish or fail.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHadoopJarStepConfig</a> smart constructor.
data HadoopJarStepConfig
HadoopJarStepConfig' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [KeyValue] -> Maybe Text -> Text -> HadoopJarStepConfig

-- | A list of command line arguments passed to the JAR file's main
--   function when executed.
[$sel:args:HadoopJarStepConfig'] :: HadoopJarStepConfig -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of Java properties that are set when the step runs. You can use
--   these properties to pass key-value pairs to your main function.
[$sel:properties:HadoopJarStepConfig'] :: HadoopJarStepConfig -> Maybe [KeyValue]

-- | The name of the main class in the specified Java file. If not
--   specified, the JAR file should specify a Main-Class in its manifest
--   file.
[$sel:mainClass:HadoopJarStepConfig'] :: HadoopJarStepConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | A path to a JAR file run during the step.
[$sel:jar:HadoopJarStepConfig'] :: HadoopJarStepConfig -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>HadoopJarStepConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:args:HadoopJarStepConfig'</a>, <a>hadoopJarStepConfig_args</a>
--   - A list of command line arguments passed to the JAR file's main
--   function when executed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:properties:HadoopJarStepConfig'</a>,
--   <a>hadoopJarStepConfig_properties</a> - A list of Java properties that
--   are set when the step runs. You can use these properties to pass
--   key-value pairs to your main function.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mainClass:HadoopJarStepConfig'</a>,
--   <a>hadoopJarStepConfig_mainClass</a> - The name of the main class in
--   the specified Java file. If not specified, the JAR file should specify
--   a Main-Class in its manifest file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jar:HadoopJarStepConfig'</a>, <a>hadoopJarStepConfig_jar</a> -
--   A path to a JAR file run during the step.
newHadoopJarStepConfig :: Text -> HadoopJarStepConfig

-- | A list of command line arguments passed to the JAR file's main
--   function when executed.
hadoopJarStepConfig_args :: Lens' HadoopJarStepConfig (Maybe [Text])

-- | A list of Java properties that are set when the step runs. You can use
--   these properties to pass key-value pairs to your main function.
hadoopJarStepConfig_properties :: Lens' HadoopJarStepConfig (Maybe [KeyValue])

-- | The name of the main class in the specified Java file. If not
--   specified, the JAR file should specify a Main-Class in its manifest
--   file.
hadoopJarStepConfig_mainClass :: Lens' HadoopJarStepConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | A path to a JAR file run during the step.
hadoopJarStepConfig_jar :: Lens' HadoopJarStepConfig Text

-- | A cluster step consisting of a JAR file whose main function will be
--   executed. The main function submits a job for Hadoop to execute and
--   waits for the job to finish or fail.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHadoopStepConfig</a> smart constructor.
data HadoopStepConfig
HadoopStepConfig' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> HadoopStepConfig

-- | The list of command line arguments to pass to the JAR file's main
--   function for execution.
[$sel:args:HadoopStepConfig'] :: HadoopStepConfig -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The list of Java properties that are set when the step runs. You can
--   use these properties to pass key-value pairs to your main function.
[$sel:properties:HadoopStepConfig'] :: HadoopStepConfig -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The path to the JAR file that runs during the step.
[$sel:jar:HadoopStepConfig'] :: HadoopStepConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the main class in the specified Java file. If not
--   specified, the JAR file should specify a main class in its manifest
--   file.
[$sel:mainClass:HadoopStepConfig'] :: HadoopStepConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>HadoopStepConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:args:HadoopStepConfig'</a>, <a>hadoopStepConfig_args</a> - The
--   list of command line arguments to pass to the JAR file's main function
--   for execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:properties:HadoopStepConfig'</a>,
--   <a>hadoopStepConfig_properties</a> - The list of Java properties that
--   are set when the step runs. You can use these properties to pass
--   key-value pairs to your main function.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jar:HadoopStepConfig'</a>, <a>hadoopStepConfig_jar</a> - The
--   path to the JAR file that runs during the step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mainClass:HadoopStepConfig'</a>,
--   <a>hadoopStepConfig_mainClass</a> - The name of the main class in the
--   specified Java file. If not specified, the JAR file should specify a
--   main class in its manifest file.
newHadoopStepConfig :: HadoopStepConfig

-- | The list of command line arguments to pass to the JAR file's main
--   function for execution.
hadoopStepConfig_args :: Lens' HadoopStepConfig (Maybe [Text])

-- | The list of Java properties that are set when the step runs. You can
--   use these properties to pass key-value pairs to your main function.
hadoopStepConfig_properties :: Lens' HadoopStepConfig (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The path to the JAR file that runs during the step.
hadoopStepConfig_jar :: Lens' HadoopStepConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the main class in the specified Java file. If not
--   specified, the JAR file should specify a main class in its manifest
--   file.
hadoopStepConfig_mainClass :: Lens' HadoopStepConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | Represents an EC2 instance provisioned as part of cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstance</a> smart constructor.
data Instance
Instance' :: Maybe [EbsVolume] -> Maybe InstanceStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MarketType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Instance

-- | The list of Amazon EBS volumes that are attached to this instance.
[$sel:ebsVolumes:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe [EbsVolume]

-- | The current status of the instance.
[$sel:status:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe InstanceStatus

-- | The EC2 instance type, for example <tt>m3.xlarge</tt>.
[$sel:instanceType:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the instance group to which this instance belongs.
[$sel:instanceGroupId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the instance in Amazon EMR.
[$sel:id:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier of the instance fleet to which an EC2 instance
--   belongs.
[$sel:instanceFleetId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The public DNS name of the instance.
[$sel:publicDnsName:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance purchasing option. Valid values are <tt>ON_DEMAND</tt> or
--   <tt>SPOT</tt>.
[$sel:market:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe MarketType

-- | The public IP address of the instance.
[$sel:publicIpAddress:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The private DNS name of the instance.
[$sel:privateDnsName:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier of the instance in Amazon EC2.
[$sel:ec2InstanceId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The private IP address of the instance.
[$sel:privateIpAddress:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Instance</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsVolumes:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_ebsVolumes</a> - The
--   list of Amazon EBS volumes that are attached to this instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_status</a> - The current
--   status of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_instanceType</a> - The
--   EC2 instance type, for example <tt>m3.xlarge</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceGroupId:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_instanceGroupId</a>
--   - The identifier of the instance group to which this instance belongs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_id</a> - The unique identifier
--   for the instance in Amazon EMR.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceFleetId:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_instanceFleetId</a>
--   - The unique identifier of the instance fleet to which an EC2 instance
--   belongs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicDnsName:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_publicDnsName</a> -
--   The public DNS name of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:market:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_market</a> - The instance
--   purchasing option. Valid values are <tt>ON_DEMAND</tt> or
--   <tt>SPOT</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicIpAddress:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_publicIpAddress</a>
--   - The public IP address of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:privateDnsName:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_privateDnsName</a> -
--   The private DNS name of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2InstanceId:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_ec2InstanceId</a> -
--   The unique identifier of the instance in Amazon EC2.
--   
--   <a>$sel:privateIpAddress:Instance'</a>,
--   <a>instance_privateIpAddress</a> - The private IP address of the
--   instance.
newInstance :: Instance

-- | The list of Amazon EBS volumes that are attached to this instance.
instance_ebsVolumes :: Lens' Instance (Maybe [EbsVolume])

-- | The current status of the instance.
instance_status :: Lens' Instance (Maybe InstanceStatus)

-- | The EC2 instance type, for example <tt>m3.xlarge</tt>.
instance_instanceType :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the instance group to which this instance belongs.
instance_instanceGroupId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the instance in Amazon EMR.
instance_id :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier of the instance fleet to which an EC2 instance
--   belongs.
instance_instanceFleetId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The public DNS name of the instance.
instance_publicDnsName :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance purchasing option. Valid values are <tt>ON_DEMAND</tt> or
--   <tt>SPOT</tt>.
instance_market :: Lens' Instance (Maybe MarketType)

-- | The public IP address of the instance.
instance_publicIpAddress :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The private DNS name of the instance.
instance_privateDnsName :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier of the instance in Amazon EC2.
instance_ec2InstanceId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The private IP address of the instance.
instance_privateIpAddress :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes an instance fleet, which is a group of EC2 instances that
--   host a particular node type (master, core, or task) in an Amazon EMR
--   cluster. Instance fleets can consist of a mix of instance types and
--   On-Demand and Spot Instances, which are provisioned to meet a defined
--   target capacity.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceFleet</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceFleet
InstanceFleet' :: Maybe InstanceFleetType -> Maybe InstanceFleetStatus -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InstanceTypeSpecification] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications -> InstanceFleet

-- | The node type that the instance fleet hosts. Valid values are MASTER,
--   CORE, or TASK.
[$sel:instanceFleetType:InstanceFleet'] :: InstanceFleet -> Maybe InstanceFleetType

-- | The current status of the instance fleet.
[$sel:status:InstanceFleet'] :: InstanceFleet -> Maybe InstanceFleetStatus

-- | The target capacity of On-Demand units for the instance fleet, which
--   determines how many On-Demand Instances to provision. When the
--   instance fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision On-Demand
--   Instances as specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance
--   configuration has a specified <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>. When an
--   On-Demand Instance is provisioned, the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> units
--   count toward the target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances
--   until the target capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results
--   in an overage. For example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill
--   capacity, and Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a
--   <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and
--   the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units. You can use
--   InstanceFleet$ProvisionedOnDemandCapacity to determine the Spot
--   capacity units that have been provisioned for the instance fleet.
--   
--   If not specified or set to 0, only Spot Instances are provisioned for
--   the instance fleet using <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>. At least one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should
--   be greater than 0. For a master instance fleet, only one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be
--   specified, and its value must be 1.
[$sel:targetOnDemandCapacity:InstanceFleet'] :: InstanceFleet -> Maybe Natural

-- | The target capacity of Spot units for the instance fleet, which
--   determines how many Spot Instances to provision. When the instance
--   fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision Spot Instances as
--   specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance configuration has a
--   specified <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>. When a Spot instance is
--   provisioned, the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> units count toward the
--   target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances until the target
--   capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results in an overage. For
--   example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill capacity, and
--   Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a
--   <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and
--   the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units. You can use
--   InstanceFleet$ProvisionedSpotCapacity to determine the Spot capacity
--   units that have been provisioned for the instance fleet.
--   
--   If not specified or set to 0, only On-Demand Instances are provisioned
--   for the instance fleet. At least one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>
--   and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should be greater than 0. For a
--   master instance fleet, only one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and
--   <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be specified, and its value must
--   be 1.
[$sel:targetSpotCapacity:InstanceFleet'] :: InstanceFleet -> Maybe Natural

-- | The unique identifier of the instance fleet.
[$sel:id:InstanceFleet'] :: InstanceFleet -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of On-Demand units that have been provisioned for the
--   instance fleet to fulfill <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt>. This
--   provisioned capacity might be less than or greater than
--   <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt>.
[$sel:provisionedOnDemandCapacity:InstanceFleet'] :: InstanceFleet -> Maybe Natural

-- | A friendly name for the instance fleet.
[$sel:name:InstanceFleet'] :: InstanceFleet -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of specifications for the instance types that comprise an
--   instance fleet.
[$sel:instanceTypeSpecifications:InstanceFleet'] :: InstanceFleet -> Maybe [InstanceTypeSpecification]

-- | The number of Spot units that have been provisioned for this instance
--   fleet to fulfill <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>. This provisioned
--   capacity might be less than or greater than
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>.
[$sel:provisionedSpotCapacity:InstanceFleet'] :: InstanceFleet -> Maybe Natural

-- | Describes the launch specification for an instance fleet.
[$sel:launchSpecifications:InstanceFleet'] :: InstanceFleet -> Maybe InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceFleet</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceFleetType:InstanceFleet'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleet_instanceFleetType</a> - The node type that the
--   instance fleet hosts. Valid values are MASTER, CORE, or TASK.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:InstanceFleet'</a>, <a>instanceFleet_status</a> - The
--   current status of the instance fleet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetOnDemandCapacity:InstanceFleet'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleet_targetOnDemandCapacity</a> - The target capacity of
--   On-Demand units for the instance fleet, which determines how many
--   On-Demand Instances to provision. When the instance fleet launches,
--   Amazon EMR tries to provision On-Demand Instances as specified by
--   InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance configuration has a specified
--   <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>. When an On-Demand Instance is provisioned,
--   the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> units count toward the target capacity.
--   Amazon EMR provisions instances until the target capacity is totally
--   fulfilled, even if this results in an overage. For example, if there
--   are 2 units remaining to fulfill capacity, and Amazon EMR can only
--   provision an instance with a <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> of 5 units, the
--   instance is provisioned, and the target capacity is exceeded by 3
--   units. You can use InstanceFleet$ProvisionedOnDemandCapacity to
--   determine the Spot capacity units that have been provisioned for the
--   instance fleet.
--   
--   If not specified or set to 0, only Spot Instances are provisioned for
--   the instance fleet using <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>. At least one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should
--   be greater than 0. For a master instance fleet, only one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be
--   specified, and its value must be 1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetSpotCapacity:InstanceFleet'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleet_targetSpotCapacity</a> - The target capacity of Spot
--   units for the instance fleet, which determines how many Spot Instances
--   to provision. When the instance fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to
--   provision Spot Instances as specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each
--   instance configuration has a specified <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>. When
--   a Spot instance is provisioned, the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> units
--   count toward the target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances
--   until the target capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results
--   in an overage. For example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill
--   capacity, and Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a
--   <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and
--   the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units. You can use
--   InstanceFleet$ProvisionedSpotCapacity to determine the Spot capacity
--   units that have been provisioned for the instance fleet.
--   
--   If not specified or set to 0, only On-Demand Instances are provisioned
--   for the instance fleet. At least one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>
--   and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should be greater than 0. For a
--   master instance fleet, only one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and
--   <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be specified, and its value must
--   be 1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:InstanceFleet'</a>, <a>instanceFleet_id</a> - The unique
--   identifier of the instance fleet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedOnDemandCapacity:InstanceFleet'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleet_provisionedOnDemandCapacity</a> - The number of
--   On-Demand units that have been provisioned for the instance fleet to
--   fulfill <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt>. This provisioned capacity
--   might be less than or greater than <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:InstanceFleet'</a>, <a>instanceFleet_name</a> - A
--   friendly name for the instance fleet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceTypeSpecifications:InstanceFleet'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleet_instanceTypeSpecifications</a> - An array of
--   specifications for the instance types that comprise an instance fleet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedSpotCapacity:InstanceFleet'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleet_provisionedSpotCapacity</a> - The number of Spot
--   units that have been provisioned for this instance fleet to fulfill
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>. This provisioned capacity might be less
--   than or greater than <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:launchSpecifications:InstanceFleet'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleet_launchSpecifications</a> - Describes the launch
--   specification for an instance fleet.
newInstanceFleet :: InstanceFleet

-- | The node type that the instance fleet hosts. Valid values are MASTER,
--   CORE, or TASK.
instanceFleet_instanceFleetType :: Lens' InstanceFleet (Maybe InstanceFleetType)

-- | The current status of the instance fleet.
instanceFleet_status :: Lens' InstanceFleet (Maybe InstanceFleetStatus)

-- | The target capacity of On-Demand units for the instance fleet, which
--   determines how many On-Demand Instances to provision. When the
--   instance fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision On-Demand
--   Instances as specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance
--   configuration has a specified <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>. When an
--   On-Demand Instance is provisioned, the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> units
--   count toward the target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances
--   until the target capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results
--   in an overage. For example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill
--   capacity, and Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a
--   <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and
--   the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units. You can use
--   InstanceFleet$ProvisionedOnDemandCapacity to determine the Spot
--   capacity units that have been provisioned for the instance fleet.
--   
--   If not specified or set to 0, only Spot Instances are provisioned for
--   the instance fleet using <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>. At least one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should
--   be greater than 0. For a master instance fleet, only one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be
--   specified, and its value must be 1.
instanceFleet_targetOnDemandCapacity :: Lens' InstanceFleet (Maybe Natural)

-- | The target capacity of Spot units for the instance fleet, which
--   determines how many Spot Instances to provision. When the instance
--   fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision Spot Instances as
--   specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance configuration has a
--   specified <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>. When a Spot instance is
--   provisioned, the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> units count toward the

--   InstanceFleet$ProvisionedSpotCapacity to determine the Spot capacity
--   units that have been provisioned for the instance fleet.
--   
--   If not specified or set to 0, only On-Demand Instances are provisioned
--   for the instance fleet. At least one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>
--   and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should be greater than 0. For a
--   master instance fleet, only one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and
--   <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be specified, and its value must
--   be 1.
instanceFleet_targetSpotCapacity :: Lens' InstanceFleet (Maybe Natural)

-- | The unique identifier of the instance fleet.
instanceFleet_id :: Lens' InstanceFleet (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of On-Demand units that have been provisioned for the
--   instance fleet to fulfill <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt>. This
--   provisioned capacity might be less than or greater than
--   <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt>.
instanceFleet_provisionedOnDemandCapacity :: Lens' InstanceFleet (Maybe Natural)

-- | A friendly name for the instance fleet.
instanceFleet_name :: Lens' InstanceFleet (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of specifications for the instance types that comprise an
--   instance fleet.
instanceFleet_instanceTypeSpecifications :: Lens' InstanceFleet (Maybe [InstanceTypeSpecification])

-- | The number of Spot units that have been provisioned for this instance
--   fleet to fulfill <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>. This provisioned
--   capacity might be less than or greater than
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>.
instanceFleet_provisionedSpotCapacity :: Lens' InstanceFleet (Maybe Natural)

-- | Describes the launch specification for an instance fleet.
instanceFleet_launchSpecifications :: Lens' InstanceFleet (Maybe InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications)

-- | The configuration that defines an instance fleet.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceFleetConfig</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceFleetConfig
InstanceFleetConfig' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications -> Maybe [InstanceTypeConfig] -> InstanceFleetType -> InstanceFleetConfig

-- | The target capacity of On-Demand units for the instance fleet, which
--   determines how many On-Demand Instances to provision. When the
--   instance fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision On-Demand
--   Instances as specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance
--   configuration has a specified <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>. When an
--   On-Demand Instance is provisioned, the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> units
--   count toward the target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances
--   until the target capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results
--   in an overage. For example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill
--   capacity, and Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a
--   <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and
--   the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units.
--   
--   If not specified or set to 0, only Spot Instances are provisioned for
--   the instance fleet using <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>. At least one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should
--   be greater than 0. For a master instance fleet, only one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be
--   specified, and its value must be 1.
[$sel:targetOnDemandCapacity:InstanceFleetConfig'] :: InstanceFleetConfig -> Maybe Natural

-- | The target capacity of Spot units for the instance fleet, which
--   determines how many Spot Instances to provision. When the instance
--   fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision Spot Instances as
--   specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance configuration has a
--   specified <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>. When a Spot Instance is
--   provisioned, the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> units count toward the
--   target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances until the target
--   capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results in an overage. For
--   example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill capacity, and
--   Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a
--   <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and
--   the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units.
--   
--   If not specified or set to 0, only On-Demand Instances are provisioned
--   for the instance fleet. At least one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>
--   and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should be greater than 0. For a
--   master instance fleet, only one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and
--   <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be specified, and its value must
--   be 1.
[$sel:targetSpotCapacity:InstanceFleetConfig'] :: InstanceFleetConfig -> Maybe Natural

-- | The friendly name of the instance fleet.
[$sel:name:InstanceFleetConfig'] :: InstanceFleetConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The launch specification for the instance fleet.
[$sel:launchSpecifications:InstanceFleetConfig'] :: InstanceFleetConfig -> Maybe InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications

-- | The instance type configurations that define the EC2 instances in the
--   instance fleet.
[$sel:instanceTypeConfigs:InstanceFleetConfig'] :: InstanceFleetConfig -> Maybe [InstanceTypeConfig]

-- | The node type that the instance fleet hosts. Valid values are MASTER,
--   CORE, and TASK.
[$sel:instanceFleetType:InstanceFleetConfig'] :: InstanceFleetConfig -> InstanceFleetType

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceFleetConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

newInstanceFleetConfig :: InstanceFleetType -> InstanceFleetConfig

-- | The target capacity of On-Demand units for the instance fleet, which
--   determines how many On-Demand Instances to provision. When the
--   instance fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision On-Demand
--   Instances as specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance

--   capacity, and Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a

--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be
--   specified, and its value must be 1.
instanceFleetConfig_targetOnDemandCapacity :: Lens' InstanceFleetConfig (Maybe Natural)

instanceFleetConfig_targetSpotCapacity :: Lens' InstanceFleetConfig (Maybe Natural)

-- | The launch specification for Spot Instances in the fleet, which

-- | The status of the instance fleet.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceFleetStatus</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceFleetStatus
InstanceFleetStatus' :: Maybe InstanceFleetStateChangeReason -> Maybe InstanceFleetState -> Maybe InstanceFleetTimeline -> InstanceFleetStatus

-- | Provides status change reason details for the instance fleet.
[$sel:stateChangeReason:InstanceFleetStatus'] :: InstanceFleetStatus -> Maybe InstanceFleetStateChangeReason

-- | A code representing the instance fleet status.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PROVISIONING</tt>—The instance fleet is provisioning EC2
--   resources and is not yet ready to run jobs.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOOTSTRAPPING</tt>—EC2 instances and other resources have been
--   provisioned and the bootstrap actions specified for the instances are
--   underway.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt>—EC2 instances and other resources are running.
--   They are either executing jobs or waiting to execute jobs.</li>
--   <li><tt>RESIZING</tt>—A resize operation is underway. EC2 instances
--   are either being added or removed.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUSPENDED</tt>—A resize operation could not complete. Existing
--   EC2 instances are running, but instances can't be added or
--   removed.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATING</tt>—The instance fleet is terminating EC2
--   instances.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATED</tt>—The instance fleet is no longer active, and
--   all EC2 instances have been terminated.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:state:InstanceFleetStatus'] :: InstanceFleetStatus -> Maybe InstanceFleetState

-- | Provides historical timestamps for the instance fleet, including the
--   time of creation, the time it became ready to run jobs, and the time
--   of termination.
[$sel:timeline:InstanceFleetStatus'] :: InstanceFleetStatus -> Maybe InstanceFleetTimeline

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceFleetStatus</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   fleet status.

--   provisioned and the bootstrap actions specified for the instances are

--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt>—EC2 instances and other resources are running.
--   They are either executing jobs or waiting to execute jobs.</li>

--   are either being added or removed.</li>

-- | Provides status change reason details for the instance fleet.

-- | A code representing the instance fleet status.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PROVISIONING</tt>—The instance fleet is provisioning EC2
--   resources and is not yet ready to run jobs.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOOTSTRAPPING</tt>—EC2 instances and other resources have been
--   provisioned and the bootstrap actions specified for the instances are
--   underway.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt>—EC2 instances and other resources are running.

--   <li><tt>SUSPENDED</tt>—A resize operation could not complete. Existing
--   EC2 instances are running, but instances can't be added or
--   removed.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATING</tt>—The instance fleet is terminating EC2
--   instances.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATED</tt>—The instance fleet is no longer active, and
--   all EC2 instances have been terminated.</li>
--   </ul>

--   time of creation, the time it became ready to run jobs, and the time
--   of termination.
instanceFleetStatus_timeline :: Lens' InstanceFleetStatus (Maybe InstanceFleetTimeline)

-- | Provides historical timestamps for the instance fleet, including the
--   time of creation, the time it became ready to run jobs, and the time
--   of termination.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR

-- | This entity represents an instance group, which is a group of
--   instances that have common purpose. For example, CORE instance group
--   is used for HDFS.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceGroup</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceGroup
InstanceGroup' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe InstanceGroupStatus -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [EbsBlockDevice] -> Maybe InstanceGroupType -> Maybe [Configuration] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Configuration] -> Maybe ShrinkPolicy -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe AutoScalingPolicyDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MarketType -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> InstanceGroup

-- | The version number of a configuration specification that was
--   successfully applied for an instance group last time.
[$sel:lastSuccessfullyAppliedConfigurationsVersion:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe Integer

-- | The current status of the instance group.
[$sel:status:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe InstanceGroupStatus

-- | If the instance group is EBS-optimized. An Amazon EBS-optimized
--   instance uses an optimized configuration stack and provides
--   additional, dedicated capacity for Amazon EBS I/O.
[$sel:ebsOptimized:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe Bool

-- | The EC2 instance type for all instances in the instance group.
[$sel:instanceType:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The EBS block devices that are mapped to this instance group.
[$sel:ebsBlockDevices:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe [EbsBlockDevice]

-- | The type of the instance group. Valid values are MASTER, CORE or TASK.
[$sel:instanceGroupType:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe InstanceGroupType

-- | Amazon EMR releases 4.x or later.
--   
--   The list of configurations supplied for an Amazon EMR cluster instance
--   group. You can specify a separate configuration for each instance
--   group (master, core, and task).
[$sel:configurations:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe [Configuration]

-- | The identifier of the instance group.
[$sel:id:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of configurations that were successfully applied for an
--   instance group last time.
[$sel:lastSuccessfullyAppliedConfigurations:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe [Configuration]

-- | Policy for customizing shrink operations.
[$sel:shrinkPolicy:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe ShrinkPolicy

-- | If specified, indicates that the instance group uses Spot Instances.
--   This is the maximum price you are willing to pay for Spot Instances.
--   Specify <tt>OnDemandPrice</tt> to set the amount equal to the
--   On-Demand price, or specify an amount in USD.
[$sel:bidPrice:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The target number of instances for the instance group.
[$sel:requestedInstanceCount:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe Int

-- | An automatic scaling policy for a core instance group or task instance
--   group in an Amazon EMR cluster. The automatic scaling policy defines
--   how an instance group dynamically adds and terminates EC2 instances in
--   response to the value of a CloudWatch metric. See
--   PutAutoScalingPolicy.
[$sel:autoScalingPolicy:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe AutoScalingPolicyDescription

-- | The name of the instance group.
[$sel:name:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The marketplace to provision instances for this group. Valid values
--   are ON_DEMAND or SPOT.
[$sel:market:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe MarketType

-- | The version number of the requested configuration specification for
--   this instance group.
[$sel:configurationsVersion:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe Integer

-- | The custom AMI ID to use for the provisioned instance group.
[$sel:customAmiId:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of instances currently running in this instance group.
[$sel:runningInstanceCount:InstanceGroup'] :: InstanceGroup -> Maybe Int

--   instance group.

--   
--   The list of configurations supplied for an EMR cluster instance group.

--   PutAutoScalingPolicy.

--   be terminated.

--   group.

--   group.

--   be terminated.

--   instances to be terminated when shrinking an instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instancesToProtect:InstanceResizePolicy'</a>,
--   <a>instanceResizePolicy_instancesToProtect</a> - Specific list of
--   instances to be protected when shrinking an instance group.

--   group.
