--   state change reason.
newInstanceStateChangeReason :: InstanceStateChangeReason

-- | The status change reason description.
instanceStateChangeReason_message :: Lens' InstanceStateChangeReason (Maybe Text)

-- | The programmable code for the state change reason.
instanceStateChangeReason_code :: Lens' InstanceStateChangeReason (Maybe InstanceStateChangeReasonCode)

-- | The instance status details.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceStatus</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceStatus
InstanceStatus' :: Maybe InstanceStateChangeReason -> Maybe InstanceState -> Maybe InstanceTimeline -> InstanceStatus

-- | The details of the status change reason for the instance.
[$sel:stateChangeReason:InstanceStatus'] :: InstanceStatus -> Maybe InstanceStateChangeReason

-- | The current state of the instance.
[$sel:state:InstanceStatus'] :: InstanceStatus -> Maybe InstanceState

-- | The timeline of the instance status over time.
[$sel:timeline:InstanceStatus'] :: InstanceStatus -> Maybe InstanceTimeline

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceStatus</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateChangeReason:InstanceStatus'</a>,
--   <a>instanceStatus_stateChangeReason</a> - The details of the status
--   change reason for the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:InstanceStatus'</a>, <a>instanceStatus_state</a> - The
--   current state of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeline:InstanceStatus'</a>, <a>instanceStatus_timeline</a> -
--   The timeline of the instance status over time.
newInstanceStatus :: InstanceStatus

-- | The details of the status change reason for the instance.
instanceStatus_stateChangeReason :: Lens' InstanceStatus (Maybe InstanceStateChangeReason)

-- | The current state of the instance.
instanceStatus_state :: Lens' InstanceStatus (Maybe InstanceState)

-- | The timeline of the instance status over time.
instanceStatus_timeline :: Lens' InstanceStatus (Maybe InstanceTimeline)

-- | The timeline of the instance lifecycle.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceTimeline</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceTimeline
InstanceTimeline' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> InstanceTimeline

-- | The date and time when the instance was terminated.
[$sel:endDateTime:InstanceTimeline'] :: InstanceTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The creation date and time of the instance.
[$sel:creationDateTime:InstanceTimeline'] :: InstanceTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time when the instance was ready to perform tasks.
[$sel:readyDateTime:InstanceTimeline'] :: InstanceTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceTimeline</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endDateTime:InstanceTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTimeline_endDateTime</a> - The date and time when the
--   instance was terminated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDateTime:InstanceTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTimeline_creationDateTime</a> - The creation date and time
--   of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readyDateTime:InstanceTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTimeline_readyDateTime</a> - The date and time when the
--   instance was ready to perform tasks.
newInstanceTimeline :: InstanceTimeline

-- | The date and time when the instance was terminated.
instanceTimeline_endDateTime :: Lens' InstanceTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The creation date and time of the instance.
instanceTimeline_creationDateTime :: Lens' InstanceTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time when the instance was ready to perform tasks.
instanceTimeline_readyDateTime :: Lens' InstanceTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An instance type configuration for each instance type in an instance
--   fleet, which determines the EC2 instances Amazon EMR attempts to
--   provision to fulfill On-Demand and Spot target capacities. When you
--   use an allocation strategy, you can include a maximum of 30 instance
--   type configurations for a fleet. For more information about how to use
--   an allocation strategy, see <a>Configure Instance Fleets</a>. Without
--   an allocation strategy, you may specify a maximum of five instance
--   type configurations for a fleet.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceTypeConfig</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceTypeConfig
InstanceTypeConfig' :: Maybe EbsConfiguration -> Maybe [Configuration] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> InstanceTypeConfig

-- | The configuration of Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) attached
--   to each instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>.
[$sel:ebsConfiguration:InstanceTypeConfig'] :: InstanceTypeConfig -> Maybe EbsConfiguration

-- | A configuration classification that applies when provisioning cluster
--   instances, which can include configurations for applications and
--   software that run on the cluster.
[$sel:configurations:InstanceTypeConfig'] :: InstanceTypeConfig -> Maybe [Configuration]

-- | The bid price for each EC2 Spot Instance type as defined by
--   <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed in USD. If neither <tt>BidPrice</tt>
--   nor <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> is provided,
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> defaults to 100%.
[$sel:bidPrice:InstanceTypeConfig'] :: InstanceTypeConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The bid price, as a percentage of On-Demand price, for each EC2 Spot
--   Instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed as a number
--   (for example, 20 specifies 20%). If neither <tt>BidPrice</tt> nor
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> is provided,
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> defaults to 100%.
[$sel:bidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice:InstanceTypeConfig'] :: InstanceTypeConfig -> Maybe Double

-- | The custom AMI ID to use for the instance type.
[$sel:customAmiId:InstanceTypeConfig'] :: InstanceTypeConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of units that a provisioned instance of this type provides
--   toward fulfilling the target capacities defined in
--   InstanceFleetConfig. This value is 1 for a master instance fleet, and
--   must be 1 or greater for core and task instance fleets. Defaults to 1
--   if not specified.
[$sel:weightedCapacity:InstanceTypeConfig'] :: InstanceTypeConfig -> Maybe Natural

-- | An EC2 instance type, such as <tt>m3.xlarge</tt>.
[$sel:instanceType:InstanceTypeConfig'] :: InstanceTypeConfig -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceTypeConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsConfiguration:InstanceTypeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeConfig_ebsConfiguration</a> - The configuration of
--   Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) attached to each instance as
--   defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurations:InstanceTypeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeConfig_configurations</a> - A configuration
--   classification that applies when provisioning cluster instances, which
--   can include configurations for applications and software that run on
--   the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bidPrice:InstanceTypeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeConfig_bidPrice</a> - The bid price for each EC2 Spot
--   Instance type as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed in USD.
--   If neither <tt>BidPrice</tt> nor
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> is provided,
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> defaults to 100%.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice:InstanceTypeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeConfig_bidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</a> - The
--   bid price, as a percentage of On-Demand price, for each EC2 Spot
--   Instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed as a number
--   (for example, 20 specifies 20%). If neither <tt>BidPrice</tt> nor
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> is provided,
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> defaults to 100%.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customAmiId:InstanceTypeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeConfig_customAmiId</a> - The custom AMI ID to use for
--   the instance type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:weightedCapacity:InstanceTypeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeConfig_weightedCapacity</a> - The number of units that
--   a provisioned instance of this type provides toward fulfilling the
--   target capacities defined in InstanceFleetConfig. This value is 1 for
--   a master instance fleet, and must be 1 or greater for core and task
--   instance fleets. Defaults to 1 if not specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:InstanceTypeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeConfig_instanceType</a> - An EC2 instance type, such as
--   <tt>m3.xlarge</tt>.
newInstanceTypeConfig :: Text -> InstanceTypeConfig

-- | The configuration of Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) attached
--   to each instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>.
instanceTypeConfig_ebsConfiguration :: Lens' InstanceTypeConfig (Maybe EbsConfiguration)

-- | A configuration classification that applies when provisioning cluster
--   instances, which can include configurations for applications and
--   software that run on the cluster.
instanceTypeConfig_configurations :: Lens' InstanceTypeConfig (Maybe [Configuration])

-- | The bid price for each EC2 Spot Instance type as defined by
--   <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed in USD. If neither <tt>BidPrice</tt>
--   nor <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> is provided,
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> defaults to 100%.
instanceTypeConfig_bidPrice :: Lens' InstanceTypeConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The bid price, as a percentage of On-Demand price, for each EC2 Spot
--   Instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed as a number
--   (for example, 20 specifies 20%). If neither <tt>BidPrice</tt> nor
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> is provided,
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> defaults to 100%.
instanceTypeConfig_bidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice :: Lens' InstanceTypeConfig (Maybe Double)

-- | The custom AMI ID to use for the instance type.
instanceTypeConfig_customAmiId :: Lens' InstanceTypeConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of units that a provisioned instance of this type provides
--   toward fulfilling the target capacities defined in
--   InstanceFleetConfig. This value is 1 for a master instance fleet, and
--   must be 1 or greater for core and task instance fleets. Defaults to 1
--   if not specified.
instanceTypeConfig_weightedCapacity :: Lens' InstanceTypeConfig (Maybe Natural)

-- | An EC2 instance type, such as <tt>m3.xlarge</tt>.
instanceTypeConfig_instanceType :: Lens' InstanceTypeConfig Text

-- | The configuration specification for each instance type in an instance
--   fleet.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceTypeSpecification</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceTypeSpecification
InstanceTypeSpecification' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [EbsBlockDevice] -> Maybe [Configuration] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> InstanceTypeSpecification

-- | Evaluates to <tt>TRUE</tt> when the specified <tt>InstanceType</tt> is
--   EBS-optimized.
[$sel:ebsOptimized:InstanceTypeSpecification'] :: InstanceTypeSpecification -> Maybe Bool

-- | The EC2 instance type, for example <tt>m3.xlarge</tt>.
[$sel:instanceType:InstanceTypeSpecification'] :: InstanceTypeSpecification -> Maybe Text

-- | The configuration of Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) attached
--   to each instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>.
[$sel:ebsBlockDevices:InstanceTypeSpecification'] :: InstanceTypeSpecification -> Maybe [EbsBlockDevice]

-- | A configuration classification that applies when provisioning cluster
--   instances, which can include configurations for applications and
--   software bundled with Amazon EMR.
[$sel:configurations:InstanceTypeSpecification'] :: InstanceTypeSpecification -> Maybe [Configuration]

-- | The bid price for each EC2 Spot Instance type as defined by
--   <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed in USD.
[$sel:bidPrice:InstanceTypeSpecification'] :: InstanceTypeSpecification -> Maybe Text

-- | The bid price, as a percentage of On-Demand price, for each EC2 Spot
--   Instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed as a number
--   (for example, 20 specifies 20%).
[$sel:bidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice:InstanceTypeSpecification'] :: InstanceTypeSpecification -> Maybe Double

-- | The custom AMI ID to use for the instance type.
[$sel:customAmiId:InstanceTypeSpecification'] :: InstanceTypeSpecification -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of units that a provisioned instance of this type provides
--   toward fulfilling the target capacities defined in
--   InstanceFleetConfig. Capacity values represent performance
--   characteristics such as vCPUs, memory, or I/O. If not specified, the
--   default value is 1.
[$sel:weightedCapacity:InstanceTypeSpecification'] :: InstanceTypeSpecification -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceTypeSpecification</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsOptimized:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_ebsOptimized</a> - Evaluates to
--   <tt>TRUE</tt> when the specified <tt>InstanceType</tt> is
--   EBS-optimized.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_instanceType</a> - The EC2 instance type,
--   for example <tt>m3.xlarge</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsBlockDevices:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_ebsBlockDevices</a> - The configuration
--   of Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) attached to each instance
--   as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurations:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_configurations</a> - A configuration
--   classification that applies when provisioning cluster instances, which
--   can include configurations for applications and software bundled with
--   Amazon EMR.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bidPrice:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_bidPrice</a> - The bid price for each EC2
--   Spot Instance type as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed in
--   USD.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:bidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_bidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</a> -
--   The bid price, as a percentage of On-Demand price, for each EC2 Spot
--   Instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed as a number
--   (for example, 20 specifies 20%).
--   
--   <a>$sel:customAmiId:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_customAmiId</a> - The custom AMI ID to
--   use for the instance type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:weightedCapacity:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_weightedCapacity</a> - The number of
--   units that a provisioned instance of this type provides toward
--   fulfilling the target capacities defined in InstanceFleetConfig.
--   Capacity values represent performance characteristics such as vCPUs,
--   memory, or I/O. If not specified, the default value is 1.
newInstanceTypeSpecification :: InstanceTypeSpecification

-- | Evaluates to <tt>TRUE</tt> when the specified <tt>InstanceType</tt> is
--   EBS-optimized.
instanceTypeSpecification_ebsOptimized :: Lens' InstanceTypeSpecification (Maybe Bool)

-- | The EC2 instance type, for example <tt>m3.xlarge</tt>.
instanceTypeSpecification_instanceType :: Lens' InstanceTypeSpecification (Maybe Text)

-- | The configuration of Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) attached
--   to each instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>.
instanceTypeSpecification_ebsBlockDevices :: Lens' InstanceTypeSpecification (Maybe [EbsBlockDevice])

-- | A configuration classification that applies when provisioning cluster
--   instances, which can include configurations for applications and
--   software bundled with Amazon EMR.
instanceTypeSpecification_configurations :: Lens' InstanceTypeSpecification (Maybe [Configuration])

-- | The bid price for each EC2 Spot Instance type as defined by
--   <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed in USD.
instanceTypeSpecification_bidPrice :: Lens' InstanceTypeSpecification (Maybe Text)

-- | The bid price, as a percentage of On-Demand price, for each EC2 Spot
--   Instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed as a number
--   (for example, 20 specifies 20%).
instanceTypeSpecification_bidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice :: Lens' InstanceTypeSpecification (Maybe Double)

-- | The custom AMI ID to use for the instance type.
instanceTypeSpecification_customAmiId :: Lens' InstanceTypeSpecification (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of units that a provisioned instance of this type provides
--   toward fulfilling the target capacities defined in
--   InstanceFleetConfig. Capacity values represent performance
--   characteristics such as vCPUs, memory, or I/O. If not specified, the
--   default value is 1.
instanceTypeSpecification_weightedCapacity :: Lens' InstanceTypeSpecification (Maybe Natural)

-- | A description of the Amazon EC2 instance on which the cluster (job
--   flow) runs. A valid JobFlowInstancesConfig must contain either
--   InstanceGroups or InstanceFleets. They cannot be used together. You
--   may also have MasterInstanceType, SlaveInstanceType, and InstanceCount
--   (all three must be present), but we don't recommend this
--   configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobFlowInstancesConfig</a> smart constructor.
data JobFlowInstancesConfig
JobFlowInstancesConfig' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InstanceFleetConfig] -> Maybe PlacementType -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InstanceGroupConfig] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> JobFlowInstancesConfig

-- | Applies only to Amazon EMR release versions earlier than 4.0. The
--   Hadoop version for the cluster. Valid inputs are "0.18" (no longer
--   maintained), "0.20" (no longer maintained), "0.20.205" (no longer
--   maintained), "1.0.3", "2.2.0", or "2.4.0". If you do not set this
--   value, the default of 0.18 is used, unless the <tt>AmiVersion</tt>
--   parameter is set in the RunJobFlow call, in which case the default
--   version of Hadoop for that AMI version is used.
[$sel:hadoopVersion:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the EC2 key pair that can be used to connect to the master
--   node using SSH as the user called "hadoop."
[$sel:ec2KeyName:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   Describes the EC2 instances and instance configurations for clusters
--   that use the instance fleet configuration.
[$sel:instanceFleets:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe [InstanceFleetConfig]

-- | The Availability Zone in which the cluster runs.
[$sel:placement:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe PlacementType

-- | Applies to clusters that use the instance fleet configuration. When
--   multiple EC2 subnet IDs are specified, Amazon EMR evaluates them and
--   launches instances in the optimal subnet.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
[$sel:ec2SubnetIds:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the core and
--   task nodes.
[$sel:additionalSlaveSecurityGroups:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Specifies whether to lock the cluster to prevent the Amazon EC2
--   instances from being terminated by API call, user intervention, or in
--   the event of a job-flow error.
[$sel:terminationProtected:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Bool

-- | The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the core and task
--   nodes. If you specify <tt>EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup</tt>, you must
--   also specify <tt>EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup</tt>.
[$sel:emrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The EC2 instance type of the master node.
[$sel:masterInstanceType:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | Configuration for the instance groups in a cluster.
[$sel:instanceGroups:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe [InstanceGroupConfig]

-- | Applies to clusters that use the uniform instance group configuration.
--   To launch the cluster in Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC),
--   set this parameter to the identifier of the Amazon VPC subnet where
--   you want the cluster to launch. If you do not specify this value and
--   your account supports EC2-Classic, the cluster launches in
--   EC2-Classic.
[$sel:ec2SubnetId:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the master node.
--   If you specify <tt>EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup</tt>, you must also
--   specify <tt>EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup</tt>.
[$sel:emrManagedMasterSecurityGroup:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the master
--   node.
[$sel:additionalMasterSecurityGroups:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The EC2 instance type of the core and task nodes.
[$sel:slaveInstanceType:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the Amazon EMR
--   service to access clusters in VPC private subnets.
[$sel:serviceAccessSecurityGroup:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the cluster should remain available after completing
--   all steps. Defaults to <tt>true</tt>. For more information about
--   configuring cluster termination, see <a>Control Cluster
--   Termination</a> in the <i>EMR Management Guide</i>.
[$sel:keepJobFlowAliveWhenNoSteps:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Bool

-- | The number of EC2 instances in the cluster.
[$sel:instanceCount:JobFlowInstancesConfig'] :: JobFlowInstancesConfig -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>JobFlowInstancesConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:hadoopVersion:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_hadoopVersion</a> - Applies only to Amazon
--   EMR release versions earlier than 4.0. The Hadoop version for the
--   cluster. Valid inputs are "0.18" (no longer maintained), "0.20" (no
--   longer maintained), "0.20.205" (no longer maintained), "1.0.3",
--   "2.2.0", or "2.4.0". If you do not set this value, the default of 0.18
--   is used, unless the <tt>AmiVersion</tt> parameter is set in the
--   RunJobFlow call, in which case the default version of Hadoop for that
--   AMI version is used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2KeyName:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_ec2KeyName</a> - The name of the EC2 key
--   pair that can be used to connect to the master node using SSH as the
--   user called "hadoop."
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceFleets:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_instanceFleets</a> - The instance fleet
--   configuration is available only in Amazon EMR versions 4.8.0 and
--   later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   Describes the EC2 instances and instance configurations for clusters
--   that use the instance fleet configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:placement:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_placement</a> - The Availability Zone in
--   which the cluster runs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2SubnetIds:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_ec2SubnetIds</a> - Applies to clusters that
--   use the instance fleet configuration. When multiple EC2 subnet IDs are
--   specified, Amazon EMR evaluates them and launches instances in the
--   optimal subnet.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalSlaveSecurityGroups:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_additionalSlaveSecurityGroups</a> - A list
--   of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the core and task
--   nodes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:terminationProtected:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_terminationProtected</a> - Specifies whether
--   to lock the cluster to prevent the Amazon EC2 instances from being
--   terminated by API call, user intervention, or in the event of a
--   job-flow error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_emrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup</a> - The
--   identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the core and task
--   nodes. If you specify <tt>EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup</tt>, you must
--   also specify <tt>EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterInstanceType:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_masterInstanceType</a> - The EC2 instance
--   type of the master node.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceGroups:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_instanceGroups</a> - Configuration for the
--   instance groups in a cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2SubnetId:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_ec2SubnetId</a> - Applies to clusters that
--   use the uniform instance group configuration. To launch the cluster in
--   Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC), set this parameter to the
--   identifier of the Amazon VPC subnet where you want the cluster to
--   launch. If you do not specify this value and your account supports
--   EC2-Classic, the cluster launches in EC2-Classic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emrManagedMasterSecurityGroup:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_emrManagedMasterSecurityGroup</a> - The
--   identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the master node. If
--   you specify <tt>EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup</tt>, you must also
--   specify <tt>EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalMasterSecurityGroups:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_additionalMasterSecurityGroups</a> - A list
--   of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the master node.
--   
--   <a>$sel:slaveInstanceType:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_slaveInstanceType</a> - The EC2 instance
--   type of the core and task nodes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessSecurityGroup:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_serviceAccessSecurityGroup</a> - The
--   identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the Amazon EMR service
--   to access clusters in VPC private subnets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keepJobFlowAliveWhenNoSteps:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_keepJobFlowAliveWhenNoSteps</a> - Specifies
--   whether the cluster should remain available after completing all
--   steps. Defaults to <tt>true</tt>. For more information about
--   configuring cluster termination, see <a>Control Cluster
--   Termination</a> in the <i>EMR Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceCount:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_instanceCount</a> - The number of EC2
--   instances in the cluster.
newJobFlowInstancesConfig :: JobFlowInstancesConfig

-- | Applies only to Amazon EMR release versions earlier than 4.0. The
--   Hadoop version for the cluster. Valid inputs are "0.18" (no longer
--   maintained), "0.20" (no longer maintained), "0.20.205" (no longer
--   maintained), "1.0.3", "2.2.0", or "2.4.0". If you do not set this
--   value, the default of 0.18 is used, unless the <tt>AmiVersion</tt>
--   parameter is set in the RunJobFlow call, in which case the default
--   version of Hadoop for that AMI version is used.
jobFlowInstancesConfig_hadoopVersion :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the EC2 key pair that can be used to connect to the master
--   node using SSH as the user called "hadoop."
jobFlowInstancesConfig_ec2KeyName :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   Describes the EC2 instances and instance configurations for clusters
--   that use the instance fleet configuration.
jobFlowInstancesConfig_instanceFleets :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe [InstanceFleetConfig])

-- | The Availability Zone in which the cluster runs.
jobFlowInstancesConfig_placement :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe PlacementType)

-- | Applies to clusters that use the instance fleet configuration. When
--   multiple EC2 subnet IDs are specified, Amazon EMR evaluates them and
--   launches instances in the optimal subnet.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
jobFlowInstancesConfig_ec2SubnetIds :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe [Text])

-- | A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the core and
--   task nodes.
jobFlowInstancesConfig_additionalSlaveSecurityGroups :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specifies whether to lock the cluster to prevent the Amazon EC2
--   instances from being terminated by API call, user intervention, or in
--   the event of a job-flow error.
jobFlowInstancesConfig_terminationProtected :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe Bool)

-- | The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the core and task
--   nodes. If you specify <tt>EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup</tt>, you must
--   also specify <tt>EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup</tt>.
jobFlowInstancesConfig_emrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The EC2 instance type of the master node.
jobFlowInstancesConfig_masterInstanceType :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | Configuration for the instance groups in a cluster.
jobFlowInstancesConfig_instanceGroups :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe [InstanceGroupConfig])

-- | Applies to clusters that use the uniform instance group configuration.
--   To launch the cluster in Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC),
--   set this parameter to the identifier of the Amazon VPC subnet where
--   you want the cluster to launch. If you do not specify this value and
--   your account supports EC2-Classic, the cluster launches in
--   EC2-Classic.
jobFlowInstancesConfig_ec2SubnetId :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the master node.
--   If you specify <tt>EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup</tt>, you must also
--   specify <tt>EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup</tt>.
jobFlowInstancesConfig_emrManagedMasterSecurityGroup :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the master
--   node.
jobFlowInstancesConfig_additionalMasterSecurityGroups :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe [Text])

-- | The EC2 instance type of the core and task nodes.
jobFlowInstancesConfig_slaveInstanceType :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the Amazon EMR
--   service to access clusters in VPC private subnets.
jobFlowInstancesConfig_serviceAccessSecurityGroup :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the cluster should remain available after completing
--   all steps. Defaults to <tt>true</tt>. For more information about
--   configuring cluster termination, see <a>Control Cluster
--   Termination</a> in the <i>EMR Management Guide</i>.
jobFlowInstancesConfig_keepJobFlowAliveWhenNoSteps :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe Bool)

-- | The number of EC2 instances in the cluster.
jobFlowInstancesConfig_instanceCount :: Lens' JobFlowInstancesConfig (Maybe Int)

-- | Attributes for Kerberos configuration when Kerberos authentication is
--   enabled using a security configuration. For more information see
--   <a>Use Kerberos Authentication</a> in the <i>Amazon EMR Management
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKerberosAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data KerberosAttributes
KerberosAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> KerberosAttributes

-- | The name of the Kerberos realm to which all nodes in a cluster belong.
--   For example, <tt>EC2.INTERNAL</tt>.
[$sel:realm:KerberosAttributes'] :: KerberosAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Required only when establishing a cross-realm trust with an Active
--   Directory domain. A user with sufficient privileges to join resources
--   to the domain.
[$sel:aDDomainJoinUser:KerberosAttributes'] :: KerberosAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The password used within the cluster for the kadmin service on the
--   cluster-dedicated KDC, which maintains Kerberos principals, password
--   policies, and keytabs for the cluster.
[$sel:kdcAdminPassword:KerberosAttributes'] :: KerberosAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Required only when establishing a cross-realm trust with a KDC in a
--   different realm. The cross-realm principal password, which must be
--   identical across realms.
[$sel:crossRealmTrustPrincipalPassword:KerberosAttributes'] :: KerberosAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The Active Directory password for <tt>ADDomainJoinUser</tt>.
[$sel:aDDomainJoinPassword:KerberosAttributes'] :: KerberosAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>KerberosAttributes</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:realm:KerberosAttributes'</a>, <a>kerberosAttributes_realm</a>
--   - The name of the Kerberos realm to which all nodes in a cluster
--   belong. For example, <tt>EC2.INTERNAL</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aDDomainJoinUser:KerberosAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>kerberosAttributes_aDDomainJoinUser</a> - Required only when
--   establishing a cross-realm trust with an Active Directory domain. A
--   user with sufficient privileges to join resources to the domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kdcAdminPassword:KerberosAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>kerberosAttributes_kdcAdminPassword</a> - The password used within
--   the cluster for the kadmin service on the cluster-dedicated KDC, which
--   maintains Kerberos principals, password policies, and keytabs for the
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:crossRealmTrustPrincipalPassword:KerberosAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>kerberosAttributes_crossRealmTrustPrincipalPassword</a> - Required
--   only when establishing a cross-realm trust with a KDC in a different
--   realm. The cross-realm principal password, which must be identical
--   across realms.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aDDomainJoinPassword:KerberosAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>kerberosAttributes_aDDomainJoinPassword</a> - The Active Directory
--   password for <tt>ADDomainJoinUser</tt>.
newKerberosAttributes :: KerberosAttributes

-- | The name of the Kerberos realm to which all nodes in a cluster belong.
--   For example, <tt>EC2.INTERNAL</tt>.
kerberosAttributes_realm :: Lens' KerberosAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | Required only when establishing a cross-realm trust with an Active
--   Directory domain. A user with sufficient privileges to join resources
--   to the domain.
kerberosAttributes_aDDomainJoinUser :: Lens' KerberosAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The password used within the cluster for the kadmin service on the
--   cluster-dedicated KDC, which maintains Kerberos principals, password
--   policies, and keytabs for the cluster.
kerberosAttributes_kdcAdminPassword :: Lens' KerberosAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | Required only when establishing a cross-realm trust with a KDC in a
--   different realm. The cross-realm principal password, which must be
--   identical across realms.
kerberosAttributes_crossRealmTrustPrincipalPassword :: Lens' KerberosAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The Active Directory password for <tt>ADDomainJoinUser</tt>.
kerberosAttributes_aDDomainJoinPassword :: Lens' KerberosAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | A key-value pair.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKeyValue</a> smart constructor.
data KeyValue
KeyValue' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> KeyValue

-- | The unique identifier of a key-value pair.
[$sel:key:KeyValue'] :: KeyValue -> Maybe Text

-- | The value part of the identified key.
[$sel:value:KeyValue'] :: KeyValue -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>KeyValue</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:KeyValue'</a>, <a>keyValue_key</a> - The unique identifier
--   of a key-value pair.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:KeyValue'</a>, <a>keyValue_value</a> - The value part of
--   the identified key.
newKeyValue :: KeyValue

-- | The unique identifier of a key-value pair.
keyValue_key :: Lens' KeyValue (Maybe Text)

-- | The value part of the identified key.
keyValue_value :: Lens' KeyValue (Maybe Text)

-- | Managed scaling policy for an Amazon EMR cluster. The policy specifies
--   the limits for resources that can be added or terminated from a
--   cluster. The policy only applies to the core and task nodes. The
--   master node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newManagedScalingPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data ManagedScalingPolicy
ManagedScalingPolicy' :: Maybe ComputeLimits -> ManagedScalingPolicy

-- | The EC2 unit limits for a managed scaling policy. The managed scaling
--   activity of a cluster is not allowed to go above or below these
--   limits. The limit only applies to the core and task nodes. The master
--   node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.
[$sel:computeLimits:ManagedScalingPolicy'] :: ManagedScalingPolicy -> Maybe ComputeLimits

-- | Create a value of <a>ManagedScalingPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:computeLimits:ManagedScalingPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>managedScalingPolicy_computeLimits</a> - The EC2 unit limits for a
--   managed scaling policy. The managed scaling activity of a cluster is
--   not allowed to go above or below these limits. The limit only applies
--   to the core and task nodes. The master node cannot be scaled after
--   initial configuration.
newManagedScalingPolicy :: ManagedScalingPolicy

-- | The EC2 unit limits for a managed scaling policy. The managed scaling
--   activity of a cluster is not allowed to go above or below these
--   limits. The limit only applies to the core and task nodes. The master
--   node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.
managedScalingPolicy_computeLimits :: Lens' ManagedScalingPolicy (Maybe ComputeLimits)

-- | A CloudWatch dimension, which is specified using a <tt>Key</tt> (known
--   as a <tt>Name</tt> in CloudWatch), <tt>Value</tt> pair. By default,
--   Amazon EMR uses one dimension whose <tt>Key</tt> is <tt>JobFlowID</tt>
--   and <tt>Value</tt> is a variable representing the cluster ID, which is
--   <tt>${emr.clusterId}</tt>. This enables the rule to bootstrap when the
--   cluster ID becomes available.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricDimension</a> smart constructor.
data MetricDimension
MetricDimension' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> MetricDimension

-- | The dimension name.
[$sel:key:MetricDimension'] :: MetricDimension -> Maybe Text

-- | The dimension value.
[$sel:value:MetricDimension'] :: MetricDimension -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MetricDimension</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:MetricDimension'</a>, <a>metricDimension_key</a> - The
--   dimension name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:MetricDimension'</a>, <a>metricDimension_value</a> - The
--   dimension value.
newMetricDimension :: MetricDimension

-- | The dimension name.
metricDimension_key :: Lens' MetricDimension (Maybe Text)

-- | The dimension value.
metricDimension_value :: Lens' MetricDimension (Maybe Text)

-- | A notebook execution. An execution is a specific instance that an EMR
--   Notebook is run using the <tt>StartNotebookExecution</tt> action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNotebookExecution</a> smart constructor.
data NotebookExecution
NotebookExecution' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe NotebookExecutionStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ExecutionEngineConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> NotebookExecution

-- | The reason for the latest status change of the notebook execution.
[$sel:lastStateChangeReason:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>START_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received the
--   execution request but execution has not begun.</li>
--   <li><tt>STARTING</tt> indicates that the execution is starting on the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> indicates that the execution is being processed
--   by the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHING</tt> indicates that execution processing is in the
--   final stages.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHED</tt> indicates that the execution has completed
--   without error.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILING</tt> indicates that the execution is failing and will
--   not finish successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> indicates that the execution failed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOP_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request and the stop is pending.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt> indicates that the cluster is in the process of
--   stopping the execution as a result of a <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt>
--   request.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt> indicates that the execution stopped because of a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe NotebookExecutionStatus

-- | A name for the notebook execution.
[$sel:notebookExecutionName:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier of the EMR Notebook that is used for the
--   notebook execution.
[$sel:editorId:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier of a notebook execution.
[$sel:notebookExecutionId:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notebook execution.
[$sel:arn:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when notebook execution started.
[$sel:startTime:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Input parameters in JSON format passed to the EMR Notebook at runtime
--   for execution.
[$sel:notebookParams:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when notebook execution ended.
[$sel:endTime:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The execution engine, such as an EMR cluster, used to run the EMR
--   notebook and perform the notebook execution.
[$sel:executionEngine:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe ExecutionEngineConfig

-- | The unique identifier of the EC2 security group associated with the
--   EMR Notebook instance. For more information see <a>Specifying EC2
--   Security Groups for EMR Notebooks</a> in the <i>EMR Management
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:notebookInstanceSecurityGroupId:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of tags associated with a notebook execution. Tags are
--   user-defined key-value pairs that consist of a required key string
--   with a maximum of 128 characters and an optional value string with a
--   maximum of 256 characters.
[$sel:tags:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The location of the notebook execution's output file in Amazon S3.
[$sel:outputNotebookURI:NotebookExecution'] :: NotebookExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NotebookExecution</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastStateChangeReason:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_lastStateChangeReason</a> - The reason for the
--   latest status change of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:NotebookExecution'</a>, <a>notebookExecution_status</a>
--   - The status of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>START_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received the
--   execution request but execution has not begun.</li>
--   <li><tt>STARTING</tt> indicates that the execution is starting on the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> indicates that the execution is being processed
--   by the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHING</tt> indicates that execution processing is in the
--   final stages.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHED</tt> indicates that the execution has completed
--   without error.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILING</tt> indicates that the execution is failing and will
--   not finish successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> indicates that the execution failed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOP_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request and the stop is pending.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt> indicates that the cluster is in the process of
--   stopping the execution as a result of a <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt>
--   request.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt> indicates that the execution stopped because of a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:notebookExecutionName:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_notebookExecutionName</a> - A name for the
--   notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:editorId:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_editorId</a> - The unique identifier of the EMR
--   Notebook that is used for the notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notebookExecutionId:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_notebookExecutionId</a> - The unique identifier
--   of a notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:NotebookExecution'</a>, <a>notebookExecution_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_startTime</a> - The timestamp when notebook
--   execution started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notebookParams:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_notebookParams</a> - Input parameters in JSON
--   format passed to the EMR Notebook at runtime for execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_endTime</a> - The timestamp when notebook
--   execution ended.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionEngine:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_executionEngine</a> - The execution engine, such
--   as an EMR cluster, used to run the EMR notebook and perform the
--   notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notebookInstanceSecurityGroupId:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_notebookInstanceSecurityGroupId</a> - The unique
--   identifier of the EC2 security group associated with the EMR Notebook
--   instance. For more information see <a>Specifying EC2 Security Groups
--   for EMR Notebooks</a> in the <i>EMR Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:NotebookExecution'</a>, <a>notebookExecution_tags</a> - A
--   list of tags associated with a notebook execution. Tags are
--   user-defined key-value pairs that consist of a required key string
--   with a maximum of 128 characters and an optional value string with a
--   maximum of 256 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputNotebookURI:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_outputNotebookURI</a> - The location of the
--   notebook execution's output file in Amazon S3.
newNotebookExecution :: NotebookExecution

-- | The reason for the latest status change of the notebook execution.
notebookExecution_lastStateChangeReason :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>START_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received the
--   execution request but execution has not begun.</li>
--   <li><tt>STARTING</tt> indicates that the execution is starting on the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> indicates that the execution is being processed
--   by the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHING</tt> indicates that execution processing is in the
--   final stages.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHED</tt> indicates that the execution has completed
--   without error.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILING</tt> indicates that the execution is failing and will
--   not finish successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> indicates that the execution failed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOP_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request and the stop is pending.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt> indicates that the cluster is in the process of
--   stopping the execution as a result of a <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt>
--   request.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt> indicates that the execution stopped because of a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request.</li>
--   </ul>
notebookExecution_status :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe NotebookExecutionStatus)

-- | A name for the notebook execution.
notebookExecution_notebookExecutionName :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier of the EMR Notebook that is used for the
--   notebook execution.
notebookExecution_editorId :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier of a notebook execution.
notebookExecution_notebookExecutionId :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notebook execution.
notebookExecution_arn :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when notebook execution started.
notebookExecution_startTime :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Input parameters in JSON format passed to the EMR Notebook at runtime
--   for execution.
notebookExecution_notebookParams :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when notebook execution ended.
notebookExecution_endTime :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The execution engine, such as an EMR cluster, used to run the EMR
--   notebook and perform the notebook execution.
notebookExecution_executionEngine :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe ExecutionEngineConfig)

-- | The unique identifier of the EC2 security group associated with the
--   EMR Notebook instance. For more information see <a>Specifying EC2
--   Security Groups for EMR Notebooks</a> in the <i>EMR Management
--   Guide</i>.
notebookExecution_notebookInstanceSecurityGroupId :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags associated with a notebook execution. Tags are
--   user-defined key-value pairs that consist of a required key string
--   with a maximum of 128 characters and an optional value string with a
--   maximum of 256 characters.
notebookExecution_tags :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The location of the notebook execution's output file in Amazon S3.
notebookExecution_outputNotebookURI :: Lens' NotebookExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | Details for a notebook execution. The details include information such
--   as the unique ID and status of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNotebookExecutionSummary</a> smart constructor.
data NotebookExecutionSummary
NotebookExecutionSummary' :: Maybe NotebookExecutionStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> NotebookExecutionSummary

-- | The status of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>START_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received the
--   execution request but execution has not begun.</li>
--   <li><tt>STARTING</tt> indicates that the execution is starting on the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> indicates that the execution is being processed
--   by the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHING</tt> indicates that execution processing is in the
--   final stages.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHED</tt> indicates that the execution has completed
--   without error.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILING</tt> indicates that the execution is failing and will
--   not finish successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> indicates that the execution failed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOP_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request and the stop is pending.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt> indicates that the cluster is in the process of
--   stopping the execution as a result of a <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt>
--   request.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt> indicates that the execution stopped because of a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:NotebookExecutionSummary'] :: NotebookExecutionSummary -> Maybe NotebookExecutionStatus

-- | The name of the notebook execution.
[$sel:notebookExecutionName:NotebookExecutionSummary'] :: NotebookExecutionSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier of the editor associated with the notebook
--   execution.
[$sel:editorId:NotebookExecutionSummary'] :: NotebookExecutionSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier of the notebook execution.
[$sel:notebookExecutionId:NotebookExecutionSummary'] :: NotebookExecutionSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when notebook execution started.
[$sel:startTime:NotebookExecutionSummary'] :: NotebookExecutionSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The timestamp when notebook execution started.
[$sel:endTime:NotebookExecutionSummary'] :: NotebookExecutionSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>NotebookExecutionSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:NotebookExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecutionSummary_status</a> - The status of the notebook
--   execution.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>START_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received the
--   execution request but execution has not begun.</li>
--   <li><tt>STARTING</tt> indicates that the execution is starting on the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> indicates that the execution is being processed
--   by the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHING</tt> indicates that execution processing is in the
--   final stages.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHED</tt> indicates that the execution has completed
--   without error.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILING</tt> indicates that the execution is failing and will
--   not finish successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> indicates that the execution failed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOP_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request and the stop is pending.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt> indicates that the cluster is in the process of
--   stopping the execution as a result of a <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt>
--   request.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt> indicates that the execution stopped because of a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:notebookExecutionName:NotebookExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecutionSummary_notebookExecutionName</a> - The name of
--   the notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:editorId:NotebookExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecutionSummary_editorId</a> - The unique identifier of
--   the editor associated with the notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notebookExecutionId:NotebookExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecutionSummary_notebookExecutionId</a> - The unique
--   identifier of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:NotebookExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecutionSummary_startTime</a> - The timestamp when
--   notebook execution started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:NotebookExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecutionSummary_endTime</a> - The timestamp when notebook
--   execution started.
newNotebookExecutionSummary :: NotebookExecutionSummary

-- | The status of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>START_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received the
--   execution request but execution has not begun.</li>
--   <li><tt>STARTING</tt> indicates that the execution is starting on the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> indicates that the execution is being processed
--   by the cluster.</li>

--   final stages.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHED</tt> indicates that the execution has completed
--   without error.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILING</tt> indicates that the execution is failing and will
--   not finish successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> indicates that the execution failed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOP_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request and the stop is pending.</li>

--   stopping the execution as a result of a <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt>

--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request.</li>
--   </ul>

notebookExecutionSummary_notebookExecutionId :: Lens' NotebookExecutionSummary (Maybe Text)

notebookExecutionSummary_startTime :: Lens' NotebookExecutionSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The timestamp when notebook execution started.
notebookExecutionSummary_endTime :: Lens' NotebookExecutionSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Describes the strategy for using unused Capacity Reservations for
--   fulfilling On-Demand capacity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOnDemandCapacityReservationOptions</a> smart
--   constructor.
data OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions
OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions' :: Maybe OnDemandCapacityReservationPreference -> Maybe Text -> Maybe OnDemandCapacityReservationUsageStrategy -> OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions

-- | Indicates the instance's Capacity Reservation preferences. Possible
--   preferences include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>open</tt> - The instance can run in any open Capacity
--   Reservation that has matching attributes (instance type, platform,
--   Availability Zone).</li>
--   <li><tt>none</tt> - The instance avoids running in a Capacity
--   Reservation even if one is available. The instance runs as an
--   On-Demand Instance.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:capacityReservationPreference:OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions'] :: OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions -> Maybe OnDemandCapacityReservationPreference

-- | The ARN of the Capacity Reservation resource group in which to run the
--   instance.
[$sel:capacityReservationResourceGroupArn:OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions'] :: OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether to use unused Capacity Reservations for fulfilling
--   On-Demand capacity.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>use-capacity-reservations-first</tt>, the fleet
--   uses unused Capacity Reservations to fulfill On-Demand capacity up to
--   the target On-Demand capacity. If multiple instance pools have unused
--   Capacity Reservations, the On-Demand allocation strategy
--   (<tt>lowest-price</tt>) is applied. If the number of unused Capacity
--   Reservations is less than the On-Demand target capacity, the remaining
--   On-Demand target capacity is launched according to the On-Demand
--   allocation strategy (<tt>lowest-price</tt>).
--   
--   If you do not specify a value, the fleet fulfills the On-Demand
--   capacity according to the chosen On-Demand allocation strategy.
[$sel:usageStrategy:OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions'] :: OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions -> Maybe OnDemandCapacityReservationUsageStrategy

-- | Create a value of <a>OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:capacityReservationPreference:OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions'</a>,
--   <a>onDemandCapacityReservationOptions_capacityReservationPreference</a>
--   - Indicates the instance's Capacity Reservation preferences. Possible
--   preferences include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>open</tt> - The instance can run in any open Capacity
--   Reservation that has matching attributes (instance type, platform,
--   Availability Zone).</li>
--   <li><tt>none</tt> - The instance avoids running in a Capacity
--   Reservation even if one is available. The instance runs as an
--   On-Demand Instance.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:capacityReservationResourceGroupArn:OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions'</a>,
--   <a>onDemandCapacityReservationOptions_capacityReservationResourceGroupArn</a>
--   - The ARN of the Capacity Reservation resource group in which to run
--   the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:usageStrategy:OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions'</a>,
--   <a>onDemandCapacityReservationOptions_usageStrategy</a> - Indicates
--   whether to use unused Capacity Reservations for fulfilling On-Demand
--   capacity.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>use-capacity-reservations-first</tt>, the fleet
--   uses unused Capacity Reservations to fulfill On-Demand capacity up to
--   the target On-Demand capacity. If multiple instance pools have unused
--   Capacity Reservations, the On-Demand allocation strategy
--   (<tt>lowest-price</tt>) is applied. If the number of unused Capacity
--   Reservations is less than the On-Demand target capacity, the remaining
--   On-Demand target capacity is launched according to the On-Demand
--   allocation strategy (<tt>lowest-price</tt>).
--   
--   If you do not specify a value, the fleet fulfills the On-Demand
--   capacity according to the chosen On-Demand allocation strategy.
newOnDemandCapacityReservationOptions :: OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions

-- | Indicates the instance's Capacity Reservation preferences. Possible
--   preferences include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>open</tt> - The instance can run in any open Capacity
--   Reservation that has matching attributes (instance type, platform,
--   Availability Zone).</li>
--   <li><tt>none</tt> - The instance avoids running in a Capacity
--   Reservation even if one is available. The instance runs as an
--   On-Demand Instance.</li>
--   </ul>
onDemandCapacityReservationOptions_capacityReservationPreference :: Lens' OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions (Maybe OnDemandCapacityReservationPreference)

-- | The ARN of the Capacity Reservation resource group in which to run the
--   instance.
onDemandCapacityReservationOptions_capacityReservationResourceGroupArn :: Lens' OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether to use unused Capacity Reservations for fulfilling
--   On-Demand capacity.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>use-capacity-reservations-first</tt>, the fleet
--   uses unused Capacity Reservations to fulfill On-Demand capacity up to
--   the target On-Demand capacity. If multiple instance pools have unused
--   Capacity Reservations, the On-Demand allocation strategy
--   (<tt>lowest-price</tt>) is applied. If the number of unused Capacity
--   Reservations is less than the On-Demand target capacity, the remaining
--   On-Demand target capacity is launched according to the On-Demand
--   allocation strategy (<tt>lowest-price</tt>).
--   
--   If you do not specify a value, the fleet fulfills the On-Demand
--   capacity according to the chosen On-Demand allocation strategy.
onDemandCapacityReservationOptions_usageStrategy :: Lens' OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions (Maybe OnDemandCapacityReservationUsageStrategy)

-- | The launch specification for On-Demand Instances in the instance
--   fleet, which determines the allocation strategy.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions. On-Demand
--   Instances allocation strategy is available in Amazon EMR version
--   5.12.1 and later.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOnDemandProvisioningSpecification</a> smart
--   constructor.
data OnDemandProvisioningSpecification
OnDemandProvisioningSpecification' :: Maybe OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions -> OnDemandProvisioningAllocationStrategy -> OnDemandProvisioningSpecification

-- | The launch specification for On-Demand instances in the instance
--   fleet, which determines the allocation strategy.
[$sel:capacityReservationOptions:OnDemandProvisioningSpecification'] :: OnDemandProvisioningSpecification -> Maybe OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions

-- | Specifies the strategy to use in launching On-Demand instance fleets.
--   Currently, the only option is <tt>lowest-price</tt> (the default),
--   which launches the lowest price first.
[$sel:allocationStrategy:OnDemandProvisioningSpecification'] :: OnDemandProvisioningSpecification -> OnDemandProvisioningAllocationStrategy

-- | Create a value of <a>OnDemandProvisioningSpecification</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:capacityReservationOptions:OnDemandProvisioningSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>onDemandProvisioningSpecification_capacityReservationOptions</a> -
--   The launch specification for On-Demand instances in the instance
--   fleet, which determines the allocation strategy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allocationStrategy:OnDemandProvisioningSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>onDemandProvisioningSpecification_allocationStrategy</a> -
--   Specifies the strategy to use in launching On-Demand instance fleets.
--   Currently, the only option is <tt>lowest-price</tt> (the default),
--   which launches the lowest price first.
newOnDemandProvisioningSpecification :: OnDemandProvisioningAllocationStrategy -> OnDemandProvisioningSpecification

-- | The launch specification for On-Demand instances in the instance
--   fleet, which determines the allocation strategy.
onDemandProvisioningSpecification_capacityReservationOptions :: Lens' OnDemandProvisioningSpecification (Maybe OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions)

-- | Specifies the strategy to use in launching On-Demand instance fleets.
--   Currently, the only option is <tt>lowest-price</tt> (the default),
--   which launches the lowest price first.
onDemandProvisioningSpecification_allocationStrategy :: Lens' OnDemandProvisioningSpecification OnDemandProvisioningAllocationStrategy

-- | Placement group configuration for an Amazon EMR cluster. The
--   configuration specifies the placement strategy that can be applied to
--   instance roles during cluster creation.
--   
--   To use this configuration, consider attaching managed policy
--   AmazonElasticMapReducePlacementGroupPolicy to the EMR role.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPlacementGroupConfig</a> smart constructor.
data PlacementGroupConfig
PlacementGroupConfig' :: Maybe PlacementGroupStrategy -> InstanceRoleType -> PlacementGroupConfig

-- | EC2 Placement Group strategy associated with instance role.
--   
--   Starting with Amazon EMR version 5.23.0, the only supported placement
--   strategy is <tt>SPREAD</tt> for the <tt>MASTER</tt> instance role.
[$sel:placementStrategy:PlacementGroupConfig'] :: PlacementGroupConfig -> Maybe PlacementGroupStrategy

-- | Role of the instance in the cluster.
--   
--   Starting with Amazon EMR version 5.23.0, the only supported instance
--   role is <tt>MASTER</tt>.
[$sel:instanceRole:PlacementGroupConfig'] :: PlacementGroupConfig -> InstanceRoleType

-- | Create a value of <a>PlacementGroupConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   strategy associated with instance role.
--   
--   Starting with Amazon EMR version 5.23.0, the only supported placement
--   strategy is <tt>SPREAD</tt> for the <tt>MASTER</tt> instance role.

--   <a>$sel:instanceRole:PlacementGroupConfig'</a>,
--   <a>placementGroupConfig_instanceRole</a> - Role of the instance in the
--   cluster.
--   
--   Starting with Amazon EMR version 5.23.0, the only supported instance
--   role is <tt>MASTER</tt>.
newPlacementGroupConfig :: InstanceRoleType -> PlacementGroupConfig

-- | EC2 Placement Group strategy associated with instance role.

--   strategy is <tt>SPREAD</tt> for the <tt>MASTER</tt> instance role.

--   role is <tt>MASTER</tt>.

-- | The Amazon EC2 Availability Zone configuration of the cluster (job
--   flow).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPlacementType</a> smart constructor.
data PlacementType
PlacementType' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> PlacementType

-- | When multiple Availability Zones are specified, Amazon EMR evaluates
--   them and launches instances in the optimal Availability Zone.
--   <tt>AvailabilityZones</tt> is used for instance fleets, while
--   <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> (singular) is used for uniform instance
--   groups.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
[$sel:availabilityZones:PlacementType'] :: PlacementType -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The Amazon EC2 Availability Zone for the cluster.
--   <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> is used for uniform instance groups, while
--   <tt>AvailabilityZones</tt> (plural) is used for instance fleets.
[$sel:availabilityZone:PlacementType'] :: PlacementType -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PlacementType</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZones:PlacementType'</a>,
--   <a>placementType_availabilityZones</a> - When multiple Availability
--   Zones are specified, Amazon EMR evaluates them and launches instances
--   in the optimal Availability Zone. <tt>AvailabilityZones</tt> is used
--   for instance fleets, while <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> (singular) is
--   used for uniform instance groups.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:PlacementType'</a>,
--   <a>placementType_availabilityZone</a> - The Amazon EC2 Availability
--   Zone for the cluster. <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> is used for uniform
--   instance groups, while <tt>AvailabilityZones</tt> (plural) is used for
--   instance fleets.
newPlacementType :: PlacementType

-- | When multiple Availability Zones are specified, Amazon EMR evaluates
--   them and launches instances in the optimal Availability Zone.
--   <tt>AvailabilityZones</tt> is used for instance fleets, while
--   <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> (singular) is used for uniform instance
--   groups.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
placementType_availabilityZones :: Lens' PlacementType (Maybe [Text])

-- | The Amazon EC2 Availability Zone for the cluster.
--   <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> is used for uniform instance groups, while
--   <tt>AvailabilityZones</tt> (plural) is used for instance fleets.
placementType_availabilityZone :: Lens' PlacementType (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of port ranges that are permitted to allow inbound traffic from
--   all public IP addresses. To specify a single port, use the same value
--   for <tt>MinRange</tt> and <tt>MaxRange</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPortRange</a> smart constructor.
data PortRange
PortRange' :: Maybe Int -> Int -> PortRange

[$sel:maxRange:PortRange'] :: PortRange -> Maybe Int

-- | The smallest port number in a specified range of port numbers.
[$sel:minRange:PortRange'] :: PortRange -> Int

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxRange:PortRange'</a>, <a>portRange_maxRange</a> - The
--   smallest port number in a specified range of port numbers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minRange:PortRange'</a>, <a>portRange_minRange</a> - The
--   smallest port number in a specified range of port numbers.
newPortRange :: Int -> PortRange

-- | The smallest port number in a specified range of port numbers.
portRange_maxRange :: Lens' PortRange (Maybe Int)

-- | The smallest port number in a specified range of port numbers.
portRange_minRange :: Lens' PortRange Int

--   <tt>spark@2.1.0</tt>.
