-- | The type of adjustment the automatic scaling activity makes when
--   triggered, and the periodicity of the adjustment.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScalingAction</a> smart constructor.
data ScalingAction
ScalingAction' :: Maybe MarketType -> SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration -> ScalingAction

-- | Not available for instance groups. Instance groups use the market type
--   specified for the group.
[$sel:market:ScalingAction'] :: ScalingAction -> Maybe MarketType

-- | The type of adjustment the automatic scaling activity makes when
--   triggered, and the periodicity of the adjustment.
[$sel:simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration:ScalingAction'] :: ScalingAction -> SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>ScalingAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:market:ScalingAction'</a>, <a>scalingAction_market</a> - Not
--   available for instance groups. Instance groups use the market type
--   specified for the group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration:ScalingAction'</a>,
--   <a>scalingAction_simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration</a> - The type of
--   adjustment the automatic scaling activity makes when triggered, and
--   the periodicity of the adjustment.
newScalingAction :: SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration -> ScalingAction

-- | Not available for instance groups. Instance groups use the market type
--   specified for the group.
scalingAction_market :: Lens' ScalingAction (Maybe MarketType)

-- | The type of adjustment the automatic scaling activity makes when
--   triggered, and the periodicity of the adjustment.
scalingAction_simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration :: Lens' ScalingAction SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration

-- | The upper and lower EC2 instance limits for an automatic scaling
--   policy. Automatic scaling activities triggered by automatic scaling
--   rules will not cause an instance group to grow above or below these
--   limits.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScalingConstraints</a> smart constructor.
data ScalingConstraints
ScalingConstraints' :: Int -> Int -> ScalingConstraints

-- | The lower boundary of EC2 instances in an instance group below which
--   scaling activities are not allowed to shrink. Scale-in activities will
--   not terminate instances below this boundary.
[$sel:minCapacity:ScalingConstraints'] :: ScalingConstraints -> Int

-- | The upper boundary of EC2 instances in an instance group beyond which
--   scaling activities are not allowed to grow. Scale-out activities will
--   not add instances beyond this boundary.
[$sel:maxCapacity:ScalingConstraints'] :: ScalingConstraints -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ScalingConstraints</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:minCapacity:ScalingConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>scalingConstraints_minCapacity</a> - The lower boundary of EC2
--   instances in an instance group below which scaling activities are not
--   allowed to shrink. Scale-in activities will not terminate instances
--   below this boundary.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxCapacity:ScalingConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>scalingConstraints_maxCapacity</a> - The upper boundary of EC2
--   instances in an instance group beyond which scaling activities are not
--   allowed to grow. Scale-out activities will not add instances beyond
--   this boundary.
newScalingConstraints :: Int -> Int -> ScalingConstraints

-- | The lower boundary of EC2 instances in an instance group below which
--   scaling activities are not allowed to shrink. Scale-in activities will
--   not terminate instances below this boundary.
scalingConstraints_minCapacity :: Lens' ScalingConstraints Int

-- | The upper boundary of EC2 instances in an instance group beyond which
--   scaling activities are not allowed to grow. Scale-out activities will
--   not add instances beyond this boundary.
scalingConstraints_maxCapacity :: Lens' ScalingConstraints Int

-- | A scale-in or scale-out rule that defines scaling activity, including
--   the CloudWatch metric alarm that triggers activity, how EC2 instances
--   are added or removed, and the periodicity of adjustments. The
--   automatic scaling policy for an instance group can comprise one or
--   more automatic scaling rules.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScalingRule</a> smart constructor.
data ScalingRule
ScalingRule' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> ScalingAction -> ScalingTrigger -> ScalingRule

-- | A friendly, more verbose description of the automatic scaling rule.
[$sel:description:ScalingRule'] :: ScalingRule -> Maybe Text

-- | The name used to identify an automatic scaling rule. Rule names must
--   be unique within a scaling policy.
[$sel:name:ScalingRule'] :: ScalingRule -> Text

-- | The conditions that trigger an automatic scaling activity.
[$sel:action:ScalingRule'] :: ScalingRule -> ScalingAction

-- | The CloudWatch alarm definition that determines when automatic scaling
--   activity is triggered.
[$sel:trigger:ScalingRule'] :: ScalingRule -> ScalingTrigger

-- | Create a value of <a>ScalingRule</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:ScalingRule'</a>, <a>scalingRule_description</a> -
--   A friendly, more verbose description of the automatic scaling rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ScalingRule'</a>, <a>scalingRule_name</a> - The name used
--   to identify an automatic scaling rule. Rule names must be unique
--   within a scaling policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:ScalingRule'</a>, <a>scalingRule_action</a> - The
--   conditions that trigger an automatic scaling activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:trigger:ScalingRule'</a>, <a>scalingRule_trigger</a> - The
--   CloudWatch alarm definition that determines when automatic scaling
--   activity is triggered.
newScalingRule :: Text -> ScalingAction -> ScalingTrigger -> ScalingRule

-- | A friendly, more verbose description of the automatic scaling rule.
scalingRule_description :: Lens' ScalingRule (Maybe Text)

-- | The name used to identify an automatic scaling rule. Rule names must
--   be unique within a scaling policy.
scalingRule_name :: Lens' ScalingRule Text

-- | The conditions that trigger an automatic scaling activity.
scalingRule_action :: Lens' ScalingRule ScalingAction

-- | The CloudWatch alarm definition that determines when automatic scaling
--   activity is triggered.
scalingRule_trigger :: Lens' ScalingRule ScalingTrigger

-- | The conditions that trigger an automatic scaling activity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScalingTrigger</a> smart constructor.
data ScalingTrigger
ScalingTrigger' :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> ScalingTrigger

-- | The definition of a CloudWatch metric alarm. When the defined alarm
--   conditions are met along with other trigger parameters, scaling
--   activity begins.
[$sel:cloudWatchAlarmDefinition:ScalingTrigger'] :: ScalingTrigger -> CloudWatchAlarmDefinition

-- | Create a value of <a>ScalingTrigger</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchAlarmDefinition:ScalingTrigger'</a>,
--   <a>scalingTrigger_cloudWatchAlarmDefinition</a> - The definition of a
--   CloudWatch metric alarm. When the defined alarm conditions are met
--   along with other trigger parameters, scaling activity begins.
newScalingTrigger :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> ScalingTrigger

-- | The definition of a CloudWatch metric alarm. When the defined alarm
--   conditions are met along with other trigger parameters, scaling
--   activity begins.
scalingTrigger_cloudWatchAlarmDefinition :: Lens' ScalingTrigger CloudWatchAlarmDefinition

--   the user or group.

-- | Policy for customizing shrink operations. Allows configuration of
--   decommissioning timeout and targeted instance shrinking.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newShrinkPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data ShrinkPolicy
ShrinkPolicy' :: Maybe InstanceResizePolicy -> Maybe Int -> ShrinkPolicy

-- | Custom policy for requesting termination protection or termination of
--   specific instances when shrinking an instance group.
[$sel:instanceResizePolicy:ShrinkPolicy'] :: ShrinkPolicy -> Maybe InstanceResizePolicy

-- | The desired timeout for decommissioning an instance. Overrides the
--   default YARN decommissioning timeout.
[$sel:decommissionTimeout:ShrinkPolicy'] :: ShrinkPolicy -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ShrinkPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   requesting termination protection or termination of specific instances
--   when shrinking an instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:decommissionTimeout:ShrinkPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>shrinkPolicy_decommissionTimeout</a> - The desired timeout for
--   decommissioning an instance. Overrides the default YARN
--   decommissioning timeout.
newShrinkPolicy :: ShrinkPolicy

-- | Custom policy for requesting termination protection or termination of
--   specific instances when shrinking an instance group.
shrinkPolicy_instanceResizePolicy :: Lens' ShrinkPolicy (Maybe InstanceResizePolicy)

-- | The desired timeout for decommissioning an instance. Overrides the
--   default YARN decommissioning timeout.
shrinkPolicy_decommissionTimeout :: Lens' ShrinkPolicy (Maybe Int)

-- | An automatic scaling configuration, which describes how the policy
--   adds or removes instances, the cooldown period, and the number of EC2
--   instances that will be added each time the CloudWatch metric alarm
--   condition is satisfied.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration
SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe AdjustmentType -> Int -> SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes
--   before any further trigger-related scaling activities can start. The
--   default value is 0.
[$sel:coolDown:SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration'] :: SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration -> Maybe Int

-- | The way in which EC2 instances are added (if
--   <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt> is a positive number) or terminated (if
--   <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt> is a negative number) each time the scaling
--   activity is triggered. <tt>CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt> is the default.
--   <tt>CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt> indicates that the EC2 instance count
--   increments or decrements by <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt>, which should
--   be expressed as an integer. <tt>PERCENT_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt>
--   indicates the instance count increments or decrements by the
--   percentage specified by <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt>, which should be
--   expressed as an integer. For example, 20 indicates an increase in 20%
--   increments of cluster capacity. <tt>EXACT_CAPACITY</tt> indicates the
--   scaling activity results in an instance group with the number of EC2
--   instances specified by <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt>, which should be
--   expressed as a positive integer.
[$sel:adjustmentType:SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration'] :: SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration -> Maybe AdjustmentType

-- | The amount by which to scale in or scale out, based on the specified
--   <tt>AdjustmentType</tt>. A positive value adds to the instance group's
--   EC2 instance count while a negative number removes instances. If
--   <tt>AdjustmentType</tt> is set to <tt>EXACT_CAPACITY</tt>, the number
--   should only be a positive integer. If <tt>AdjustmentType</tt> is set
--   to <tt>PERCENT_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt>, the value should express the
--   percentage as an integer. For example, -20 indicates a decrease in 20%
--   increments of cluster capacity.
[$sel:scalingAdjustment:SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration'] :: SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:coolDown:SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration_coolDown</a> - The amount of time,
--   in seconds, after a scaling activity completes before any further
--   trigger-related scaling activities can start. The default value is 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:adjustmentType:SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration_adjustmentType</a> - The way in
--   which EC2 instances are added (if <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt> is a
--   positive number) or terminated (if <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt> is a
--   negative number) each time the scaling activity is triggered.
--   <tt>CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt> is the default.
--   <tt>CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt> indicates that the EC2 instance count
--   increments or decrements by <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt>, which should
--   be expressed as an integer. <tt>PERCENT_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt>
--   indicates the instance count increments or decrements by the
--   percentage specified by <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt>, which should be
--   expressed as an integer. For example, 20 indicates an increase in 20%
--   increments of cluster capacity. <tt>EXACT_CAPACITY</tt> indicates the
--   scaling activity results in an instance group with the number of EC2
--   instances specified by <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt>, which should be
--   expressed as a positive integer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scalingAdjustment:SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration_scalingAdjustment</a> - The amount
--   by which to scale in or scale out, based on the specified
--   <tt>AdjustmentType</tt>. A positive value adds to the instance group's
--   EC2 instance count while a negative number removes instances. If
--   <tt>AdjustmentType</tt> is set to <tt>EXACT_CAPACITY</tt>, the number
--   should only be a positive integer. If <tt>AdjustmentType</tt> is set
--   to <tt>PERCENT_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt>, the value should express the
--   percentage as an integer. For example, -20 indicates a decrease in 20%
--   increments of cluster capacity.
newSimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration :: Int -> SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes
--   before any further trigger-related scaling activities can start. The
--   default value is 0.
simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration_coolDown :: Lens' SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration (Maybe Int)

-- | The way in which EC2 instances are added (if
--   <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt> is a positive number) or terminated (if
--   <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt> is a negative number) each time the scaling
--   activity is triggered. <tt>CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt> is the default.
--   <tt>CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt> indicates that the EC2 instance count
--   increments or decrements by <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt>, which should
--   be expressed as an integer. <tt>PERCENT_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt>
--   indicates the instance count increments or decrements by the
--   percentage specified by <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt>, which should be
--   expressed as an integer. For example, 20 indicates an increase in 20%
--   increments of cluster capacity. <tt>EXACT_CAPACITY</tt> indicates the
--   scaling activity results in an instance group with the number of EC2
--   instances specified by <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt>, which should be
--   expressed as a positive integer.
simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration_adjustmentType :: Lens' SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration (Maybe AdjustmentType)

-- | The amount by which to scale in or scale out, based on the specified
--   <tt>AdjustmentType</tt>. A positive value adds to the instance group's
--   EC2 instance count while a negative number removes instances. If
--   <tt>AdjustmentType</tt> is set to <tt>EXACT_CAPACITY</tt>, the number
--   should only be a positive integer. If <tt>AdjustmentType</tt> is set
--   to <tt>PERCENT_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt>, the value should express the
--   percentage as an integer. For example, -20 indicates a decrease in 20%
--   increments of cluster capacity.
simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration_scalingAdjustment :: Lens' SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration Int

-- | The returned release label application names or versions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSimplifiedApplication</a> smart constructor.
data SimplifiedApplication
SimplifiedApplication' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SimplifiedApplication

--   <tt>3.2.1</tt>.
[$sel:version:SimplifiedApplication'] :: SimplifiedApplication -> Maybe Text

-- | The returned release label application name. For example,
--   <tt>hadoop</tt>.
[$sel:name:SimplifiedApplication'] :: SimplifiedApplication -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SimplifiedApplication</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:SimplifiedApplication'</a>,
--   <a>simplifiedApplication_version</a> - The returned release label
--   application version. For example, <tt>3.2.1</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:SimplifiedApplication'</a>,
--   <a>simplifiedApplication_name</a> - The returned release label
--   application name. For example, <tt>hadoop</tt>.
newSimplifiedApplication :: SimplifiedApplication

-- | The returned release label application version. For example,
--   <tt>3.2.1</tt>.
simplifiedApplication_version :: Lens' SimplifiedApplication (Maybe Text)

-- | The returned release label application name. For example,
--   <tt>hadoop</tt>.
simplifiedApplication_name :: Lens' SimplifiedApplication (Maybe Text)

-- | The launch specification for Spot Instances in the instance fleet,
--   which determines the defined duration, provisioning timeout behavior,
--   and allocation strategy.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions. Spot Instance
--   allocation strategy is available in Amazon EMR version 5.12.1 and
--   later.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSpotProvisioningSpecification</a> smart constructor.
data SpotProvisioningSpecification
SpotProvisioningSpecification' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe SpotProvisioningAllocationStrategy -> Natural -> SpotProvisioningTimeoutAction -> SpotProvisioningSpecification

-- | The defined duration for Spot Instances (also known as Spot blocks) in
--   minutes. When specified, the Spot Instance does not terminate before
--   the defined duration expires, and defined duration pricing for Spot
--   Instances applies. Valid values are 60, 120, 180, 240, 300, or 360.
--   The duration period starts as soon as a Spot Instance receives its
--   instance ID. At the end of the duration, Amazon EC2 marks the Spot
--   Instance for termination and provides a Spot Instance termination
--   notice, which gives the instance a two-minute warning before it
--   terminates.
[$sel:blockDurationMinutes:SpotProvisioningSpecification'] :: SpotProvisioningSpecification -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the strategy to use in launching Spot Instance fleets.
--   Currently, the only option is capacity-optimized (the default), which
--   launches instances from Spot Instance pools with optimal capacity for
--   the number of instances that are launching.
[$sel:allocationStrategy:SpotProvisioningSpecification'] :: SpotProvisioningSpecification -> Maybe SpotProvisioningAllocationStrategy

-- | The spot provisioning timeout period in minutes. If Spot Instances are
--   not provisioned within this time period, the <tt>TimeOutAction</tt> is
--   taken. Minimum value is 5 and maximum value is 1440. The timeout
--   applies only during initial provisioning, when the cluster is first
--   created.
[$sel:timeoutDurationMinutes:SpotProvisioningSpecification'] :: SpotProvisioningSpecification -> Natural

-- | The action to take when <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> has not been
--   fulfilled when the <tt>TimeoutDurationMinutes</tt> has expired; that
--   is, when all Spot Instances could not be provisioned within the Spot
--   provisioning timeout. Valid values are <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt> and
--   <tt>SWITCH_TO_ON_DEMAND</tt>. SWITCH_TO_ON_DEMAND specifies that if no
--   Spot Instances are available, On-Demand Instances should be
--   provisioned to fulfill any remaining Spot capacity.
[$sel:timeoutAction:SpotProvisioningSpecification'] :: SpotProvisioningSpecification -> SpotProvisioningTimeoutAction

-- | Create a value of <a>SpotProvisioningSpecification</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockDurationMinutes:SpotProvisioningSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>spotProvisioningSpecification_blockDurationMinutes</a> - The
--   defined duration for Spot Instances (also known as Spot blocks) in
--   minutes. When specified, the Spot Instance does not terminate before
--   the defined duration expires, and defined duration pricing for Spot
--   Instances applies. Valid values are 60, 120, 180, 240, 300, or 360.
--   The duration period starts as soon as a Spot Instance receives its
--   instance ID. At the end of the duration, Amazon EC2 marks the Spot
--   Instance for termination and provides a Spot Instance termination
--   notice, which gives the instance a two-minute warning before it
--   terminates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allocationStrategy:SpotProvisioningSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>spotProvisioningSpecification_allocationStrategy</a> - Specifies
--   the strategy to use in launching Spot Instance fleets. Currently, the
--   only option is capacity-optimized (the default), which launches
--   instances from Spot Instance pools with optimal capacity for the
--   number of instances that are launching.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeoutDurationMinutes:SpotProvisioningSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>spotProvisioningSpecification_timeoutDurationMinutes</a> - The spot
--   provisioning timeout period in minutes. If Spot Instances are not
--   provisioned within this time period, the <tt>TimeOutAction</tt> is
--   taken. Minimum value is 5 and maximum value is 1440. The timeout
--   applies only during initial provisioning, when the cluster is first
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeoutAction:SpotProvisioningSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>spotProvisioningSpecification_timeoutAction</a> - The action to
--   take when <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> has not been fulfilled when the
--   <tt>TimeoutDurationMinutes</tt> has expired; that is, when all Spot
--   Instances could not be provisioned within the Spot provisioning
--   timeout. Valid values are <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt> and
--   <tt>SWITCH_TO_ON_DEMAND</tt>. SWITCH_TO_ON_DEMAND specifies that if no
--   Spot Instances are available, On-Demand Instances should be
--   provisioned to fulfill any remaining Spot capacity.
newSpotProvisioningSpecification :: Natural -> SpotProvisioningTimeoutAction -> SpotProvisioningSpecification

-- | The defined duration for Spot Instances (also known as Spot blocks) in
--   minutes. When specified, the Spot Instance does not terminate before
--   the defined duration expires, and defined duration pricing for Spot
--   Instances applies. Valid values are 60, 120, 180, 240, 300, or 360.
--   The duration period starts as soon as a Spot Instance receives its
--   instance ID. At the end of the duration, Amazon EC2 marks the Spot
--   Instance for termination and provides a Spot Instance termination
--   notice, which gives the instance a two-minute warning before it
--   terminates.
spotProvisioningSpecification_blockDurationMinutes :: Lens' SpotProvisioningSpecification (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the strategy to use in launching Spot Instance fleets.
--   Currently, the only option is capacity-optimized (the default), which
--   launches instances from Spot Instance pools with optimal capacity for
--   the number of instances that are launching.
spotProvisioningSpecification_allocationStrategy :: Lens' SpotProvisioningSpecification (Maybe SpotProvisioningAllocationStrategy)

-- | The spot provisioning timeout period in minutes. If Spot Instances are
--   not provisioned within this time period, the <tt>TimeOutAction</tt> is
--   taken. Minimum value is 5 and maximum value is 1440. The timeout
--   applies only during initial provisioning, when the cluster is first
--   created.
spotProvisioningSpecification_timeoutDurationMinutes :: Lens' SpotProvisioningSpecification Natural

-- | The action to take when <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> has not been
--   fulfilled when the <tt>TimeoutDurationMinutes</tt> has expired; that
--   is, when all Spot Instances could not be provisioned within the Spot
--   provisioning timeout. Valid values are <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt> and
--   <tt>SWITCH_TO_ON_DEMAND</tt>. SWITCH_TO_ON_DEMAND specifies that if no
--   Spot Instances are available, On-Demand Instances should be
--   provisioned to fulfill any remaining Spot capacity.
spotProvisioningSpecification_timeoutAction :: Lens' SpotProvisioningSpecification SpotProvisioningTimeoutAction

-- | This represents a step in a cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStep</a> smart constructor.
data Step
Step' :: Maybe StepStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HadoopStepConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ActionOnFailure -> Step

-- | The current execution status details of the cluster step.
[$sel:status:Step'] :: Step -> Maybe StepStatus

-- | The identifier of the cluster step.
[$sel:id:Step'] :: Step -> Maybe Text

-- | The Hadoop job configuration of the cluster step.
[$sel:config:Step'] :: Step -> Maybe HadoopStepConfig

-- | The name of the cluster step.
[$sel:name:Step'] :: Step -> Maybe Text

-- | The action to take when the cluster step fails. Possible values are
--   <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>, <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt>, and
--   <tt>CONTINUE</tt>. <tt>TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW</tt> is provided for
--   backward compatibility. We recommend using <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>
--   instead.
--   
--   If a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> is greater than
--   <tt>1</tt>, do not use <tt>AddJobFlowSteps</tt> to submit a step with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt> or
--   <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>. The step is not submitted and the action
--   fails with a message that the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> setting is not
--   valid.
--   
--   If you change a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> to be greater
--   than 1 while a step is running, the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> parameter
--   may not behave as you expect. In this case, for a step that fails with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt>, pending steps and the
--   running step are not canceled; for a step that fails with this
--   parameter set to <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>, the cluster does not
--   terminate.
[$sel:actionOnFailure:Step'] :: Step -> Maybe ActionOnFailure

-- | Create a value of <a>Step</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Step'</a>, <a>step_status</a> - The current execution
--   status details of the cluster step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Step'</a>, <a>step_id</a> - The identifier of the cluster
--   step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:config:Step'</a>, <a>step_config</a> - The Hadoop job
--   configuration of the cluster step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Step'</a>, <a>step_name</a> - The name of the cluster
--   step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionOnFailure:Step'</a>, <a>step_actionOnFailure</a> - The
--   action to take when the cluster step fails. Possible values are
--   <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>, <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt>, and
--   <tt>CONTINUE</tt>. <tt>TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW</tt> is provided for
--   backward compatibility. We recommend using <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>
--   instead.
--   
--   If a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> is greater than
--   <tt>1</tt>, do not use <tt>AddJobFlowSteps</tt> to submit a step with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt> or
--   <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>. The step is not submitted and the action
--   fails with a message that the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> setting is not
--   valid.
--   
--   If you change a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> to be greater
--   than 1 while a step is running, the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> parameter
--   may not behave as you expect. In this case, for a step that fails with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt>, pending steps and the
--   running step are not canceled; for a step that fails with this
--   parameter set to <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>, the cluster does not
--   terminate.
newStep :: Step

-- | The current execution status details of the cluster step.
step_status :: Lens' Step (Maybe StepStatus)

-- | The identifier of the cluster step.
step_id :: Lens' Step (Maybe Text)

-- | The Hadoop job configuration of the cluster step.
step_config :: Lens' Step (Maybe HadoopStepConfig)

-- | The name of the cluster step.
step_name :: Lens' Step (Maybe Text)

-- | The action to take when the cluster step fails. Possible values are
--   <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>, <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt>, and
--   <tt>CONTINUE</tt>. <tt>TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW</tt> is provided for
--   backward compatibility. We recommend using <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>
--   instead.
--   
--   If a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> is greater than
--   <tt>1</tt>, do not use <tt>AddJobFlowSteps</tt> to submit a step with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt> or
--   <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>. The step is not submitted and the action
--   fails with a message that the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> setting is not
--   valid.
--   
--   If you change a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> to be greater
--   than 1 while a step is running, the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> parameter
--   may not behave as you expect. In this case, for a step that fails with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt>, pending steps and the
--   running step are not canceled; for a step that fails with this
--   parameter set to <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>, the cluster does not
--   terminate.
step_actionOnFailure :: Lens' Step (Maybe ActionOnFailure)

-- | Specification for a cluster (job flow) step.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStepConfig</a> smart constructor.
data StepConfig
StepConfig' :: Maybe ActionOnFailure -> Text -> HadoopJarStepConfig -> StepConfig

-- | The action to take when the step fails. Use one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt> - Shuts down the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt> - Cancels any pending steps and returns
--   the cluster to the <tt>WAITING</tt> state.</li>
--   <li><tt>CONTINUE</tt> - Continues to the next step in the queue.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW</tt> - Shuts down the cluster.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW</tt> is provided for backward compatibility. We
--   recommend using <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt> instead.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> is greater than
--   <tt>1</tt>, do not use <tt>AddJobFlowSteps</tt> to submit a step with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt> or
--   <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>. The step is not submitted and the action
--   fails with a message that the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> setting is not
--   valid.
--   
--   If you change a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> to be greater
--   than 1 while a step is running, the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> parameter
--   may not behave as you expect. In this case, for a step that fails with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt>, pending steps and the
--   running step are not canceled; for a step that fails with this
--   parameter set to <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>, the cluster does not
--   terminate.
[$sel:actionOnFailure:StepConfig'] :: StepConfig -> Maybe ActionOnFailure

-- | The name of the step.
[$sel:name:StepConfig'] :: StepConfig -> Text

-- | The JAR file used for the step.
[$sel:hadoopJarStep:StepConfig'] :: StepConfig -> HadoopJarStepConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>StepConfig</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionOnFailure:StepConfig'</a>,
--   <a>stepConfig_actionOnFailure</a> - The action to take when the step
--   fails. Use one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt> - Shuts down the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt> - Cancels any pending steps and returns
--   the cluster to the <tt>WAITING</tt> state.</li>
--   <li><tt>CONTINUE</tt> - Continues to the next step in the queue.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW</tt> - Shuts down the cluster.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW</tt> is provided for backward compatibility. We
--   recommend using <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt> instead.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> is greater than
--   <tt>1</tt>, do not use <tt>AddJobFlowSteps</tt> to submit a step with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt> or
--   <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>. The step is not submitted and the action
--   fails with a message that the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> setting is not
--   valid.
--   
--   If you change a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> to be greater
--   than 1 while a step is running, the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> parameter
--   may not behave as you expect. In this case, for a step that fails with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt>, pending steps and the
--   running step are not canceled; for a step that fails with this
--   parameter set to <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>, the cluster does not
--   terminate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:StepConfig'</a>, <a>stepConfig_name</a> - The name of the
--   step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hadoopJarStep:StepConfig'</a>, <a>stepConfig_hadoopJarStep</a>
--   - The JAR file used for the step.
newStepConfig :: Text -> HadoopJarStepConfig -> StepConfig

-- | The action to take when the step fails. Use one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt> - Shuts down the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt> - Cancels any pending steps and returns
--   the cluster to the <tt>WAITING</tt> state.</li>
--   <li><tt>CONTINUE</tt> - Continues to the next step in the queue.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW</tt> - Shuts down the cluster.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW</tt> is provided for backward compatibility. We
--   recommend using <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt> instead.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> is greater than
--   <tt>1</tt>, do not use <tt>AddJobFlowSteps</tt> to submit a step with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt> or
--   <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>. The step is not submitted and the action
--   fails with a message that the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> setting is not
--   valid.
--   
--   If you change a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> to be greater
--   than 1 while a step is running, the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> parameter
--   may not behave as you expect. In this case, for a step that fails with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt>, pending steps and the
--   running step are not canceled; for a step that fails with this
--   parameter set to <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>, the cluster does not
--   terminate.
stepConfig_actionOnFailure :: Lens' StepConfig (Maybe ActionOnFailure)

-- | The name of the step.
stepConfig_name :: Lens' StepConfig Text

-- | The JAR file used for the step.
stepConfig_hadoopJarStep :: Lens' StepConfig HadoopJarStepConfig

-- | The details of the step state change reason.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStepStateChangeReason</a> smart constructor.
data StepStateChangeReason
StepStateChangeReason' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe StepStateChangeReasonCode -> StepStateChangeReason

-- | The descriptive message for the state change reason.
[$sel:message:StepStateChangeReason'] :: StepStateChangeReason -> Maybe Text

-- | The programmable code for the state change reason. Note: Currently,
--   the service provides no code for the state change.
[$sel:code:StepStateChangeReason'] :: StepStateChangeReason -> Maybe StepStateChangeReasonCode

-- | Create a value of <a>StepStateChangeReason</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:StepStateChangeReason'</a>,
--   <a>stepStateChangeReason_message</a> - The descriptive message for the
--   state change reason.
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:StepStateChangeReason'</a>,
--   <a>stepStateChangeReason_code</a> - The programmable code for the
--   state change reason. Note: Currently, the service provides no code for
--   the state change.
newStepStateChangeReason :: StepStateChangeReason

-- | The descriptive message for the state change reason.
stepStateChangeReason_message :: Lens' StepStateChangeReason (Maybe Text)

-- | The programmable code for the state change reason. Note: Currently,
--   the service provides no code for the state change.
stepStateChangeReason_code :: Lens' StepStateChangeReason (Maybe StepStateChangeReasonCode)

-- | The execution status details of the cluster step.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStepStatus</a> smart constructor.
data StepStatus
StepStatus' :: Maybe StepStateChangeReason -> Maybe FailureDetails -> Maybe StepState -> Maybe StepTimeline -> StepStatus

-- | The reason for the step execution status change.
[$sel:stateChangeReason:StepStatus'] :: StepStatus -> Maybe StepStateChangeReason

-- | The details for the step failure including reason, message, and log
--   file path where the root cause was identified.
[$sel:failureDetails:StepStatus'] :: StepStatus -> Maybe FailureDetails

-- | The execution state of the cluster step.
[$sel:state:StepStatus'] :: StepStatus -> Maybe StepState

-- | The timeline of the cluster step status over time.
[$sel:timeline:StepStatus'] :: StepStatus -> Maybe StepTimeline

-- | Create a value of <a>StepStatus</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateChangeReason:StepStatus'</a>,
--   <a>stepStatus_stateChangeReason</a> - The reason for the step
--   execution status change.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureDetails:StepStatus'</a>,
--   <a>stepStatus_failureDetails</a> - The details for the step failure
--   including reason, message, and log file path where the root cause was
--   identified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:StepStatus'</a>, <a>stepStatus_state</a> - The execution
--   state of the cluster step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeline:StepStatus'</a>, <a>stepStatus_timeline</a> - The
--   timeline of the cluster step status over time.
newStepStatus :: StepStatus

-- | The reason for the step execution status change.
stepStatus_stateChangeReason :: Lens' StepStatus (Maybe StepStateChangeReason)

-- | The details for the step failure including reason, message, and log
--   file path where the root cause was identified.
stepStatus_failureDetails :: Lens' StepStatus (Maybe FailureDetails)

-- | The execution state of the cluster step.
stepStatus_state :: Lens' StepStatus (Maybe StepState)

-- | The timeline of the cluster step status over time.
stepStatus_timeline :: Lens' StepStatus (Maybe StepTimeline)

-- | The summary of the cluster step.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStepSummary</a> smart constructor.
data StepSummary
StepSummary' :: Maybe StepStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HadoopStepConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ActionOnFailure -> StepSummary

-- | The current execution status details of the cluster step.
[$sel:status:StepSummary'] :: StepSummary -> Maybe StepStatus

-- | The identifier of the cluster step.
[$sel:id:StepSummary'] :: StepSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The Hadoop job configuration of the cluster step.
[$sel:config:StepSummary'] :: StepSummary -> Maybe HadoopStepConfig

-- | The name of the cluster step.
[$sel:name:StepSummary'] :: StepSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The action to take when the cluster step fails. Possible values are
--   TERMINATE_CLUSTER, CANCEL_AND_WAIT, and CONTINUE. TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW
--   is available for backward compatibility.
[$sel:actionOnFailure:StepSummary'] :: StepSummary -> Maybe ActionOnFailure

-- | Create a value of <a>StepSummary</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:StepSummary'</a>, <a>stepSummary_status</a> - The
--   current execution status details of the cluster step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:StepSummary'</a>, <a>stepSummary_id</a> - The identifier of
--   the cluster step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:config:StepSummary'</a>, <a>stepSummary_config</a> - The
--   Hadoop job configuration of the cluster step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:StepSummary'</a>, <a>stepSummary_name</a> - The name of
--   the cluster step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionOnFailure:StepSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stepSummary_actionOnFailure</a> - The action to take when the
--   cluster step fails. Possible values are TERMINATE_CLUSTER,
--   CANCEL_AND_WAIT, and CONTINUE. TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW is available for
--   backward compatibility.
newStepSummary :: StepSummary

-- | The current execution status details of the cluster step.
stepSummary_status :: Lens' StepSummary (Maybe StepStatus)

-- | The identifier of the cluster step.
stepSummary_id :: Lens' StepSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The Hadoop job configuration of the cluster step.
stepSummary_config :: Lens' StepSummary (Maybe HadoopStepConfig)

-- | The name of the cluster step.
stepSummary_name :: Lens' StepSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The action to take when the cluster step fails. Possible values are
--   TERMINATE_CLUSTER, CANCEL_AND_WAIT, and CONTINUE. TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW
--   is available for backward compatibility.
stepSummary_actionOnFailure :: Lens' StepSummary (Maybe ActionOnFailure)

-- | The timeline of the cluster step lifecycle.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStepTimeline</a> smart constructor.
data StepTimeline
StepTimeline' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> StepTimeline

-- | The date and time when the cluster step execution started.
[$sel:startDateTime:StepTimeline'] :: StepTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time when the cluster step execution completed or failed.
[$sel:endDateTime:StepTimeline'] :: StepTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time when the cluster step was created.
[$sel:creationDateTime:StepTimeline'] :: StepTimeline -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>StepTimeline</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startDateTime:StepTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>stepTimeline_startDateTime</a> - The date and time when the cluster
--   step execution started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endDateTime:StepTimeline'</a>, <a>stepTimeline_endDateTime</a>
--   - The date and time when the cluster step execution completed or
--   failed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDateTime:StepTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>stepTimeline_creationDateTime</a> - The date and time when the
--   cluster step was created.
newStepTimeline :: StepTimeline

-- | The date and time when the cluster step execution started.
stepTimeline_startDateTime :: Lens' StepTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time when the cluster step execution completed or failed.
stepTimeline_endDateTime :: Lens' StepTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time when the cluster step was created.
stepTimeline_creationDateTime :: Lens' StepTimeline (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Details for an Amazon EMR Studio including ID, creation time, name,
--   and so on.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStudio</a> smart constructor.
data Studio
Studio' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AuthMode -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Studio

-- | The time the Amazon EMR Studio was created.
[$sel:creationTime:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the IAM role assumed by the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:serviceRole:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the Workspace security group associated with the Amazon EMR
--   Studio. The Workspace security group allows outbound network traffic
--   to resources in the Engine security group and to the internet.
[$sel:workspaceSecurityGroupId:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon S3 location to back up Amazon EMR Studio Workspaces and
--   notebook files.
[$sel:defaultS3Location:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the Amazon EMR Studio authenticates users using IAM
--   or Amazon Web Services SSO.
[$sel:authMode:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe AuthMode

-- | The list of IDs of the subnets associated with the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:subnetIds:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The name of the IAM role assumed by users logged in to the Amazon EMR
--   Studio. A Studio only requires a <tt>UserRole</tt> when you use IAM
--   authentication.
[$sel:userRole:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:name:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of your identity provider's <tt>RelayState</tt> parameter.
[$sel:idpRelayStateParameterName:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of tags associated with the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:tags:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Your identity provider's authentication endpoint. Amazon EMR Studio
--   redirects federated users to this endpoint for authentication when
--   logging in to a Studio with the Studio URL.
[$sel:idpAuthUrl:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | The detailed description of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:description:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique access URL of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:url:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the VPC associated with the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:vpcId:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:studioId:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:studioArn:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the Engine security group associated with the Amazon EMR
--   Studio. The Engine security group allows inbound network traffic from
--   resources in the Workspace security group.
[$sel:engineSecurityGroupId:Studio'] :: Studio -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Studio</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_creationTime</a> - The
--   time the Amazon EMR Studio was created.

--   of the IAM role assumed by the Amazon EMR Studio.

--   <a>studio_workspaceSecurityGroupId</a> - The ID of the Workspace
--   security group associated with the Amazon EMR Studio. The Workspace

--   Engine security group and to the internet.

--   whether the Amazon EMR Studio authenticates users using IAM or Amazon
--   Web Services SSO.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetIds:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_subnetIds</a> - The list of
--   IDs of the subnets associated with the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userRole:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_userRole</a> - The name of the
--   IAM role assumed by users logged in to the Amazon EMR Studio. A Studio
--   only requires a <tt>UserRole</tt> when you use IAM authentication.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_name</a> - The name of the Amazon
--   EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:idpRelayStateParameterName:Studio'</a>,
--   <a>studio_idpRelayStateParameterName</a> - The name of your identity
--   provider's <tt>RelayState</tt> parameter.

--   <a>$sel:tags:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_tags</a> - A list of tags
--   associated with the Amazon EMR Studio.

--   identity provider's authentication endpoint. Amazon EMR Studio
--   redirects federated users to this endpoint for authentication when
--   logging in to a Studio with the Studio URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_description</a> - The
--   detailed description of the Amazon EMR Studio.

--   <a>$sel:url:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_url</a> - The unique access URL of
--   the Amazon EMR Studio.

--   Amazon EMR Studio.

--   Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon EMR Studio.

--   group associated with the Amazon EMR Studio. The Engine security group
--   allows inbound network traffic from resources in the Workspace
--   security group.
newStudio :: Studio

studio_creationTime :: Lens' Studio (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the IAM role assumed by the Amazon EMR Studio.
studio_serviceRole :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

--   Studio. The Workspace security group allows outbound network traffic
--   to resources in the Engine security group and to the internet.
studio_workspaceSecurityGroupId :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

--   notebook files.
studio_defaultS3Location :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

--   or Amazon Web Services SSO.
studio_authMode :: Lens' Studio (Maybe AuthMode)

-- | The list of IDs of the subnets associated with the Amazon EMR Studio.
studio_subnetIds :: Lens' Studio (Maybe [Text])

--   Studio. A Studio only requires a <tt>UserRole</tt> when you use IAM
--   authentication.
studio_userRole :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

studio_idpRelayStateParameterName :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

studio_tags :: Lens' Studio (Maybe [Tag])

-- | Your identity provider's authentication endpoint. Amazon EMR Studio
--   redirects federated users to this endpoint for authentication when
--   logging in to a Studio with the Studio URL.
studio_idpAuthUrl :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

-- | The detailed description of the Amazon EMR Studio.
studio_description :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

studio_url :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the VPC associated with the Amazon EMR Studio.
studio_vpcId :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio.
studio_studioId :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon EMR Studio.
studio_studioArn :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the Engine security group associated with the Amazon EMR
--   Studio. The Engine security group allows inbound network traffic from
--   resources in the Workspace security group.
studio_engineSecurityGroupId :: Lens' Studio (Maybe Text)

-- | Details for an Amazon EMR Studio, including ID, Name, VPC, and
--   Description. The details do not include subnets, IAM roles, security
--   groups, or tags associated with the Studio.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStudioSummary</a> smart constructor.
data StudioSummary
StudioSummary' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe AuthMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> StudioSummary

-- | The time when the Amazon EMR Studio was created.
[$sel:creationTime:StudioSummary'] :: StudioSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Specifies whether the Studio authenticates users using IAM or Amazon
--   Web Services SSO.
[$sel:authMode:StudioSummary'] :: StudioSummary -> Maybe AuthMode

-- | The name of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:name:StudioSummary'] :: StudioSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The detailed description of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:description:StudioSummary'] :: StudioSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique access URL of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:url:StudioSummary'] :: StudioSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) associated with the
--   Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:vpcId:StudioSummary'] :: StudioSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:studioId:StudioSummary'] :: StudioSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StudioSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--

--   Specifies whether the Studio authenticates users using IAM or Amazon
--   Web Services SSO.

--   <a>$sel:name:StudioSummary'</a>, <a>studioSummary_name</a> - The name
--   of the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:StudioSummary'</a>,
--   <a>studioSummary_description</a> - The detailed description of the
--   Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:StudioSummary'</a>, <a>studioSummary_url</a> - The unique
--   access URL of the Amazon EMR Studio.
--

--   of the Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) associated with the Amazon
--   EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:studioId:StudioSummary'</a>, <a>studioSummary_studioId</a> -
--   The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio.
newStudioSummary :: StudioSummary

-- | The time when the Amazon EMR Studio was created.
studioSummary_creationTime :: Lens' StudioSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies whether the Studio authenticates users using IAM or Amazon
--   Web Services SSO.
studioSummary_authMode :: Lens' StudioSummary (Maybe AuthMode)

studioSummary_name :: Lens' StudioSummary (Maybe Text)

studioSummary_description :: Lens' StudioSummary (Maybe Text)

--   Amazon EMR Studio.
studioSummary_vpcId :: Lens' StudioSummary (Maybe Text)

studioSummary_studioId :: Lens' StudioSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of supported product configurations that allow user-supplied
--   arguments. EMR accepts these arguments and forwards them to the
--   corresponding installation script as bootstrap action arguments.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSupportedProductConfig</a> smart constructor.
data SupportedProductConfig
SupportedProductConfig' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> SupportedProductConfig

-- | The list of user-supplied arguments.
[$sel:args:SupportedProductConfig'] :: SupportedProductConfig -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The name of the product configuration.
[$sel:name:SupportedProductConfig'] :: SupportedProductConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SupportedProductConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   arguments.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:SupportedProductConfig'</a>,
--   <a>supportedProductConfig_name</a> - The name of the product
--   configuration.
newSupportedProductConfig :: SupportedProductConfig

-- | The list of user-supplied arguments.
supportedProductConfig_args :: Lens' SupportedProductConfig (Maybe [Text])

-- | The name of the product configuration.
supportedProductConfig_name :: Lens' SupportedProductConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | A key-value pair containing user-defined metadata that you can
--   associate with an Amazon EMR resource. Tags make it easier to
--   associate clusters in various ways, such as grouping clusters to track
--   your Amazon EMR resource allocation costs. For more information, see
--   <a>Tag Clusters</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Tag

-- | A user-defined key, which is the minimum required information for a
--   valid tag. For more information, see <a>Tag</a> .
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | A user-defined value, which is optional in a tag. For more
--   information, see <a>Tag Clusters</a>.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - A user-defined key, which is
--   the minimum required information for a valid tag. For more
--   information, see <a>Tag</a> .
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - A user-defined value, which
--   is optional in a tag. For more information, see <a>Tag Clusters</a>.
newTag :: Tag

-- | A user-defined key, which is the minimum required information for a
--   valid tag. For more information, see <a>Tag</a> .
tag_key :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | A user-defined value, which is optional in a tag. For more
--   information, see <a>Tag Clusters</a>.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | EBS volume specifications such as volume type, IOPS, and size (GiB)
--   that will be requested for the EBS volume attached to an EC2 instance
--   in the cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVolumeSpecification</a> smart constructor.
data VolumeSpecification
VolumeSpecification' :: Maybe Int -> Text -> Int -> VolumeSpecification

-- | The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume
--   supports.
[$sel:iops:VolumeSpecification'] :: VolumeSpecification -> Maybe Int

-- | The volume type. Volume types supported are gp2, io1, standard.
[$sel:volumeType:VolumeSpecification'] :: VolumeSpecification -> Text

-- | The volume size, in gibibytes (GiB). This can be a number from 1 -
--   1024. If the volume type is EBS-optimized, the minimum value is 10.
[$sel:sizeInGB:VolumeSpecification'] :: VolumeSpecification -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>VolumeSpecification</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iops:VolumeSpecification'</a>, <a>volumeSpecification_iops</a>
--   - The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume
--   supports.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeType:VolumeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>volumeSpecification_volumeType</a> - The volume type. Volume types
--   supported are gp2, io1, standard.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInGB:VolumeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>volumeSpecification_sizeInGB</a> - The volume size, in gibibytes
--   (GiB). This can be a number from 1 - 1024. If the volume type is
--   EBS-optimized, the minimum value is 10.
newVolumeSpecification :: Text -> Int -> VolumeSpecification

-- | The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume
--   supports.
volumeSpecification_iops :: Lens' VolumeSpecification (Maybe Int)

-- | The volume type. Volume types supported are gp2, io1, standard.
volumeSpecification_volumeType :: Lens' VolumeSpecification Text

-- | The volume size, in gibibytes (GiB). This can be a number from 1 -
--   1024. If the volume type is EBS-optimized, the minimum value is 10.
volumeSpecification_sizeInGB :: Lens' VolumeSpecification Int


-- | TerminateJobFlows shuts a list of clusters (job flows) down. When a
--   job flow is shut down, any step not yet completed is canceled and the
--   EC2 instances on which the cluster is running are stopped. Any log
--   files not already saved are uploaded to Amazon S3 if a LogUri was
--   specified when the cluster was created.
--   
--   The maximum number of clusters allowed is 10. The call to
--   <tt>TerminateJobFlows</tt> is asynchronous. Depending on the
--   configuration of the cluster, it may take up to 1-5 minutes for the
--   cluster to completely terminate and release allocated resources, such
--   as Amazon EC2 instances.
module Network.AWS.EMR.TerminateJobFlows

-- | Input to the TerminateJobFlows operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTerminateJobFlows</a> smart constructor.
data TerminateJobFlows
TerminateJobFlows' :: [Text] -> TerminateJobFlows

-- | A list of job flows to be shut down.
[$sel:jobFlowIds:TerminateJobFlows'] :: TerminateJobFlows -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>TerminateJobFlows</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobFlowIds:TerminateJobFlows'</a>,
--   <a>terminateJobFlows_jobFlowIds</a> - A list of job flows to be shut
--   down.
newTerminateJobFlows :: TerminateJobFlows

-- | A list of job flows to be shut down.
terminateJobFlows_jobFlowIds :: Lens' TerminateJobFlows [Text]

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTerminateJobFlowsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data TerminateJobFlowsResponse
TerminateJobFlowsResponse' :: TerminateJobFlowsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>TerminateJobFlowsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newTerminateJobFlowsResponse :: TerminateJobFlowsResponse
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.TerminateJobFlows.TerminateJobFlows
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.TerminateJobFlows.TerminateJobFlows
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.TerminateJobFlows.TerminateJobFlows
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.TerminateJobFlows.TerminateJobFlows
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.TerminateJobFlows.TerminateJobFlowsResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.TerminateJobFlows.TerminateJobFlowsResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.TerminateJobFlows.TerminateJobFlowsResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.TerminateJobFlows.TerminateJobFlowsResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.EMR.TerminateJobFlows.TerminateJobFlows
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.TerminateJobFlows.TerminateJobFlowsResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.EMR.TerminateJobFlows.TerminateJobFlows
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.TerminateJobFlows.TerminateJobFlows
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.EMR.TerminateJobFlows.TerminateJobFlows
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.TerminateJobFlows.TerminateJobFlows
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.EMR.TerminateJobFlows.TerminateJobFlows
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.EMR.TerminateJobFlows.TerminateJobFlows

-- | Starts a notebook execution.
module Network.AWS.EMR.StartNotebookExecution

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartNotebookExecution</a> smart constructor.
data StartNotebookExecution
StartNotebookExecution' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> ExecutionEngineConfig -> Text -> StartNotebookExecution

-- | An optional name for the notebook execution.
[$sel:notebookExecutionName:StartNotebookExecution'] :: StartNotebookExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | Input parameters in JSON format passed to the EMR Notebook at runtime
--   for execution.
[$sel:notebookParams:StartNotebookExecution'] :: StartNotebookExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group to associate
--   with the EMR Notebook for this notebook execution.
[$sel:notebookInstanceSecurityGroupId:StartNotebookExecution'] :: StartNotebookExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of tags associated with a notebook execution. Tags are
--   user-defined key-value pairs that consist of a required key string
--   with a maximum of 128 characters and an optional value string with a
--   maximum of 256 characters.
[$sel:tags:StartNotebookExecution'] :: StartNotebookExecution -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The unique identifier of the EMR Notebook to use for notebook
--   execution.
[$sel:editorId:StartNotebookExecution'] :: StartNotebookExecution -> Text

-- | The path and file name of the notebook file for this execution,
--   relative to the path specified for the EMR Notebook. For example, if
--   you specify a path of <tt>s3://MyBucket/MyNotebooks</tt> when you
--   create an EMR Notebook for a notebook with an ID of
--   <tt>e-ABCDEFGHIJK1234567890ABCD</tt> (the <tt>EditorID</tt> of this
--   request), and you specify a <tt>RelativePath</tt> of
--   <tt>my_notebook_executions/notebook_execution.ipynb</tt>, the location
--   of the file for the notebook execution is
--   <tt>s3://MyBucket/MyNotebooks/e-ABCDEFGHIJK1234567890ABCD/my_notebook_executions/notebook_execution.ipynb</tt>.
[$sel:relativePath:StartNotebookExecution'] :: StartNotebookExecution -> Text

-- | Specifies the execution engine (cluster) that runs the notebook
--   execution.
[$sel:executionEngine:StartNotebookExecution'] :: StartNotebookExecution -> ExecutionEngineConfig

-- | The name or ARN of the IAM role that is used as the service role for
--   Amazon EMR (the EMR role) for the notebook execution.
[$sel:serviceRole:StartNotebookExecution'] :: StartNotebookExecution -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StartNotebookExecution</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:notebookExecutionName:StartNotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>startNotebookExecution_notebookExecutionName</a> - An optional name
--   for the notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notebookParams:StartNotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>startNotebookExecution_notebookParams</a> - Input parameters in
--   JSON format passed to the EMR Notebook at runtime for execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notebookInstanceSecurityGroupId:StartNotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>startNotebookExecution_notebookInstanceSecurityGroupId</a> - The
--   unique identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group to associate with
--   the EMR Notebook for this notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:StartNotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>startNotebookExecution_tags</a> - A list of tags associated with a
--   notebook execution. Tags are user-defined key-value pairs that consist
--   of a required key string with a maximum of 128 characters and an
--   optional value string with a maximum of 256 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:editorId:StartNotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>startNotebookExecution_editorId</a> - The unique identifier of the
--   EMR Notebook to use for notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:relativePath:StartNotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>startNotebookExecution_relativePath</a> - The path and file name of
--   the notebook file for this execution, relative to the path specified
--   for the EMR Notebook. For example, if you specify a path of
--   <tt>s3://MyBucket/MyNotebooks</tt> when you create an EMR Notebook for
--   a notebook with an ID of <tt>e-ABCDEFGHIJK1234567890ABCD</tt> (the
--   <tt>EditorID</tt> of this request), and you specify a
--   <tt>RelativePath</tt> of
--   <tt>my_notebook_executions/notebook_execution.ipynb</tt>, the location
--   of the file for the notebook execution is
--   <tt>s3://MyBucket/MyNotebooks/e-ABCDEFGHIJK1234567890ABCD/my_notebook_executions/notebook_execution.ipynb</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionEngine:StartNotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>startNotebookExecution_executionEngine</a> - Specifies the
--   execution engine (cluster) that runs the notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceRole:StartNotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>startNotebookExecution_serviceRole</a> - The name or ARN of the IAM
--   role that is used as the service role for Amazon EMR (the EMR role)
--   for the notebook execution.
newStartNotebookExecution :: Text -> Text -> ExecutionEngineConfig -> Text -> StartNotebookExecution

-- | An optional name for the notebook execution.
startNotebookExecution_notebookExecutionName :: Lens' StartNotebookExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | Input parameters in JSON format passed to the EMR Notebook at runtime
--   for execution.
startNotebookExecution_notebookParams :: Lens' StartNotebookExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group to associate
--   with the EMR Notebook for this notebook execution.
startNotebookExecution_notebookInstanceSecurityGroupId :: Lens' StartNotebookExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags associated with a notebook execution. Tags are
--   user-defined key-value pairs that consist of a required key string
--   with a maximum of 128 characters and an optional value string with a
--   maximum of 256 characters.
startNotebookExecution_tags :: Lens' StartNotebookExecution (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The unique identifier of the EMR Notebook to use for notebook
--   execution.
startNotebookExecution_editorId :: Lens' StartNotebookExecution Text

-- | The path and file name of the notebook file for this execution,
--   relative to the path specified for the EMR Notebook. For example, if
--   you specify a path of <tt>s3://MyBucket/MyNotebooks</tt> when you
--   create an EMR Notebook for a notebook with an ID of
--   <tt>e-ABCDEFGHIJK1234567890ABCD</tt> (the <tt>EditorID</tt> of this
--   request), and you specify a <tt>RelativePath</tt> of
--   <tt>my_notebook_executions/notebook_execution.ipynb</tt>, the location
--   of the file for the notebook execution is
--   <tt>s3://MyBucket/MyNotebooks/e-ABCDEFGHIJK1234567890ABCD/my_notebook_executions/notebook_execution.ipynb</tt>.
startNotebookExecution_relativePath :: Lens' StartNotebookExecution Text

-- | Specifies the execution engine (cluster) that runs the notebook
--   execution.
startNotebookExecution_executionEngine :: Lens' StartNotebookExecution ExecutionEngineConfig

-- | The name or ARN of the IAM role that is used as the service role for
--   Amazon EMR (the EMR role) for the notebook execution.
startNotebookExecution_serviceRole :: Lens' StartNotebookExecution Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartNotebookExecutionResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data StartNotebookExecutionResponse
StartNotebookExecutionResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> StartNotebookExecutionResponse

-- | The unique identifier of the notebook execution.
[$sel:notebookExecutionId:StartNotebookExecutionResponse'] :: StartNotebookExecutionResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:StartNotebookExecutionResponse'] :: StartNotebookExecutionResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>StartNotebookExecutionResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   identifier of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:StartNotebookExecutionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>startNotebookExecutionResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newStartNotebookExecutionResponse :: Int -> StartNotebookExecutionResponse

-- | The unique identifier of the notebook execution.

startNotebookExecutionResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' StartNotebookExecutionResponse Int

-- | Sets the Cluster$VisibleToAllUsers value for an EMR cluster. When
--   <tt>true</tt>, IAM principals in the Amazon Web Services account can
--   perform EMR cluster actions that their IAM policies allow. When
--   <tt>false</tt>, only the IAM principal that created the cluster and
--   the Amazon Web Services account root user can perform EMR actions on
--   the cluster, regardless of IAM permissions policies attached to other
--   IAM principals.
--   
--   This action works on running clusters. When you create a cluster, use
--   the RunJobFlowInput$VisibleToAllUsers parameter.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Understanding the EMR Cluster
--   VisibleToAllUsers Setting</a> in the <i>Amazon EMRManagement
--   Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.EMR.SetVisibleToAllUsers

-- | The input to the SetVisibleToAllUsers action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSetVisibleToAllUsers</a> smart constructor.
data SetVisibleToAllUsers
SetVisibleToAllUsers' :: [Text] -> Bool -> SetVisibleToAllUsers

-- | The unique identifier of the job flow (cluster).
[$sel:jobFlowIds:SetVisibleToAllUsers'] :: SetVisibleToAllUsers -> [Text]

-- | A value of <tt>true</tt> indicates that an IAM principal in the Amazon
--   Web Services account can perform EMR actions on the cluster that the
--   IAM policies attached to the principal allow. A value of
--   <tt>false</tt> indicates that only the IAM principal that created the
--   cluster and the Amazon Web Services root user can perform EMR actions
--   on the cluster.
[$sel:visibleToAllUsers:SetVisibleToAllUsers'] :: SetVisibleToAllUsers -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>SetVisibleToAllUsers</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobFlowIds:SetVisibleToAllUsers'</a>,
--   <a>setVisibleToAllUsers_jobFlowIds</a> - The unique identifier of the
--   job flow (cluster).
--   
--   <a>$sel:visibleToAllUsers:SetVisibleToAllUsers'</a>,
--   <a>setVisibleToAllUsers_visibleToAllUsers</a> - A value of
--   <tt>true</tt> indicates that an IAM principal in the Amazon Web
--   Services account can perform EMR actions on the cluster that the IAM
--   policies attached to the principal allow. A value of <tt>false</tt>
--   indicates that only the IAM principal that created the cluster and the
--   Amazon Web Services root user can perform EMR actions on the cluster.
newSetVisibleToAllUsers :: Bool -> SetVisibleToAllUsers

-- | The unique identifier of the job flow (cluster).
setVisibleToAllUsers_jobFlowIds :: Lens' SetVisibleToAllUsers [Text]

-- | A value of <tt>true</tt> indicates that an IAM principal in the Amazon
--   Web Services account can perform EMR actions on the cluster that the
--   IAM policies attached to the principal allow. A value of
--   <tt>false</tt> indicates that only the IAM principal that created the
--   cluster and the Amazon Web Services root user can perform EMR actions
--   on the cluster.
setVisibleToAllUsers_visibleToAllUsers :: Lens' SetVisibleToAllUsers Bool

--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newSetVisibleToAllUsersResponse :: SetVisibleToAllUsersResponse

-- | SetTerminationProtection locks a cluster (job flow) so the EC2
--   instances in the cluster cannot be terminated by user intervention, an
--   API call, or in the event of a job-flow error. The cluster still
--   terminates upon successful completion of the job flow. Calling
--   <tt>SetTerminationProtection</tt> on a cluster is similar to calling
--   the Amazon EC2 <tt>DisableAPITermination</tt> API on all EC2 instances
--   in a cluster.
--   
--   <tt>SetTerminationProtection</tt> is used to prevent accidental
--   termination of a cluster and to ensure that in the event of an error,
--   the instances persist so that you can recover any data stored in their
--   ephemeral instance storage.
--   
--   To terminate a cluster that has been locked by setting
--   <tt>SetTerminationProtection</tt> to <tt>true</tt>, you must first
--   unlock the job flow by a subsequent call to
--   <tt>SetTerminationProtection</tt> in which you set the value to
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see<a>Managing Cluster Termination</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon EMR Management Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.EMR.SetTerminationProtection

-- | The input argument to the TerminationProtection operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSetTerminationProtection</a> smart constructor.
data SetTerminationProtection
SetTerminationProtection' :: [Text] -> Bool -> SetTerminationProtection

-- | A list of strings that uniquely identify the clusters to protect. This
--   identifier is returned by RunJobFlow and can also be obtained from
--   DescribeJobFlows .
[$sel:jobFlowIds:SetTerminationProtection'] :: SetTerminationProtection -> [Text]

-- | A Boolean that indicates whether to protect the cluster and prevent
--   the Amazon EC2 instances in the cluster from shutting down due to API
--   calls, user intervention, or job-flow error.
[$sel:terminationProtected:SetTerminationProtection'] :: SetTerminationProtection -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>SetTerminationProtection</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobFlowIds:SetTerminationProtection'</a>,
--   <a>setTerminationProtection_jobFlowIds</a> - A list of strings that
--   uniquely identify the clusters to protect. This identifier is returned
--   by RunJobFlow and can also be obtained from DescribeJobFlows .
--   
--   <a>$sel:terminationProtected:SetTerminationProtection'</a>,
--   <a>setTerminationProtection_terminationProtected</a> - A Boolean that
--   indicates whether to protect the cluster and prevent the Amazon EC2
--   instances in the cluster from shutting down due to API calls, user
--   intervention, or job-flow error.
newSetTerminationProtection :: Bool -> SetTerminationProtection

-- | A list of strings that uniquely identify the clusters to protect. This
--   identifier is returned by RunJobFlow and can also be obtained from
--   DescribeJobFlows .
setTerminationProtection_jobFlowIds :: Lens' SetTerminationProtection [Text]

-- | A Boolean that indicates whether to protect the cluster and prevent
--   the Amazon EC2 instances in the cluster from shutting down due to API
--   calls, user intervention, or job-flow error.
setTerminationProtection_terminationProtected :: Lens' SetTerminationProtection Bool

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSetTerminationProtectionResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SetTerminationProtectionResponse
SetTerminationProtectionResponse' :: SetTerminationProtectionResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>SetTerminationProtectionResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newSetTerminationProtectionResponse :: SetTerminationProtectionResponse

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.SetTerminationProtection.SetTerminationProtection
