instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.SetTerminationProtection.SetTerminationProtection
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.EMR.SetTerminationProtection.SetTerminationProtection
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.EMR.SetTerminationProtection.SetTerminationProtection
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.EMR.SetTerminationProtection.SetTerminationProtection
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.EMR.SetTerminationProtection.SetTerminationProtection


-- | RunJobFlow creates and starts running a new cluster (job flow). The
--   cluster runs the steps specified. After the steps complete, the
--   cluster stops and the HDFS partition is lost. To prevent loss of data,
--   configure the last step of the job flow to store results in Amazon S3.
--   If the JobFlowInstancesConfig <tt>KeepJobFlowAliveWhenNoSteps</tt>
--   parameter is set to <tt>TRUE</tt>, the cluster transitions to the
--   WAITING state rather than shutting down after the steps have
--   completed.
--   
--   For additional protection, you can set the JobFlowInstancesConfig
--   <tt>TerminationProtected</tt> parameter to <tt>TRUE</tt> to lock the
--   cluster and prevent it from being terminated by API call, user
--   intervention, or in the event of a job flow error.
--   
--   A maximum of 256 steps are allowed in each job flow.
--   
--   If your cluster is long-running (such as a Hive data warehouse) or
--   complex, you may require more than 256 steps to process your data. You
--   can bypass the 256-step limitation in various ways, including using
--   the SSH shell to connect to the master node and submitting queries
--   directly to the software running on the master node, such as Hive and
--   Hadoop. For more information on how to do this, see <a>Add More than
--   256 Steps to a Cluster</a> in the <i>Amazon EMR Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   For long running clusters, we recommend that you periodically store
--   your results.
--   
--   The instance fleets configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions. The RunJobFlow
--   request can contain InstanceFleets parameters or InstanceGroups
--   parameters, but not both.
module Network.AWS.EMR.RunJobFlow

-- | Input to the RunJobFlow operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRunJobFlow</a> smart constructor.
data RunJobFlow
RunJobFlow' :: Maybe RepoUpgradeOnBoot -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [PlacementGroupConfig] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ScaleDownBehavior -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Configuration] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [BootstrapActionConfig] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Application] -> Maybe [StepConfig] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AutoTerminationPolicy -> Maybe ManagedScalingPolicy -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [SupportedProductConfig] -> Maybe KerberosAttributes -> Text -> JobFlowInstancesConfig -> RunJobFlow

-- | Applies only when <tt>CustomAmiID</tt> is used. Specifies which
--   updates from the Amazon Linux AMI package repositories to apply
--   automatically when the instance boots using the AMI. If omitted, the
--   default is <tt>SECURITY</tt>, which indicates that only security
--   updates are applied. If <tt>NONE</tt> is specified, no updates are
--   applied, and all updates must be applied manually.
[$sel:repoUpgradeOnBoot:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe RepoUpgradeOnBoot

-- | Applies only to Amazon EMR AMI versions 3.x and 2.x. For Amazon EMR
--   releases 4.0 and later, <tt>ReleaseLabel</tt> is used. To specify a
--   custom AMI, use <tt>CustomAmiID</tt>.
[$sel:amiVersion:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe Text

-- | The specified placement group configuration for an Amazon EMR cluster.
[$sel:placementGroupConfigs:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe [PlacementGroupConfig]

-- | A JSON string for selecting additional features.
[$sel:additionalInfo:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe Text

-- | The IAM role that Amazon EMR assumes in order to access Amazon Web
--   Services resources on your behalf.
[$sel:serviceRole:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe Text

-- | An IAM role for automatic scaling policies. The default role is
--   <tt>EMR_AutoScaling_DefaultRole</tt>. The IAM role provides
--   permissions that the automatic scaling feature requires to launch and
--   terminate EC2 instances in an instance group.
[$sel:autoScalingRole:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the way that individual Amazon EC2 instances terminate when
--   an automatic scale-in activity occurs or an instance group is resized.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_INSTANCE_HOUR</tt> indicates that Amazon EMR
--   terminates nodes at the instance-hour boundary, regardless of when the
--   request to terminate the instance was submitted. This option is only
--   available with Amazon EMR 5.1.0 and later and is the default for
--   clusters created using that version.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> indicates that Amazon EMR adds
--   nodes to a deny list and drains tasks from nodes before terminating
--   the Amazon EC2 instances, regardless of the instance-hour boundary.
--   With either behavior, Amazon EMR removes the least active nodes first
--   and blocks instance termination if it could lead to HDFS corruption.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> available only in Amazon EMR
--   version 4.1.0 and later, and is the default for versions of Amazon EMR
--   earlier than 5.1.0.
[$sel:scaleDownBehavior:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe ScaleDownBehavior

-- | The name of a security configuration to apply to the cluster.
[$sel:securityConfiguration:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe Text

-- | For Amazon EMR releases 4.0 and later. The list of configurations
--   supplied for the EMR cluster you are creating.
[$sel:configurations:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe [Configuration]

-- | The size, in GiB, of the Amazon EBS root device volume of the Linux
--   AMI that is used for each EC2 instance. Available in Amazon EMR
--   version 4.x and later.
[$sel:ebsRootVolumeSize:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe Int

-- | The Amazon EMR release label, which determines the version of
--   open-source application packages installed on the cluster. Release
--   labels are in the form <tt>emr-x.x.x</tt>, where x.x.x is an Amazon
--   EMR release version such as <tt>emr-5.14.0</tt>. For more information
--   about Amazon EMR release versions and included application versions
--   and features, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ReleaseGuide/</a>. The
--   release label applies only to Amazon EMR releases version 4.0 and
--   later. Earlier versions use <tt>AmiVersion</tt>.
[$sel:releaseLabel:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of bootstrap actions to run before Hadoop starts on the cluster
--   nodes.
[$sel:bootstrapActions:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe [BootstrapActionConfig]

-- | The KMS key used for encrypting log files. If a value is not provided,
--   the logs remain encrypted by AES-256. This attribute is only available
--   with Amazon EMR version 5.30.0 and later, excluding Amazon EMR 6.0.0.
[$sel:logEncryptionKmsKeyId:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of tags to associate with a cluster and propagate to Amazon EC2
--   instances.
[$sel:tags:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Also called instance profile and EC2 role. An IAM role for an EMR
--   cluster. The EC2 instances of the cluster assume this role. The
--   default role is <tt>EMR_EC2_DefaultRole</tt>. In order to use the
--   default role, you must have already created it using the CLI or
--   console.
[$sel:jobFlowRole:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe Text

-- | Applies to Amazon EMR releases 4.0 and later. A case-insensitive list
--   of applications for Amazon EMR to install and configure when launching
--   the cluster. For a list of applications available for each Amazon EMR
--   release version, see the <a>Amazon EMR Release Guide</a>.
[$sel:applications:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe [Application]

-- | A list of steps to run.
[$sel:steps:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe [StepConfig]

-- | Specifies the number of steps that can be executed concurrently. The
--   default value is <tt>1</tt>. The maximum value is <tt>256</tt>.
[$sel:stepConcurrencyLevel:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe Int

-- | For Amazon EMR releases 3.x and 2.x. For Amazon EMR releases 4.x and
--   later, use Applications.
--   
--   A list of strings that indicates third-party software to use. For more
--   information, see the <a>Amazon EMR Developer Guide</a>. Currently
--   supported values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>"mapr-m3" - launch the job flow using MapR M3 Edition.</li>
--   <li>"mapr-m5" - launch the job flow using MapR M5 Edition.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:supportedProducts:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Set this value to <tt>true</tt> so that IAM principals in the Amazon
--   Web Services account associated with the cluster can perform EMR
--   actions on the cluster that their IAM policies allow. This value
--   defaults to <tt>true</tt> for clusters created using the EMR API or
--   the CLI <a>create-cluster</a> command.
--   
--   When set to <tt>false</tt>, only the IAM principal that created the
--   cluster and the Amazon Web Services account root user can perform EMR
--   actions for the cluster, regardless of the IAM permissions policies
--   attached to other IAM principals. For more information, see
--   <a>Understanding the EMR Cluster VisibleToAllUsers Setting</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon EMRManagement Guide</i>.
[$sel:visibleToAllUsers:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe Bool

-- | Available only in Amazon EMR version 5.7.0 and later. The ID of a
--   custom Amazon EBS-backed Linux AMI. If specified, Amazon EMR uses this
--   AMI when it launches cluster EC2 instances. For more information about
--   custom AMIs in Amazon EMR, see <a>Using a Custom AMI</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon EMR Management Guide</i>. If omitted, the cluster uses the
--   base Linux AMI for the <tt>ReleaseLabel</tt> specified. For Amazon EMR
--   versions 2.x and 3.x, use <tt>AmiVersion</tt> instead.
--   
--   For information about creating a custom AMI, see <a>Creating an Amazon
--   EBS-Backed Linux AMI</a> in the <i>Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User
--   Guide for Linux Instances</i>. For information about finding an AMI
--   ID, see <a>Finding a Linux AMI</a>.
[$sel:customAmiId:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe Text
[$sel:autoTerminationPolicy:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe AutoTerminationPolicy

-- | The specified managed scaling policy for an Amazon EMR cluster.
[$sel:managedScalingPolicy:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe ManagedScalingPolicy

-- | The location in Amazon S3 to write the log files of the job flow. If a
--   value is not provided, logs are not created.
[$sel:logUri:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe Text

-- | For Amazon EMR releases 3.x and 2.x. For Amazon EMR releases 4.x and
--   later, use Applications.
--   
--   A list of strings that indicates third-party software to use with the
--   job flow that accepts a user argument list. EMR accepts and forwards
--   the argument list to the corresponding installation script as
--   bootstrap action arguments. For more information, see "Launch a Job
--   Flow on the MapR Distribution for Hadoop" in the <a>Amazon EMR
--   Developer Guide</a>. Supported values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>"mapr-m3" - launch the cluster using MapR M3 Edition.</li>
--   <li>"mapr-m5" - launch the cluster using MapR M5 Edition.</li>
--   <li>"mapr" with the user arguments specifying "--edition,m3" or
--   "--edition,m5" - launch the job flow using MapR M3 or M5 Edition
--   respectively.</li>
--   <li>"mapr-m7" - launch the cluster using MapR M7 Edition.</li>
--   <li>"hunk" - launch the cluster with the Hunk Big Data Analytics
--   Platform.</li>
--   <li>"hue"- launch the cluster with Hue installed.</li>
--   <li>"spark" - launch the cluster with Apache Spark installed.</li>
--   <li>"ganglia" - launch the cluster with the Ganglia Monitoring System
--   installed.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:newSupportedProducts':RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe [SupportedProductConfig]

-- | Attributes for Kerberos configuration when Kerberos authentication is
--   enabled using a security configuration. For more information see
--   <a>Use Kerberos Authentication</a> in the <i>Amazon EMR Management
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:kerberosAttributes:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Maybe KerberosAttributes

-- | The name of the job flow.
[$sel:name:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> Text

-- | A specification of the number and type of Amazon EC2 instances.
[$sel:instances:RunJobFlow'] :: RunJobFlow -> JobFlowInstancesConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>RunJobFlow</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:repoUpgradeOnBoot:RunJobFlow'</a>,
--   <a>runJobFlow_repoUpgradeOnBoot</a> - Applies only when
--   <tt>CustomAmiID</tt> is used. Specifies which updates from the Amazon
--   Linux AMI package repositories to apply automatically when the
--   instance boots using the AMI. If omitted, the default is
--   <tt>SECURITY</tt>, which indicates that only security updates are
--   applied. If <tt>NONE</tt> is specified, no updates are applied, and
--   all updates must be applied manually.
--   
--   <a>$sel:amiVersion:RunJobFlow'</a>, <a>runJobFlow_amiVersion</a> -
--   Applies only to Amazon EMR AMI versions 3.x and 2.x. For Amazon EMR
--   releases 4.0 and later, <tt>ReleaseLabel</tt> is used. To specify a
--   custom AMI, use <tt>CustomAmiID</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:placementGroupConfigs:RunJobFlow'</a>,
--   <a>runJobFlow_placementGroupConfigs</a> - The specified placement
--   group configuration for an Amazon EMR cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalInfo:RunJobFlow'</a>,
--   <a>runJobFlow_additionalInfo</a> - A JSON string for selecting
--   additional features.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceRole:RunJobFlow'</a>, <a>runJobFlow_serviceRole</a> -
--   The IAM role that Amazon EMR assumes in order to access Amazon Web
--   Services resources on your behalf.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScalingRole:RunJobFlow'</a>,
--   <a>runJobFlow_autoScalingRole</a> - An IAM role for automatic scaling
--   policies. The default role is <tt>EMR_AutoScaling_DefaultRole</tt>.
--   The IAM role provides permissions that the automatic scaling feature
--   requires to launch and terminate EC2 instances in an instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleDownBehavior:RunJobFlow'</a>,
--   <a>runJobFlow_scaleDownBehavior</a> - Specifies the way that
--   individual Amazon EC2 instances terminate when an automatic scale-in
--   activity occurs or an instance group is resized.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_INSTANCE_HOUR</tt> indicates that Amazon EMR
--   terminates nodes at the instance-hour boundary, regardless of when the
--   request to terminate the instance was submitted. This option is only
--   available with Amazon EMR 5.1.0 and later and is the default for
--   clusters created using that version.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> indicates that Amazon EMR adds
--   nodes to a deny list and drains tasks from nodes before terminating
--   the Amazon EC2 instances, regardless of the instance-hour boundary.
--   With either behavior, Amazon EMR removes the least active nodes first
--   and blocks instance termination if it could lead to HDFS corruption.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> available only in Amazon EMR
--   version 4.1.0 and later, and is the default for versions of Amazon EMR
--   earlier than 5.1.0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityConfiguration:RunJobFlow'</a>,
--   <a>runJobFlow_securityConfiguration</a> - The name of a security
--   configuration to apply to the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurations:RunJobFlow'</a>,
--   <a>runJobFlow_configurations</a> - For Amazon EMR releases 4.0 and
--   later. The list of configurations supplied for the EMR cluster you are
--   creating.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsRootVolumeSize:RunJobFlow'</a>,
--   <a>runJobFlow_ebsRootVolumeSize</a> - The size, in GiB, of the Amazon
--   EBS root device volume of the Linux AMI that is used for each EC2
--   instance. Available in Amazon EMR version 4.x and later.
--   
--   <a>$sel:releaseLabel:RunJobFlow'</a>, <a>runJobFlow_releaseLabel</a> -
--   The Amazon EMR release label, which determines the version of
--   open-source application packages installed on the cluster. Release
--   labels are in the form <tt>emr-x.x.x</tt>, where x.x.x is an Amazon
--   EMR release version such as <tt>emr-5.14.0</tt>. For more information
--   about Amazon EMR release versions and included application versions
--   and features, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ReleaseGuide/</a>. The
--   release label applies only to Amazon EMR releases version 4.0 and
--   later. Earlier versions use <tt>AmiVersion</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bootstrapActions:RunJobFlow'</a>,
--   <a>runJobFlow_bootstrapActions</a> - A list of bootstrap actions to
--   run before Hadoop starts on the cluster nodes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logEncryptionKmsKeyId:RunJobFlow'</a>,
--   <a>runJobFlow_logEncryptionKmsKeyId</a> - The KMS key used for
--   encrypting log files. If a value is not provided, the logs remain
--   encrypted by AES-256. This attribute is only available with Amazon EMR
--   version 5.30.0 and later, excluding Amazon EMR 6.0.0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:RunJobFlow'</a>, <a>runJobFlow_tags</a> - A list of tags
--   to associate with a cluster and propagate to Amazon EC2 instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobFlowRole:RunJobFlow'</a>, <a>runJobFlow_jobFlowRole</a> -
--   Also called instance profile and EC2 role. An IAM role for an EMR
--   cluster. The EC2 instances of the cluster assume this role. The
--   default role is <tt>EMR_EC2_DefaultRole</tt>. In order to use the
--   default role, you must have already created it using the CLI or
--   console.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applications:RunJobFlow'</a>, <a>runJobFlow_applications</a> -
--   Applies to Amazon EMR releases 4.0 and later. A case-insensitive list
--   of applications for Amazon EMR to install and configure when launching
--   the cluster. For a list of applications available for each Amazon EMR
--   release version, see the <a>Amazon EMR Release Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:steps:RunJobFlow'</a>, <a>runJobFlow_steps</a> - A list of
--   steps to run.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stepConcurrencyLevel:RunJobFlow'</a>,
--   <a>runJobFlow_stepConcurrencyLevel</a> - Specifies the number of steps
--   that can be executed concurrently. The default value is <tt>1</tt>.
--   The maximum value is <tt>256</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportedProducts:RunJobFlow'</a>,
--   <a>runJobFlow_supportedProducts</a> - For Amazon EMR releases 3.x and
--   2.x. For Amazon EMR releases 4.x and later, use Applications.
--   
--   A list of strings that indicates third-party software to use. For more
--   information, see the <a>Amazon EMR Developer Guide</a>. Currently
--   supported values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>"mapr-m3" - launch the job flow using MapR M3 Edition.</li>
--   <li>"mapr-m5" - launch the job flow using MapR M5 Edition.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:visibleToAllUsers:RunJobFlow'</a>,
--   <a>runJobFlow_visibleToAllUsers</a> - Set this value to <tt>true</tt>
--   so that IAM principals in the Amazon Web Services account associated
--   with the cluster can perform EMR actions on the cluster that their IAM
--   policies allow. This value defaults to <tt>true</tt> for clusters
--   created using the EMR API or the CLI <a>create-cluster</a> command.
--   
--   When set to <tt>false</tt>, only the IAM principal that created the
--   cluster and the Amazon Web Services account root user can perform EMR
--   actions for the cluster, regardless of the IAM permissions policies
--   attached to other IAM principals. For more information, see
--   <a>Understanding the EMR Cluster VisibleToAllUsers Setting</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon EMRManagement Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customAmiId:RunJobFlow'</a>, <a>runJobFlow_customAmiId</a> -
--   Available only in Amazon EMR version 5.7.0 and later. The ID of a
--   custom Amazon EBS-backed Linux AMI. If specified, Amazon EMR uses this
--   AMI when it launches cluster EC2 instances. For more information about
--   custom AMIs in Amazon EMR, see <a>Using a Custom AMI</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon EMR Management Guide</i>. If omitted, the cluster uses the
--   base Linux AMI for the <tt>ReleaseLabel</tt> specified. For Amazon EMR
--   versions 2.x and 3.x, use <tt>AmiVersion</tt> instead.
--   
--   For information about creating a custom AMI, see <a>Creating an Amazon
--   EBS-Backed Linux AMI</a> in the <i>Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User
--   Guide for Linux Instances</i>. For information about finding an AMI
--   ID, see <a>Finding a Linux AMI</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoTerminationPolicy:RunJobFlow'</a>,
--   <a>runJobFlow_autoTerminationPolicy</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:managedScalingPolicy:RunJobFlow'</a>,
--   <a>runJobFlow_managedScalingPolicy</a> - The specified managed scaling
--   policy for an Amazon EMR cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logUri:RunJobFlow'</a>, <a>runJobFlow_logUri</a> - The
--   location in Amazon S3 to write the log files of the job flow. If a
--   value is not provided, logs are not created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:newSupportedProducts':RunJobFlow'</a>,
--   <a>runJobFlow_newSupportedProducts</a> - For Amazon EMR releases 3.x
--   and 2.x. For Amazon EMR releases 4.x and later, use Applications.
--   
--   A list of strings that indicates third-party software to use with the
--   job flow that accepts a user argument list. EMR accepts and forwards
--   the argument list to the corresponding installation script as
--   bootstrap action arguments. For more information, see "Launch a Job
--   Flow on the MapR Distribution for Hadoop" in the <a>Amazon EMR
--   Developer Guide</a>. Supported values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>"mapr-m3" - launch the cluster using MapR M3 Edition.</li>
--   <li>"mapr-m5" - launch the cluster using MapR M5 Edition.</li>
--   <li>"mapr" with the user arguments specifying "--edition,m3" or
--   "--edition,m5" - launch the job flow using MapR M3 or M5 Edition
--   respectively.</li>
--   <li>"mapr-m7" - launch the cluster using MapR M7 Edition.</li>
--   <li>"hunk" - launch the cluster with the Hunk Big Data Analytics
--   Platform.</li>
--   <li>"hue"- launch the cluster with Hue installed.</li>
--   <li>"spark" - launch the cluster with Apache Spark installed.</li>
--   <li>"ganglia" - launch the cluster with the Ganglia Monitoring System
--   installed.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:kerberosAttributes:RunJobFlow'</a>,
--   <a>runJobFlow_kerberosAttributes</a> - Attributes for Kerberos
--   configuration when Kerberos authentication is enabled using a security
--   configuration. For more information see <a>Use Kerberos
--   Authentication</a> in the <i>Amazon EMR Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:RunJobFlow'</a>, <a>runJobFlow_name</a> - The name of the
--   job flow.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instances:RunJobFlow'</a>, <a>runJobFlow_instances</a> - A
--   specification of the number and type of Amazon EC2 instances.
newRunJobFlow :: Text -> JobFlowInstancesConfig -> RunJobFlow

-- | Applies only when <tt>CustomAmiID</tt> is used. Specifies which
--   updates from the Amazon Linux AMI package repositories to apply
--   automatically when the instance boots using the AMI. If omitted, the
--   default is <tt>SECURITY</tt>, which indicates that only security
--   updates are applied. If <tt>NONE</tt> is specified, no updates are
--   applied, and all updates must be applied manually.
runJobFlow_repoUpgradeOnBoot :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe RepoUpgradeOnBoot)

-- | Applies only to Amazon EMR AMI versions 3.x and 2.x. For Amazon EMR
--   releases 4.0 and later, <tt>ReleaseLabel</tt> is used. To specify a
--   custom AMI, use <tt>CustomAmiID</tt>.
runJobFlow_amiVersion :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | The specified placement group configuration for an Amazon EMR cluster.
runJobFlow_placementGroupConfigs :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe [PlacementGroupConfig])

-- | A JSON string for selecting additional features.
runJobFlow_additionalInfo :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | The IAM role that Amazon EMR assumes in order to access Amazon Web
--   Services resources on your behalf.
runJobFlow_serviceRole :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | An IAM role for automatic scaling policies. The default role is
--   <tt>EMR_AutoScaling_DefaultRole</tt>. The IAM role provides
--   permissions that the automatic scaling feature requires to launch and
--   terminate EC2 instances in an instance group.
runJobFlow_autoScalingRole :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the way that individual Amazon EC2 instances terminate when
--   an automatic scale-in activity occurs or an instance group is resized.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_INSTANCE_HOUR</tt> indicates that Amazon EMR
--   terminates nodes at the instance-hour boundary, regardless of when the
--   request to terminate the instance was submitted. This option is only
--   available with Amazon EMR 5.1.0 and later and is the default for
--   clusters created using that version.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> indicates that Amazon EMR adds
--   nodes to a deny list and drains tasks from nodes before terminating
--   the Amazon EC2 instances, regardless of the instance-hour boundary.
--   With either behavior, Amazon EMR removes the least active nodes first
--   and blocks instance termination if it could lead to HDFS corruption.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> available only in Amazon EMR
--   version 4.1.0 and later, and is the default for versions of Amazon EMR
--   earlier than 5.1.0.
runJobFlow_scaleDownBehavior :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe ScaleDownBehavior)

-- | The name of a security configuration to apply to the cluster.
runJobFlow_securityConfiguration :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | For Amazon EMR releases 4.0 and later. The list of configurations
--   supplied for the EMR cluster you are creating.
runJobFlow_configurations :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe [Configuration])

-- | The size, in GiB, of the Amazon EBS root device volume of the Linux
--   AMI that is used for each EC2 instance. Available in Amazon EMR
--   version 4.x and later.
runJobFlow_ebsRootVolumeSize :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Int)

-- | The Amazon EMR release label, which determines the version of
--   open-source application packages installed on the cluster. Release
--   labels are in the form <tt>emr-x.x.x</tt>, where x.x.x is an Amazon
--   EMR release version such as <tt>emr-5.14.0</tt>. For more information
--   about Amazon EMR release versions and included application versions
--   and features, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ReleaseGuide/</a>. The
--   release label applies only to Amazon EMR releases version 4.0 and
--   later. Earlier versions use <tt>AmiVersion</tt>.
runJobFlow_releaseLabel :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of bootstrap actions to run before Hadoop starts on the cluster
--   nodes.
runJobFlow_bootstrapActions :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe [BootstrapActionConfig])

-- | The KMS key used for encrypting log files. If a value is not provided,
--   the logs remain encrypted by AES-256. This attribute is only available
--   with Amazon EMR version 5.30.0 and later, excluding Amazon EMR 6.0.0.
runJobFlow_logEncryptionKmsKeyId :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags to associate with a cluster and propagate to Amazon EC2
--   instances.
runJobFlow_tags :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe [Tag])

-- | Also called instance profile and EC2 role. An IAM role for an EMR
--   cluster. The EC2 instances of the cluster assume this role. The
--   default role is <tt>EMR_EC2_DefaultRole</tt>. In order to use the
--   default role, you must have already created it using the CLI or
--   console.
runJobFlow_jobFlowRole :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | Applies to Amazon EMR releases 4.0 and later. A case-insensitive list
--   of applications for Amazon EMR to install and configure when launching
--   the cluster. For a list of applications available for each Amazon EMR
--   release version, see the <a>Amazon EMR Release Guide</a>.
runJobFlow_applications :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe [Application])

-- | A list of steps to run.
runJobFlow_steps :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe [StepConfig])

-- | Specifies the number of steps that can be executed concurrently. The
--   default value is <tt>1</tt>. The maximum value is <tt>256</tt>.
runJobFlow_stepConcurrencyLevel :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Int)

-- | For Amazon EMR releases 3.x and 2.x. For Amazon EMR releases 4.x and
--   later, use Applications.
--   
--   A list of strings that indicates third-party software to use. For more
--   information, see the <a>Amazon EMR Developer Guide</a>. Currently
--   supported values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>"mapr-m3" - launch the job flow using MapR M3 Edition.</li>
--   <li>"mapr-m5" - launch the job flow using MapR M5 Edition.</li>
--   </ul>
runJobFlow_supportedProducts :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe [Text])

-- | Set this value to <tt>true</tt> so that IAM principals in the Amazon
--   Web Services account associated with the cluster can perform EMR
--   actions on the cluster that their IAM policies allow. This value
--   defaults to <tt>true</tt> for clusters created using the EMR API or
--   the CLI <a>create-cluster</a> command.
--   
--   When set to <tt>false</tt>, only the IAM principal that created the
--   cluster and the Amazon Web Services account root user can perform EMR
--   actions for the cluster, regardless of the IAM permissions policies
--   attached to other IAM principals. For more information, see
--   <a>Understanding the EMR Cluster VisibleToAllUsers Setting</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon EMRManagement Guide</i>.
runJobFlow_visibleToAllUsers :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Bool)

-- | Available only in Amazon EMR version 5.7.0 and later. The ID of a
--   custom Amazon EBS-backed Linux AMI. If specified, Amazon EMR uses this
--   AMI when it launches cluster EC2 instances. For more information about
--   custom AMIs in Amazon EMR, see <a>Using a Custom AMI</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon EMR Management Guide</i>. If omitted, the cluster uses the
--   base Linux AMI for the <tt>ReleaseLabel</tt> specified. For Amazon EMR
--   versions 2.x and 3.x, use <tt>AmiVersion</tt> instead.
--   
--   For information about creating a custom AMI, see <a>Creating an Amazon
--   EBS-Backed Linux AMI</a> in the <i>Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User
--   Guide for Linux Instances</i>. For information about finding an AMI
--   ID, see <a>Finding a Linux AMI</a>.
runJobFlow_customAmiId :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
runJobFlow_autoTerminationPolicy :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe AutoTerminationPolicy)

-- | The specified managed scaling policy for an Amazon EMR cluster.
runJobFlow_managedScalingPolicy :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe ManagedScalingPolicy)

-- | The location in Amazon S3 to write the log files of the job flow. If a
--   value is not provided, logs are not created.
runJobFlow_logUri :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | For Amazon EMR releases 3.x and 2.x. For Amazon EMR releases 4.x and
--   later, use Applications.
--   
--   A list of strings that indicates third-party software to use with the
--   job flow that accepts a user argument list. EMR accepts and forwards
--   the argument list to the corresponding installation script as
--   bootstrap action arguments. For more information, see "Launch a Job
--   Flow on the MapR Distribution for Hadoop" in the <a>Amazon EMR
--   Developer Guide</a>. Supported values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>"mapr-m3" - launch the cluster using MapR M3 Edition.</li>
--   <li>"mapr-m5" - launch the cluster using MapR M5 Edition.</li>
--   <li>"mapr" with the user arguments specifying "--edition,m3" or
--   "--edition,m5" - launch the job flow using MapR M3 or M5 Edition
--   respectively.</li>
--   <li>"mapr-m7" - launch the cluster using MapR M7 Edition.</li>
--   <li>"hunk" - launch the cluster with the Hunk Big Data Analytics
--   Platform.</li>
--   <li>"hue"- launch the cluster with Hue installed.</li>
--   <li>"spark" - launch the cluster with Apache Spark installed.</li>
--   <li>"ganglia" - launch the cluster with the Ganglia Monitoring System
--   installed.</li>
--   </ul>
runJobFlow_newSupportedProducts :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe [SupportedProductConfig])

-- | Attributes for Kerberos configuration when Kerberos authentication is
--   enabled using a security configuration. For more information see
--   <a>Use Kerberos Authentication</a> in the <i>Amazon EMR Management
--   Guide</i>.
runJobFlow_kerberosAttributes :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe KerberosAttributes)

-- | The name of the job flow.
runJobFlow_name :: Lens' RunJobFlow Text

-- | A specification of the number and type of Amazon EC2 instances.
runJobFlow_instances :: Lens' RunJobFlow JobFlowInstancesConfig

-- | The result of the RunJobFlow operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRunJobFlowResponse</a> smart constructor.
data RunJobFlowResponse
RunJobFlowResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Int -> RunJobFlowResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster.
[$sel:clusterArn:RunJobFlowResponse'] :: RunJobFlowResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique identifier for the job flow.
[$sel:jobFlowId:RunJobFlowResponse'] :: RunJobFlowResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:RunJobFlowResponse'] :: RunJobFlowResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>RunJobFlowResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterArn:RunJobFlowResponse'</a>,
--   <a>runJobFlowResponse_clusterArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobFlowId:RunJobFlowResponse'</a>,
--   <a>runJobFlowResponse_jobFlowId</a> - A unique identifier for the job
--   flow.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:RunJobFlowResponse'</a>,
--   <a>runJobFlowResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newRunJobFlowResponse :: Int -> RunJobFlowResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster.
runJobFlowResponse_clusterArn :: Lens' RunJobFlowResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique identifier for the job flow.
runJobFlowResponse_jobFlowId :: Lens' RunJobFlowResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
runJobFlowResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' RunJobFlowResponse Int

-- | Removes tags from an Amazon EMR resource, such as a cluster or Amazon
--   EMR Studio. Tags make it easier to associate resources in various
--   ways, such as grouping clusters to track your Amazon EMR resource
--   allocation costs. For more information, see <a>Tag Clusters</a>.
--   
--   The following example removes the stack tag with value Prod from a
--   cluster:
module Network.AWS.EMR.RemoveTags

-- | This input identifies an Amazon EMR resource and a list of tags to
--   remove.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRemoveTags</a> smart constructor.
data RemoveTags
RemoveTags' :: Text -> [Text] -> RemoveTags

-- | The Amazon EMR resource identifier from which tags will be removed.
--   For example, a cluster identifier or an Amazon EMR Studio ID.
[$sel:resourceId:RemoveTags'] :: RemoveTags -> Text

-- | A list of tag keys to remove from the resource.

-- | Creates or updates a managed scaling policy for an Amazon EMR cluster.
--   The managed scaling policy defines the limits for resources, such as
--   EC2 instances that can be added or terminated from a cluster. The
--   policy only applies to the core and task nodes. The master node cannot
--   be scaled after initial configuration.
module Network.AWS.EMR.PutManagedScalingPolicy

-- | Creates or updates an Amazon EMR block public access configuration for
--   your Amazon Web Services account in the current Region. For more
--   information see <a>Configure Block Public Access for Amazon EMR</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon EMR Management Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.EMR.PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration
PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration' :: BlockPublicAccessConfiguration -> PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration

-- | A configuration for Amazon EMR block public access. The configuration
--   applies to all clusters created in your account for the current
--   Region. The configuration specifies whether block public access is
--   enabled. If block public access is enabled, security groups associated
--   with the cluster cannot have rules that allow inbound traffic from
--   0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 on a port, unless the port is specified as an
--   exception using <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt> in the
--   <tt>BlockPublicAccessConfiguration</tt>. By default, Port 22 (SSH) is
--   an exception, and public access is allowed on this port. You can
--   change this by updating <tt>BlockPublicSecurityGroupRules</tt> to
--   remove the exception.
--   
--   For accounts that created clusters in a Region before November 25,
--   2019, block public access is disabled by default in that Region. To
--   use this feature, you must manually enable and configure it. For
--   accounts that did not create an EMR cluster in a Region before this
--   date, block public access is enabled by default in that Region.
[$sel:blockPublicAccessConfiguration:PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration'] :: PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration -> BlockPublicAccessConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockPublicAccessConfiguration:PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>putBlockPublicAccessConfiguration_blockPublicAccessConfiguration</a>
--   - A configuration for Amazon EMR block public access. The
--   configuration applies to all clusters created in your account for the
--   current Region. The configuration specifies whether block public
--   access is enabled. If block public access is enabled, security groups
--   associated with the cluster cannot have rules that allow inbound
--   traffic from 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 on a port, unless the port is specified
--   as an exception using <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>
--   in the <tt>BlockPublicAccessConfiguration</tt>. By default, Port 22
--   (SSH) is an exception, and public access is allowed on this port. You
--   can change this by updating <tt>BlockPublicSecurityGroupRules</tt> to
--   remove the exception.
--   
--   For accounts that created clusters in a Region before November 25,
--   2019, block public access is disabled by default in that Region. To
--   use this feature, you must manually enable and configure it. For
--   accounts that did not create an EMR cluster in a Region before this
--   date, block public access is enabled by default in that Region.
newPutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration :: BlockPublicAccessConfiguration -> PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration

-- | A configuration for Amazon EMR block public access. The configuration
--   applies to all clusters created in your account for the current
--   Region. The configuration specifies whether block public access is
--   enabled. If block public access is enabled, security groups associated
--   with the cluster cannot have rules that allow inbound traffic from
--   0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 on a port, unless the port is specified as an
--   exception using <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt> in the
--   <tt>BlockPublicAccessConfiguration</tt>. By default, Port 22 (SSH) is
--   an exception, and public access is allowed on this port. You can
--   change this by updating <tt>BlockPublicSecurityGroupRules</tt> to
--   remove the exception.
--   
--   For accounts that created clusters in a Region before November 25,
--   2019, block public access is disabled by default in that Region. To
--   use this feature, you must manually enable and configure it. For
--   accounts that did not create an EMR cluster in a Region before this
--   date, block public access is enabled by default in that Region.
putBlockPublicAccessConfiguration_blockPublicAccessConfiguration :: Lens' PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration BlockPublicAccessConfiguration

-- | Creates or updates an auto-termination policy for an Amazon EMR
--   cluster. An auto-termination policy defines the amount of idle time in
--   seconds after which a cluster automatically terminates. For
--   alternative cluster termination options, see <a>Control cluster
--   termination</a>.
module Network.AWS.EMR.PutAutoTerminationPolicy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutAutoTerminationPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data PutAutoTerminationPolicy
PutAutoTerminationPolicy' :: Maybe AutoTerminationPolicy -> Text -> PutAutoTerminationPolicy

-- | Specifies the auto-termination policy to attach to the cluster.
[$sel:autoTerminationPolicy:PutAutoTerminationPolicy'] :: PutAutoTerminationPolicy -> Maybe AutoTerminationPolicy

-- | Creates or updates an automatic scaling policy for a core instance
--   group or task instance group in an Amazon EMR cluster. The automatic
--   scaling policy defines how an instance group dynamically adds and
--   terminates EC2 instances in response to the value of a CloudWatch
--   metric.

-- | Modifies the number of steps that can be executed concurrently for the
--   cluster specified using ClusterID.
module Network.AWS.EMR.ModifyCluster

data ModifyCluster
ModifyCluster' :: Maybe Int -> Text -> ModifyCluster

-- | The number of steps that can be executed concurrently. You can specify
--   a minimum of 1 step and a maximum of 256 steps. We recommend that you
--   do not change this parameter while steps are running or the
--   <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> setting may not behave as expected. For more
--   information see Step$ActionOnFailure.
[$sel:stepConcurrencyLevel:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Int

-- | The unique identifier of the cluster.

--   can be executed concurrently. You can specify a minimum of 1 step and
--   a maximum of 256 steps. We recommend that you do not change this
--   parameter while steps are running or the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt>
--   setting may not behave as expected. For more information see
--   Step$ActionOnFailure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterId:ModifyCluster'</a>, <a>modifyCluster_clusterId</a> -
--   The unique identifier of the cluster.

-- | Returns a list of all Amazon EMR Studios associated with the Amazon
--   Web Services account. The list includes details such as ID, Studio
--   Access URL, and creation time for each Studio.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

-- | Returns a list of all user or group session mappings for the Amazon
--   EMR Studio specified by <tt>StudioId</tt>.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.EMR.ListStudioSessionMappings

ListStudioSessionMappings' :: Maybe IdentityType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ListStudioSessionMappings

-- | Specifies whether to return session mappings for users or groups. If
--   not specified, the results include session mapping details for both
--   users and groups.

-- | Provides a list of steps for the cluster in reverse order unless you
--   specify <tt>stepIds</tt> with the request or filter by
--   <tt>StepStates</tt>. You can specify a maximum of 10 <tt>stepIDs</tt>.
--   The CLI automatically paginates results to return a list greater than
--   50 steps. To return more than 50 steps using the CLI, specify a
--   <tt>Marker</tt>, which is a pagination token that indicates the next
--   set of steps to retrieve.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.EMR.ListSteps

-- | This input determines which steps to list.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListSteps</a> smart constructor.
data ListSteps
ListSteps' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [StepState] -> Maybe Text -> Text -> ListSteps

-- | The filter to limit the step list based on the identifier of the
--   steps. You can specify a maximum of ten Step IDs. The character
--   constraint applies to the overall length of the array.
[$sel:stepIds:ListSteps'] :: ListSteps -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The filter to limit the step list based on certain states.
[$sel:stepStates:ListSteps'] :: ListSteps -> Maybe [StepState]

-- | The maximum number of steps that a single <tt>ListSteps</tt> action
--   returns is 50. To return a longer list of steps, use multiple
--   <tt>ListSteps</tt> actions along with the <tt>Marker</tt> parameter,
--   which is a pagination token that indicates the next set of results to
--   retrieve.
[$sel:marker:ListSteps'] :: ListSteps -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the cluster for which to list the steps.
[$sel:clusterId:ListSteps'] :: ListSteps -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListSteps</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stepIds:ListSteps'</a>, <a>listSteps_stepIds</a> - The filter
--   to limit the step list based on the identifier of the steps. You can
--   specify a maximum of ten Step IDs. The character constraint applies to
--   the overall length of the array.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stepStates:ListSteps'</a>, <a>listSteps_stepStates</a> - The
--   filter to limit the step list based on certain states.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:ListSteps'</a>, <a>listSteps_marker</a> - The maximum
--   number of steps that a single <tt>ListSteps</tt> action returns is 50.
--   To return a longer list of steps, use multiple <tt>ListSteps</tt>
--   actions along with the <tt>Marker</tt> parameter, which is a
--   pagination token that indicates the next set of results to retrieve.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterId:ListSteps'</a>, <a>listSteps_clusterId</a> - The
--   identifier of the cluster for which to list the steps.
newListSteps :: Text -> ListSteps

-- | The filter to limit the step list based on the identifier of the
--   steps. You can specify a maximum of ten Step IDs. The character
--   constraint applies to the overall length of the array.
listSteps_stepIds :: Lens' ListSteps (Maybe [Text])

-- | The filter to limit the step list based on certain states.
listSteps_stepStates :: Lens' ListSteps (Maybe [StepState])

-- | The maximum number of steps that a single <tt>ListSteps</tt> action
--   returns is 50. To return a longer list of steps, use multiple
--   <tt>ListSteps</tt> actions along with the <tt>Marker</tt> parameter,
--   which is a pagination token that indicates the next set of results to
--   retrieve.
listSteps_marker :: Lens' ListSteps (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the cluster for which to list the steps.
listSteps_clusterId :: Lens' ListSteps Text

-- | This output contains the list of steps returned in reverse order. This
--   means that the last step is the first element in the list.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListStepsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListStepsResponse
ListStepsResponse' :: Maybe [StepSummary] -> Maybe Text -> Int -> ListStepsResponse

-- | The filtered list of steps for the cluster.
[$sel:steps:ListStepsResponse'] :: ListStepsResponse -> Maybe [StepSummary]

-- | The maximum number of steps that a single <tt>ListSteps</tt> action
--   returns is 50. To return a longer list of steps, use multiple
--   <tt>ListSteps</tt> actions along with the <tt>Marker</tt> parameter,
--   which is a pagination token that indicates the next set of results to
--   retrieve.
[$sel:marker:ListStepsResponse'] :: ListStepsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListStepsResponse'] :: ListStepsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListStepsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:steps:ListStepsResponse'</a>, <a>listStepsResponse_steps</a> -
--   The filtered list of steps for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:ListSteps'</a>, <a>listStepsResponse_marker</a> - The
--   maximum number of steps that a single <tt>ListSteps</tt> action
--   returns is 50. To return a longer list of steps, use multiple
--   <tt>ListSteps</tt> actions along with the <tt>Marker</tt> parameter,
--   which is a pagination token that indicates the next set of results to
--   retrieve.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListStepsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listStepsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status code.
newListStepsResponse :: Int -> ListStepsResponse

-- | The filtered list of steps for the cluster.
listStepsResponse_steps :: Lens' ListStepsResponse (Maybe [StepSummary])

-- | The maximum number of steps that a single <tt>ListSteps</tt> action
--   returns is 50. To return a longer list of steps, use multiple

--   which is a pagination token that indicates the next set of results to
--   retrieve.

-- | Retrieves release labels of EMR services in the region where the API
--   is called.
module Network.AWS.EMR.ListReleaseLabels

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListReleaseLabels</a> smart constructor.
data ListReleaseLabels
ListReleaseLabels' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe ReleaseLabelFilter -> ListReleaseLabels

-- | Specifies the next page of results. If <tt>NextToken</tt> is not
--   specified, which is usually the case for the first request of
--   ListReleaseLabels, the first page of results are determined by other
--   filtering parameters or by the latest version. The
--   <tt>ListReleaseLabels</tt> request fails if the identity (Amazon Web
--   Services account ID) and all filtering parameters are different from
--   the original request, or if the <tt>NextToken</tt> is expired or
--   tampered with.
[$sel:nextToken:ListReleaseLabels'] :: ListReleaseLabels -> Maybe Text

-- | Defines the maximum number of release labels to return in a single
--   response. The default is <tt>100</tt>.
[$sel:maxResults:ListReleaseLabels'] :: ListReleaseLabels -> Maybe Natural

-- | Filters the results of the request. <tt>Prefix</tt> specifies the
--   prefix of release labels to return. <tt>Application</tt> specifies the
--   application (with/without version) of release labels to return.
[$sel:filters:ListReleaseLabels'] :: ListReleaseLabels -> Maybe ReleaseLabelFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>ListReleaseLabels</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListReleaseLabels'</a>,
--   <a>listReleaseLabels_nextToken</a> - Specifies the next page of
--   results. If <tt>NextToken</tt> is not specified, which is usually the
--   case for the first request of ListReleaseLabels, the first page of
--   results are determined by other filtering parameters or by the latest
--   version. The <tt>ListReleaseLabels</tt> request fails if the identity
--   (Amazon Web Services account ID) and all filtering parameters are
--   different from the original request, or if the <tt>NextToken</tt> is
--   expired or tampered with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListReleaseLabels'</a>,
--   <a>listReleaseLabels_maxResults</a> - Defines the maximum number of
--   release labels to return in a single response. The default is
--   <tt>100</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:ListReleaseLabels'</a>,
--   <a>listReleaseLabels_filters</a> - Filters the results of the request.
--   <tt>Prefix</tt> specifies the prefix of release labels to return.
--   <tt>Application</tt> specifies the application (with/without version)
--   of release labels to return.
newListReleaseLabels :: ListReleaseLabels

-- | Specifies the next page of results. If <tt>NextToken</tt> is not
--   specified, which is usually the case for the first request of
--   ListReleaseLabels, the first page of results are determined by other
--   filtering parameters or by the latest version. The
--   <tt>ListReleaseLabels</tt> request fails if the identity (Amazon Web
--   Services account ID) and all filtering parameters are different from
--   the original request, or if the <tt>NextToken</tt> is expired or
--   tampered with.
listReleaseLabels_nextToken :: Lens' ListReleaseLabels (Maybe Text)

-- | Defines the maximum number of release labels to return in a single
--   response. The default is <tt>100</tt>.
listReleaseLabels_maxResults :: Lens' ListReleaseLabels (Maybe Natural)

-- | Filters the results of the request. <tt>Prefix</tt> specifies the
--   prefix of release labels to return. <tt>Application</tt> specifies the
--   application (with/without version) of release labels to return.
listReleaseLabels_filters :: Lens' ListReleaseLabels (Maybe ReleaseLabelFilter)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListReleaseLabelsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListReleaseLabelsResponse
ListReleaseLabelsResponse' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Int -> ListReleaseLabelsResponse

-- | The returned release labels.
[$sel:releaseLabels:ListReleaseLabelsResponse'] :: ListReleaseLabelsResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Used to paginate the next page of results if specified in the next
--   <tt>ListReleaseLabels</tt> request.
[$sel:nextToken:ListReleaseLabelsResponse'] :: ListReleaseLabelsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListReleaseLabelsResponse'] :: ListReleaseLabelsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListReleaseLabelsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   labels.
--

--   <a>listReleaseLabelsResponse_nextToken</a> - Used to paginate the next
--   page of results if specified in the next <tt>ListReleaseLabels</tt>
--   request.
--

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.EMR.ListReleaseLabels.ListReleaseLabels

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.EMR.ListReleaseLabels.ListReleaseLabels


-- | Provides summaries of all notebook executions. You can filter the list
--   based on multiple criteria such as status, time range, and editor id.
--   Returns a maximum of 50 notebook executions and a marker to track the
--   paging of a longer notebook execution list across multiple
--   <tt>ListNotebookExecution</tt> calls.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.EMR.ListNotebookExecutions

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListNotebookExecutions</a> smart constructor.
data ListNotebookExecutions
ListNotebookExecutions' :: Maybe NotebookExecutionStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> ListNotebookExecutions

-- | The status filter for listing notebook executions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>START_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received the
--   execution request but execution has not begun.</li>
--   <li><tt>STARTING</tt> indicates that the execution is starting on the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> indicates that the execution is being processed
--   by the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHING</tt> indicates that execution processing is in the
--   final stages.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHED</tt> indicates that the execution has completed
--   without error.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILING</tt> indicates that the execution is failing and will
--   not finish successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> indicates that the execution failed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOP_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request and the stop is pending.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt> indicates that the cluster is in the process of
--   stopping the execution as a result of a <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt>
--   request.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt> indicates that the execution stopped because of a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:ListNotebookExecutions'] :: ListNotebookExecutions -> Maybe NotebookExecutionStatus

-- | The unique ID of the editor associated with the notebook execution.
[$sel:editorId:ListNotebookExecutions'] :: ListNotebookExecutions -> Maybe Text

-- | The end of time range filter for listing notebook executions. The
--   default is the current timestamp.
[$sel:to:ListNotebookExecutions'] :: ListNotebookExecutions -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The beginning of time range filter for listing notebook executions.
--   The default is the timestamp of 30 days ago.
[$sel:from:ListNotebookExecutions'] :: ListNotebookExecutions -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The pagination token, returned by a previous
--   <tt>ListNotebookExecutions</tt> call, that indicates the start of the
--   list for this <tt>ListNotebookExecutions</tt> call.
[$sel:marker:ListNotebookExecutions'] :: ListNotebookExecutions -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListNotebookExecutions</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ListNotebookExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>listNotebookExecutions_status</a> - The status filter for listing
--   notebook executions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>START_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received the
--   execution request but execution has not begun.</li>
--   <li><tt>STARTING</tt> indicates that the execution is starting on the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> indicates that the execution is being processed
--   by the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHING</tt> indicates that execution processing is in the
--   final stages.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHED</tt> indicates that the execution has completed
--   without error.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILING</tt> indicates that the execution is failing and will
--   not finish successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> indicates that the execution failed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOP_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request and the stop is pending.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt> indicates that the cluster is in the process of
--   stopping the execution as a result of a <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt>
--   request.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt> indicates that the execution stopped because of a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:editorId:ListNotebookExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>listNotebookExecutions_editorId</a> - The unique ID of the editor
--   associated with the notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:to:ListNotebookExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>listNotebookExecutions_to</a> - The end of time range filter for
--   listing notebook executions. The default is the current timestamp.
--   
--   <a>$sel:from:ListNotebookExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>listNotebookExecutions_from</a> - The beginning of time range
--   filter for listing notebook executions. The default is the timestamp
--   of 30 days ago.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:ListNotebookExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>listNotebookExecutions_marker</a> - The pagination token, returned
--   by a previous <tt>ListNotebookExecutions</tt> call, that indicates the
--   start of the list for this <tt>ListNotebookExecutions</tt> call.
newListNotebookExecutions :: ListNotebookExecutions

-- | The status filter for listing notebook executions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>START_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received the
--   execution request but execution has not begun.</li>
--   <li><tt>STARTING</tt> indicates that the execution is starting on the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> indicates that the execution is being processed
--   by the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHING</tt> indicates that execution processing is in the
--   final stages.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHED</tt> indicates that the execution has completed
--   without error.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILING</tt> indicates that the execution is failing and will
--   not finish successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> indicates that the execution failed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOP_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request and the stop is pending.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt> indicates that the cluster is in the process of
--   stopping the execution as a result of a <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt>
--   request.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt> indicates that the execution stopped because of a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request.</li>
--   </ul>
listNotebookExecutions_status :: Lens' ListNotebookExecutions (Maybe NotebookExecutionStatus)

-- | The unique ID of the editor associated with the notebook execution.
listNotebookExecutions_editorId :: Lens' ListNotebookExecutions (Maybe Text)

-- | The end of time range filter for listing notebook executions. The
--   default is the current timestamp.
listNotebookExecutions_to :: Lens' ListNotebookExecutions (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The beginning of time range filter for listing notebook executions.
--   The default is the timestamp of 30 days ago.
listNotebookExecutions_from :: Lens' ListNotebookExecutions (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The pagination token, returned by a previous
--   <tt>ListNotebookExecutions</tt> call, that indicates the start of the
--   list for this <tt>ListNotebookExecutions</tt> call.
listNotebookExecutions_marker :: Lens' ListNotebookExecutions (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information for all active EC2 instances and EC2 instances
--   terminated in the last 30 days, up to a maximum of 2,000. EC2
--   instances in any of the following states are considered active:
--   AWAITING_FULFILLMENT, PROVISIONING, BOOTSTRAPPING, RUNNING.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.EMR.ListInstances

-- | This input determines which instances to list.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListInstances</a> smart constructor.
data ListInstances
ListInstances' :: Maybe InstanceFleetType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InstanceState] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InstanceGroupType] -> Maybe Text -> Text -> ListInstances

-- | The node type of the instance fleet. For example MASTER, CORE, or
--   TASK.
[$sel:instanceFleetType:ListInstances'] :: ListInstances -> Maybe InstanceFleetType

-- | The identifier of the instance group for which to list the instances.
[$sel:instanceGroupId:ListInstances'] :: ListInstances -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of instance states that will filter the instances returned with
--   this request.
[$sel:instanceStates:ListInstances'] :: ListInstances -> Maybe [InstanceState]

-- | The unique identifier of the instance fleet.
[$sel:instanceFleetId:ListInstances'] :: ListInstances -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of instance group for which to list the instances.
[$sel:instanceGroupTypes:ListInstances'] :: ListInstances -> Maybe [InstanceGroupType]

-- | The pagination token that indicates the next set of results to
--   retrieve.
[$sel:marker:ListInstances'] :: ListInstances -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the cluster for which to list the instances.
[$sel:clusterId:ListInstances'] :: ListInstances -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListInstances</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   fleet. For example MASTER, CORE, or TASK.

--   group for which to list the instances.

--   will filter the instances returned with this request.

--   The identifier of the cluster for which to list the instances.

-- | Lists all available details about the instance fleets in a cluster.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.EMR.ListInstanceFleets

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListInstanceFleets</a> smart constructor.

--   the next set of results to retrieve.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterId:ListInstanceFleets'</a>,

--   cluster.

-- | Provides the status of all clusters visible to this Amazon Web
--   Services account. Allows you to filter the list of clusters based on
--   certain criteria; for example, filtering by cluster creation date and
--   time or by status. This call returns a maximum of 50 clusters in
--   unsorted order per call, but returns a marker to track the paging of
--   the cluster list across multiple ListClusters calls.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.EMR.ListClusters

-- | This input determines how the ListClusters action filters the list of
--   clusters that it returns.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListClusters</a> smart constructor.
data ListClusters
ListClusters' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [ClusterState] -> Maybe Text -> ListClusters

-- | The creation date and time beginning value filter for listing
--   clusters.
[$sel:createdAfter:ListClusters'] :: ListClusters -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The creation date and time end value filter for listing clusters.
[$sel:createdBefore:ListClusters'] :: ListClusters -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The cluster state filters to apply when listing clusters. Clusters
--   that change state while this action runs may be not be returned as
--   expected in the list of clusters.
[$sel:clusterStates:ListClusters'] :: ListClusters -> Maybe [ClusterState]

-- | The pagination token that indicates the next set of results to
--   retrieve.
[$sel:marker:ListClusters'] :: ListClusters -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListClusters</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   beginning value filter for listing clusters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdBefore:ListClusters'</a>,
--   <a>listClusters_createdBefore</a> - The creation date and time end
--   value filter for listing clusters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterStates:ListClusters'</a>,
--   <a>listClusters_clusterStates</a> - The cluster state filters to apply
--   when listing clusters. Clusters that change state while this action
--   runs may be not be returned as expected in the list of clusters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:ListClusters'</a>, <a>listClusters_marker</a> - The
--   pagination token that indicates the next set of results to retrieve.

-- | The creation date and time beginning value filter for listing
--   clusters.

-- | The creation date and time end value filter for listing clusters.

--   retrieve.

newGetBlockPublicAccessConfiguration :: GetBlockPublicAccessConfiguration

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse
GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse' :: Int -> BlockPublicAccessConfiguration -> BlockPublicAccessConfigurationMetadata -> GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse'] :: GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse -> Int

-- | A configuration for Amazon EMR block public access. The configuration
--   applies to all clusters created in your account for the current
--   Region. The configuration specifies whether block public access is
--   enabled. If block public access is enabled, security groups associated
--   with the cluster cannot have rules that allow inbound traffic from
--   0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 on a port, unless the port is specified as an
--   exception using <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt> in the
--   <tt>BlockPublicAccessConfiguration</tt>. By default, Port 22 (SSH) is
--   an exception, and public access is allowed on this port. You can
--   change this by updating the block public access configuration to
--   remove the exception.
--   
--   For accounts that created clusters in a Region before November 25,
--   2019, block public access is disabled by default in that Region. To
--   use this feature, you must manually enable and configure it. For
--   accounts that did not create an EMR cluster in a Region before this
--   date, block public access is enabled by default in that Region.
[$sel:blockPublicAccessConfiguration:GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse'] :: GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse -> BlockPublicAccessConfiguration

-- | Properties that describe the Amazon Web Services principal that
--   created the <tt>BlockPublicAccessConfiguration</tt> using the
--   <tt>PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration</tt> action as well as the date
--   and time that the configuration was created. Each time a configuration
--   for block public access is updated, Amazon EMR updates this metadata.
[$sel:blockPublicAccessConfigurationMetadata:GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse'] :: GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse -> BlockPublicAccessConfigurationMetadata

-- | Create a value of <a>GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse</a>

--   optional fields omitted.

--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:DescribeReleaseLabel'</a>,
--   <a>describeReleaseLabelResponse_nextToken</a> - The pagination token.
--   Reserved for future use. Currently set to null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:releaseLabel:DescribeReleaseLabel'</a>,
--   <a>describeReleaseLabelResponse_releaseLabel</a> - The target release
--   label described in the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applications:DescribeReleaseLabelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeReleaseLabelResponse_applications</a> - The list of
--   applications available for the target release label. <tt>Name</tt> is
--   the name of the application. <tt>Version</tt> is the concise version
--   of the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeReleaseLabelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeReleaseLabelResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDescribeReleaseLabelResponse :: Int -> DescribeReleaseLabelResponse

-- | The pagination token. Reserved for future use. Currently set to null.
describeReleaseLabelResponse_nextToken :: Lens' DescribeReleaseLabelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The target release label described in the response.
describeReleaseLabelResponse_releaseLabel :: Lens' DescribeReleaseLabelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of applications available for the target release label.
--   <tt>Name</tt> is the name of the application. <tt>Version</tt> is the
--   concise version of the application.
describeReleaseLabelResponse_applications :: Lens' DescribeReleaseLabelResponse (Maybe [SimplifiedApplication])

-- | The response's http status code.
describeReleaseLabelResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeReleaseLabelResponse Int

-- | Maps a user or group to the Amazon EMR Studio specified by
--   <tt>StudioId</tt>, and applies a session policy to refine Studio
--   permissions for that user or group. Use
--   <tt>CreateStudioSessionMapping</tt> to assign users to a Studio when
--   you use Amazon Web Services SSO authentication. For instructions on
--   how to assign users to a Studio when you use IAM authentication, see
--   <a>Assign a user or group to your EMR Studio</a>.
module Network.AWS.EMR.CreateStudioSessionMapping

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateStudioSessionMapping</a> smart constructor.
data CreateStudioSessionMapping
CreateStudioSessionMapping' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> IdentityType -> Text -> CreateStudioSessionMapping

-- | The name of the user or group. For more information, see
--   <a>UserName</a> and <a>DisplayName</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services
--   SSO Identity Store API Reference</i>. Either <tt>IdentityName</tt> or
--   <tt>IdentityId</tt> must be specified, but not both.
[$sel:identityName:CreateStudioSessionMapping'] :: CreateStudioSessionMapping -> Maybe Text

-- | The globally unique identifier (GUID) of the user or group from the
--   Amazon Web Services SSO Identity Store. For more information, see
--   <a>UserId</a> and <a>GroupId</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services SSO
--   Identity Store API Reference</i>. Either <tt>IdentityName</tt> or
--   <tt>IdentityId</tt> must be specified, but not both.
[$sel:identityId:CreateStudioSessionMapping'] :: CreateStudioSessionMapping -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio to which the user or group will be
--   mapped.
[$sel:studioId:CreateStudioSessionMapping'] :: CreateStudioSessionMapping -> Text

-- | Specifies whether the identity to map to the Amazon EMR Studio is a
--   user or a group.
[$sel:identityType:CreateStudioSessionMapping'] :: CreateStudioSessionMapping -> IdentityType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the session policy that will be
--   applied to the user or group. You should specify the ARN for the
--   session policy that you want to apply, not the ARN of your user role.
--   For more information, see <a>Create an EMR Studio User Role with
--   Session Policies</a>.
[$sel:sessionPolicyArn:CreateStudioSessionMapping'] :: CreateStudioSessionMapping -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateStudioSessionMapping</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityName:CreateStudioSessionMapping'</a>,
--   <a>createStudioSessionMapping_identityName</a> - The name of the user
--   or group. For more information, see <a>UserName</a> and
--   <a>DisplayName</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services SSO Identity Store
--   API Reference</i>. Either <tt>IdentityName</tt> or <tt>IdentityId</tt>
--   must be specified, but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityId:CreateStudioSessionMapping'</a>,
--   <a>createStudioSessionMapping_identityId</a> - The globally unique
--   identifier (GUID) of the user or group from the Amazon Web Services
--   SSO Identity Store. For more information, see <a>UserId</a> and
--   <a>GroupId</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services SSO Identity Store API
--   Reference</i>. Either <tt>IdentityName</tt> or <tt>IdentityId</tt>
--   must be specified, but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:studioId:CreateStudioSessionMapping'</a>,
--   <a>createStudioSessionMapping_studioId</a> - The ID of the Amazon EMR
--   Studio to which the user or group will be mapped.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityType:CreateStudioSessionMapping'</a>,
--   <a>createStudioSessionMapping_identityType</a> - Specifies whether the
--   identity to map to the Amazon EMR Studio is a user or a group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sessionPolicyArn:CreateStudioSessionMapping'</a>,
--   <a>createStudioSessionMapping_sessionPolicyArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) for the session policy that will be applied to the
--   user or group. You should specify the ARN for the session policy that
--   you want to apply, not the ARN of your user role. For more
--   information, see <a>Create an EMR Studio User Role with Session
--   Policies</a>.
newCreateStudioSessionMapping :: Text -> IdentityType -> Text -> CreateStudioSessionMapping

-- | The name of the user or group. For more information, see
--   <a>UserName</a> and <a>DisplayName</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services
--   SSO Identity Store API Reference</i>. Either <tt>IdentityName</tt> or
--   <tt>IdentityId</tt> must be specified, but not both.
createStudioSessionMapping_identityName :: Lens' CreateStudioSessionMapping (Maybe Text)

-- | The globally unique identifier (GUID) of the user or group from the
--   Amazon Web Services SSO Identity Store. For more information, see
--   <a>UserId</a> and <a>GroupId</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services SSO
--   Identity Store API Reference</i>. Either <tt>IdentityName</tt> or
--   <tt>IdentityId</tt> must be specified, but not both.
createStudioSessionMapping_identityId :: Lens' CreateStudioSessionMapping (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio to which the user or group will be
--   mapped.
createStudioSessionMapping_studioId :: Lens' CreateStudioSessionMapping Text

-- | Specifies whether the identity to map to the Amazon EMR Studio is a
--   user or a group.
createStudioSessionMapping_identityType :: Lens' CreateStudioSessionMapping IdentityType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the session policy that will be
--   applied to the user or group. You should specify the ARN for the
--   session policy that you want to apply, not the ARN of your user role.
--   For more information, see <a>Create an EMR Studio User Role with
--   Session Policies</a>.
createStudioSessionMapping_sessionPolicyArn :: Lens' CreateStudioSessionMapping Text

--   constructor.
