-- | Creates a new Amazon EMR Studio.
module Network.AWS.EMR.CreateStudio

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateStudio</a> smart constructor.
data CreateStudio
CreateStudio' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> AuthMode -> Text -> [Text] -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateStudio

-- | The IAM user role that users and groups assume when logged in to an
--   Amazon EMR Studio. Only specify a <tt>UserRole</tt> when you use
--   Amazon Web Services SSO authentication. The permissions attached to
--   the <tt>UserRole</tt> can be scoped down for each user or group using
--   session policies.
[$sel:userRole:CreateStudio'] :: CreateStudio -> Maybe Text

-- | The name that your identity provider (IdP) uses for its
--   <tt>RelayState</tt> parameter. For example, <tt>RelayState</tt> or
--   <tt>TargetSource</tt>. Specify this value when you use IAM
--   authentication and want to let federated users log in to a Studio
--   using the Studio URL. The <tt>RelayState</tt> parameter differs by
--   IdP.
[$sel:idpRelayStateParameterName:CreateStudio'] :: CreateStudio -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of tags to associate with the Amazon EMR Studio. Tags are
--   user-defined key-value pairs that consist of a required key string
--   with a maximum of 128 characters, and an optional value string with a
--   maximum of 256 characters.
[$sel:tags:CreateStudio'] :: CreateStudio -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The authentication endpoint of your identity provider (IdP). Specify
--   this value when you use IAM authentication and want to let federated
--   users log in to a Studio with the Studio URL and credentials from your
--   IdP. Amazon EMR Studio redirects users to this endpoint to enter
--   credentials.
[$sel:idpAuthUrl:CreateStudio'] :: CreateStudio -> Maybe Text

-- | A detailed description of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:description:CreateStudio'] :: CreateStudio -> Maybe Text

-- | A descriptive name for the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:name:CreateStudio'] :: CreateStudio -> Text

-- | Specifies whether the Studio authenticates users using IAM or Amazon
--   Web Services SSO.
[$sel:authMode:CreateStudio'] :: CreateStudio -> AuthMode

-- | The ID of the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) to associate
--   with the Studio.
[$sel:vpcId:CreateStudio'] :: CreateStudio -> Text

-- | A list of subnet IDs to associate with the Amazon EMR Studio. A Studio
--   can have a maximum of 5 subnets. The subnets must belong to the VPC
--   specified by <tt>VpcId</tt>. Studio users can create a Workspace in
--   any of the specified subnets.
[$sel:subnetIds:CreateStudio'] :: CreateStudio -> [Text]

-- | The IAM role that the Amazon EMR Studio assumes. The service role
--   provides a way for Amazon EMR Studio to interoperate with other Amazon
--   Web Services services.
[$sel:serviceRole:CreateStudio'] :: CreateStudio -> Text

-- | The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio Workspace security group. The
--   Workspace security group allows outbound network traffic to resources
--   in the Engine security group, and it must be in the same VPC specified
--   by <tt>VpcId</tt>.
[$sel:workspaceSecurityGroupId:CreateStudio'] :: CreateStudio -> Text

-- | The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio Engine security group. The Engine
--   security group allows inbound network traffic from the Workspace
--   security group, and it must be in the same VPC specified by
--   <tt>VpcId</tt>.
[$sel:engineSecurityGroupId:CreateStudio'] :: CreateStudio -> Text

-- | The Amazon S3 location to back up Amazon EMR Studio Workspaces and
--   notebook files.
[$sel:defaultS3Location:CreateStudio'] :: CreateStudio -> Text

-- | Cancels a pending step or steps in a running cluster. Available only
--   in Amazon EMR versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding version 5.0.0. A
--   maximum of 256 steps are allowed in each CancelSteps request.
--   CancelSteps is idempotent but asynchronous; it does not guarantee that
--   a step will be canceled, even if the request is successfully
--   submitted. When you use Amazon EMR versions 5.28.0 and later, you can
--   cancel steps that are in a <tt>PENDING</tt> or <tt>RUNNING</tt> state.
--   In earlier versions of Amazon EMR, you can only cancel steps that are
--   in a <tt>PENDING</tt> state.
module Network.AWS.EMR.CancelSteps

-- | The input argument to the CancelSteps operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCancelSteps</a> smart constructor.
data CancelSteps
CancelSteps' :: Maybe StepCancellationOption -> Text -> [Text] -> CancelSteps

-- | The option to choose to cancel <tt>RUNNING</tt> steps. By default, the
--   value is <tt>SEND_INTERRUPT</tt>.
[$sel:stepCancellationOption:CancelSteps'] :: CancelSteps -> Maybe StepCancellationOption

-- | The <tt>ClusterID</tt> for the specified steps that will be canceled.
--   Use RunJobFlow and ListClusters to get ClusterIDs.
[$sel:clusterId:CancelSteps'] :: CancelSteps -> Text

-- | The list of <tt>StepIDs</tt> to cancel. Use ListSteps to get steps and
--   their states for the specified cluster.
[$sel:stepIds:CancelSteps'] :: CancelSteps -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>CancelSteps</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stepCancellationOption:CancelSteps'</a>,
--   <a>cancelSteps_stepCancellationOption</a> - The option to choose to
--   cancel <tt>RUNNING</tt> steps. By default, the value is
--   <tt>SEND_INTERRUPT</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterId:CancelSteps'</a>, <a>cancelSteps_clusterId</a> - The
--   <tt>ClusterID</tt> for the specified steps that will be canceled. Use
--   RunJobFlow and ListClusters to get ClusterIDs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stepIds:CancelSteps'</a>, <a>cancelSteps_stepIds</a> - The
--   list of <tt>StepIDs</tt> to cancel. Use ListSteps to get steps and
--   their states for the specified cluster.
newCancelSteps :: Text -> CancelSteps

-- | The option to choose to cancel <tt>RUNNING</tt> steps. By default, the
--   value is <tt>SEND_INTERRUPT</tt>.
cancelSteps_stepCancellationOption :: Lens' CancelSteps (Maybe StepCancellationOption)

-- | The <tt>ClusterID</tt> for the specified steps that will be canceled.
--   Use RunJobFlow and ListClusters to get ClusterIDs.
cancelSteps_clusterId :: Lens' CancelSteps Text

-- | The list of <tt>StepIDs</tt> to cancel. Use ListSteps to get steps and
--   their states for the specified cluster.
cancelSteps_stepIds :: Lens' CancelSteps [Text]

-- | The output for the CancelSteps operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCancelStepsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CancelStepsResponse
CancelStepsResponse' :: Maybe [CancelStepsInfo] -> Int -> CancelStepsResponse

-- | A list of CancelStepsInfo, which shows the status of specified cancel
--   requests for each <tt>StepID</tt> specified.
[$sel:cancelStepsInfoList:CancelStepsResponse'] :: CancelStepsResponse -> Maybe [CancelStepsInfo]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CancelStepsResponse'] :: CancelStepsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CancelStepsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cancelStepsInfoList:CancelStepsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>cancelStepsResponse_cancelStepsInfoList</a> - A list of
--   CancelStepsInfo, which shows the status of specified cancel requests
--   for each <tt>StepID</tt> specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CancelStepsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>cancelStepsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newCancelStepsResponse :: Int -> CancelStepsResponse

-- | A list of CancelStepsInfo, which shows the status of specified cancel
--   requests for each <tt>StepID</tt> specified.
cancelStepsResponse_cancelStepsInfoList :: Lens' CancelStepsResponse (Maybe [CancelStepsInfo])

-- | The response's http status code.
cancelStepsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CancelStepsResponse Int

-- | Adds tags to an Amazon EMR resource, such as a cluster or an Amazon
--   EMR Studio. Tags make it easier to associate resources in various
--   ways, such as grouping clusters to track your Amazon EMR resource
--   allocation costs. For more information, see <a>Tag Clusters</a>.
module Network.AWS.EMR.AddTags

-- | This input identifies an Amazon EMR resource and a list of tags to
--   attach.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAddTags</a> smart constructor.
data AddTags
AddTags' :: Text -> [Tag] -> AddTags

-- | The Amazon EMR resource identifier to which tags will be added. For
--   example, a cluster identifier or an Amazon EMR Studio ID.
[$sel:resourceId:AddTags'] :: AddTags -> Text

-- | A list of tags to associate with a resource. Tags are user-defined
--   key-value pairs that consist of a required key string with a maximum
--   of 128 characters, and an optional value string with a maximum of 256
--   characters.
[$sel:tags:AddTags'] :: AddTags -> [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>AddTags</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:AddTags'</a>, <a>addTags_resourceId</a> - The
--   Amazon EMR resource identifier to which tags will be added. For
--   example, a cluster identifier or an Amazon EMR Studio ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:AddTags'</a>, <a>addTags_tags</a> - A list of tags to
--   associate with a resource. Tags are user-defined key-value pairs that
--   consist of a required key string with a maximum of 128 characters, and
--   an optional value string with a maximum of 256 characters.
newAddTags :: Text -> AddTags

-- | The Amazon EMR resource identifier to which tags will be added. For
--   example, a cluster identifier or an Amazon EMR Studio ID.
addTags_resourceId :: Lens' AddTags Text

-- | A list of tags to associate with a resource. Tags are user-defined
--   key-value pairs that consist of a required key string with a maximum
--   of 128 characters, and an optional value string with a maximum of 256
--   characters.
addTags_tags :: Lens' AddTags [Tag]

-- | This output indicates the result of adding tags to a resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAddTagsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data AddTagsResponse
AddTagsResponse' :: Int -> AddTagsResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:AddTagsResponse'] :: AddTagsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>AddTagsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:AddTagsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>addTagsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status code.
newAddTagsResponse :: Int -> AddTagsResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
addTagsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' AddTagsResponse Int

-- | AddJobFlowSteps adds new steps to a running cluster. A maximum of 256
--   steps are allowed in each job flow.
--   
--   If your cluster is long-running (such as a Hive data warehouse) or
--   complex, you may require more than 256 steps to process your data. You
--   can bypass the 256-step limitation in various ways, including using
--   SSH to connect to the master node and submitting queries directly to
--   the software running on the master node, such as Hive and Hadoop. For
--   more information on how to do this, see <a>Add More than 256 Steps to
--   a Cluster</a> in the <i>Amazon EMR Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   A step specifies the location of a JAR file stored either on the
--   master node of the cluster or in Amazon S3. Each step is performed by
--   the main function of the main class of the JAR file. The main class
--   can be specified either in the manifest of the JAR or by using the
--   MainFunction parameter of the step.
--   
--   Amazon EMR executes each step in the order listed. For a step to be
--   considered complete, the main function must exit with a zero exit code
--   and all Hadoop jobs started while the step was running must have
--   completed and run successfully.
--   
--   You can only add steps to a cluster that is in one of the following
--   states: STARTING, BOOTSTRAPPING, RUNNING, or WAITING.
module Network.AWS.EMR.AddJobFlowSteps

-- | The input argument to the AddJobFlowSteps operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAddJobFlowSteps</a> smart constructor.
data AddJobFlowSteps
AddJobFlowSteps' :: Text -> [StepConfig] -> AddJobFlowSteps

-- | A string that uniquely identifies the job flow. This identifier is
--   returned by RunJobFlow and can also be obtained from ListClusters.
[$sel:jobFlowId:AddJobFlowSteps'] :: AddJobFlowSteps -> Text

-- | A list of StepConfig to be executed by the job flow.
[$sel:steps:AddJobFlowSteps'] :: AddJobFlowSteps -> [StepConfig]

-- | Create a value of <a>AddJobFlowSteps</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobFlowId:AddJobFlowSteps'</a>,
--   <a>addJobFlowSteps_jobFlowId</a> - A string that uniquely identifies
--   the job flow. This identifier is returned by RunJobFlow and can also
--   be obtained from ListClusters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:steps:AddJobFlowSteps'</a>, <a>addJobFlowSteps_steps</a> - A
--   list of StepConfig to be executed by the job flow.
newAddJobFlowSteps :: Text -> AddJobFlowSteps

-- | A string that uniquely identifies the job flow. This identifier is
--   returned by RunJobFlow and can also be obtained from ListClusters.
addJobFlowSteps_jobFlowId :: Lens' AddJobFlowSteps Text

-- | A list of StepConfig to be executed by the job flow.
addJobFlowSteps_steps :: Lens' AddJobFlowSteps [StepConfig]

-- | The output for the AddJobFlowSteps operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAddJobFlowStepsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data AddJobFlowStepsResponse
AddJobFlowStepsResponse' :: Maybe [Text] -> Int -> AddJobFlowStepsResponse

-- | The identifiers of the list of steps added to the job flow.
[$sel:stepIds:AddJobFlowStepsResponse'] :: AddJobFlowStepsResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:AddJobFlowStepsResponse'] :: AddJobFlowStepsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>AddJobFlowStepsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stepIds:AddJobFlowStepsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>addJobFlowStepsResponse_stepIds</a> - The identifiers of the list
--   of steps added to the job flow.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:AddJobFlowStepsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>addJobFlowStepsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newAddJobFlowStepsResponse :: Int -> AddJobFlowStepsResponse

-- | The identifiers of the list of steps added to the job flow.
addJobFlowStepsResponse_stepIds :: Lens' AddJobFlowStepsResponse (Maybe [Text])

-- | The response's http status code.
addJobFlowStepsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' AddJobFlowStepsResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.EMR.AddJobFlowSteps.AddJobFlowSteps
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.AddJobFlowSteps.AddJobFlowSteps
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.AddJobFlowSteps.AddJobFlowSteps
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.EMR.AddJobFlowSteps.AddJobFlowSteps

-- | Updates an Amazon EMR Studio configuration, including attributes such
--   as name, description, and subnets.
module Network.AWS.EMR.UpdateStudio

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateStudio</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateStudio
UpdateStudio' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> UpdateStudio

-- | The Amazon S3 location to back up Workspaces and notebook files for
--   the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:defaultS3Location:UpdateStudio'] :: UpdateStudio -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of subnet IDs to associate with the Amazon EMR Studio. The list
--   can include new subnet IDs, but must also include all of the subnet
--   IDs previously associated with the Studio. The list order does not
--   matter. A Studio can have a maximum of 5 subnets. The subnets must
--   belong to the same VPC as the Studio.
[$sel:subnetIds:UpdateStudio'] :: UpdateStudio -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A descriptive name for the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:name:UpdateStudio'] :: UpdateStudio -> Maybe Text

-- | A detailed description to assign to the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:description:UpdateStudio'] :: UpdateStudio -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio to update.
[$sel:studioId:UpdateStudio'] :: UpdateStudio -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateStudio</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultS3Location:UpdateStudio'</a>,
--   <a>updateStudio_defaultS3Location</a> - The Amazon S3 location to back
--   up Workspaces and notebook files for the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetIds:UpdateStudio'</a>, <a>updateStudio_subnetIds</a> - A
--   list of subnet IDs to associate with the Amazon EMR Studio. The list
--   can include new subnet IDs, but must also include all of the subnet
--   IDs previously associated with the Studio. The list order does not
--   matter. A Studio can have a maximum of 5 subnets. The subnets must
--   belong to the same VPC as the Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateStudio'</a>, <a>updateStudio_name</a> - A
--   descriptive name for the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:UpdateStudio'</a>, <a>updateStudio_description</a>
--   - A detailed description to assign to the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:studioId:UpdateStudio'</a>, <a>updateStudio_studioId</a> - The
--   ID of the Amazon EMR Studio to update.
newUpdateStudio :: Text -> UpdateStudio

-- | The Amazon S3 location to back up Workspaces and notebook files for
--   the Amazon EMR Studio.
updateStudio_defaultS3Location :: Lens' UpdateStudio (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of subnet IDs to associate with the Amazon EMR Studio. The list
--   can include new subnet IDs, but must also include all of the subnet
--   IDs previously associated with the Studio. The list order does not
--   matter. A Studio can have a maximum of 5 subnets. The subnets must
--   belong to the same VPC as the Studio.
updateStudio_subnetIds :: Lens' UpdateStudio (Maybe [Text])

-- | A descriptive name for the Amazon EMR Studio.
updateStudio_name :: Lens' UpdateStudio (Maybe Text)

-- | A detailed description to assign to the Amazon EMR Studio.
updateStudio_description :: Lens' UpdateStudio (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio to update.
updateStudio_studioId :: Lens' UpdateStudio Text

data UpdateStudioResponse
UpdateStudioResponse' :: UpdateStudioResponse

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newUpdateStudioResponse :: UpdateStudioResponse

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.EMR.UpdateStudio.UpdateStudio
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.EMR.UpdateStudio.UpdateStudio

-- | Updates the session policy attached to the user or group for the
--   specified Amazon EMR Studio.
module Network.AWS.EMR.UpdateStudioSessionMapping

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateStudioSessionMapping</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateStudioSessionMapping
UpdateStudioSessionMapping' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> IdentityType -> Text -> UpdateStudioSessionMapping

-- | The name of the user or group to update. For more information, see
--   <a>UserName</a> and <a>DisplayName</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services
--   SSO Identity Store API Reference</i>. Either <tt>IdentityName</tt> or
--   <tt>IdentityId</tt> must be specified.
[$sel:identityName:UpdateStudioSessionMapping'] :: UpdateStudioSessionMapping -> Maybe Text

-- | The globally unique identifier (GUID) of the user or group. For more
--   information, see <a>UserId</a> and <a>GroupId</a> in the <i>Amazon Web
--   Services SSO Identity Store API Reference</i>. Either
--   <tt>IdentityName</tt> or <tt>IdentityId</tt> must be specified.
[$sel:identityId:UpdateStudioSessionMapping'] :: UpdateStudioSessionMapping -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio.
[$sel:studioId:UpdateStudioSessionMapping'] :: UpdateStudioSessionMapping -> Text

-- | Specifies whether the identity to update is a user or a group.
[$sel:identityType:UpdateStudioSessionMapping'] :: UpdateStudioSessionMapping -> IdentityType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the session policy to associate with
--   the specified user or group.
[$sel:sessionPolicyArn:UpdateStudioSessionMapping'] :: UpdateStudioSessionMapping -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateStudioSessionMapping</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>$sel:identityName:UpdateStudioSessionMapping'</a>,

--   or group to update. For more information, see <a>UserName</a> and
--   <a>DisplayName</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services SSO Identity Store
--   API Reference</i>. Either <tt>IdentityName</tt> or <tt>IdentityId</tt>
--   must be specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityId:UpdateStudioSessionMapping'</a>,
--   <a>updateStudioSessionMapping_identityId</a> - The globally unique
--   identifier (GUID) of the user or group. For more information, see
--   <a>UserId</a> and <a>GroupId</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services SSO
--   Identity Store API Reference</i>. Either <tt>IdentityName</tt> or
--   <tt>IdentityId</tt> must be specified.

--   Studio.

--   <a>$sel:identityType:UpdateStudioSessionMapping'</a>,

--   Resource Name (ARN) of the session policy to associate with the
--   specified user or group.

removeTagsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' RemoveTagsResponse Int

--   SSO Identity Store API Reference</i>. Either <tt>IdentityName</tt> or
--   <tt>IdentityId</tt> must be specified.
getStudioSessionMapping_identityName :: Lens' GetStudioSessionMapping (Maybe Text)

-- | The globally unique identifier (GUID) of the user or group. For more
--   information, see <a>UserId</a> and <a>GroupId</a> in the <i>Amazon Web
--   Services SSO Identity Store API Reference</i>. Either
--   <tt>IdentityName</tt> or <tt>IdentityId</tt> must be specified.
getStudioSessionMapping_identityId :: Lens' GetStudioSessionMapping (Maybe Text)

getStudioSessionMapping_studioId :: Lens' GetStudioSessionMapping Text

getStudioSessionMappingResponse_sessionMapping :: Lens' GetStudioSessionMappingResponse (Maybe SessionMappingDetail)

getStudioSessionMappingResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetStudioSessionMappingResponse Int

-- | The unique identifier of the job flow (cluster).
setVisibleToAllUsers_jobFlowIds :: Lens' SetVisibleToAllUsers [Text]

-- | A value of <tt>true</tt> indicates that an IAM principal in the Amazon
--   Web Services account can perform EMR actions on the cluster that the
--   IAM policies attached to the principal allow. A value of
--   <tt>false</tt> indicates that only the IAM principal that created the
--   cluster and the Amazon Web Services root user can perform EMR actions
--   on the cluster.
setVisibleToAllUsers_visibleToAllUsers :: Lens' SetVisibleToAllUsers Bool

-- | Applies only when <tt>CustomAmiID</tt> is used. Specifies which
--   updates from the Amazon Linux AMI package repositories to apply
--   automatically when the instance boots using the AMI. If omitted, the
--   default is <tt>SECURITY</tt>, which indicates that only security
--   updates are applied. If <tt>NONE</tt> is specified, no updates are
--   applied, and all updates must be applied manually.
runJobFlow_repoUpgradeOnBoot :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe RepoUpgradeOnBoot)

-- | Applies only to Amazon EMR AMI versions 3.x and 2.x. For Amazon EMR
--   releases 4.0 and later, <tt>ReleaseLabel</tt> is used. To specify a
--   custom AMI, use <tt>CustomAmiID</tt>.
runJobFlow_amiVersion :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | The specified placement group configuration for an Amazon EMR cluster.
runJobFlow_placementGroupConfigs :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe [PlacementGroupConfig])

-- | A JSON string for selecting additional features.
runJobFlow_additionalInfo :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | The IAM role that Amazon EMR assumes in order to access Amazon Web
--   Services resources on your behalf.
runJobFlow_serviceRole :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | An IAM role for automatic scaling policies. The default role is
--   <tt>EMR_AutoScaling_DefaultRole</tt>. The IAM role provides
--   permissions that the automatic scaling feature requires to launch and
--   terminate EC2 instances in an instance group.
runJobFlow_autoScalingRole :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the way that individual Amazon EC2 instances terminate when
--   an automatic scale-in activity occurs or an instance group is resized.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_INSTANCE_HOUR</tt> indicates that Amazon EMR
--   terminates nodes at the instance-hour boundary, regardless of when the
--   request to terminate the instance was submitted. This option is only
--   available with Amazon EMR 5.1.0 and later and is the default for
--   clusters created using that version.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> indicates that Amazon EMR adds
--   nodes to a deny list and drains tasks from nodes before terminating
--   the Amazon EC2 instances, regardless of the instance-hour boundary.
--   With either behavior, Amazon EMR removes the least active nodes first
--   and blocks instance termination if it could lead to HDFS corruption.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> available only in Amazon EMR
--   version 4.1.0 and later, and is the default for versions of Amazon EMR
--   earlier than 5.1.0.
runJobFlow_scaleDownBehavior :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe ScaleDownBehavior)

-- | The name of a security configuration to apply to the cluster.
runJobFlow_securityConfiguration :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | For Amazon EMR releases 4.0 and later. The list of configurations
--   supplied for the EMR cluster you are creating.
runJobFlow_configurations :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe [Configuration])

-- | The size, in GiB, of the Amazon EBS root device volume of the Linux
--   AMI that is used for each EC2 instance. Available in Amazon EMR
--   version 4.x and later.
runJobFlow_ebsRootVolumeSize :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Int)

-- | The Amazon EMR release label, which determines the version of
--   open-source application packages installed on the cluster. Release
--   labels are in the form <tt>emr-x.x.x</tt>, where x.x.x is an Amazon
--   EMR release version such as <tt>emr-5.14.0</tt>. For more information
--   about Amazon EMR release versions and included application versions
--   and features, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ReleaseGuide/</a>. The
--   release label applies only to Amazon EMR releases version 4.0 and
--   later. Earlier versions use <tt>AmiVersion</tt>.
runJobFlow_releaseLabel :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of bootstrap actions to run before Hadoop starts on the cluster
--   nodes.
runJobFlow_bootstrapActions :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe [BootstrapActionConfig])

-- | The KMS key used for encrypting log files. If a value is not provided,
--   the logs remain encrypted by AES-256. This attribute is only available
--   with Amazon EMR version 5.30.0 and later, excluding Amazon EMR 6.0.0.
runJobFlow_logEncryptionKmsKeyId :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags to associate with a cluster and propagate to Amazon EC2
--   instances.
runJobFlow_tags :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe [Tag])

-- | Also called instance profile and EC2 role. An IAM role for an EMR
--   cluster. The EC2 instances of the cluster assume this role. The
--   default role is <tt>EMR_EC2_DefaultRole</tt>. In order to use the
--   default role, you must have already created it using the CLI or
--   console.
runJobFlow_jobFlowRole :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | Applies to Amazon EMR releases 4.0 and later. A case-insensitive list
--   of applications for Amazon EMR to install and configure when launching
--   the cluster. For a list of applications available for each Amazon EMR
--   release version, see the <a>Amazon EMR Release Guide</a>.
runJobFlow_applications :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe [Application])

-- | A list of steps to run.
runJobFlow_steps :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe [StepConfig])

-- | Specifies the number of steps that can be executed concurrently. The
--   default value is <tt>1</tt>. The maximum value is <tt>256</tt>.
runJobFlow_stepConcurrencyLevel :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Int)

-- | For Amazon EMR releases 3.x and 2.x. For Amazon EMR releases 4.x and
--   later, use Applications.
--   
--   A list of strings that indicates third-party software to use. For more
--   information, see the <a>Amazon EMR Developer Guide</a>. Currently
--   supported values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>"mapr-m3" - launch the job flow using MapR M3 Edition.</li>
--   <li>"mapr-m5" - launch the job flow using MapR M5 Edition.</li>
--   </ul>
runJobFlow_supportedProducts :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe [Text])

-- | Set this value to <tt>true</tt> so that IAM principals in the Amazon
--   Web Services account associated with the cluster can perform EMR
--   actions on the cluster that their IAM policies allow. This value
--   defaults to <tt>true</tt> for clusters created using the EMR API or
--   the CLI <a>create-cluster</a> command.
--   
--   When set to <tt>false</tt>, only the IAM principal that created the
--   cluster and the Amazon Web Services account root user can perform EMR
--   actions for the cluster, regardless of the IAM permissions policies
--   attached to other IAM principals. For more information, see
--   <a>Understanding the EMR Cluster VisibleToAllUsers Setting</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon EMRManagement Guide</i>.
runJobFlow_visibleToAllUsers :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Bool)

-- | Available only in Amazon EMR version 5.7.0 and later. The ID of a
--   custom Amazon EBS-backed Linux AMI. If specified, Amazon EMR uses this
--   AMI when it launches cluster EC2 instances. For more information about
--   custom AMIs in Amazon EMR, see <a>Using a Custom AMI</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon EMR Management Guide</i>. If omitted, the cluster uses the
--   base Linux AMI for the <tt>ReleaseLabel</tt> specified. For Amazon EMR
--   versions 2.x and 3.x, use <tt>AmiVersion</tt> instead.
--   
--   For information about creating a custom AMI, see <a>Creating an Amazon
--   EBS-Backed Linux AMI</a> in the <i>Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User
--   Guide for Linux Instances</i>. For information about finding an AMI
--   ID, see <a>Finding a Linux AMI</a>.
runJobFlow_customAmiId :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
runJobFlow_autoTerminationPolicy :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe AutoTerminationPolicy)

-- | The specified managed scaling policy for an Amazon EMR cluster.
runJobFlow_managedScalingPolicy :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe ManagedScalingPolicy)

-- | The location in Amazon S3 to write the log files of the job flow. If a
--   value is not provided, logs are not created.
runJobFlow_logUri :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | For Amazon EMR releases 3.x and 2.x. For Amazon EMR releases 4.x and
--   later, use Applications.
--   
--   A list of strings that indicates third-party software to use with the
--   job flow that accepts a user argument list. EMR accepts and forwards
--   the argument list to the corresponding installation script as
--   bootstrap action arguments. For more information, see "Launch a Job
--   Flow on the MapR Distribution for Hadoop" in the <a>Amazon EMR
--   Developer Guide</a>. Supported values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>"mapr-m3" - launch the cluster using MapR M3 Edition.</li>
--   <li>"mapr-m5" - launch the cluster using MapR M5 Edition.</li>
--   <li>"mapr" with the user arguments specifying "--edition,m3" or
--   "--edition,m5" - launch the job flow using MapR M3 or M5 Edition
--   respectively.</li>
--   <li>"mapr-m7" - launch the cluster using MapR M7 Edition.</li>
--   <li>"hunk" - launch the cluster with the Hunk Big Data Analytics
--   Platform.</li>
--   <li>"hue"- launch the cluster with Hue installed.</li>
--   <li>"spark" - launch the cluster with Apache Spark installed.</li>
--   <li>"ganglia" - launch the cluster with the Ganglia Monitoring System
--   installed.</li>
--   </ul>
runJobFlow_newSupportedProducts :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe [SupportedProductConfig])

-- | Attributes for Kerberos configuration when Kerberos authentication is
--   enabled using a security configuration. For more information see
--   <a>Use Kerberos Authentication</a> in the <i>Amazon EMR Management
--   Guide</i>.
runJobFlow_kerberosAttributes :: Lens' RunJobFlow (Maybe KerberosAttributes)

-- | The name of the job flow.
runJobFlow_name :: Lens' RunJobFlow Text

-- | A specification of the number and type of Amazon EC2 instances.
runJobFlow_instances :: Lens' RunJobFlow JobFlowInstancesConfig

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster.
runJobFlowResponse_clusterArn :: Lens' RunJobFlowResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique identifier for the job flow.
runJobFlowResponse_jobFlowId :: Lens' RunJobFlowResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
runJobFlowResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' RunJobFlowResponse Int

-- | The IAM user role that users and groups assume when logged in to an
--   Amazon EMR Studio. Only specify a <tt>UserRole</tt> when you use
--   Amazon Web Services SSO authentication. The permissions attached to
--   the <tt>UserRole</tt> can be scoped down for each user or group using
--   session policies.
createStudio_userRole :: Lens' CreateStudio (Maybe Text)

-- | The name that your identity provider (IdP) uses for its
--   <tt>RelayState</tt> parameter. For example, <tt>RelayState</tt> or
--   <tt>TargetSource</tt>. Specify this value when you use IAM
--   authentication and want to let federated users log in to a Studio
--   using the Studio URL. The <tt>RelayState</tt> parameter differs by
--   IdP.
createStudio_idpRelayStateParameterName :: Lens' CreateStudio (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags to associate with the Amazon EMR Studio. Tags are
--   user-defined key-value pairs that consist of a required key string
--   with a maximum of 128 characters, and an optional value string with a
--   maximum of 256 characters.
createStudio_tags :: Lens' CreateStudio (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The authentication endpoint of your identity provider (IdP). Specify
--   this value when you use IAM authentication and want to let federated
--   users log in to a Studio with the Studio URL and credentials from your
--   IdP. Amazon EMR Studio redirects users to this endpoint to enter
--   credentials.
createStudio_idpAuthUrl :: Lens' CreateStudio (Maybe Text)

-- | A detailed description of the Amazon EMR Studio.
createStudio_description :: Lens' CreateStudio (Maybe Text)

-- | A descriptive name for the Amazon EMR Studio.
createStudio_name :: Lens' CreateStudio Text

-- | Specifies whether the Studio authenticates users using IAM or Amazon
--   Web Services SSO.
createStudio_authMode :: Lens' CreateStudio AuthMode

-- | The ID of the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) to associate
--   with the Studio.
createStudio_vpcId :: Lens' CreateStudio Text

-- | A list of subnet IDs to associate with the Amazon EMR Studio. A Studio
--   can have a maximum of 5 subnets. The subnets must belong to the VPC
--   specified by <tt>VpcId</tt>. Studio users can create a Workspace in
--   any of the specified subnets.
createStudio_subnetIds :: Lens' CreateStudio [Text]

-- | The IAM role that the Amazon EMR Studio assumes. The service role
--   provides a way for Amazon EMR Studio to interoperate with other Amazon
--   Web Services services.
createStudio_serviceRole :: Lens' CreateStudio Text

-- | The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio Workspace security group. The
--   Workspace security group allows outbound network traffic to resources
--   in the Engine security group, and it must be in the same VPC specified
--   by <tt>VpcId</tt>.
createStudio_workspaceSecurityGroupId :: Lens' CreateStudio Text

-- | The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio Engine security group. The Engine
--   security group allows inbound network traffic from the Workspace
--   security group, and it must be in the same VPC specified by
--   <tt>VpcId</tt>.
createStudio_engineSecurityGroupId :: Lens' CreateStudio Text

-- | The Amazon S3 location to back up Amazon EMR Studio Workspaces and
--   notebook files.
createStudio_defaultS3Location :: Lens' CreateStudio Text

createStudioResponse_url :: Lens' CreateStudioResponse (Maybe Text)

--   the Amazon EMR Studio.
updateStudio_defaultS3Location :: Lens' UpdateStudio (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of subnet IDs to associate with the Amazon EMR Studio. The list
--   can include new subnet IDs, but must also include all of the subnet
--   IDs previously associated with the Studio. The list order does not
--   matter. A Studio can have a maximum of 5 subnets. The subnets must
--   belong to the same VPC as the Studio.
updateStudio_subnetIds :: Lens' UpdateStudio (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specifies the next page of results. If <tt>NextToken</tt> is not
--   specified, which is usually the case for the first request of
--   ListReleaseLabels, the first page of results are determined by other
--   filtering parameters or by the latest version. The
--   <tt>ListReleaseLabels</tt> request fails if the identity (Amazon Web
--   Services account ID) and all filtering parameters are different from
--   the original request, or if the <tt>NextToken</tt> is expired or
--   tampered with.

-- | The response's http status code.
getBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse Int

-- | A configuration for Amazon EMR block public access. The configuration
--   applies to all clusters created in your account for the current
--   Region. The configuration specifies whether block public access is
--   enabled. If block public access is enabled, security groups associated
--   with the cluster cannot have rules that allow inbound traffic from
--   0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 on a port, unless the port is specified as an
--   exception using <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt> in the
--   <tt>BlockPublicAccessConfiguration</tt>. By default, Port 22 (SSH) is
--   an exception, and public access is allowed on this port. You can
--   change this by updating the block public access configuration to
--   remove the exception.
--   
--   For accounts that created clusters in a Region before November 25,
--   2019, block public access is disabled by default in that Region. To
--   use this feature, you must manually enable and configure it. For
--   accounts that did not create an EMR cluster in a Region before this
--   date, block public access is enabled by default in that Region.
getBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse_blockPublicAccessConfiguration :: Lens' GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse BlockPublicAccessConfiguration

-- | Properties that describe the Amazon Web Services principal that
--   created the <tt>BlockPublicAccessConfiguration</tt> using the
--   <tt>PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration</tt> action as well as the date
--   and time that the configuration was created. Each time a configuration
--   for block public access is updated, Amazon EMR updates this metadata.
getBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse_blockPublicAccessConfigurationMetadata :: Lens' GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse BlockPublicAccessConfigurationMetadata

-- | The number of steps that can be executed concurrently. You can specify
--   a minimum of 1 step and a maximum of 256 steps. We recommend that you
--   do not change this parameter while steps are running or the
--   <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> setting may not behave as expected. For more
--   information see Step$ActionOnFailure.
modifyCluster_stepConcurrencyLevel :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Int)

-- | The status filter for listing notebook executions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>START_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received the
--   execution request but execution has not begun.</li>
--   <li><tt>STARTING</tt> indicates that the execution is starting on the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> indicates that the execution is being processed
--   by the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHING</tt> indicates that execution processing is in the
--   final stages.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHED</tt> indicates that the execution has completed
--   without error.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILING</tt> indicates that the execution is failing and will
--   not finish successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> indicates that the execution failed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOP_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request and the stop is pending.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt> indicates that the cluster is in the process of
--   stopping the execution as a result of a <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt>
--   request.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt> indicates that the execution stopped because of a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request.</li>
--   </ul>
listNotebookExecutions_status :: Lens' ListNotebookExecutions (Maybe NotebookExecutionStatus)

-- | The unique ID of the editor associated with the notebook execution.
listNotebookExecutions_editorId :: Lens' ListNotebookExecutions (Maybe Text)

-- | The end of time range filter for listing notebook executions. The
--   default is the current timestamp.
listNotebookExecutions_to :: Lens' ListNotebookExecutions (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The beginning of time range filter for listing notebook executions.
--   The default is the timestamp of 30 days ago.
listNotebookExecutions_from :: Lens' ListNotebookExecutions (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The pagination token, returned by a previous
--   <tt>ListNotebookExecutions</tt> call, that indicates the start of the
--   list for this <tt>ListNotebookExecutions</tt> call.
listNotebookExecutions_marker :: Lens' ListNotebookExecutions (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the cluster to which the instance group belongs.
modifyInstanceGroups_clusterId :: Lens' ModifyInstanceGroups (Maybe Text)

-- | Instance groups to change.
modifyInstanceGroups_instanceGroups :: Lens' ModifyInstanceGroups (Maybe [InstanceGroupModifyConfig])

-- | A list of strings that uniquely identify the clusters to protect. This
--   identifier is returned by RunJobFlow and can also be obtained from
--   DescribeJobFlows .
setTerminationProtection_jobFlowIds :: Lens' SetTerminationProtection [Text]

-- | A Boolean that indicates whether to protect the cluster and prevent
--   the Amazon EC2 instances in the cluster from shutting down due to API
--   calls, user intervention, or job-flow error.
setTerminationProtection_terminationProtected :: Lens' SetTerminationProtection Bool

-- | A configuration for Amazon EMR block public access. The configuration
--   applies to all clusters created in your account for the current
--   Region. The configuration specifies whether block public access is
--   enabled. If block public access is enabled, security groups associated
--   with the cluster cannot have rules that allow inbound traffic from
--   0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 on a port, unless the port is specified as an
--   exception using <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt> in the
--   <tt>BlockPublicAccessConfiguration</tt>. By default, Port 22 (SSH) is
--   an exception, and public access is allowed on this port. You can
--   change this by updating <tt>BlockPublicSecurityGroupRules</tt> to
--   remove the exception.
--   
--   For accounts that created clusters in a Region before November 25,
--   2019, block public access is disabled by default in that Region. To
--   use this feature, you must manually enable and configure it. For
--   accounts that did not create an EMR cluster in a Region before this
--   date, block public access is enabled by default in that Region.
putBlockPublicAccessConfiguration_blockPublicAccessConfiguration :: Lens' PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration BlockPublicAccessConfiguration

-- | The response's http status code.
putBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' PutBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse Int

-- | Specifies the ID of the Amazon EMR cluster from which the
--   auto-termination policy will be removed.
removeAutoTerminationPolicy_clusterId :: Lens' RemoveAutoTerminationPolicy Text

-- | The response's http status code.
removeAutoTerminationPolicyResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' RemoveAutoTerminationPolicyResponse Int

-- | The name of the security configuration.
createSecurityConfiguration_name :: Lens' CreateSecurityConfiguration Text

-- | The security configuration details in JSON format. For JSON parameters
--   and examples, see <a>Use Security Configurations to Set Up Cluster
--   Security</a> in the <i>Amazon EMR Management Guide</i>.
createSecurityConfiguration_securityConfiguration :: Lens' CreateSecurityConfiguration Text

-- | The response's http status code.
createSecurityConfigurationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateSecurityConfigurationResponse Int

-- | The name of the security configuration.
createSecurityConfigurationResponse_name :: Lens' CreateSecurityConfigurationResponse Text

-- | The date and time the security configuration was created.
createSecurityConfigurationResponse_creationDateTime :: Lens' CreateSecurityConfigurationResponse UTCTime

-- | Arguments for Amazon EMR to pass to the application.
application_args :: Lens' Application (Maybe [Text])

-- | This option is for advanced users only. This is meta information about
--   third-party applications that third-party vendors use for testing
--   purposes.
application_additionalInfo :: Lens' Application (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The version of the application.
application_version :: Lens' Application (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the application.
application_name :: Lens' Application (Maybe Text)

-- | The upper and lower EC2 instance limits for an automatic scaling
--   policy. Automatic scaling activity will not cause an instance group to
--   grow above or below these limits.
autoScalingPolicy_constraints :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicy ScalingConstraints

-- | The scale-in and scale-out rules that comprise the automatic scaling
--   policy.
autoScalingPolicy_rules :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicy [ScalingRule]

-- | The status of an automatic scaling policy.
autoScalingPolicyDescription_status :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicyDescription (Maybe AutoScalingPolicyStatus)

-- | The upper and lower EC2 instance limits for an automatic scaling
--   policy. Automatic scaling activity will not cause an instance group to
--   grow above or below these limits.
autoScalingPolicyDescription_constraints :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicyDescription (Maybe ScalingConstraints)

-- | The scale-in and scale-out rules that comprise the automatic scaling
--   policy.
autoScalingPolicyDescription_rules :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicyDescription (Maybe [ScalingRule])

-- | A friendly, more verbose message that accompanies an automatic scaling
--   policy state change.
autoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason_message :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason (Maybe Text)

-- | The code indicating the reason for the change in
--   status.<tt>USER_REQUEST</tt> indicates that the scaling policy status
--   was changed by a user. <tt>PROVISION_FAILURE</tt> indicates that the
--   status change was because the policy failed to provision.
--   <tt>CLEANUP_FAILURE</tt> indicates an error.
autoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason_code :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason (Maybe AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReasonCode)

-- | The reason for a change in status.
autoScalingPolicyStatus_stateChangeReason :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicyStatus (Maybe AutoScalingPolicyStateChangeReason)

-- | Indicates the status of the automatic scaling policy.
autoScalingPolicyStatus_state :: Lens' AutoScalingPolicyStatus (Maybe AutoScalingPolicyState)

-- | Specifies the amount of idle time in seconds after which the cluster
--   automatically terminates. You can specify a minimum of 60 seconds and
--   a maximum of 604800 seconds (seven days).
autoTerminationPolicy_idleTimeout :: Lens' AutoTerminationPolicy (Maybe Integer)

-- | Specifies ports and port ranges that are permitted to have security
--   group rules that allow inbound traffic from all public sources. For
--   example, if Port 23 (Telnet) is specified for
--   <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>, Amazon EMR allows
--   cluster creation if a security group associated with the cluster has a
--   rule that allows inbound traffic on Port 23 from IPv4 0.0.0.0/0 or
--   IPv6 port ::/0 as the source.
--   
--   By default, Port 22, which is used for SSH access to the cluster EC2
--   instances, is in the list of
--   <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>.
blockPublicAccessConfiguration_permittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges :: Lens' BlockPublicAccessConfiguration (Maybe [PortRange])

-- | Indicates whether Amazon EMR block public access is enabled
--   (<tt>true</tt>) or disabled (<tt>false</tt>). By default, the value is
--   <tt>false</tt> for accounts that have created EMR clusters before July
--   2019. For accounts created after this, the default is <tt>true</tt>.
blockPublicAccessConfiguration_blockPublicSecurityGroupRules :: Lens' BlockPublicAccessConfiguration Bool

blockPublicAccessConfigurationMetadata_creationDateTime :: Lens' BlockPublicAccessConfigurationMetadata UTCTime

-- | The Amazon Resource Name that created or last modified the
--   configuration.
blockPublicAccessConfigurationMetadata_createdByArn :: Lens' BlockPublicAccessConfigurationMetadata Text

bootstrapActionConfig_name :: Lens' BootstrapActionConfig Text

bootstrapActionConfig_scriptBootstrapAction :: Lens' BootstrapActionConfig ScriptBootstrapActionConfig

cancelStepsInfo_stepId :: Lens' CancelStepsInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The unit of measure associated with the CloudWatch metric being
--   watched. The value specified for <tt>Unit</tt> must correspond to the
--   units specified in the CloudWatch metric.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_unit :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition (Maybe Unit)

-- | The statistic to apply to the metric associated with the alarm. The
--   default is <tt>AVERAGE</tt>.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_statistic :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition (Maybe Statistic)

-- | The namespace for the CloudWatch metric. The default is
--   <tt>AWS/ElasticMapReduce</tt>.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_namespace :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition (Maybe Text)

-- | A CloudWatch metric dimension.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_dimensions :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition (Maybe [MetricDimension])

-- | The number of periods, in five-minute increments, during which the
--   alarm condition must exist before the alarm triggers automatic scaling
--   activity. The default value is <tt>1</tt>.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_evaluationPeriods :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition (Maybe Int)

-- | Determines how the metric specified by <tt>MetricName</tt> is compared
--   to the value specified by <tt>Threshold</tt>.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_comparisonOperator :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition ComparisonOperator

-- | The name of the CloudWatch metric that is watched to determine an
--   alarm condition.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_metricName :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition Text

-- | The period, in seconds, over which the statistic is applied. EMR
--   CloudWatch metrics are emitted every five minutes (300 seconds), so if
--   an EMR CloudWatch metric is specified, specify <tt>300</tt>.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_period :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition Int

-- | The value against which the specified statistic is compared.
cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_threshold :: Lens' CloudWatchAlarmDefinition Double

-- | Applies only when <tt>CustomAmiID</tt> is used. Specifies the type of
--   updates that are applied from the Amazon Linux AMI package
--   repositories when an instance boots using the AMI.
cluster_repoUpgradeOnBoot :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe RepoUpgradeOnBoot)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name of the cluster.
cluster_clusterArn :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The IAM role that Amazon EMR assumes in order to access Amazon Web
--   Services resources on your behalf.
cluster_serviceRole :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | An IAM role for automatic scaling policies. The default role is
--   <tt>EMR_AutoScaling_DefaultRole</tt>. The IAM role provides
--   permissions that the automatic scaling feature requires to launch and
--   terminate EC2 instances in an instance group.
cluster_autoScalingRole :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The way that individual Amazon EC2 instances terminate when an
--   automatic scale-in activity occurs or an instance group is resized.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_INSTANCE_HOUR</tt> indicates that Amazon EMR
--   terminates nodes at the instance-hour boundary, regardless of when the
--   request to terminate the instance was submitted. This option is only
--   available with Amazon EMR 5.1.0 and later and is the default for
--   clusters created using that version.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> indicates that Amazon EMR adds
--   nodes to a deny list and drains tasks from nodes before terminating
--   the Amazon EC2 instances, regardless of the instance-hour boundary.
--   With either behavior, Amazon EMR removes the least active nodes first
--   and blocks instance termination if it could lead to HDFS corruption.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> is available only in Amazon EMR
--   version 4.1.0 and later, and is the default for versions of Amazon EMR
--   earlier than 5.1.0.
cluster_scaleDownBehavior :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe ScaleDownBehavior)

-- | The name of the security configuration applied to the cluster.
cluster_securityConfiguration :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether Amazon EMR will lock the cluster to prevent the EC2
--   instances from being terminated by an API call or user intervention,
--   or in the event of a cluster error.
cluster_terminationProtected :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Bool)

-- | The DNS name of the master node. If the cluster is on a private
--   subnet, this is the private DNS name. On a public subnet, this is the
--   public DNS name.
cluster_masterPublicDnsName :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Applies only to Amazon EMR releases 4.x and later. The list of
--   Configurations supplied to the EMR cluster.
cluster_configurations :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [Configuration])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost where the cluster is
--   launched.
cluster_outpostArn :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The AMI version running on this cluster.
cluster_runningAmiVersion :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The size, in GiB, of the Amazon EBS root device volume of the Linux
--   AMI that is used for each EC2 instance. Available in Amazon EMR
--   version 4.x and later.
cluster_ebsRootVolumeSize :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Int)

-- | The AMI version requested for this cluster.
cluster_requestedAmiVersion :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon EMR release label, which determines the version of
--   open-source application packages installed on the cluster. Release
--   labels are in the form <tt>emr-x.x.x</tt>, where x.x.x is an Amazon
--   EMR release version such as <tt>emr-5.14.0</tt>. For more information
--   about Amazon EMR release versions and included application versions
--   and features, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ReleaseGuide/</a>. The
--   release label applies only to Amazon EMR releases version 4.0 and
--   later. Earlier versions use <tt>AmiVersion</tt>.
cluster_releaseLabel :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   The instance group configuration of the cluster. A value of
--   <tt>INSTANCE_GROUP</tt> indicates a uniform instance group
--   configuration. A value of <tt>INSTANCE_FLEET</tt> indicates an
--   instance fleets configuration.
cluster_instanceCollectionType :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe InstanceCollectionType)

--   available with EMR version 5.30.0 and later, excluding EMR 6.0.0.
cluster_logEncryptionKmsKeyId :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags associated with a cluster.
cluster_tags :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The applications installed on this cluster.
cluster_applications :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [Application])

-- | Specifies the number of steps that can be executed concurrently.
cluster_stepConcurrencyLevel :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Int)

-- | Indicates whether the cluster is visible to IAM principals in the
--   Amazon Web Services account associated with the cluster. When
--   <tt>true</tt>, IAM principals in the Amazon Web Services account can
--   perform EMR cluster actions on the cluster that their IAM policies
--   allow. When <tt>false</tt>, only the IAM principal that created the
--   cluster and the Amazon Web Services account root user can perform EMR
--   actions, regardless of IAM permissions policies attached to other IAM
--   principals.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>true</tt> if a value is not provided when
--   creating a cluster using the EMR API RunJobFlow command, the CLI
--   <a>create-cluster</a> command, or the Amazon Web Services Management
--   Console. IAM principals that are allowed to perform actions on the
--   cluster can use the SetVisibleToAllUsers action to change the value on
--   a running cluster. For more information, see <a>Understanding the EMR
--   Cluster VisibleToAllUsers Setting</a> in the <i>Amazon EMRManagement
--   Guide</i>.
cluster_visibleToAllUsers :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether the cluster should terminate after completing all
--   steps.
cluster_autoTerminate :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Bool)

-- | Available only in Amazon EMR version 5.7.0 and later. The ID of a
--   custom Amazon EBS-backed Linux AMI if the cluster uses a custom AMI.
cluster_customAmiId :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | An approximation of the cost of the cluster, represented in
--   m1.small/hours. This value is incremented one time for every hour an
--   m1.small instance runs. Larger instances are weighted more, so an EC2
--   instance that is roughly four times more expensive would result in the
--   normalized instance hours being incremented by four. This result is
--   only an approximation and does not reflect the actual billing rate.
cluster_normalizedInstanceHours :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Int)

-- | Placement group configured for an Amazon EMR cluster.
cluster_placementGroups :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [PlacementGroupConfig])

-- | The path to the Amazon S3 location where logs for this cluster are
--   stored.
cluster_logUri :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

--   Guide</i>.
cluster_kerberosAttributes :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe KerberosAttributes)

--   category. For example, key name, subnet ID, IAM instance profile, and
--   so on.
cluster_ec2InstanceAttributes :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Ec2InstanceAttributes)

-- | An approximation of the cost of the cluster, represented in

command_scriptPath :: Lens' Command (Maybe Text)

command_name :: Lens' Command (Maybe Text)

-- | The upper boundary of On-Demand EC2 units. It is measured through vCPU
--   cores or instances for instance groups and measured through units for
--   instance fleets. The On-Demand units are not allowed to scale beyond
--   this boundary. The parameter is used to split capacity allocation
--   between On-Demand and Spot Instances.
computeLimits_maximumOnDemandCapacityUnits :: Lens' ComputeLimits (Maybe Int)

-- | The upper boundary of EC2 units for core node type in a cluster. It is
--   measured through vCPU cores or instances for instance groups and
--   measured through units for instance fleets. The core units are not
--   allowed to scale beyond this boundary. The parameter is used to split
--   capacity allocation between core and task nodes.
computeLimits_maximumCoreCapacityUnits :: Lens' ComputeLimits (Maybe Int)

-- | The unit type used for specifying a managed scaling policy.
computeLimits_unitType :: Lens' ComputeLimits ComputeLimitsUnitType

-- | The lower boundary of EC2 units. It is measured through vCPU cores or
--   instances for instance groups and measured through units for instance
--   fleets. Managed scaling activities are not allowed beyond this
--   boundary. The limit only applies to the core and task nodes. The
--   master node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.
computeLimits_minimumCapacityUnits :: Lens' ComputeLimits Int

-- | The upper boundary of EC2 units. It is measured through vCPU cores or
--   instances for instance groups and measured through units for instance
--   fleets. Managed scaling activities are not allowed beyond this
--   boundary. The limit only applies to the core and task nodes. The
--   master node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.
computeLimits_maximumCapacityUnits :: Lens' ComputeLimits Int
