--   constructor.
data GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse
GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse' :: Int -> BlockPublicAccessConfiguration -> BlockPublicAccessConfigurationMetadata -> GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockPublicAccessConfiguration:GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse_blockPublicAccessConfiguration</a>
--   - A configuration for Amazon EMR block public access. The
--   configuration applies to all clusters created in your account for the
--   current Region. The configuration specifies whether block public
--   access is enabled. If block public access is enabled, security groups
--   associated with the cluster cannot have rules that allow inbound
--   traffic from 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 on a port, unless the port is specified
--   as an exception using <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>
--   in the <tt>BlockPublicAccessConfiguration</tt>. By default, Port 22
--   (SSH) is an exception, and public access is allowed on this port. You
--   can change this by updating the block public access configuration to
--   remove the exception.
--   
--   For accounts that created clusters in a Region before November 25,
--   2019, block public access is disabled by default in that Region. To
--   use this feature, you must manually enable and configure it. For
--   accounts that did not create an EMR cluster in a Region before this
--   date, block public access is enabled by default in that Region.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockPublicAccessConfigurationMetadata:GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse_blockPublicAccessConfigurationMetadata</a>
--   - Properties that describe the Amazon Web Services principal that
--   created the <tt>BlockPublicAccessConfiguration</tt> using the
--   <tt>PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration</tt> action as well as the date
--   and time that the configuration was created. Each time a configuration
--   for block public access is updated, Amazon EMR updates this metadata.
newGetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse :: Int -> BlockPublicAccessConfiguration -> BlockPublicAccessConfigurationMetadata -> GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListNotebookExecutions</a> smart constructor.
data ListNotebookExecutions
ListNotebookExecutions' :: Maybe NotebookExecutionStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> ListNotebookExecutions

-- | Create a value of <a>ListNotebookExecutions</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ListNotebookExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>listNotebookExecutions_status</a> - The status filter for listing
--   notebook executions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>START_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received the
--   execution request but execution has not begun.</li>
--   <li><tt>STARTING</tt> indicates that the execution is starting on the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> indicates that the execution is being processed
--   by the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHING</tt> indicates that execution processing is in the
--   final stages.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHED</tt> indicates that the execution has completed
--   without error.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILING</tt> indicates that the execution is failing and will
--   not finish successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> indicates that the execution failed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOP_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request and the stop is pending.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt> indicates that the cluster is in the process of
--   stopping the execution as a result of a <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt>
--   request.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt> indicates that the execution stopped because of a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:editorId:ListNotebookExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>listNotebookExecutions_editorId</a> - The unique ID of the editor
--   associated with the notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:to:ListNotebookExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>listNotebookExecutions_to</a> - The end of time range filter for
--   listing notebook executions. The default is the current timestamp.
--   
--   <a>$sel:from:ListNotebookExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>listNotebookExecutions_from</a> - The beginning of time range
--   filter for listing notebook executions. The default is the timestamp
--   of 30 days ago.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:ListNotebookExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>listNotebookExecutions_marker</a> - The pagination token, returned

-- | Create a value of <a>PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockPublicAccessConfiguration:PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>putBlockPublicAccessConfiguration_blockPublicAccessConfiguration</a>
--   - A configuration for Amazon EMR block public access. The
--   configuration applies to all clusters created in your account for the
--   current Region. The configuration specifies whether block public
--   access is enabled. If block public access is enabled, security groups
--   associated with the cluster cannot have rules that allow inbound
--   traffic from 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 on a port, unless the port is specified
--   as an exception using <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>
--   in the <tt>BlockPublicAccessConfiguration</tt>. By default, Port 22
--   (SSH) is an exception, and public access is allowed on this port. You
--   can change this by updating <tt>BlockPublicSecurityGroupRules</tt> to
--   remove the exception.
--   
--   For accounts that created clusters in a Region before November 25,
--   2019, block public access is disabled by default in that Region. To
--   use this feature, you must manually enable and configure it. For
--   accounts that did not create an EMR cluster in a Region before this
--   date, block public access is enabled by default in that Region.
newPutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration :: BlockPublicAccessConfiguration -> PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration

-- | With Amazon EMR release version 4.0 and later, the only accepted
--   parameter is the application name. To pass arguments to applications,
--   you use configuration classifications specified using configuration
--   JSON objects. For more information, see <a>Configuring
--   Applications</a>.
--   
--   With earlier Amazon EMR releases, the application is any Amazon or
--   third-party software that you can add to the cluster. This structure
--   contains a list of strings that indicates the software to use with the
--   cluster and accepts a user argument list. Amazon EMR accepts and
--   forwards the argument list to the corresponding installation script as
--   bootstrap action argument.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newApplication</a> smart constructor.
data Application
Application' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Application

-- | Create a value of <a>Application</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:args:Application'</a>, <a>application_args</a> - Arguments for
--   Amazon EMR to pass to the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalInfo:Application'</a>,
--   <a>application_additionalInfo</a> - This option is for advanced users
--   only. This is meta information about third-party applications that
--   third-party vendors use for testing purposes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:Application'</a>, <a>application_version</a> - The
--   version of the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Application'</a>, <a>application_name</a> - The name of
--   the application.
newApplication :: Application

-- | An automatic scaling policy for a core instance group or task instance
--   group in an Amazon EMR cluster. An automatic scaling policy defines
--   how an instance group dynamically adds and terminates EC2 instances in
--   response to the value of a CloudWatch metric. See
--   PutAutoScalingPolicy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoScalingPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data AutoScalingPolicy
AutoScalingPolicy' :: ScalingConstraints -> [ScalingRule] -> AutoScalingPolicy

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoScalingPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:constraints:AutoScalingPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingPolicy_constraints</a> - The upper and lower EC2
--   instance limits for an automatic scaling policy. Automatic scaling
--   activity will not cause an instance group to grow above or below these
--   limits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rules:AutoScalingPolicy'</a>, <a>autoScalingPolicy_rules</a> -
--   The scale-in and scale-out rules that comprise the automatic scaling
--   policy.
newAutoScalingPolicy :: ScalingConstraints -> AutoScalingPolicy

-- | An automatic scaling policy for a core instance group or task instance

--   how an instance group dynamically adds and terminates EC2 instances in

-- | An auto-termination policy for an Amazon EMR cluster. An
--   auto-termination policy defines the amount of idle time in seconds

--   cluster termination options, see <a>Control cluster termination</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoTerminationPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data AutoTerminationPolicy

--   idle time in seconds after which the cluster automatically terminates.
--   You can specify a minimum of 60 seconds and a maximum of 604800
--   seconds (seven days).
newAutoTerminationPolicy :: AutoTerminationPolicy

-- | A configuration for Amazon EMR block public access. When
--   <tt>BlockPublicSecurityGroupRules</tt> is set to <tt>true</tt>, Amazon
--   EMR prevents cluster creation if one of the cluster's security groups
--   has a rule that allows inbound traffic from 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 on a
--   port, unless the port is specified as an exception using
--   <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBlockPublicAccessConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data BlockPublicAccessConfiguration
BlockPublicAccessConfiguration' :: Maybe [PortRange] -> Bool -> BlockPublicAccessConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>BlockPublicAccessConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:permittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges:BlockPublicAccessConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>blockPublicAccessConfiguration_permittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</a>
--   - Specifies ports and port ranges that are permitted to have security
--   group rules that allow inbound traffic from all public sources. For
--   example, if Port 23 (Telnet) is specified for
--   <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>, Amazon EMR allows
--   cluster creation if a security group associated with the cluster has a
--   rule that allows inbound traffic on Port 23 from IPv4 0.0.0.0/0 or
--   IPv6 port ::/0 as the source.
--   
--   By default, Port 22, which is used for SSH access to the cluster EC2
--   instances, is in the list of
--   <tt>PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges</tt>.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockPublicSecurityGroupRules:BlockPublicAccessConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>blockPublicAccessConfiguration_blockPublicSecurityGroupRules</a> -
--   Indicates whether Amazon EMR block public access is enabled
--   (<tt>true</tt>) or disabled (<tt>false</tt>). By default, the value is
--   <tt>false</tt> for accounts that have created EMR clusters before July
--   2019. For accounts created after this, the default is <tt>true</tt>.
newBlockPublicAccessConfiguration :: Bool -> BlockPublicAccessConfiguration

-- | Properties that describe the Amazon Web Services principal that
--   created the <tt>BlockPublicAccessConfiguration</tt> using the
--   <tt>PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration</tt> action as well as the date
--   and time that the configuration was created. Each time a configuration

-- | The definition of a CloudWatch metric alarm, which determines when an
--   automatic scaling activity is triggered. When the defined alarm
--   conditions are satisfied, scaling activity begins.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudWatchAlarmDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data CloudWatchAlarmDefinition
CloudWatchAlarmDefinition' :: Maybe Unit -> Maybe Statistic -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [MetricDimension] -> Maybe Int -> ComparisonOperator -> Text -> Int -> Double -> CloudWatchAlarmDefinition

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudWatchAlarmDefinition</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_unit</a> - The unit of measure associated
--   with the CloudWatch metric being watched. The value specified for
--   <tt>Unit</tt> must correspond to the units specified in the CloudWatch
--   metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statistic:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_statistic</a> - The statistic to apply to
--   the metric associated with the alarm. The default is <tt>AVERAGE</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:namespace:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_namespace</a> - The namespace for the
--   CloudWatch metric. The default is <tt>AWS/ElasticMapReduce</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_dimensions</a> - A CloudWatch metric
--   dimension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluationPeriods:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_evaluationPeriods</a> - The number of
--   periods, in five-minute increments, during which the alarm condition
--   must exist before the alarm triggers automatic scaling activity. The
--   default value is <tt>1</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparisonOperator:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_comparisonOperator</a> - Determines how
--   the metric specified by <tt>MetricName</tt> is compared to the value
--   specified by <tt>Threshold</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricName:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_metricName</a> - The name of the
--   CloudWatch metric that is watched to determine an alarm condition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:period:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_period</a> - The period, in seconds, over
--   which the statistic is applied. EMR CloudWatch metrics are emitted
--   every five minutes (300 seconds), so if an EMR CloudWatch metric is
--   specified, specify <tt>300</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:threshold:CloudWatchAlarmDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchAlarmDefinition_threshold</a> - The value against which
--   the specified statistic is compared.
newCloudWatchAlarmDefinition :: ComparisonOperator -> Text -> Int -> Double -> CloudWatchAlarmDefinition

-- | The detailed description of the cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCluster</a> smart constructor.
data Cluster
Cluster' :: Maybe RepoUpgradeOnBoot -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ScaleDownBehavior -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Configuration] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InstanceCollectionType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe [Application] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [PlacementGroupConfig] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe KerberosAttributes -> Maybe Ec2InstanceAttributes -> Text -> Text -> ClusterStatus -> Cluster

-- | Create a value of <a>Cluster</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:repoUpgradeOnBoot:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_repoUpgradeOnBoot</a> - Applies only when
--   <tt>CustomAmiID</tt> is used. Specifies the type of updates that are
--   applied from the Amazon Linux AMI package repositories when an
--   instance boots using the AMI.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterArn:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_clusterArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name of the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceRole:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_serviceRole</a> - The IAM
--   role that Amazon EMR assumes in order to access Amazon Web Services
--   resources on your behalf.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScalingRole:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_autoScalingRole</a> -
--   An IAM role for automatic scaling policies. The default role is
--   <tt>EMR_AutoScaling_DefaultRole</tt>. The IAM role provides
--   permissions that the automatic scaling feature requires to launch and
--   terminate EC2 instances in an instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleDownBehavior:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_scaleDownBehavior</a> - The way that individual Amazon EC2
--   instances terminate when an automatic scale-in activity occurs or an
--   instance group is resized. <tt>TERMINATE_AT_INSTANCE_HOUR</tt>
--   indicates that Amazon EMR terminates nodes at the instance-hour
--   boundary, regardless of when the request to terminate the instance was
--   submitted. This option is only available with Amazon EMR 5.1.0 and
--   later and is the default for clusters created using that version.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> indicates that Amazon EMR adds
--   nodes to a deny list and drains tasks from nodes before terminating
--   the Amazon EC2 instances, regardless of the instance-hour boundary.
--   With either behavior, Amazon EMR removes the least active nodes first
--   and blocks instance termination if it could lead to HDFS corruption.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION</tt> is available only in Amazon EMR
--   version 4.1.0 and later, and is the default for versions of Amazon EMR
--   earlier than 5.1.0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityConfiguration:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_securityConfiguration</a> - The name of the security
--   configuration applied to the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:terminationProtected:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_terminationProtected</a> - Indicates whether Amazon EMR
--   will lock the cluster to prevent the EC2 instances from being
--   terminated by an API call or user intervention, or in the event of a
--   cluster error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterPublicDnsName:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_masterPublicDnsName</a> - The DNS name of the master node.
--   If the cluster is on a private subnet, this is the private DNS name.
--   On a public subnet, this is the public DNS name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurations:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_configurations</a> -
--   Applies only to Amazon EMR releases 4.x and later. The list of
--   Configurations supplied to the EMR cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outpostArn:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_outpostArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost where the cluster is
--   launched.
--   
--   <a>$sel:runningAmiVersion:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_runningAmiVersion</a> - The AMI version running on this
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsRootVolumeSize:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_ebsRootVolumeSize</a> - The size, in GiB, of the Amazon EBS
--   root device volume of the Linux AMI that is used for each EC2
--   instance. Available in Amazon EMR version 4.x and later.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestedAmiVersion:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_requestedAmiVersion</a> - The AMI version requested for
--   this cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:releaseLabel:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_releaseLabel</a> - The
--   Amazon EMR release label, which determines the version of open-source
--   application packages installed on the cluster. Release labels are in
--   the form <tt>emr-x.x.x</tt>, where x.x.x is an Amazon EMR release
--   version such as <tt>emr-5.14.0</tt>. For more information about Amazon
--   EMR release versions and included application versions and features,
--   see <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ReleaseGuide/</a>. The
--   release label applies only to Amazon EMR releases version 4.0 and
--   later. Earlier versions use <tt>AmiVersion</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceCollectionType:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_instanceCollectionType</a> - The instance fleet
--   configuration is available only in Amazon EMR versions 4.8.0 and
--   later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   The instance group configuration of the cluster. A value of
--   <tt>INSTANCE_GROUP</tt> indicates a uniform instance group
--   configuration. A value of <tt>INSTANCE_FLEET</tt> indicates an
--   instance fleets configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logEncryptionKmsKeyId:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_logEncryptionKmsKeyId</a> - The KMS key used for encrypting
--   log files. This attribute is only available with EMR version 5.30.0
--   and later, excluding EMR 6.0.0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_tags</a> - A list of tags
--   associated with a cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applications:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_applications</a> - The
--   applications installed on this cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stepConcurrencyLevel:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_stepConcurrencyLevel</a> - Specifies the number of steps
--   that can be executed concurrently.
--   
--   <a>$sel:visibleToAllUsers:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_visibleToAllUsers</a> - Indicates whether the cluster is
--   visible to IAM principals in the Amazon Web Services account
--   associated with the cluster. When <tt>true</tt>, IAM principals in the
--   Amazon Web Services account can perform EMR cluster actions on the
--   cluster that their IAM policies allow. When <tt>false</tt>, only the
--   IAM principal that created the cluster and the Amazon Web Services
--   account root user can perform EMR actions, regardless of IAM
--   permissions policies attached to other IAM principals.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>true</tt> if a value is not provided when
--   creating a cluster using the EMR API RunJobFlow command, the CLI
--   <a>create-cluster</a> command, or the Amazon Web Services Management
--   Console. IAM principals that are allowed to perform actions on the
--   cluster can use the SetVisibleToAllUsers action to change the value on
--   a running cluster. For more information, see <a>Understanding the EMR
--   Cluster VisibleToAllUsers Setting</a> in the <i>Amazon EMRManagement
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoTerminate:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_autoTerminate</a> -
--   Specifies whether the cluster should terminate after completing all
--   steps.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customAmiId:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_customAmiId</a> -
--   Available only in Amazon EMR version 5.7.0 and later. The ID of a
--   custom Amazon EBS-backed Linux AMI if the cluster uses a custom AMI.
--   
--   <a>$sel:normalizedInstanceHours:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_normalizedInstanceHours</a> - An approximation of the cost
--   of the cluster, represented in m1.small/hours. This value is
--   incremented one time for every hour an m1.small instance runs. Larger
--   instances are weighted more, so an EC2 instance that is roughly four
--   times more expensive would result in the normalized instance hours
--   being incremented by four. This result is only an approximation and
--   does not reflect the actual billing rate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:placementGroups:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_placementGroups</a> -
--   Placement group configured for an Amazon EMR cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logUri:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_logUri</a> - The path to the
--   Amazon S3 location where logs for this cluster are stored.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kerberosAttributes:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_kerberosAttributes</a> - Attributes for Kerberos
--   configuration when Kerberos authentication is enabled using a security
--   configuration. For more information see <a>Use Kerberos
--   Authentication</a> in the <i>Amazon EMR Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2InstanceAttributes:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_ec2InstanceAttributes</a> - Provides information about the
--   EC2 instances in a cluster grouped by category. For example, key name,
--   subnet ID, IAM instance profile, and so on.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_id</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_name</a> - The name of the
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_status</a> - The current
--   status details about the cluster.
newCluster :: Text -> Text -> ClusterStatus -> Cluster

-- | The EC2 unit limits for a managed scaling policy. The managed scaling
--   activity of a cluster can not be above or below these limits. The
--   limit only applies to the core and task nodes. The master node cannot
--   be scaled after initial configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newComputeLimits</a> smart constructor.
data ComputeLimits
ComputeLimits' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> ComputeLimitsUnitType -> Int -> Int -> ComputeLimits

-- | Create a value of <a>ComputeLimits</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumOnDemandCapacityUnits:ComputeLimits'</a>,
--   <a>computeLimits_maximumOnDemandCapacityUnits</a> - The upper boundary
--   of On-Demand EC2 units. It is measured through vCPU cores or instances
--   for instance groups and measured through units for instance fleets.
--   The On-Demand units are not allowed to scale beyond this boundary. The
--   parameter is used to split capacity allocation between On-Demand and
--   Spot Instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumCoreCapacityUnits:ComputeLimits'</a>,
--   <a>computeLimits_maximumCoreCapacityUnits</a> - The upper boundary of
--   EC2 units for core node type in a cluster. It is measured through vCPU
--   cores or instances for instance groups and measured through units for
--   instance fleets. The core units are not allowed to scale beyond this
--   boundary. The parameter is used to split capacity allocation between
--   core and task nodes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unitType:ComputeLimits'</a>, <a>computeLimits_unitType</a> -
--   The unit type used for specifying a managed scaling policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minimumCapacityUnits:ComputeLimits'</a>,
--   <a>computeLimits_minimumCapacityUnits</a> - The lower boundary of EC2
--   units. It is measured through vCPU cores or instances for instance
--   groups and measured through units for instance fleets. Managed scaling
--   activities are not allowed beyond this boundary. The limit only
--   applies to the core and task nodes. The master node cannot be scaled
--   after initial configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumCapacityUnits:ComputeLimits'</a>,
--   <a>computeLimits_maximumCapacityUnits</a> - The upper boundary of EC2
--   units. It is measured through vCPU cores or instances for instance
--   groups and measured through units for instance fleets. Managed scaling
--   activities are not allowed beyond this boundary. The limit only
--   applies to the core and task nodes. The master node cannot be scaled
--   after initial configuration.
newComputeLimits :: ComputeLimitsUnitType -> Int -> Int -> ComputeLimits

-- | Amazon EMR releases 4.x or later.
--   
--   An optional configuration specification to be used when provisioning
--   cluster instances, which can include configurations for applications
--   and software bundled with Amazon EMR. A configuration consists of a
--   classification, properties, and optional nested configurations. A
--   classification refers to an application-specific configuration file.
--   Properties are the settings you want to change in that file. For more
--   information, see <a>Configuring Applications</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data Configuration

--   configurations to apply within a configuration object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:properties:Configuration'</a>, <a>configuration_properties</a>
--   - A set of properties specified within a configuration classification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:classification:Configuration'</a>,
--   <a>configuration_classification</a> - The classification within a
--   configuration.
newConfiguration :: Configuration

data Ec2InstanceAttributes
Ec2InstanceAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Ec2InstanceAttributes

-- | Create a value of <a>Ec2InstanceAttributes</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2KeyName:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_ec2KeyName</a> - The name of the Amazon EC2
--   key pair to use when connecting with SSH into the master node as a
--   user named "hadoop".
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalSlaveSecurityGroups:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_additionalSlaveSecurityGroups</a> - A list of
--   additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the core and task nodes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2AvailabilityZone:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_ec2AvailabilityZone</a> - The Availability
--   Zone in which the cluster will run.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_emrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup</a> - The
--   identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the core and task
--   nodes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestedEc2AvailabilityZones:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_requestedEc2AvailabilityZones</a> - Applies
--   to clusters configured with the instance fleets option. Specifies one
--   or more Availability Zones in which to launch EC2 cluster instances
--   when the EC2-Classic network configuration is supported. Amazon EMR
--   chooses the Availability Zone with the best fit from among the list of
--   <tt>RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones</tt>, and then launches all cluster
--   instances within that Availability Zone. If you do not specify this
--   value, Amazon EMR chooses the Availability Zone for you.
--   <tt>RequestedEc2SubnetIDs</tt> and
--   <tt>RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones</tt> cannot be specified together.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2SubnetId:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_ec2SubnetId</a> - Set this parameter to the
--   identifier of the Amazon VPC subnet where you want the cluster to
--   launch. If you do not specify this value, and your account supports
--   EC2-Classic, the cluster launches in EC2-Classic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emrManagedMasterSecurityGroup:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_emrManagedMasterSecurityGroup</a> - The
--   identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the master node.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamInstanceProfile:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_iamInstanceProfile</a> - The IAM role that
--   was specified when the cluster was launched. The EC2 instances of the
--   cluster assume this role.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalMasterSecurityGroups:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_additionalMasterSecurityGroups</a> - A list
--   of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the master node.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestedEc2SubnetIds:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_requestedEc2SubnetIds</a> - Applies to
--   clusters configured with the instance fleets option. Specifies the
--   unique identifier of one or more Amazon EC2 subnets in which to launch
--   EC2 cluster instances. Subnets must exist within the same VPC. Amazon
--   EMR chooses the EC2 subnet with the best fit from among the list of
--   <tt>RequestedEc2SubnetIds</tt>, and then launches all cluster
--   instances within that Subnet. If this value is not specified, and the
--   account and Region support EC2-Classic networks, the cluster launches
--   instances in the EC2-Classic network and uses
--   <tt>RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones</tt> instead of this setting. If
--   EC2-Classic is not supported, and no Subnet is specified, Amazon EMR
--   chooses the subnet for you. <tt>RequestedEc2SubnetIDs</tt> and
--   <tt>RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones</tt> cannot be specified together.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessSecurityGroup:Ec2InstanceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>ec2InstanceAttributes_serviceAccessSecurityGroup</a> - The
--   identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the Amazon EMR service
--   to access clusters in VPC private subnets.
newEc2InstanceAttributes :: Ec2InstanceAttributes

-- | Specifies the execution engine (cluster) to run the notebook and
--   perform the notebook execution, for example, an EMR cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExecutionEngineConfig</a> smart constructor.
data ExecutionEngineConfig
ExecutionEngineConfig' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ExecutionEngineType -> Text -> ExecutionEngineConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>ExecutionEngineConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterInstanceSecurityGroupId:ExecutionEngineConfig'</a>,
--   <a>executionEngineConfig_masterInstanceSecurityGroupId</a> - An
--   optional unique ID of an EC2 security group to associate with the
--   master instance of the EMR cluster for this notebook execution. For
--   more information see <a>Specifying EC2 Security Groups for EMR
--   Notebooks</a> in the <i>EMR Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ExecutionEngineConfig'</a>,
--   <a>executionEngineConfig_type</a> - The type of execution engine. A
--   value of <tt>EMR</tt> specifies an EMR cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ExecutionEngineConfig'</a>, <a>executionEngineConfig_id</a>
--   - The unique identifier of the execution engine. For an EMR cluster,
--   this is the cluster ID.
newExecutionEngineConfig :: Text -> ExecutionEngineConfig

-- | The details of the step failure. The service attempts to detect the
--   root cause for many common failures.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFailureDetails</a> smart constructor.
data FailureDetails
FailureDetails' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> FailureDetails

-- | Create a value of <a>FailureDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:FailureDetails'</a>, <a>failureDetails_message</a> -
--   The descriptive message including the error the Amazon EMR service has
--   identified as the cause of step failure. This is text from an error
--   log that describes the root cause of the failure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reason:FailureDetails'</a>, <a>failureDetails_reason</a> - The
--   reason for the step failure. In the case where the service cannot
--   successfully determine the root cause of the failure, it returns
--   "Unknown Error" as a reason.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logFile:FailureDetails'</a>, <a>failureDetails_logFile</a> -
--   The path to the log file where the step failure root cause was
--   originally recorded.
newFailureDetails :: FailureDetails

-- | A job flow step consisting of a JAR file whose main function will be

newHadoopJarStepConfig :: Text -> HadoopJarStepConfig

-- | Represents an EC2 instance provisioned as part of cluster.

data Instance

--   status of the instance.

newInstance :: Instance

-- | Describes an instance fleet, which is a group of EC2 instances that
--   host a particular node type (master, core, or task) in an Amazon EMR
--   cluster. Instance fleets can consist of a mix of instance types and
--   On-Demand and Spot Instances, which are provisioned to meet a defined
--   target capacity.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceFleet</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceFleet
InstanceFleet' :: Maybe InstanceFleetType -> Maybe InstanceFleetStatus -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InstanceTypeSpecification] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications -> InstanceFleet

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceFleet</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceFleetType:InstanceFleet'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleet_instanceFleetType</a> - The node type that the
--   instance fleet hosts. Valid values are MASTER, CORE, or TASK.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:InstanceFleet'</a>, <a>instanceFleet_status</a> - The
--   current status of the instance fleet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetOnDemandCapacity:InstanceFleet'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleet_targetOnDemandCapacity</a> - The target capacity of
--   On-Demand units for the instance fleet, which determines how many
--   On-Demand Instances to provision. When the instance fleet launches,
--   Amazon EMR tries to provision On-Demand Instances as specified by
--   InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance configuration has a specified
--   <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>. When an On-Demand Instance is provisioned,
--   the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> units count toward the target capacity.
--   Amazon EMR provisions instances until the target capacity is totally
--   fulfilled, even if this results in an overage. For example, if there
--   are 2 units remaining to fulfill capacity, and Amazon EMR can only
--   provision an instance with a <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> of 5 units, the
--   instance is provisioned, and the target capacity is exceeded by 3
--   units. You can use InstanceFleet$ProvisionedOnDemandCapacity to
--   determine the Spot capacity units that have been provisioned for the
--   instance fleet.
--   
--   If not specified or set to 0, only Spot Instances are provisioned for
--   the instance fleet using <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>. At least one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should
--   be greater than 0. For a master instance fleet, only one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be
--   specified, and its value must be 1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetSpotCapacity:InstanceFleet'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleet_targetSpotCapacity</a> - The target capacity of Spot
--   units for the instance fleet, which determines how many Spot Instances
--   to provision. When the instance fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to
--   provision Spot Instances as specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each
--   instance configuration has a specified <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>. When
--   a Spot instance is provisioned, the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> units
--   count toward the target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances
--   until the target capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results
--   in an overage. For example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill
--   capacity, and Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a
--   <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and
--   the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units. You can use
--   InstanceFleet$ProvisionedSpotCapacity to determine the Spot capacity
--   units that have been provisioned for the instance fleet.
--   
--   If not specified or set to 0, only On-Demand Instances are provisioned
--   for the instance fleet. At least one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>
--   and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should be greater than 0. For a
--   master instance fleet, only one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and
--   <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be specified, and its value must
--   be 1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:InstanceFleet'</a>, <a>instanceFleet_id</a> - The unique
--   identifier of the instance fleet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedOnDemandCapacity:InstanceFleet'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleet_provisionedOnDemandCapacity</a> - The number of
--   On-Demand units that have been provisioned for the instance fleet to
--   fulfill <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt>. This provisioned capacity
--   might be less than or greater than <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:InstanceFleet'</a>, <a>instanceFleet_name</a> - A
--   friendly name for the instance fleet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceTypeSpecifications:InstanceFleet'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleet_instanceTypeSpecifications</a> - An array of
--   specifications for the instance types that comprise an instance fleet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedSpotCapacity:InstanceFleet'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleet_provisionedSpotCapacity</a> - The number of Spot
--   units that have been provisioned for this instance fleet to fulfill
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>. This provisioned capacity might be less
--   than or greater than <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:launchSpecifications:InstanceFleet'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleet_launchSpecifications</a> - Describes the launch
--   specification for an instance fleet.
newInstanceFleet :: InstanceFleet

-- | The configuration that defines an instance fleet.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceFleetConfig</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceFleetConfig
InstanceFleetConfig' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InstanceFleetProvisioningSpecifications -> Maybe [InstanceTypeConfig] -> InstanceFleetType -> InstanceFleetConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceFleetConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetOnDemandCapacity:InstanceFleetConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleetConfig_targetOnDemandCapacity</a> - The target
--   capacity of On-Demand units for the instance fleet, which determines
--   how many On-Demand Instances to provision. When the instance fleet
--   launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision On-Demand Instances as
--   specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance configuration has a
--   specified <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>. When an On-Demand Instance is
--   provisioned, the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> units count toward the
--   target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances until the target
--   capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results in an overage. For
--   example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill capacity, and
--   Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a
--   <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and
--   the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units.
--   
--   If not specified or set to 0, only Spot Instances are provisioned for
--   the instance fleet using <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>. At least one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should
--   be greater than 0. For a master instance fleet, only one of
--   <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be
--   specified, and its value must be 1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetSpotCapacity:InstanceFleetConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleetConfig_targetSpotCapacity</a> - The target capacity of
--   Spot units for the instance fleet, which determines how many Spot
--   Instances to provision. When the instance fleet launches, Amazon EMR
--   tries to provision Spot Instances as specified by InstanceTypeConfig.
--   Each instance configuration has a specified <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>.
--   When a Spot Instance is provisioned, the <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt>
--   units count toward the target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions
--   instances until the target capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this
--   results in an overage. For example, if there are 2 units remaining to
--   fulfill capacity, and Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a
--   <tt>WeightedCapacity</tt> of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and
--   the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units.
--   
--   If not specified or set to 0, only On-Demand Instances are provisioned
--   for the instance fleet. At least one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt>
--   and <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> should be greater than 0. For a
--   master instance fleet, only one of <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> and
--   <tt>TargetOnDemandCapacity</tt> can be specified, and its value must
--   be 1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:InstanceFleetConfig'</a>, <a>instanceFleetConfig_name</a>
--   - The friendly name of the instance fleet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:launchSpecifications:InstanceFleetConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleetConfig_launchSpecifications</a> - The launch
--   specification for the instance fleet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceTypeConfigs:InstanceFleetConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleetConfig_instanceTypeConfigs</a> - The instance type
--   configurations that define the EC2 instances in the instance fleet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceFleetType:InstanceFleetConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleetConfig_instanceFleetType</a> - The node type that the
--   instance fleet hosts. Valid values are MASTER, CORE, and TASK.
newInstanceFleetConfig :: InstanceFleetType -> InstanceFleetConfig

-- | The status of the instance fleet.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceFleetStatus</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceFleetStatus
InstanceFleetStatus' :: Maybe InstanceFleetStateChangeReason -> Maybe InstanceFleetState -> Maybe InstanceFleetTimeline -> InstanceFleetStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceFleetStatus</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateChangeReason:InstanceFleetStatus'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleetStatus_stateChangeReason</a> - Provides status change
--   reason details for the instance fleet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:InstanceFleetStatus'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleetStatus_state</a> - A code representing the instance
--   fleet status.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PROVISIONING</tt>—The instance fleet is provisioning EC2
--   resources and is not yet ready to run jobs.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOOTSTRAPPING</tt>—EC2 instances and other resources have been
--   provisioned and the bootstrap actions specified for the instances are
--   underway.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt>—EC2 instances and other resources are running.
--   They are either executing jobs or waiting to execute jobs.</li>
--   <li><tt>RESIZING</tt>—A resize operation is underway. EC2 instances
--   are either being added or removed.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUSPENDED</tt>—A resize operation could not complete. Existing
--   EC2 instances are running, but instances can't be added or
--   removed.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATING</tt>—The instance fleet is terminating EC2
--   instances.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATED</tt>—The instance fleet is no longer active, and
--   all EC2 instances have been terminated.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeline:InstanceFleetStatus'</a>,
--   <a>instanceFleetStatus_timeline</a> - Provides historical timestamps
--   for the instance fleet, including the time of creation, the time it
--   became ready to run jobs, and the time of termination.
newInstanceFleetStatus :: InstanceFleetStatus

-- | Provides historical timestamps for the instance fleet, including the
--   time of creation, the time it became ready to run jobs, and the time
--   of termination.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceFleetTimeline</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceFleetTimeline

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceFleetTimeline</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   instance fleet terminated.

--   <a>instanceFleetTimeline_readyDateTime</a> - The time and date the
--   instance fleet was ready to run jobs.
newInstanceFleetTimeline :: InstanceFleetTimeline

-- | This entity represents an instance group, which is a group of
--   instances that have common purpose. For example, CORE instance group
--   is used for HDFS.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceGroup</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceGroup
InstanceGroup' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe InstanceGroupStatus -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [EbsBlockDevice] -> Maybe InstanceGroupType -> Maybe [Configuration] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Configuration] -> Maybe ShrinkPolicy -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe AutoScalingPolicyDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MarketType -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> InstanceGroup

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastSuccessfullyAppliedConfigurationsVersion:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_lastSuccessfullyAppliedConfigurationsVersion</a> -
--   The version number of a configuration specification that was
--   successfully applied for an instance group last time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:InstanceGroup'</a>, <a>instanceGroup_status</a> - The
--   current status of the instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsOptimized:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_ebsOptimized</a> - If the instance group is
--   EBS-optimized. An Amazon EBS-optimized instance uses an optimized
--   configuration stack and provides additional, dedicated capacity for
--   Amazon EBS I/O.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_instanceType</a> - The EC2 instance type for all
--   instances in the instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsBlockDevices:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_ebsBlockDevices</a> - The EBS block devices that are
--   mapped to this instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceGroupType:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_instanceGroupType</a> - The type of the instance
--   group. Valid values are MASTER, CORE or TASK.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurations:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_configurations</a> - Amazon EMR releases 4.x or
--   later.
--   
--   The list of configurations supplied for an Amazon EMR cluster instance
--   group. You can specify a separate configuration for each instance
--   group (master, core, and task).
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:InstanceGroup'</a>, <a>instanceGroup_id</a> - The
--   identifier of the instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastSuccessfullyAppliedConfigurations:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_lastSuccessfullyAppliedConfigurations</a> - A list of
--   configurations that were successfully applied for an instance group
--   last time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shrinkPolicy:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_shrinkPolicy</a> - Policy for customizing shrink
--   operations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bidPrice:InstanceGroup'</a>, <a>instanceGroup_bidPrice</a> -
--   If specified, indicates that the instance group uses Spot Instances.
--   This is the maximum price you are willing to pay for Spot Instances.
--   Specify <tt>OnDemandPrice</tt> to set the amount equal to the
--   On-Demand price, or specify an amount in USD.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestedInstanceCount:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_requestedInstanceCount</a> - The target number of
--   instances for the instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScalingPolicy:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_autoScalingPolicy</a> - An automatic scaling policy
--   for a core instance group or task instance group in an Amazon EMR
--   cluster. The automatic scaling policy defines how an instance group
--   dynamically adds and terminates EC2 instances in response to the value
--   of a CloudWatch metric. See PutAutoScalingPolicy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:InstanceGroup'</a>, <a>instanceGroup_name</a> - The name
--   of the instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:market:InstanceGroup'</a>, <a>instanceGroup_market</a> - The
--   marketplace to provision instances for this group. Valid values are
--   ON_DEMAND or SPOT.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationsVersion:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_configurationsVersion</a> - The version number of the
--   requested configuration specification for this instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customAmiId:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_customAmiId</a> - The custom AMI ID to use for the
--   provisioned instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:runningInstanceCount:InstanceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroup_runningInstanceCount</a> - The number of instances
--   currently running in this instance group.
newInstanceGroup :: InstanceGroup

data InstanceGroupConfig

--   later.

--   You can specify a separate configuration for each instance group
--   (master, core, and task).

--   <a>instanceGroupConfig_bidPrice</a> - If specified, indicates that the
--   instance group uses Spot Instances. This is the maximum price you are

--   set the amount equal to the On-Demand price, or specify an amount in
--   USD.

--   value of a CloudWatch metric. See PutAutoScalingPolicy.

--   used to create a cluster node.

--   the provisioned instance group.

--   group in the cluster.

--   <a>instanceGroupConfig_instanceType</a> - The EC2 instance type for
--   all instances in the instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceCount:InstanceGroupConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceGroupConfig_instanceCount</a> - Target number of instances
--   for the instance group.
newInstanceGroupConfig :: InstanceRoleType -> Text -> Int -> InstanceGroupConfig

-- | An instance type configuration for each instance type in an instance
--   fleet, which determines the EC2 instances Amazon EMR attempts to
--   provision to fulfill On-Demand and Spot target capacities. When you
--   use an allocation strategy, you can include a maximum of 30 instance
--   type configurations for a fleet. For more information about how to use
--   an allocation strategy, see <a>Configure Instance Fleets</a>. Without
--   an allocation strategy, you may specify a maximum of five instance
--   type configurations for a fleet.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceTypeConfig</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceTypeConfig
InstanceTypeConfig' :: Maybe EbsConfiguration -> Maybe [Configuration] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> InstanceTypeConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceTypeConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsConfiguration:InstanceTypeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeConfig_ebsConfiguration</a> - The configuration of
--   Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) attached to each instance as
--   defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurations:InstanceTypeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeConfig_configurations</a> - A configuration
--   classification that applies when provisioning cluster instances, which
--   can include configurations for applications and software that run on
--   the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bidPrice:InstanceTypeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeConfig_bidPrice</a> - The bid price for each EC2 Spot
--   Instance type as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed in USD.
--   If neither <tt>BidPrice</tt> nor
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> is provided,
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> defaults to 100%.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice:InstanceTypeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeConfig_bidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</a> - The
--   bid price, as a percentage of On-Demand price, for each EC2 Spot
--   Instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed as a number
--   (for example, 20 specifies 20%). If neither <tt>BidPrice</tt> nor
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> is provided,
--   <tt>BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</tt> defaults to 100%.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customAmiId:InstanceTypeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeConfig_customAmiId</a> - The custom AMI ID to use for
--   the instance type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:weightedCapacity:InstanceTypeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeConfig_weightedCapacity</a> - The number of units that
--   a provisioned instance of this type provides toward fulfilling the
--   target capacities defined in InstanceFleetConfig. This value is 1 for
--   a master instance fleet, and must be 1 or greater for core and task
--   instance fleets. Defaults to 1 if not specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:InstanceTypeConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeConfig_instanceType</a> - An EC2 instance type, such as
--   <tt>m3.xlarge</tt>.
newInstanceTypeConfig :: Text -> InstanceTypeConfig

-- | The configuration specification for each instance type in an instance
--   fleet.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceTypeSpecification</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceTypeSpecification
InstanceTypeSpecification' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [EbsBlockDevice] -> Maybe [Configuration] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> InstanceTypeSpecification

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceTypeSpecification</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsOptimized:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_ebsOptimized</a> - Evaluates to
--   <tt>TRUE</tt> when the specified <tt>InstanceType</tt> is
--   EBS-optimized.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_instanceType</a> - The EC2 instance type,
--   for example <tt>m3.xlarge</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsBlockDevices:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_ebsBlockDevices</a> - The configuration
--   of Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) attached to each instance
--   as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurations:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_configurations</a> - A configuration
--   classification that applies when provisioning cluster instances, which
--   can include configurations for applications and software bundled with
--   Amazon EMR.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bidPrice:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_bidPrice</a> - The bid price for each EC2
--   Spot Instance type as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed in
--   USD.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:bidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_bidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice</a> -
--   The bid price, as a percentage of On-Demand price, for each EC2 Spot
--   Instance as defined by <tt>InstanceType</tt>. Expressed as a number
--   (for example, 20 specifies 20%).
--   
--   <a>$sel:customAmiId:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_customAmiId</a> - The custom AMI ID to
--   use for the instance type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:weightedCapacity:InstanceTypeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>instanceTypeSpecification_weightedCapacity</a> - The number of
--   units that a provisioned instance of this type provides toward
--   fulfilling the target capacities defined in InstanceFleetConfig.
--   Capacity values represent performance characteristics such as vCPUs,
--   memory, or I/O. If not specified, the default value is 1.
newInstanceTypeSpecification :: InstanceTypeSpecification

-- | A description of the Amazon EC2 instance on which the cluster (job
--   flow) runs. A valid JobFlowInstancesConfig must contain either
--   InstanceGroups or InstanceFleets. They cannot be used together. You
--   may also have MasterInstanceType, SlaveInstanceType, and InstanceCount
--   (all three must be present), but we don't recommend this
--   configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobFlowInstancesConfig</a> smart constructor.
data JobFlowInstancesConfig
JobFlowInstancesConfig' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InstanceFleetConfig] -> Maybe PlacementType -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InstanceGroupConfig] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> JobFlowInstancesConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>JobFlowInstancesConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:hadoopVersion:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_hadoopVersion</a> - Applies only to Amazon
--   EMR release versions earlier than 4.0. The Hadoop version for the
--   cluster. Valid inputs are "0.18" (no longer maintained), "0.20" (no
--   longer maintained), "0.20.205" (no longer maintained), "1.0.3",
--   "2.2.0", or "2.4.0". If you do not set this value, the default of 0.18
--   is used, unless the <tt>AmiVersion</tt> parameter is set in the
--   RunJobFlow call, in which case the default version of Hadoop for that
--   AMI version is used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2KeyName:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_ec2KeyName</a> - The name of the EC2 key
--   pair that can be used to connect to the master node using SSH as the
--   user called "hadoop."
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceFleets:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_instanceFleets</a> - The instance fleet
--   configuration is available only in Amazon EMR versions 4.8.0 and
--   later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   Describes the EC2 instances and instance configurations for clusters
--   that use the instance fleet configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:placement:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_placement</a> - The Availability Zone in
--   which the cluster runs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2SubnetIds:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_ec2SubnetIds</a> - Applies to clusters that
--   use the instance fleet configuration. When multiple EC2 subnet IDs are
--   specified, Amazon EMR evaluates them and launches instances in the
--   optimal subnet.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalSlaveSecurityGroups:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_additionalSlaveSecurityGroups</a> - A list
--   of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the core and task
--   nodes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:terminationProtected:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_terminationProtected</a> - Specifies whether
--   to lock the cluster to prevent the Amazon EC2 instances from being
--   terminated by API call, user intervention, or in the event of a
--   job-flow error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_emrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup</a> - The
--   identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the core and task
--   nodes. If you specify <tt>EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup</tt>, you must
--   also specify <tt>EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterInstanceType:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_masterInstanceType</a> - The EC2 instance
--   type of the master node.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceGroups:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_instanceGroups</a> - Configuration for the
--   instance groups in a cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2SubnetId:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_ec2SubnetId</a> - Applies to clusters that
--   use the uniform instance group configuration. To launch the cluster in
--   Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC), set this parameter to the
--   identifier of the Amazon VPC subnet where you want the cluster to
--   launch. If you do not specify this value and your account supports
--   EC2-Classic, the cluster launches in EC2-Classic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emrManagedMasterSecurityGroup:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_emrManagedMasterSecurityGroup</a> - The
--   identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the master node. If
--   you specify <tt>EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup</tt>, you must also
--   specify <tt>EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalMasterSecurityGroups:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_additionalMasterSecurityGroups</a> - A list
--   of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the master node.
--   
--   <a>$sel:slaveInstanceType:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_slaveInstanceType</a> - The EC2 instance
--   type of the core and task nodes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessSecurityGroup:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_serviceAccessSecurityGroup</a> - The
--   identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the Amazon EMR service
--   to access clusters in VPC private subnets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keepJobFlowAliveWhenNoSteps:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_keepJobFlowAliveWhenNoSteps</a> - Specifies
--   whether the cluster should remain available after completing all
--   steps. Defaults to <tt>true</tt>. For more information about
--   configuring cluster termination, see <a>Control Cluster
--   Termination</a> in the <i>EMR Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceCount:JobFlowInstancesConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobFlowInstancesConfig_instanceCount</a> - The number of EC2
--   instances in the cluster.
newJobFlowInstancesConfig :: JobFlowInstancesConfig

-- | Attributes for Kerberos configuration when Kerberos authentication is

--   user with sufficient privileges to join resources to the domain.

--   realm. The cross-realm principal password, which must be identical
--   across realms.

--   password for <tt>ADDomainJoinUser</tt>.
newKerberosAttributes :: KerberosAttributes

-- | Managed scaling policy for an Amazon EMR cluster. The policy specifies
--   the limits for resources that can be added or terminated from a
--   cluster. The policy only applies to the core and task nodes. The
--   master node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newManagedScalingPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data ManagedScalingPolicy

--   managed scaling policy. The managed scaling activity of a cluster is
--   not allowed to go above or below these limits. The limit only applies
--   to the core and task nodes. The master node cannot be scaled after
--   initial configuration.
newManagedScalingPolicy :: ManagedScalingPolicy

-- | A CloudWatch dimension, which is specified using a <tt>Key</tt> (known
--   as a <tt>Name</tt> in CloudWatch), <tt>Value</tt> pair. By default,
--   Amazon EMR uses one dimension whose <tt>Key</tt> is <tt>JobFlowID</tt>
--   and <tt>Value</tt> is a variable representing the cluster ID, which is
--   <tt>${emr.clusterId}</tt>. This enables the rule to bootstrap when the
--   cluster ID becomes available.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricDimension</a> smart constructor.
data MetricDimension

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   dimension name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:MetricDimension'</a>, <a>metricDimension_value</a> - The
--   dimension value.
newMetricDimension :: MetricDimension

-- | A notebook execution. An execution is a specific instance that an EMR
--   Notebook is run using the <tt>StartNotebookExecution</tt> action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNotebookExecution</a> smart constructor.
data NotebookExecution
NotebookExecution' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe NotebookExecutionStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ExecutionEngineConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> NotebookExecution

-- | Create a value of <a>NotebookExecution</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastStateChangeReason:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_lastStateChangeReason</a> - The reason for the
--   latest status change of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:NotebookExecution'</a>, <a>notebookExecution_status</a>
--   - The status of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>START_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received the
--   execution request but execution has not begun.</li>
--   <li><tt>STARTING</tt> indicates that the execution is starting on the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> indicates that the execution is being processed
--   by the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHING</tt> indicates that execution processing is in the
--   final stages.</li>
--   <li><tt>FINISHED</tt> indicates that the execution has completed
--   without error.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILING</tt> indicates that the execution is failing and will
--   not finish successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> indicates that the execution failed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOP_PENDING</tt> indicates that the cluster has received a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request and the stop is pending.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt> indicates that the cluster is in the process of
--   stopping the execution as a result of a <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt>
--   request.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt> indicates that the execution stopped because of a
--   <tt>StopNotebookExecution</tt> request.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:notebookExecutionName:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_notebookExecutionName</a> - A name for the
--   notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:editorId:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_editorId</a> - The unique identifier of the EMR
--   Notebook that is used for the notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notebookExecutionId:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_notebookExecutionId</a> - The unique identifier
--   of a notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:NotebookExecution'</a>, <a>notebookExecution_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_startTime</a> - The timestamp when notebook
--   execution started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notebookParams:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_notebookParams</a> - Input parameters in JSON
--   format passed to the EMR Notebook at runtime for execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_endTime</a> - The timestamp when notebook
--   execution ended.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionEngine:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_executionEngine</a> - The execution engine, such
--   as an EMR cluster, used to run the EMR notebook and perform the
--   notebook execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notebookInstanceSecurityGroupId:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_notebookInstanceSecurityGroupId</a> - The unique
--   identifier of the EC2 security group associated with the EMR Notebook
--   instance. For more information see <a>Specifying EC2 Security Groups
--   for EMR Notebooks</a> in the <i>EMR Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:NotebookExecution'</a>, <a>notebookExecution_tags</a> - A
--   list of tags associated with a notebook execution. Tags are
--   user-defined key-value pairs that consist of a required key string
--   with a maximum of 128 characters and an optional value string with a
--   maximum of 256 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputNotebookURI:NotebookExecution'</a>,
--   <a>notebookExecution_outputNotebookURI</a> - The location of the
--   notebook execution's output file in Amazon S3.
newNotebookExecution :: NotebookExecution

--   execution request but execution has not begun.</li>
--   <li><tt>STARTING</tt> indicates that the execution is starting on the

-- | Describes the strategy for using unused Capacity Reservations for
--   fulfilling On-Demand capacity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOnDemandCapacityReservationOptions</a> smart
--   constructor.
data OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions
OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions' :: Maybe OnDemandCapacityReservationPreference -> Maybe Text -> Maybe OnDemandCapacityReservationUsageStrategy -> OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions

-- | Create a value of <a>OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:capacityReservationPreference:OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions'</a>,
--   <a>onDemandCapacityReservationOptions_capacityReservationPreference</a>
--   - Indicates the instance's Capacity Reservation preferences. Possible
--   preferences include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>open</tt> - The instance can run in any open Capacity
--   Reservation that has matching attributes (instance type, platform,
--   Availability Zone).</li>
--   <li><tt>none</tt> - The instance avoids running in a Capacity
--   Reservation even if one is available. The instance runs as an
--   On-Demand Instance.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:capacityReservationResourceGroupArn:OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions'</a>,
--   <a>onDemandCapacityReservationOptions_capacityReservationResourceGroupArn</a>
--   - The ARN of the Capacity Reservation resource group in which to run
--   the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:usageStrategy:OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions'</a>,
--   <a>onDemandCapacityReservationOptions_usageStrategy</a> - Indicates
--   whether to use unused Capacity Reservations for fulfilling On-Demand
--   capacity.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>use-capacity-reservations-first</tt>, the fleet
--   uses unused Capacity Reservations to fulfill On-Demand capacity up to
--   the target On-Demand capacity. If multiple instance pools have unused
--   Capacity Reservations, the On-Demand allocation strategy
--   (<tt>lowest-price</tt>) is applied. If the number of unused Capacity
--   Reservations is less than the On-Demand target capacity, the remaining
--   On-Demand target capacity is launched according to the On-Demand
--   allocation strategy (<tt>lowest-price</tt>).
--   
--   If you do not specify a value, the fleet fulfills the On-Demand
--   capacity according to the chosen On-Demand allocation strategy.
newOnDemandCapacityReservationOptions :: OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions

-- | The launch specification for On-Demand Instances in the instance
--   fleet, which determines the allocation strategy.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions. On-Demand
--   Instances allocation strategy is available in Amazon EMR version
--   5.12.1 and later.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOnDemandProvisioningSpecification</a> smart
--   constructor.
data OnDemandProvisioningSpecification

--   The launch specification for On-Demand instances in the instance
--   fleet, which determines the allocation strategy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allocationStrategy:OnDemandProvisioningSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>onDemandProvisioningSpecification_allocationStrategy</a> -
--   Specifies the strategy to use in launching On-Demand instance fleets.
--   Currently, the only option is <tt>lowest-price</tt> (the default),
--   which launches the lowest price first.
newOnDemandProvisioningSpecification :: OnDemandProvisioningAllocationStrategy -> OnDemandProvisioningSpecification

--   Zones are specified, Amazon EMR evaluates them and launches instances
--   in the optimal Availability Zone. <tt>AvailabilityZones</tt> is used
--   for instance fleets, while <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> (singular) is

--   Zone for the cluster. <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> is used for uniform
--   instance groups, while <tt>AvailabilityZones</tt> (plural) is used for
--   instance fleets.
newPlacementType :: PlacementType

-- | The upper and lower EC2 instance limits for an automatic scaling
--   policy. Automatic scaling activities triggered by automatic scaling
--   rules will not cause an instance group to grow above or below these
