data ScalingConstraints
ScalingConstraints' :: Int -> Int -> ScalingConstraints

-- | Create a value of <a>ScalingConstraints</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:minCapacity:ScalingConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>scalingConstraints_minCapacity</a> - The lower boundary of EC2
--   instances in an instance group below which scaling activities are not
--   allowed to shrink. Scale-in activities will not terminate instances
--   below this boundary.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxCapacity:ScalingConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>scalingConstraints_maxCapacity</a> - The upper boundary of EC2
--   instances in an instance group beyond which scaling activities are not
--   allowed to grow. Scale-out activities will not add instances beyond
--   this boundary.
newScalingConstraints :: Int -> Int -> ScalingConstraints

-- | A scale-in or scale-out rule that defines scaling activity, including
--   the CloudWatch metric alarm that triggers activity, how EC2 instances
--   are added or removed, and the periodicity of adjustments. The
--   automatic scaling policy for an instance group can comprise one or
--   more automatic scaling rules.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScalingRule</a> smart constructor.
data ScalingRule
ScalingRule' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> ScalingAction -> ScalingTrigger -> ScalingRule

-- | Create a value of <a>ScalingRule</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:ScalingRule'</a>, <a>scalingRule_description</a> -
--   A friendly, more verbose description of the automatic scaling rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ScalingRule'</a>, <a>scalingRule_name</a> - The name used
--   to identify an automatic scaling rule. Rule names must be unique
--   within a scaling policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:ScalingRule'</a>, <a>scalingRule_action</a> - The
--   conditions that trigger an automatic scaling activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:trigger:ScalingRule'</a>, <a>scalingRule_trigger</a> - The
--   CloudWatch alarm definition that determines when automatic scaling
--   activity is triggered.
newScalingRule :: Text -> ScalingAction -> ScalingTrigger -> ScalingRule

-- | The conditions that trigger an automatic scaling activity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScalingTrigger</a> smart constructor.
data ScalingTrigger
ScalingTrigger' :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> ScalingTrigger

-- | Create a value of <a>ScalingTrigger</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchAlarmDefinition:ScalingTrigger'</a>,
--   <a>scalingTrigger_cloudWatchAlarmDefinition</a> - The definition of a
--   CloudWatch metric alarm. When the defined alarm conditions are met
--   along with other trigger parameters, scaling activity begins.
newScalingTrigger :: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition -> ScalingTrigger

--   <a>sessionMappingDetail_studioId</a> - The ID of the Amazon EMR
--   Studio.
newSessionMappingDetail :: SessionMappingDetail

-- | Policy for customizing shrink operations. Allows configuration of
--   decommissioning timeout and targeted instance shrinking.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newShrinkPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data ShrinkPolicy
ShrinkPolicy' :: Maybe InstanceResizePolicy -> Maybe Int -> ShrinkPolicy

-- | Create a value of <a>ShrinkPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceResizePolicy:ShrinkPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>shrinkPolicy_instanceResizePolicy</a> - Custom policy for
--   requesting termination protection or termination of specific instances
--   when shrinking an instance group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:decommissionTimeout:ShrinkPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>shrinkPolicy_decommissionTimeout</a> - The desired timeout for
--   decommissioning an instance. Overrides the default YARN
--   decommissioning timeout.
newShrinkPolicy :: ShrinkPolicy

-- | An automatic scaling configuration, which describes how the policy
--   adds or removes instances, the cooldown period, and the number of EC2
--   instances that will be added each time the CloudWatch metric alarm
--   condition is satisfied.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration
SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe AdjustmentType -> Int -> SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:coolDown:SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration_coolDown</a> - The amount of time,
--   in seconds, after a scaling activity completes before any further
--   trigger-related scaling activities can start. The default value is 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:adjustmentType:SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration_adjustmentType</a> - The way in
--   which EC2 instances are added (if <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt> is a
--   positive number) or terminated (if <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt> is a
--   negative number) each time the scaling activity is triggered.
--   <tt>CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt> is the default.
--   <tt>CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt> indicates that the EC2 instance count
--   increments or decrements by <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt>, which should
--   be expressed as an integer. <tt>PERCENT_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt>
--   indicates the instance count increments or decrements by the
--   percentage specified by <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt>, which should be
--   expressed as an integer. For example, 20 indicates an increase in 20%
--   increments of cluster capacity. <tt>EXACT_CAPACITY</tt> indicates the
--   scaling activity results in an instance group with the number of EC2
--   instances specified by <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt>, which should be
--   expressed as a positive integer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scalingAdjustment:SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>simpleScalingPolicyConfiguration_scalingAdjustment</a> - The amount
--   by which to scale in or scale out, based on the specified
--   <tt>AdjustmentType</tt>. A positive value adds to the instance group's
--   EC2 instance count while a negative number removes instances. If
--   <tt>AdjustmentType</tt> is set to <tt>EXACT_CAPACITY</tt>, the number
--   should only be a positive integer. If <tt>AdjustmentType</tt> is set
--   to <tt>PERCENT_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY</tt>, the value should express the
--   percentage as an integer. For example, -20 indicates a decrease in 20%
--   increments of cluster capacity.
newSimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration :: Int -> SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration

newSimplifiedApplication :: SimplifiedApplication

-- | The launch specification for Spot Instances in the instance fleet,
--   which determines the defined duration, provisioning timeout behavior,
--   and allocation strategy.
--   
--   The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR
--   versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions. Spot Instance
--   allocation strategy is available in Amazon EMR version 5.12.1 and
--   later.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSpotProvisioningSpecification</a> smart constructor.
data SpotProvisioningSpecification
SpotProvisioningSpecification' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe SpotProvisioningAllocationStrategy -> Natural -> SpotProvisioningTimeoutAction -> SpotProvisioningSpecification

-- | Create a value of <a>SpotProvisioningSpecification</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockDurationMinutes:SpotProvisioningSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>spotProvisioningSpecification_blockDurationMinutes</a> - The
--   defined duration for Spot Instances (also known as Spot blocks) in
--   minutes. When specified, the Spot Instance does not terminate before
--   the defined duration expires, and defined duration pricing for Spot
--   Instances applies. Valid values are 60, 120, 180, 240, 300, or 360.
--   The duration period starts as soon as a Spot Instance receives its
--   instance ID. At the end of the duration, Amazon EC2 marks the Spot
--   Instance for termination and provides a Spot Instance termination
--   notice, which gives the instance a two-minute warning before it
--   terminates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allocationStrategy:SpotProvisioningSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>spotProvisioningSpecification_allocationStrategy</a> - Specifies
--   the strategy to use in launching Spot Instance fleets. Currently, the
--   only option is capacity-optimized (the default), which launches
--   instances from Spot Instance pools with optimal capacity for the
--   number of instances that are launching.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeoutDurationMinutes:SpotProvisioningSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>spotProvisioningSpecification_timeoutDurationMinutes</a> - The spot
--   provisioning timeout period in minutes. If Spot Instances are not
--   provisioned within this time period, the <tt>TimeOutAction</tt> is
--   taken. Minimum value is 5 and maximum value is 1440. The timeout
--   applies only during initial provisioning, when the cluster is first
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeoutAction:SpotProvisioningSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>spotProvisioningSpecification_timeoutAction</a> - The action to
--   take when <tt>TargetSpotCapacity</tt> has not been fulfilled when the
--   <tt>TimeoutDurationMinutes</tt> has expired; that is, when all Spot
--   Instances could not be provisioned within the Spot provisioning
--   timeout. Valid values are <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt> and
--   <tt>SWITCH_TO_ON_DEMAND</tt>. SWITCH_TO_ON_DEMAND specifies that if no
--   Spot Instances are available, On-Demand Instances should be
--   provisioned to fulfill any remaining Spot capacity.
newSpotProvisioningSpecification :: Natural -> SpotProvisioningTimeoutAction -> SpotProvisioningSpecification

-- | This represents a step in a cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStep</a> smart constructor.
data Step
Step' :: Maybe StepStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HadoopStepConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ActionOnFailure -> Step

-- | Create a value of <a>Step</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Step'</a>, <a>step_status</a> - The current execution
--   status details of the cluster step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Step'</a>, <a>step_id</a> - The identifier of the cluster
--   step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:config:Step'</a>, <a>step_config</a> - The Hadoop job
--   configuration of the cluster step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Step'</a>, <a>step_name</a> - The name of the cluster
--   step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionOnFailure:Step'</a>, <a>step_actionOnFailure</a> - The
--   action to take when the cluster step fails. Possible values are
--   <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>, <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt>, and
--   <tt>CONTINUE</tt>. <tt>TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW</tt> is provided for
--   backward compatibility. We recommend using <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>
--   instead.
--   
--   If a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> is greater than
--   <tt>1</tt>, do not use <tt>AddJobFlowSteps</tt> to submit a step with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt> or
--   <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>. The step is not submitted and the action
--   fails with a message that the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> setting is not
--   valid.
--   
--   If you change a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> to be greater
--   than 1 while a step is running, the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> parameter
--   may not behave as you expect. In this case, for a step that fails with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt>, pending steps and the
--   running step are not canceled; for a step that fails with this
--   parameter set to <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>, the cluster does not
--   terminate.
newStep :: Step

-- | Specification for a cluster (job flow) step.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStepConfig</a> smart constructor.
data StepConfig
StepConfig' :: Maybe ActionOnFailure -> Text -> HadoopJarStepConfig -> StepConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>StepConfig</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionOnFailure:StepConfig'</a>,
--   <a>stepConfig_actionOnFailure</a> - The action to take when the step
--   fails. Use one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt> - Shuts down the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt> - Cancels any pending steps and returns
--   the cluster to the <tt>WAITING</tt> state.</li>
--   <li><tt>CONTINUE</tt> - Continues to the next step in the queue.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW</tt> - Shuts down the cluster.
--   <tt>TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW</tt> is provided for backward compatibility. We
--   recommend using <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt> instead.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> is greater than
--   <tt>1</tt>, do not use <tt>AddJobFlowSteps</tt> to submit a step with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt> or
--   <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>. The step is not submitted and the action
--   fails with a message that the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> setting is not
--   valid.
--   
--   If you change a cluster's <tt>StepConcurrencyLevel</tt> to be greater
--   than 1 while a step is running, the <tt>ActionOnFailure</tt> parameter
--   may not behave as you expect. In this case, for a step that fails with
--   this parameter set to <tt>CANCEL_AND_WAIT</tt>, pending steps and the
--   running step are not canceled; for a step that fails with this
--   parameter set to <tt>TERMINATE_CLUSTER</tt>, the cluster does not
--   terminate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:StepConfig'</a>, <a>stepConfig_name</a> - The name of the
--   step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hadoopJarStep:StepConfig'</a>, <a>stepConfig_hadoopJarStep</a>
--   - The JAR file used for the step.
newStepConfig :: Text -> HadoopJarStepConfig -> StepConfig

newStepStateChangeReason :: StepStateChangeReason

--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateChangeReason:StepStatus'</a>,

--   execution status change.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureDetails:StepStatus'</a>,
--   <a>stepStatus_failureDetails</a> - The details for the step failure
--   including reason, message, and log file path where the root cause was
--   identified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:StepStatus'</a>, <a>stepStatus_state</a> - The execution
--   state of the cluster step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeline:StepStatus'</a>, <a>stepStatus_timeline</a> - The
--   timeline of the cluster step status over time.
newStepStatus :: StepStatus

-- | The summary of the cluster step.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStepSummary</a> smart constructor.
data StepSummary
StepSummary' :: Maybe StepStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HadoopStepConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ActionOnFailure -> StepSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>StepSummary</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:StepSummary'</a>, <a>stepSummary_status</a> - The
--   current execution status details of the cluster step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:StepSummary'</a>, <a>stepSummary_id</a> - The identifier of
--   the cluster step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:config:StepSummary'</a>, <a>stepSummary_config</a> - The
--   Hadoop job configuration of the cluster step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:StepSummary'</a>, <a>stepSummary_name</a> - The name of
--   the cluster step.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionOnFailure:StepSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stepSummary_actionOnFailure</a> - The action to take when the
--   cluster step fails. Possible values are TERMINATE_CLUSTER,
--   CANCEL_AND_WAIT, and CONTINUE. TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW is available for
--   backward compatibility.
newStepSummary :: StepSummary

-- | The timeline of the cluster step lifecycle.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStepTimeline</a> smart constructor.
data StepTimeline
StepTimeline' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> StepTimeline

-- | Create a value of <a>StepTimeline</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startDateTime:StepTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>stepTimeline_startDateTime</a> - The date and time when the cluster
--   step execution started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endDateTime:StepTimeline'</a>, <a>stepTimeline_endDateTime</a>
--   - The date and time when the cluster step execution completed or
--   failed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDateTime:StepTimeline'</a>,
--   <a>stepTimeline_creationDateTime</a> - The date and time when the
--   cluster step was created.
newStepTimeline :: StepTimeline

-- | Details for an Amazon EMR Studio including ID, creation time, name,
--   and so on.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStudio</a> smart constructor.
data Studio
Studio' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AuthMode -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Studio

-- | Create a value of <a>Studio</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_creationTime</a> - The
--   time the Amazon EMR Studio was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceRole:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_serviceRole</a> - The name
--   of the IAM role assumed by the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceSecurityGroupId:Studio'</a>,
--   <a>studio_workspaceSecurityGroupId</a> - The ID of the Workspace
--   security group associated with the Amazon EMR Studio. The Workspace
--   security group allows outbound network traffic to resources in the
--   Engine security group and to the internet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultS3Location:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_defaultS3Location</a>
--   - The Amazon S3 location to back up Amazon EMR Studio Workspaces and
--   notebook files.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authMode:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_authMode</a> - Specifies
--   whether the Amazon EMR Studio authenticates users using IAM or Amazon
--   Web Services SSO.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetIds:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_subnetIds</a> - The list of
--   IDs of the subnets associated with the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userRole:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_userRole</a> - The name of the
--   IAM role assumed by users logged in to the Amazon EMR Studio. A Studio
--   only requires a <tt>UserRole</tt> when you use IAM authentication.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_name</a> - The name of the Amazon
--   EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:idpRelayStateParameterName:Studio'</a>,
--   <a>studio_idpRelayStateParameterName</a> - The name of your identity
--   provider's <tt>RelayState</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_tags</a> - A list of tags
--   associated with the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:idpAuthUrl:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_idpAuthUrl</a> - Your
--   identity provider's authentication endpoint. Amazon EMR Studio
--   redirects federated users to this endpoint for authentication when
--   logging in to a Studio with the Studio URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_description</a> - The
--   detailed description of the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_url</a> - The unique access URL of
--   the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_vpcId</a> - The ID of the VPC
--   associated with the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:studioId:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_studioId</a> - The ID of the
--   Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:studioArn:Studio'</a>, <a>studio_studioArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineSecurityGroupId:Studio'</a>,
--   <a>studio_engineSecurityGroupId</a> - The ID of the Engine security
--   group associated with the Amazon EMR Studio. The Engine security group
--   allows inbound network traffic from resources in the Workspace
--   security group.
newStudio :: Studio

-- | Details for an Amazon EMR Studio, including ID, Name, VPC, and
--   Description. The details do not include subnets, IAM roles, security
--   groups, or tags associated with the Studio.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStudioSummary</a> smart constructor.
data StudioSummary
StudioSummary' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe AuthMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> StudioSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>StudioSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:StudioSummary'</a>,
--   <a>studioSummary_creationTime</a> - The time when the Amazon EMR
--   Studio was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authMode:StudioSummary'</a>, <a>studioSummary_authMode</a> -
--   Specifies whether the Studio authenticates users using IAM or Amazon
--   Web Services SSO.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:StudioSummary'</a>, <a>studioSummary_name</a> - The name
--   of the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:StudioSummary'</a>,
--   <a>studioSummary_description</a> - The detailed description of the
--   Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:StudioSummary'</a>, <a>studioSummary_url</a> - The unique
--   access URL of the Amazon EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:StudioSummary'</a>, <a>studioSummary_vpcId</a> - The ID
--   of the Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) associated with the Amazon
--   EMR Studio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:studioId:StudioSummary'</a>, <a>studioSummary_studioId</a> -
--   The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio.
newStudioSummary :: StudioSummary

-- | The list of supported product configurations that allow user-supplied
--   arguments. EMR accepts these arguments and forwards them to the
--   corresponding installation script as bootstrap action arguments.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSupportedProductConfig</a> smart constructor.
data SupportedProductConfig
SupportedProductConfig' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> SupportedProductConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>SupportedProductConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:args:SupportedProductConfig'</a>,
--   <a>supportedProductConfig_args</a> - The list of user-supplied
--   arguments.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:SupportedProductConfig'</a>,
--   <a>supportedProductConfig_name</a> - The name of the product
--   configuration.
newSupportedProductConfig :: SupportedProductConfig

-- | A key-value pair containing user-defined metadata that you can
--   associate with an Amazon EMR resource. Tags make it easier to
--   associate clusters in various ways, such as grouping clusters to track
--   your Amazon EMR resource allocation costs. For more information, see
--   <a>Tag Clusters</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Tag

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - A user-defined key, which is
--   the minimum required information for a valid tag. For more
--   information, see <a>Tag</a> .
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - A user-defined value, which
--   is optional in a tag. For more information, see <a>Tag Clusters</a>.
newTag :: Tag

-- | EBS volume specifications such as volume type, IOPS, and size (GiB)
--   that will be requested for the EBS volume attached to an EC2 instance
--   in the cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVolumeSpecification</a> smart constructor.
data VolumeSpecification
VolumeSpecification' :: Maybe Int -> Text -> Int -> VolumeSpecification

-- | Create a value of <a>VolumeSpecification</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iops:VolumeSpecification'</a>, <a>volumeSpecification_iops</a>
--   - The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume
--   supports.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeType:VolumeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>volumeSpecification_volumeType</a> - The volume type. Volume types
--   supported are gp2, io1, standard.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInGB:VolumeSpecification'</a>,
--   <a>volumeSpecification_sizeInGB</a> - The volume size, in gibibytes
--   (GiB). This can be a number from 1 - 1024. If the volume type is
--   EBS-optimized, the minimum value is 10.
newVolumeSpecification :: Text -> Int -> VolumeSpecification
